Title: Potter appointed new Sweden boss
Content: Graham Potter has not been out of work for long. The former West Ham boss will be the new Sweden head coach, taking charge of the men‚Äôs national team with the goal of qualifying for next summer‚Äôs World Cup. After only one point from the first four matches in the World Cup qualifiers, Jon Dahl Tomasson lost his job last week. Potter takes charge from today with the short-term agreement to extend over the ongoing qualifying period with matches against Switzerland and Slovenia in November and a potential playoff in March. The deal will be extended if Sweden make it to the World Cup. "Together with the players, I want to realise the fans' dream of a championship summer," says Potter. "I am very humbled by the assignment, but also incredibly inspired. Sweden has fantastic players who deliver in the world's best leagues during the weeks. My job will be to create the conditions so that we as a team deliver at the highest level to take Sweden to the World Cup next summer.‚Äù Potter, who was sacked by West Ham on September 27, retains a strong reputation in Sweden after seven successful years at Ostersunds FK between 2011 and 2018, during which time he took the club into Europe. "It feels very good that Graham in,‚Äù says Kim Kallstrom, the football director of Sweden‚Äôs football federation. ‚ÄúWe are all aware of the situation we are in, and believe that with his leadership skills he will bring the team together in a good way. He is tactically skilled at creating conditions to win matches and has an ability to identify players' strengths and how they interact in the best way.‚Äù

Title: Pope confirms clause triggered in Newcastle deal
Content: Newcastle goalkeeper Nick Pope has confirmed the club have triggered a one-year extension on his current contract. Sky Sports News reported the clause had been triggered earlier in October, meaning he will now remain at St James' Park until 2027. The 33-year-old goalkeeper, who has been in outstanding form so far this season, accepted the option as part of a reward for helping the club qualify for the Champions League. Speaking ahead of the Champions League clash against Benfica on Tuesday, Pope was asked about how it felt to extend his stay with the Magpies. "My contract is up in 2027," he said. "I look forward to spending as long as I can here."

Title: Potter's pride as he returns to Sweden
Content: Graham Potter has spoken of his pride at returning to Sweden as national team manager, having begun his coaching career in the country. His first task is qualifying for the World Cup, having earned just just one point from their opening four qualifying games. ‚ÄúMy feelings for being the Swedish national team manager are one of extreme pride, it‚Äôs a really exciting day for me,‚Äù Potter said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs quite clear, we want to get to the World Cup, simple as that. We have to get the team together, playing well, winning games, and our aim is to get to the World Cup. ‚ÄúHow I see the players, the team and the group is positive. The challenge now and the work is to make us into a really good team.‚Äù Potter took Ostersunds from the fourth division of Swedish football to the first division during his seven-year tenure at the club. ‚ÄúI think back to coming into the country in 2011, playing in the fourth tier in Swedish football, and so to be here now I'm incredibly proud and it feels really, really special," Potter added. ‚ÄúI always keep an eye on Swedish football because of my relationship with the country. ‚ÄúSwedish football means an incredible amount to me. It‚Äôs the start of my professional coaching career, I‚Äôll be forever grateful for the time I had here, for the football family here ‚Äì it‚Äôs an incredible place and one I'm really proud to be part of.‚Äù A poor run of results has left Sweden bottom of their qualifying group, and their most recent 1-0 defeat to Kosovo on October 13 led to the dismissal of Jon Dahl Tomasson. ‚ÄúI'm aware of the results that the team had and the players that we have, but now it‚Äôs about looking forward and I'm really excited to be here and help the team achieve the goal of the World Cup,‚Äù Potter said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs an incredible opportunity for me, a very proud moment in my life and my career. ‚ÄúWhat I look forward to most is meeting the players, all the people in the football family in Sweden, our supporters, and then competing and winning games to get to the World Cup. ‚ÄúThe message to our supporters is, we need their support. Swedish football fans are renowned for being incredible around the world and I'm really looking forward to experiencing that.‚Äù

Title: Kemp signs new Stevenage deal
'I could never have asked for that amount of money!'
Content: Former Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp speaking on the Diary of a CEO podcast: "We built three stands and a training ground. Nobody ever told me that this is possible that we can spend like that. "My last year at Liverpool, the Adidas deal, the new stadium, all these kind of things earned more money, but never, ever could I have asked for that amount of money, but that's not a problem. "I love the fact we were as successful as we were and built new stands and built a training ground, because we talk now about transfer windows in the way you want to talk about it, spend a lot of money, but there's no discussion about the stands and no discussion about the training ground. They are second to none. "The same place where Anfield is, they could build pretty much a new stadium without leaving the old one so that's a fantastic story and that will stay forever. Maybe at one point they decide the Kop could be for even more people or whatever, but you could do stuff there. And that's what I love about this. "I really want, as much as I can - and it's not my first target because I have to win football games with my team - a club that benefits from the time we were together after we left. I want that."

Title: Klopp: I turned down Man Utd in 2013
Content: Jurgen Klopp has revealed he turned down the Manchester United job in 2013 having decided the project was ‚Äúnot for me‚Äù after he was told things during discussions that he "didn't like." Speaking on the Diary of a CEO podcast, Klopp who was later appointed Liverpool manager in October 2015, explained: ‚ÄúYes, I spoke to them [Manchester United]. "In the year when Sir Alex Ferguson retired they spoke to me. Of course they were interested. ‚ÄúAt one point. At that time I would have been interested. I was young, I had a sensational team at Dortmund, my God. They probably thought ‚Äòwhat is he doing there?‚Äô ‚ÄúThey tried. It was the wrong time, wrong moment. I had a contract at Dortmund and wouldn‚Äôt have left, not really for nobody at that time. ‚ÄúThere are some reasons [why he didn‚Äôt take the job]. The people in that conversation told me [things] which I didn‚Äôt like. ‚ÄúUnited was that big ‚Äì ‚Äúwe get all the players we want. We get him, we get him, we get him, we get him‚Äù and I was sitting there ‚Ä¶ It was not my project. ‚ÄúIt was the wrong time but on top of that it was not my project. I didn't want to bring back, I don‚Äôt know, Pogba. ‚ÄúPaul is a sensational player, my God, but these things don‚Äôt work usually. Or Cristiano, my God, we all know together with Messi he is the best player in the world but bringing back never helps. ‚ÄúAt that time in 2013 it was obviously not about Cristiano maybe about Paul, I‚Äôm not even sure, [I don‚Äôt] get the numbers [dates] together, but the idea is we bring the best players together and let‚Äôs go."

Title: McGinn set to sign new Villa deal
Content: John McGinn is close to signing a new contract to stay at Aston Villa. The Villa captain had interest from other Premier League clubs in the summer and was the subject of an ¬£18m bid from Everton. However, the Scotland international remains an important part of Unai Emery‚Äôs plans at Villa Park. McGinn signed for Villa from Hibernian in 2018 and his current deal, signed in 2023, expires in 2027.

Title: Keane: Mainoo might have to move on
Content: Roy Keane believes Kobbie Mainoo may have to move on from Manchester United if he cannot get in Ruben Amorim's team after another snub in a big game. Mainoo was left on United's bench for the Super Sunday clash at LIverpool despite veteran midfielder Casemiro playing two games for Brazil over the international break and travelling a long distance from South Korea. Casemiro still started over Mainoo, but Keane understands why Mainoo is not playing right now. "It's obviously seems to be a problem for Mainoo getting into this team," said Keane to Sky Sports. The word coming out is they don't' think he can cover the ground that quickly, but if you look at Man Utd's other midfielders they've got, they're not great at that either. "Asa a young player, he has to suck that up and work hard And when he gets a chance, he has to take it. "A young player with good potential cannot be guaranteed a place in United's team. But it will come down to the player himself. Your job every day every week is to make sure the manager puts you in the team. "If the manager deep down doesn't fancy him? I don't know. We will find that out in the next few weeks. Because if he doesn't fancy him, he might have to move him on. "But Mainoo's got that opportunity. He got some plaudits when he first came in, he was involved in the England squad. He has to get back to that, "He's had opportunities recently and when he's come on and got opportunities, he just looks a bit short for me. I wouldn't be scratching my head thinking: why is he not in the team? I can see why he is not picking him at this moment in time."

Title: 'Liverpool need Slot to act like a Real Madrid manager'
Content: Sky Sports Jamie Carragher at Anfield: "They‚Äôve brought in a lot of players and it‚Äôs given the manager a few problems. "When you have spent that much on players, you have to make that work and you have to find a way to get the players into the team. The idea that Florian Wirtz won‚Äôt get into the Liverpool team most weeks is nonsensical. You are going to have to find a way to make it work. "It makes me think a little bit of Real Madrid. The summer Liverpool had was Real Madrid-like, it wasn‚Äôt Liverpool like. Liverpool don‚Äôt normally ‚Äì at least when I played and under Jurgen Klopp ‚Äì go and buy the best players on the market for the most market. That wasn‚Äôt the way Liverpool did things, but they did it this summer. "Alexander Isak is arguably the best available striker on the market and Florian Wirtz is the best No 10, they paid big money for them. That‚Äôs what Real Madrid would do most summers ‚Äì and then the managers like Vicente del Bosque or Carlo Ancelotti would just have to figure it out. They would be given a set of players and that‚Äôs what Arne Slot has got to do. "It‚Äôs been a Real Madrid summer for Liverpool in terms of transfer fees, they may need their manager to be a Real Madrid manager as such for the next few months and just try and make things work. Not necessarily getting them into his system, but how does he get this team functioning well and getting the best from them?"

Title: Antony continuing to shine for Betis
Content: Former Manchester United winger Antony was the hero for Real Betis as his late brace earned them a 2‚Äì2 draw away to Villarreal. The Brazilian struck twice, first in the 66th minute and again deep into stoppage time, to salvage a point after goals from Tajon Buchanan and Alberto Moleiro had put the hosts in control. It‚Äôs a reminder of Antony‚Äôs quality on his day, with Betis now unbeaten in their last three La Liga matches.

Title: Silva in frame for Forest job?
Content: Fulham boss Marco Silva has major internal support at Nottingham Forest over succeeding Ange Postecoglou, according to BBC Sport. However, it is claimed that Silva has a "significant" release clause in his contract at Craven Cottage, which provides an obstacle for Forest. Postecoglou was sacked by Forest less than 20 minutes after the full-time whistle of Saturday's 3-0 home defeat to Chelsea. Sky Sports News understands that Sean Dyche is in advanced talks with Forest about the prospect of becoming their new head coach - but other candidates have not yet been ruled out. Former Manchester City boss Roberto Mancini has held positive talks about replacing Postecoglou. Importantly, both Dyche and Mancini are currently out of work and would therefore be available without the need to pay compensation for their release.

Title: Marinakis wants to move quickly in search for third coach of season
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui and Rob Dorsett: The decision over who replaces Ange Postecoglou lies entirely with Nottingham Forest owner Marinakis, who is looking for his third head coach of the season already. He knows this next managerial appointment is key in trying to produce some stability and belief in the dressing room and amongst the supporter base after a damaging period for the club. In that regard, Forest's hierarchy currently believe Dyche is the best man to steady the ship, organise and motivate the players, and crucially keep the club in the Premier League despite having ambitions of finishing further up the table. Another key demand from the owner is for whoever takes over to maximise the significant investment that was made in the playing squad in the summer. Forest spent more than ¬£180m in the transfer window, and ¬£130m of that talent wasn't in the matchday squad against Chelsea. This was another area of dispute between the owner and Postecoglu, Sky Sports News has been told. Despite the importance of the appointment, Forest's bosses are keen to move quickly, with the Europa League game against Porto to come on Thursday.

Title: Nottingham Forest in advanced Dyche talks
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui and Rob Dorsett: Sean Dyche is in advanced talks with Nottingham Forest about the prospect of becoming their new manager - but other candidates have not yet been ruled out. Former Man City boss Roberto Mancini has held positive talks about the vacancy and has been out of work since leaving his role as head coach of the Saudi Arabia national team in 20234. Forest bosses have also shown interest in Italian coach Luciano Spalletti, who was sounded out about the role but, according to Sky in Italy, he is no longer in contention. Ex-Olympiakos head coach Pedro Martins, the Portuguese currently working in Qatar, was considered, but will not be taking over at Forest. While Mancini is not yet out of the running, Sky Sports News has been told that Dyche is very much the front-runner, and could be appointed quickly if owner Evangelos Marinakis finally decides he is the right man to replace Ange Postecoglou. The Australian, who could not win any of his eight games in charge at Forest, was sacked within 18 minutes of the defeat to Chelsea at the City Ground on Saturday lunchtime. Sky Sports

Title: 'Dyche and Mancini in frame for Forest job'
Content: Sean Dyche is the strongest contender to replace Ange Postecoglou as Nottingham Forest head coach, but Roberto Mancini is also in the frame, according to Sky in Italy's Gianluca Di Marzio. Former Napoli boss Luciano Spalletti was among the names considered, the report from Italy suggests that is unlikely. Sky in Italy report that a decision will be made over a new Forest head coach imminently.

Title: How Ange's sacking unfolded at Forest
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui: A 39-day tenure ended with a 39-word statement. The Ange Postecoglou era was short but anything but sweet as was his exit from the City Ground today. After the final whistle, he went straight down the tunnel, no time to talk to the media and within minutes, he was in his car and off the premises. Then, Forest sent out their short statement confirming he was no longer head coach. The players were asked to attend a meeting in the boardroom at the City Ground after the announcement. There was then a players-only discussion in the changing room, which lasted about an hour.

Title: Mancini to replace Postecoglou at Forest?
Content: Roberto Mancini is a surprise contender for the Nottingham Forest job, according to The Athletic's David Ornstein. Ange Postecoglou was sacked by Forest less than 20 minutes after the full-time whistle of Saturday's 3-0 defeat to Chelsea. And it is now being reported that Forest have made contact with former Man City boss Mancini as a potential option to replace him, with The Athletic citing sources in Italy. Mancini is currently out of a job which means he would be available to take over right away and brings Premier League experience having led City to the title in 2011/12. The 60-year-old's last role was with Saudi Arabia's national team. He left in October 2024 after disappointing results in World Cup qualifying.

Title: Glasner: Guehi told Crystal Palace he will leave club next year
Content: Crystal Palace captain Marc Guehi has informed the club he does not want to sign a new contract and will leave the club next year, head coach Oliver Glasner has revealed. The England international's current Palace deal expires on June 30, when he can leave the Eagles on a free transfer. Guehi is also able to sign a pre-contract agreement with a foreign club when the January transfer window opens on New Year's Day 2026. Sky Sports "I think Marc has already told us that he doesn't sign a new contract, so he will leave next year," said Glasner on Friday. "The club wanted [him to stay]. They offered Marc a new contract. But he said, 'no, I want to make something different'. And that's normal. "And for us, it's how we can deal with this situation? [What] is the best way to get this next step done? And that's all about how we are talking together."

Title: Pep keeps door open on Grealish's Man City career
Content: Pep Guardiola has left the door open for Jack Grealish to return to Manchester City. The England international has made a big impact at Everton since joining the Merseyside club on a season-long loan from City in August. The 30-year-old playmaker - who cannot play against his parent club on Saturday - had fallen down the pecking order at the Etihad Stadium. City manager Guardiola said: "The important thing is he is back. He is a massive influence in the Everton games. "After what's happened, maybe Manchester City want him back, but I don't know. "Many things are still going to happen. We'll see. "The important thing is he is playing again, a lot of minutes. This is the standard. I'm happy, really, honestly, that he's back in, trying his best." 'I'm at my best when I feel loved' - watch Jack Grealish open up on life at Everton in an exclusive recent interview with former manager Tim Sherwood...

Title: Maresca insists relationship with Chelsea hierarchy is ‚Äònormal‚Äô
Content: Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca believes the media struggle to accept that he has a ‚Äúnormal‚Äù relationship with his Blues bosses. Co-owner Behdad Eghbali is a frequent visitor to the home changing room at Stamford Bridge after matches, as are co-sporting directors Paul Winstanley and Laurence Stewart. At times it has prompted questioning as to the nature of the conversations that go on in the immediate aftermath of games, particularly when results have been poor. The trio were seen entering the changing room almost before Maresca and his players after a messy collapse that precipitated a 3-1 defeat to Brighton in September, with the Italian grilled over what the hierarchy had made of his team‚Äôs capitulation. He has repeatedly insisted that any talk of a strained atmosphere is wide of the mark, and ahead of Saturday‚Äôs meeting with Nottingham Forest at the City Ground said it had been business as usual with owners. ‚ÄúI spoke with Behdad (Thursday) night,‚Äù said Maresca. ‚ÄúIt was just a normal conversation like almost every week. Even if you (the media) struggle to accept or to understand. ‚ÄúThey are always in the changing room,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe always have conversations with Paul and Laurence and Behdad. Nothing has changed since I joined the club. ‚ÄúWe all know that we are going in the right direction, we all know there are things we need to do better. We all know there are things with which we are happy.‚Äù

Title: Frank hails Paratici‚Äôs ‚Äògreat eye‚Äô on return to Tottenham
Content: Tottenham head coach Thomas Frank is aware of Fabio Paratici‚Äôs recent criminal case but has praised the ‚Äúgood guy‚Äù with a ‚Äúgreat eye‚Äù after the Italian officially returned to the club. Spurs announced on Wednesday that Paratici was back as co-sporting director after being used as a consultant for the past two years since his resignation in 2023. Paratici first joined Tottenham in 2021, but stepped down to deal with allegations of false accounting at former club Juventus. The Italian subsequently served a 30-month ban imposed by FIFA ‚Äì which did not prevent his consultancy work ‚Äì before a criminal case over the same matter reached a conclusion last month in Rome after a plea bargain by Paratici and others involved was entered. With the court case over, Paratici has been able to return to Tottenham and will work alongside Johan Lange, who has been technical director for the past 24 months but has been promoted to co-sporting director. Ahead of Sunday‚Äôs visit of Aston Villa, Frank said: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve heard about (the case). I don‚Äôt know too much about the details. ‚ÄúI know Fabio as a good guy at the times I‚Äôve met him and I think he‚Äôs got a lot of quality and I look forward to working with him. ‚ÄúThe strong abilities both Johan and Fabio have, I think that they complement each other so well, so it‚Äôs like a perfect match. ‚ÄúJohan is very good to put in good structures and building that recruitment department, our insight department, our analysis department. ‚ÄúI think Fabio comes with another angle and another experience from 10 years in Italy with a great network and a great eye and a great vision for football. I think the way they complement each other is very good.‚Äù

Title: Potter on verge of becoming Sweden manager
Content: Graham Potter is close to agreeing a deal with the Swedish FA to take over as the national team manager. He will be tasked with trying to help Sweden qualify for next summer‚Äôs World Cup. That is a tall order as Sweden are currently bottom of World Cup qualifying Group B, with only a point from their opening four matches. The best they can hope for is to overhaul Kosovo and Slovenia to finish second, thereby making it into the play-offs. To do that, they have to win their final two games and hope Kosovo lose both of theirs. Former Blackburn manager Jon Dahl Tomason was sacked on Tuesday following the 1-0 home defeat to Kosovo. The contract being discussed with Potter is a short-term one, which will see him take charge in time for next month's international break when they face a must-win game away at group-leaders Switzerland. In the unlikely event he were to help Sweden achieve qualification, his contract would be extended to include the World Cup finals next summer, and probably beyond. Potter, who was sacked by West Ham last month, began his coaching career in Sweden with Ostersunds FK, winning three promotions in four seasons and the Swedish cup. He still has a great number of friends and contacts in the country. Whilst he didn't have a burning desire to go into international management at this stage of his career, he feels he owes the nation that gave him his start in football management, and wants to try to help if he can.

Title: Ex-Liverpool striker Borini joins Salford City until January
Content: Former Liverpool and Sunderland striker Fabio Borini has joined League Two side Salford City on a short-term deal until January. The 34-year-old moves to Salford as a free agent after leaving Serie B side Sampdoria in the summer. The former Chelsea and Swansea striker had been training with Salford for the last month and has officially joined the club after Jay Bird sustained a long-term injury. The ex-AC Milan and Roma forward said: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been great, I came in to train to keep myself fit in this transition between contracts and Salford, the Gaffer, Alex Bruce, were kind enough to allow me to use the facilities and train here. ‚ÄúExperience is one thing that I can bring, but it‚Äôs not just about the experience that I have on the pitch, it‚Äôs outside of the pitch so leading by example in training, outside training, how to manage a game. I‚Äôve never played League Two football so I need to learn as well from my team mates the main characteristics of this league, but I will bring myself as an open book for my team mates to use me, learn from me or help me, so I‚Äôm very open to this challenge. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a challenge that I‚Äôm embracing and I chose to embrace because I needed the real football, something that warms my heart for football, not for anything else.‚Äù Borini will wear the number 16 shirt at ninth-placed Salford and could make his debut against Oldham on Saturday, live on Sky Sports+, with kick-off at 12.30pm.

Title: Pope extends Newcastle contract
Content: Exclusive by Adrian Kajumba and Keith Downie: Nick Pope has taken up the option of an additional year on his Newcastle United contract. This means the England international will not be out of contract at the end of the season, and his deal actually still has over 18 months to run. Newcastle have yet to announce this extension. The 33-year-old goalkeeper, who has been in outstanding form so far this season, accepted the option as part of a reward for helping the club qualify for the Champions League. Eddie Howe said today that one of the first tasks for new Sporting Director Ross Wilson will be to talk to the likes of Sandro Tonali, Sven Botman and Tino Livramento over new deals. Botman's deal expires in 2027, with key duo Tonali and Livramento out of contract in 2028.

Title: Sunderland will not revive Lucumi interest in January
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: Sunderland will not be resurrecting their interest in Bologna defender Jhon Lucumi in the January transfer window. Reports in Italy have suggested the Black Cats will be back in for the Colombia international, but Sky Sports News understands Sunderland have ended their interest following the arrivals of Nordi Mukiele and Lutsharel Geertruida. Sunderland offered Bologna ¬£24m for the 27-year-old in the summer, but the bid was rejected by the Italian side.

Title: Newcastle agree deal to sign Barnsley wonderkid
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: Newcastle have agreed to pay ¬£350,000 plus significant bonuses for wonderkid Josh Kenchington. Newcastle‚Äôs second bid to Barnsley for the 15-year-old defender was accepted, after a ¬£275,000 first offer was turned down. Labelled the next John Stones, Kenchington was paying U18 football aged just 14. He's been capped by England U15. Newcastle fended off rival interest from Man United, Spurs and Brighton for the youngster‚Äôs signature. Kenchington is a two-footed centre-back who already stands over 6ft tall. The teenager will sign upon clearance of Premier League family checks and will attend school in Newcastle while also training at the academy.

Title: Pickford keen to build legacy at Everton after agreeing four-year deal
Content: Everton goalkeeper Jordan Pickford intends to ‚Äúbuild a legacy‚Äù after signing a new four-year contract at the club. The England number one will take his stay with the Toffees to 12 years after extending his existing deal to 2029. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm delighted to get it done ‚Äì it‚Äôs an extra two years, so four years in total,‚Äù he told evertontv. ‚ÄúIt just shows the commitment I‚Äôve made to Everton and also the faith the club has put into me as well. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm over the moon and it gives me the opportunity to build a legacy for myself here, move forward and build this club to where we want to be. ‚Äú(Neville) Southall is the great at Everton and I don‚Äôt want to be too far behind him, if not in front of him, when my time comes to an end. ‚ÄúI think everyone‚Äôs seen the changes and how I‚Äôve developed over time, but I‚Äôm still that lad who loves to keep the ball out of the net. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been Everton who have helped me develop and a lot of hard work‚Äôs been put in as well. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always felt like a natural fit for me, with the fans and the passion ‚Äì it‚Äôs second to none and something I thrive off.‚Äù The 31-year-old goalkeeper, who has won all his 80 England caps while at Everton, has made 326 appearances for the Toffees. Pickford has followed defenders James Tarkowski and Jarrad Branthwaite, all key players under manager David Moyes, in signing a new contract in the last few months.

Title: Slow progress expected over new Glasner contract
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra: Crystal Palace have held initial talks with Oliver Glasner about extending his contract ‚Äì but it is unlikely that things will progress quickly. Palace are planning for the Austrian to be in charge next season and Glasner has been involved in positive conversations about the medium-to-long-term future at the Eagles. Chairman Steve Parish confirmed those talks earlier in the international break ‚Äì but the club are not putting a timescale on discussions around the 51-year-old's future and there is no deadline by which they are working towards. Glasner‚Äôs current deal expires at the end of the season and, in the background, Palace will continue to do due diligence on a number of potential managerial candidates if they do need to recruit a new head coach next summer. The Palace boss is in a brilliant position, and his stock has risen massively due to his success at Selhurst Park, helping the club claim their first ever major trophy in the FA Cup last season. The German is admired by a number of Europe's top sides and, from Glasner's perspective, there is no need or urgency to commit his future at this current stage. Behind the scenes, the club's hierarchy have been incredibly impressed by the level of professionalism shown by Glasner in spite of the uncertainty surrounding his long-term position. They are fully aware that they possess a world-class manager. There has been much outside noise surrounding the future of the likes of Glasner, Marc Guehi and Adam Wharton. However, inside the training ground there remains a real sense of calm regarding the situations around each of them.

Title: Steele extends Brighton deal
Content: Brighton goalkeeper Jason Steele has signed a new contract to keep him at the club until the summer of 2027. Head coach Fabian Hurzeler said, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm delighted Jason is going to be with us for the next few years. He is a big influence in the dressing room and he maintains high standards on and off the pitch every day." Steele added: ‚ÄúThe progress the club has made since I came to Brighton is incredible and hopefully I can complete ten years with the club, which would be a fantastic achievement personally."

Title: Kluivert leaves Indonesia role
Content: Patrick Kluivert has left his role as Indonesia's head coach. The former Barcelona striker signed a two-year contract in January as Indonesia aimed to reach the World Cup for the first time. However, losses to Saudi Arabia and Iraq during the October international break ended the South East nation's hopes of qualification. "The Indonesian Football Association (PSSI) and the Indonesian National Team Coaching Team have officially agreed to terminate their cooperation early through a mutual termination mechanism," a statement said. Kluivert replaced South Korean coach Sin Tae-yong in January and helped take the side to the final stages of qualification. The majority of Kluivert‚Äôs final roster of 23 were born overseas, mainly in the Netherlands. However, results didn't noticeably improve under the new coaching setup. Indonesia won three out of eight games while Kluivert was in charge.

Title: 'Zirkzee to be offered Man United exit route'
Content: Joshua Zirkzee could be offered an escape route from Manchester United by Roma, who are monitoring his situation before a potential January loan bid, say The Times. Zirkzee is yet to start a game in the Premier League for Man Utd this season, only managing 74 minutes via three substitute appearances. He hasn't scored a goal since April.

Title: PSG attempt to ward off interest in Barcola
Content: Paris Saint-Germain are holding contract negotiations with Bradley Barcola after the France forward attracted interest from several clubs including Liverpool and Bayern Munich in the summer, say L'Equipe. Liverpool spent ¬£446.5m in the most recent window, splashing out on Alexander Isak and Florian Wirtz, among others. 23-year-old forward Barcola is also a player they reportedly tracked.

Title: Chelsea to rival Man City for Anderson
Content: Manchester City are plotting a ¬£75m bid for Nottingham Forest midfielder Elliot Anderson next summer, according to reports. They are likely, however, to face stiff competition from Chelsea for the 22-year-old. Anderson, who joined Forest from Newcastle in 2024, has been particularly impressive this season, doing enough to catch the eye of Thomas Tuchel and earn a place in England's last two squad selections.

Title: Palace relaxed over Wharton transfer 'interest'
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra, Kaveh Solhehol, Lyall Thomas: Crystal Palace are relaxed about the future of Adam Wharton amid increasing speculation of interest from other clubs. Although there are currently no discussions around a new contract for the England midfielder, Palace are planning for the future with the 21-year-old a focal point of their team. Wharton signed a five-and-a-half year deal when joining from Blackburn in 2024 ‚Äì meaning he still has four years remaining on his contract until 2029. Palace are not pushing for fresh terms with a release clause to ward off the big European clubs, who are naturally tracking the midfielder's progress. At the same time, Wharton is not actively seeking improved terms himself despite his impressive exploits, and any idea of a January exit is not currently on the cards. The kind of significant deals and transfer fees it would take for a player like Wharton are more typical of the summer market and many of the top clubs are currently well stocked in the defensive midfield position. Club chairman Steve Parish said last weekend: "I think Adam at some point will want to play either in the Champions League with us - if we can make that happen - or probably with another club." Every player has a price and Palace will not stand in Wharton‚Äôs way if his hefty valuation is met ‚Äì as was the case with Eberechi Eze in the summer. The club would also make sure they have contingency plans for a replacement in place if the former Blackburn star was to depart.

Title: Why have Spurs reappointed Paratici?
Content: Sky Sports' Michael Bridge explains Tottenham's decision to reappoint Fabio Paratici as sporting director: It's big news for Tottenham. There has been so many changes over the past few months, the biggest obviously being the departure of Daniel Levy and introduction of a new head coach in Thomas Frank. Fabio Paratici is back, but he's never really gone away. He's been at the training ground constantly, and he's an influential figure. He's got a contacts book bigger than the Yellow Pages. He's a very good negotiator and obviously Spurs are delighted to have him back in a full-time capacity. Most notably, signings made under him were the likes of Rodrigo Bentancur, Dejan Kulusevski and Christian Romero. They've not all been a success, but no sporting director has got a 100 per cent record. Thomas Frank as given the thumbs up on this. Paratici wanted Frank as the club's new head coach when asked in the summer. They won't agree on everything, but that's what the club wants - multiple viewpoints.

Title: 'Wharton moves above Baleba in Man Utd transfer shortlist'
Content: Crystal Palace midfielder Adam Wharton has moved above Brighton's Carlos Baleba on Manchester United's transfer wishlist, according to the i newspaper. Sky Sports News reported earlier this month that signing a new midfielder a key target next summer. The Old Trafford club have long been admirers of Baleba, however, despite heavily reported interest, United didn't pursue a move for the 21-year-old during the transfer window. It is now being reported that Ruben Amorim and United's attention has now turned to Wharton amid doubts over Baleba's resolve after a slow start to the campaign from the Cameroon international. Baleba has failed to complete a full 90 minutes this term, struggling for form since the beginning of the season, while Wharton has continued to impress. The report suggests some at United view Wharton as the 'next Michael Carrick', with the midfielder fitting the bill of what the Reds need in the middle of the park. Wharton has a current deal at Selhurst Park that runs until 2029.

Title: Muscat favourite to take over at Rangers
Content: Kevin Muscat is emerging as the frontrunner for the Rangers job, but he is not the only candidate the Ibrox club are in talks with. Sky Sports Newsunderstands the 52-year-old ‚Äì who is currently manager of Chinese club Shanghai Port‚Äì is highly regarded by the Rangers hierarchy, who are considering various options as they search for Russell Martin‚Äôs successor. Former Sheffield Wednesday boss Danny Rohl is another option who has held talks and impressed. It comes afterSky Sports Newsrevealed on Saturday that Steven Gerrard had pulled out of the process, with the timing of a possible move back to Ibrox thought to be an issue.

Title: Chelsea relaxed over Caicedo
Content: Chelsea have no concern over the future of Moises Caicedo following the midfielder's split from former agent Manuel Sierra, say The Telegraph. Caicedo's Chelsea deal runs until 2031, with the option of a further year. The 23-year-old's form this season has prompted high praise, with Sky Sports' Jamie Carragher naming him among the best central midfielders in the Premier League.

Title: Casemiro could stay at Man Utd under new terms
Content: Manchester United are considering extending midfielder Casemiro's contract beyond this season, but only if he takes a cut in wages, according to reports. The Brazil midfielder is under contract until June 2026 and as things stand will leave Old Trafford as a free agent in the summer. Casemiro has made five starts this season, scoring once, and become a key figure under Ruben Amorim.

Title: Paratici rejoins Spurs following football ban
Content: Tottenham have announced that Fabio Paratici has returned to the club in a new structure that includes two sporting directors. Paratici will join Johan Lange, who has been promoted from technical director to sporting director. Paratici initially stepped back from his role at Spurs in 2023 following a ban from football operations, that was made worldwide by FIFA. The Italian was handed a 30-month suspension from the game after his former club Juventus, where he worked for 11 years, were found guilty by an Italian court of false accounting. In a statement, Spurs said the move to appoint to appoint two sporting directors is designed to "strengthen leadership, collaboration and long-term decision-making." The club's CEO, Vinai Venkatesham, said: ‚ÄúThis is an important evolution in how we operate. The remit of a Sporting Director today is vast, and by uniting two exceptional leaders in Johan and Fabio, we‚Äôre setting the foundations for sustained success."

Rashford: Leaving Man Utd for Barca boosted my World Cup chances
Content: Marcus Rashford says he has found it difficult to be at his best on a regular basis due to being in an "inconsistent environment for a very long time" - but he expects his loan from Man Utd to Barcelona to boost his World Cup prospects. The forward fell out of favour at Old Trafford under Ruben Amorim but had a positive spell at Aston Villa in the second half of last season, with six goal involvements in 14 appearances across the Premier League and Champions League. Rashford was out of the England frame for a year from March 2024, missing the Euros, but returned in March 2025 on the back of his Villa form. "I feel like I've been in an inconsistent environment for a very long time," he told ITV Sport. "It's even more difficult to be consistent then. "Obviously I want to be at my best. Not sometimes but as often as possible." Asked if the move to Barcelona improved his chances of going to the World Cup, he said: "Yeah. Yeah." Then asked if he had stayed at Man Utd, would he be selected for England, he said: "I wouldn't have been playing! So no I don't think I'd have been selected."

Title: Watford turn down formal Dennis deal
Content: Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Dharmesh Sheth: Watford have decided against signing striker Emmanuel Dennis at this stage. The 27-year-old free agent was in talks with the club over an 18-month contract and underwent medical and fitness tests on Tuesday. It‚Äôs understood the club have decided not to sign their former player, but have left the door open to resume talks in January. Dennis has been training with the club and this may continue, informally.

Title: 'He can be a World Cup game changer for England' | Bentley heaps praise on Rashford
Sweden sack head coach Dahl Tomasson
Content: Sweden sack national team manager Tomasson Sweden have sacked national team boss Jon Dahl Tomasson. The Swedish FA's decision comes a day after they missed out on automatic qualification to the 2026 World Cup, following a 1-0 defeat to Kosovo on Monday night. However, Sweden can still qualify for the tournament should they make March's play-offs. However they are bottom of Group B, having taken just one point from four games. It's the first time the country have ever sacked an international manager. In an official statement, The Sweden FA explained "The decision is based on disappointing results in the World Cup qualifiers. The decision made by the board is rooted in the fact that the men's national team has not delivered the results we had hoped for. "There is still a chance for a playoff in March, and our responsibility is to ensure that we have the best possible conditions to reach a World Cup final. "In this assessment, we believe that new leadership in the form of a new head coach is required, says Simon √Östr√∂m, chairman of the Swedish Football Association. Football chief Kim K√§llstr√∂m added: "We have a group of players that we believe in very much and want to create new opportunities for them to deliver. We believe that this team can qualify for the World Cup if the chance for a playoff exists in March." The FA thanked Tomasson for his contributions, since taking post in February 2024. and have said work to find a replacement has begun immidiately.

Title: 'Semenyo has release clause in Bournemouth contract'
Content: In-form forward Antoine Semenyo has a release clause in his Bournemouth contract, according to Talk Sport. Semenyo was a target for a host of big clubs over the summer, but no one could meet Bournemouth's valuation of more than ¬£70m and he signed a new deal instead. This report claims that his new contract includes a release clause - but its value has so far not emerged. Manchester United and Tottenham explored a potential deal for Semenyo over the summer, Sky Sports News understands, while every top six club other than Arsenal showed interest. Interest is only expected to intensify this summer after Semenyo's blistering start to the season has seen him score six goals in seven Premier League appearances.

Title: 'Brighton not willing to sell Baleba in January'
Content: Brighton have no plans to cash in on Manchester United target Carlos Baleba in January, according to Talk Sport. United showed interest in the midfielder over the summer but chose not to pursue a deal further due to Brighton's reluctance to sell. Nothing has changed with regard to United's admiration of the player - but this report claims they would have to wait until at least the summer if they are to reignite their interest. Sky Sports News understands that United will make signing a midfielder a key target for next summer. Casemiro is out of contract at the end of the season and there is a realistic chance that his deal will not be extended. Baleba is understood to be one of a number of options United are looking at, with Nottingham Forest's Elliot Anderson also admired.

Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Anthony Joseph: Free agent Emmanuel Dennis will undergo a medical and fitness tests with Watford tomorrow. No deal has been reached yet. Watford also want to make sure he is the right fit for the dressing room and new boss Javi Gracia. Any deal will be heavily incentivised for the club to gain promotion to the Premier League.

Title: Muscat being considered as Martin successor at Rangers
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Sahil Jaidka: Kevin Muscat is among the various options Rangers are considering as they search for a new head coach. The 52-year-old ‚Äì who played for Rangers in the 2002/03 treble-winning season ‚Äì is currently manager of Chinese club Shanghai Port. Their campaign is in its closing stages, with four league games to go over the next six weeks, and Muscat‚Äôs side top of the table by two points. Muscat has won silverware as a boss in Australia, Japan, and China, plus had a spell in the dugout in Belgium too and had been linked with the Ibrox job in recent seasons. He is just one of several candidates Rangers are considering to pursue, with Danny Rohl having already impressed Ibrox officials after talks. The 36-year-old, who was sounded out by Rangers in the summer before Russell Martin was appointed, led Sheffield Wednesday to a 12th-placed finish in the Championship in his only full season as a manager before leaving the troubled Yorkshire club in July. Previously an assistant manager at RB Leipzig, Bayern Munich and with the Germany national team, he had steered Wednesday out of relegation trouble the previous campaign.

Title: Watford in talks to sign Dennis - again!
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Anthony Joseph: Watford are in talks to sign striker Emmanuel Dennis for a third time. Sky Sports News understands the 27-year-old free agent is very keen on a return to Vicarage Road and is willing to accept a fraction of his market-value salary. Watford will need to assess his fitness and physical condition. They also want to make sure he is the right fit for new boss Javi Gracia, before finalising any deal. Dennis has had two spells at Watford between 2021-2023 and then again on loan in the second half of the 2023/24 season.

Title: WATCH: 'That ship has sailed' | Will Marcus Rashford return to Manchester United?
Content: Sky Sports' Clinton Morrison believes Marcus Rashford's time at Manchester United is over despite having over two years remaining on his contract at the club. Rashford is currently on loan at Barcelona, who have an option to make the deal permanent at the end of the season, with his contract at Old Trafford set to expire in 2028. "He has been outspoken. He has talked about the inconsistent environment at Manchester United, which he didn't feel brought out the best of him," Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett said while assessing Rashford's situation. "There has been a lot of change at United in terms of personnel and how they want to play. We know it has been a time for Rashford at United. "It was an objective view of what has been a difficult time. He still has, after the season-long loan at Barcelona, two years on his contract. "Barcelona have an option to buy him and from what we are being told, they won't consider that until the end of the season. To which Clinton Morrison, while speaking on Sky Sports News, replied: "The club might think that but Rashford does not think that. "Maybe his time is over. He still has two more years but I think he moves on. "He's a top talent and he is letting his feet do the talking."

Title: Business as usual for Postecoglou despite pressure building
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas: Ange Postecoglou has been at the Nottingham Forest training ground every working day during the international break, training with the players he still has at his disposal. The Australian is continuing to prepare the team for the game against Chelsea this weekend, with his international players due to start returning to base on Wednesday. Despite Postecoglou‚Äôs position as Forest boss being under scrutiny already, after failing to win any of his first seven games as manager in all competitions, including five losses, it is business as usual in West Bridgford. There are still four days to go before Forest play Chelsea and only owner Evangelos Marinakis will decide whether and when to change managers or not. Postecoglou was himself appointed on the Tuesday before the Premier League return during September's international break.

Title: Bright announces international retirement
Content: Millie Bright has announced her retirement from international football with England. Bright withdrew from Lionesses contention before the successful Euro 2025 campaign to protect her physical and mental health. Speaking on the Rest is Football Podcast with Rachel Daly, Bright said: "It‚Äôs one of those decisions no one can make for you. It‚Äôs a feeling and I‚Äôm at peace with it. "Having the summer to reflect, fix my knee, and get my head straight really put things into perspective. As you get older, your priorities change. I‚Äôve been craving family time, time with friends, and time for myself. "I‚Äôve always played through every injury I‚Äôve ever had, but I got to a stage where I needed to make smart decisions and look after my physical and mental health. "I am retiring from international football. I‚Äôm incredibly proud and honoured to have played for England for so long. Every single cap has been special and the memories I‚Äôve made, especially with this one sat opposite me, have been some of the best of my life. But it‚Äôs time. It‚Äôs the right time for me to call it a day with England. "

Title: Pickford agrees long-term Everton deal
Content: Latest from Rob Dorsett, Vinny O'Connor & Lyall Thomas: Jordan Pickford has agreed terms on a new long-term contract with Everton. Sky Sports News has been told he is expected to sign it before Everton‚Äôs next game against Man City this weekend. Sky Sports News reported in September (below) that the club want Pickford to stay for the rest of his career ‚Äì and that ambition has now moved a step closer. Pickford has agreed terms on a new four-year deal. His current deal runs until 2027, which would mark 10 years at the club, and the new deal is expected to extend that stay well beyond. Sky Sports News reported last month that the proposed new contract could take Pickford past his 36th birthday. He will turn 32 in March. Currently in his ninth season as an Everton player, Pickford has long established himself as England‚Äôs first-choice despite Everton‚Äôs well documented struggles against relegation. Everton believe Pickford is happy, settled and open to the idea of committing the majority (possibly all) of his remaining years at the highest level to the club. They are hopeful the positivity of the new stadium; new ownership; the encouraging upturn in form under David Moyes; and a successful summer transfer window in which the signing of Jack Grealish has been a real signal of the club‚Äôs ambitions. Everton travel to the Etihad on Saturday.

Title: Glasner has had ‚Äòearly conversations‚Äô with Crystal Palace over new deal
Content: Crystal Palace have had ‚Äúearly conversations‚Äù with manager Oliver Glasner about extending his contract, co-owner and chairman Steve Parish has revealed. The highly-rated Austrian led Palace to their first major trophy with FA Cup success last year and has since won the Community Shield and enjoyed a strong start to the Premier League season. His current deal expires at the end of the campaign and Parish told talkSPORT: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had some early conversations. We would love to keep Oliver, we‚Äôre building something. I think for Oliver it‚Äôs about the conditions being right. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs about everything being in a way that he enjoys his work and he finds the conditions favourable to achieve. ‚ÄúOliver wants to win things. He makes no secret of that. That‚Äôs what he‚Äôs in football for. ‚ÄúSo if we can align those interests then hopefully we can make something happen.‚Äù Parish also said midfielder Adam Wharton was ‚Äúfocused‚Äù on the Eagles amid reports linking Manchester United with a move for the England international. He said: ‚ÄúI think Adam at some point will want to play either in the Champions League with us, if we can make that happen, or probably with another club. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs an extraordinary talent. I think right now, and I can‚Äôt speak for Adam, but I think he‚Äôs focused on his time at Crystal Palace.‚Äù

Monchi: I thought Asensio was going to join Villa
Content: Former Aston Villa sporting director Monchi has revealed he thought Marco Asensio was going to end up back at the club. Asensio enjoyed a good loan spell at Villa Park last season but ended up moving to Fenerbahce instead from Paris Saint-Germain. And Monchi, who was replaced as Villa's transfer chief by Roberto Olabe, was quoted by Eldesmarque as saying: ‚ÄúI thought he was going to end up at Villa Park, which was the goal. ‚Äú[The deal collapsed] mainly for financial reasons, because PSG was being tougher on us. In the end Marco was also worried, he was nervous. He saw that the transfer market was going on. ‚ÄúHe opted for Fenerbahce. It‚Äôs true that I thought, we all thought, that he could end up at Villa Park, because he had also had six very good months previously.‚Äù

Title: Nagelsmann defends Wirtz after quiet Liverpool start
Content: Germany head coach Julian Nagelsmann has defended the form of Florian Wirtz after a quiet start to life at Liverpool. The attacking midfielder has yet to register a goal or an assist in the Premier League for the Reds since joining in a move over ¬£100m from Bayer Leverkusen. "Even if he hasn't scored a goal, he's the player who creates the most chances in the Premier League," Nagelsmann told Sport 1 when asked about Wirtz. "It's not his fault if his team-mate doesn't create them, and the statistic isn't even a third of the truth. He simply has to get used to the league. "I've seen him feel completely liberated. He knows what he's capable of and how things work. Not everything has always been handed to him - he'll work hard now, too."

Title: Wilshere among leading candidates for Luton job
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Chris Reidy: Jack Wilshere is understood to be among the leading contenders for the Luton job. The League One club are at the interview stage of their process finding a new manager. They are thought to have three preferred candidates: Wilshere being high in their thoughts. Another is thought to be Richie Wellens but Leyton Orient would be due compensation to hire him. Charlie Daniels - the senior academy coach at Watford - is also said to be one of the names that has been considered among several others. Luton sacked Matt Bloomfield following their loss to Stevenage in League One with the team 11th in the league.

Title: Gerrard will not return as Rangers head coach
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Sahil Jaidka: Steven Gerrard will not return as Rangers head coach after he removed himself from the process to become Russell Martin's successor. Sky Sports News understands Rangers held open and constructive discussions with Gerrard regarding the head coach position on Thursday and Friday. Sky Sports However, Gerrard felt the timing wasn't quite right for a return at this stage and confirmed that he did not want to continue in the recruitment process. Talks between Gerrard and Rangers were understood to be positive throughout and both sides agreed to leave the door open for the future. The former England captain expressed his gratitude for the continued support of the Rangers fans and wished the club every success for the season ahead.

Title: Gerrard, Rohl in frame for Rangers job as search continues
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph, Sahil Jaidka and Mark McAdam: Rangers are holding further talks with various candidates this weekend as they continue their search for Russell Martin‚Äôs replacement. Sky Sports News understands discussions with former manager Steven Gerrard progressed well over the past two days, as the Gers hierarchy laid out their plans for the club. The 45-year-old is thought to be open to the idea of returning to Glasgow, four years after departing for Aston Villa. He would likely bring Gary McAllister back to the club as part of his backroom team, plus former Rangers striker Jermain Defoe, while ex-England coach Steve Holland has been sounded out too. Former Sheffield Wednesday boss Danny Rohl has also impressed Ibrox chiefs during the process and remains in the race for the job. Rohl ‚Äì who has been out of work since leaving the Owls in July ‚Äì was sounded out by Rangers in the summer before the club appointed Martin. Rangers chairman Andrew Cavenagh ‚Äì who led the US takeover of the club in the summer ‚Äì and vice-chairman Paraag Marathe have been holding talks with various candidates. They have been joined by 49ers Enterprises technical director Gretar Steinsson, Gers CEO Patrick Stewart and sporting director Kevin Thelwell in London for the negotiations. Reports suggesting Rangers have offered the job to any candidate are premature, with Ibrox officials insisting a thorough process is taking place. After 123 days in the job, Martin was sacked last Sunday after a 1-1 draw at Falkirk, leaving Rangers eighth in the Scottish Premiership, 11 points adrift of leaders Hearts and nine behind rivals Celtic. Rangers return to action next Saturday as they host Dundee United at Ibrox in the league.

Title: Man Utd captain Fernandes responds to Saudi links
Content: Bruno Fernandes insists he did not shut the door on a move to Saudi Arabia in the summer to ensure he was part of Portugal's squad for the 2026 World Cup. The Manchester United captain was the subject of strong summer interest from Al Hilal, who were willing to pay ¬£100m for Fernandes and offer him a very lucrative contract to join them. Fernandes chose to stay at Old Trafford - but speculation has persisted that his mind could change if the opportunity was still on the table next summer. "I didn't close the door on moving to Saudi Arabia because of the World Cup," Fernandes said ahead of Saturday's Group F qualifier against Republic of Ireland. "That was never in my mind. I wanted to stay at Manchester United, and the club wanted me to stay. That's all there is to it." Fernandes says he has not held talks about moving to Saudi further down the line and is happy at Old Trafford. "That's an impossible scenario to imagine, because it's nothing that's been discussed with me," he added. "When it was discussed with me, I spoke openly with you at a press conference before a Nations League match. "I like to enjoy the moment, and the most important thing for me now is representing the national team, because it's a source of enormous pride to be able to play (Saturday), and I still don't know if I'll play, let alone if I'll leave Manchester United in a year. "I'm happy where I am. Otherwise, I wouldn't have stayed, but it's something that doesn't affect me."

Title: 'Spurs monitoring Schade ahead of summer'

Wilson has not only has been recognised for his recruitment and player identification but is seen as someone who can continue to grow the club off the pitch and ensure Newcastle can compete in every way possible. Title: Ronaldo becomes football's first billionaire
Content: Cristiano Ronaldo has become football's first billionaire player, according to Bloomberg. Bloomberg's Billionaires Index tracks the world's richest people based on net worth. The index has measured Ronaldo's wealth for the first time, with the valuation taking into account career earnings, investments and endorsements. It says Ronaldo's net worth is ¬£1.04bn and that he has earned over ¬£410m in salary between 2002 and 2023. Further earnings come through deals and sponsorships, including a 10-year long deal with Nike worth almost ¬£13.4m a year. Ronaldo currently plays in the Saudi Pro League for Al-Nassr.

Content: James Tarkowski has signed a two-year contract extension with Everton, keeping him at the club until the end of June 2028. "I'm super excited and proud to be an Everton player and to continue this journey," Tarkowski told evertontv. "It's been a crazy few years with some big lows and some massive highs. We've managed to get through those tough times and hopefully now we're on to more positive and exciting times ahead." The 32-year-old joined from Burnley on a free transfer in the summer of 2022, making 128 appearances in all competitions for the Toffees and becoming the club's vice-captain. The defender said: "I think the intention has been set out from the start of this season. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve loved every minute so far of working under the manager [David Moyes]. He has made it clear where we're going with this club. The results and performances have really improved in his time here and it does seem to be going in one direction. "The reason I've signed is because I want to be a part of that. Now it's up to us as players to get on board and take us in that direction."

Title: Watford sack Pezzolano as Gracia returns as replacement

Gracia, who was previously in charge for 66 games at Watford between January 2018 and September 2019, was the number one target to replace Pezzolano and has now agreed to return to Vicarage Road. Title: Alba to retire at end of season
Content: Inter Miami‚Äôs former Barcelona and Spain defender Jordi Alba announced he will retire at the end of the Major League Soccer season. The 36-year-old made 459 appearances for Barca between 2012 and 2023, winning six LaLiga titles and the 2015 Champions League. He was capped 93 times at international level and part of the Spain squad which won Euro 2012, in addition to captaining his country to Nations League glory in 2023. Alba, who is preparing for the MLS play-offs, said: ‚ÄúI feel it‚Äôs the right moment to begin a new personal chapter and fully enjoy time with my family after so many demanding years in professional football.‚Äù

Title: Henderson: With hindsight, maybe I would‚Äôve made different Saudi decision
Content: Jordan Henderson likened leaving Liverpool to a break-up and says in hindsight he may have taken ‚Äúdifferent decisions‚Äù than choosing to make the controversial switch to Saudi Arabia. The 35-year-old faced widespread criticism in 2023 when the Reds skipper made a lucrative move to play for Al-Ettifaq in a country where same sex-relationships are illegal. Henderson had been a high-profile supporter of LGBTQ+ rights and apologised for letting down or hurting anyone in the community having left Saudi to join Ajax six months into a three-year deal. The midfielder returned to the Premier League this summer by joining Brentford and admits he ‚Äústruggled for a period‚Äù after ending his 12-year association with Liverpool. ‚ÄúIt felt like a break-up,‚Äù Henderson said. ‚ÄúIt was just difficult. ‚ÄúI think if you asked a lot of players when they leave a club ‚Äì not just Liverpool ‚Äì you have been at for so long and have that attachment to, whether you retire or move on, I think for a period of time it‚Äôs really difficult. ‚ÄúThat was hard but within time things change, you move on, but I would say that was probably the most difficult time.‚Äù

Title: Is Isak's form a concern for Liverpool?
Content: Former Newcastle manager Alan Pardew speaking on the Transfer Show: "There will always be a stigma on the way the transfer has happened over him. So there there's a bit of pressure on him because of that. I think he senses that. Not from the Liverpool fanbase but from everybody else, there is some bad feeling about him. "I think he's carrying a bit of that. I think the media as well are saying 'you shouldn't have done that.' "But he's an outstanding footballer. I don't think he's the best striker in Europe. I think Haaland's above him. I think Kane's above him. But he's in that criteria. He will have a great future ahead of him."

Title: NY Red Bulls midfielder Edelman attracting interest from Championship

Title: Wirtz 'not a concern' for Liverpool
Content: Alan Pardew speaking on the Transfer Show: "I have a bit of insight on him because Freddie Woodman is the goalkeeper at Liverpool. He said he's unbelievable in training. So I don't think there's concern there. "What he was doing at Leverkusen was off the charts. He played in a slightly different position because he was wide off the left and would drift in, whereas now at Liverpool he's playing central. "I think he's finding that an issue. There's a lack of time, he isn't getting time on the ball. But Freddie tells me he's as good a player he's ever seen. "I would play him on the left for a little while and see how he evolves in the team. "I think he is a fantastic player who will settle."

Title: Will Glasner stay if Palace qualify for Champions League?

Title: Pardew: Why Parish pulled plug on Guehi deal
Content: Former Crystal Palace boss Alan Pardew on the Transfer Show: "There was a certain amount of pressure on Steve Parish from the American ownership to get that money [for Marc Guehi]. "Steve, with his football mind, knew the manager was going to be an issue, knew that Marc probably would still play at the same level, that it was a better call and that's why they made it. "[Oliver Glasner] would never have quit. I'm not saying that. But the point is you've got a manager who, let's be honest, is way above the level. He's doing a great job and in a powerful position. "Do you want to demotivate him to a level where you're selling the captain when perhaps you could keep him? So it's not the fact that Oliver was going to say 'I'm going to leave'. "It's the fact that [given] how powerful he was, that [selling Guehi] is going to be a massive blow. That's how a manager throws his toys out in the pram." Title: Why Barca, Bayern and Real Madrid have advantage in Guehi race
Content: Sky Sports News chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol: "If I had to put money on it, I would say he's going to end up next summer playing for Real Madrid or Barcelona. "I think clubs like Real Madrid and Barcelona now have an advantage because they can sign a pre-contract agreement with him in January, which Premier League clubs obviously can't do. "So Premier League clubs will have to wait until next summer if they want to sign him on a free. "Premier League clubs could make Crystal Palace a big offer for him in January. But how big would it be considering he's going to be a free agent in the summer? "Speaking to some people at other Premier League clubs, they're telling me the feeling is that Real Madrid and Barcelona and Bayern Munich are all interested in signing him, and they definitely will have the advantage."

Title: Guehi 'in a better position' after Liverpool move fell through
Content: Former Crystal Palace boss Alan Pardew on the Transfer Show: "The bottom line is what we have here is an outstanding individual as a footballer and as a personality, and every club will want him. "Marc has ended up, in my view, in a better position, than if he'd have moved to Liverpool. He's now perhaps even still got Liverpool. So who knows? He's in a great position. "I know he's a real family person and I know his father is very influential and I think between them the decision will be made."

Title: Why Guehi didn't join Liverpool
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol: "Liverpool wanted Marc Guehi, but they didn't really want him that much. They were quite laid back about if they wanted him or not. "Quite late in the window they contacted Crystal Palace and said they were willing to pay ¬£35 million. They didn't really budge from that "Obviously, Crystal Palace didn't want to lose him for nothing in the summer, so they reluctantly accepted the offer. "The problem was, Crystal Palace could not put options to Oliver Glasner that he was willing to accept. To give Steve Parish credit, around 4pm he said 'I'm really sorry, Marc Guehi isn't going anywhere.' "Steve had a face to face meeting with Marc Guehi and his father to explain the situation to him. Of course Marc Guehi was upset. "The reason he didn't end up at Liverpool is that Liverpool didn't go all out to get him. If they really really wanted him, they could've moved much earlier to get him."

Title: Palace's Guehi position - and why Barca and Real Madrid have advantage

Title: If Penders is so good - why is he not at Chelsea now?
Content: Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol: "Mike Penders is young and to be a goalkeeper in the Premier League you need to have a bit more experience. "If he was to move to Chelsea next summer after a season at Strasbourg, adding the games he has played at international level, he would have about 70 games under his belt. "I think that is enough experience for him to challenge to be the No 1 goalkeeper at Chelsea."

Title: George likely to leave Chelsea in January
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol: Tyrique George is likely to leave Chelsea in January. Multiple Champions League and Europa League clubs wanted to sign him in the summer and he came very close to joining Fulham on Deadline Day. George is viewed predominantly as a winger and Chelsea already have Pedro Neto, Estevao Willian, Jamie Gittens and Alejandro Garnacho. Geovany Quenda is also moving from Sporting Lisbon next summer. Marc Guiu will be staying at Chelsea for the whole season after his loan to Sunderland was cancelled at the end of the window.

Title: What's happening with Sterling and Disasi?
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol: Chelsea are working to find clubs for Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi in January. The players are keeping fit and it is also up to them to agree to any deal which may materialise.

Title: Why Chelsea aren't planning to sign a centre-back in January
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol: Chelsea have no plans to sign a centre-back in January as things stand. The club have enough options at centre back and that is why they are unlikely to sign any players in that position in January. The challenge is to keep the players they have fully fit. Trevoh Chalobah, Tosin Adarabioyo, Wesley Fofana, Benoit Badiashile, Josh Acheampong are all high-quality centre backs and Levi Colwill is due to return from injury later this season. Jorrel Hato and Reece James can also play at centre back and Chelsea have two centre backs out on loan who are expected to return next summer, Mamadou Sarr and Aaron Anselmino. Chelsea looked at the possibility of signing a centre back in the summer but the only high-quality option available was Dean Huijsen and he decided to join Real Madrid from Bournemouth.

Title: Chelsea's goalkeeper plans revealed
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol: Chelsea have no current plans to sign a goalkeeper over the next two transfer windows. Enzo Maresca has three goalkeepers ‚Äì Robert Sanchez, Filip Jorgensen and Mike Penders ‚Äì who are regarded as being good enough to be their established No. 1. Sanchez is an exceptional shot-stopper and he won the award for the best goalkeeper at the Club World Cup. He has made a good start to the season and despite his red card at Manchester United, he has cut down the number of mistakes he has made. Robert Sanchez has not made a single error leading to a goal this season - compared to his five in the previous campaign Jorgensen is still also highly rated at the club and he was a transfer target for some of the biggest clubs in England in the summer. Penders has been in impressive form at Strasbourg and he has been receiving some rave reviews for his performances which have helped his side climb to third in the table. Chelsea were offered the chance to sign AC Milan goalkeeper Mike Maignan in the summer but decided not to pay the asking price because they had faith in Sanchez, Jorgensen and Penders.

Title: How much is Wharton worth?
Content: Former Crystal Palace boss Alan Pardew on the Transfer Show: "Adam Wharton has done exceptionally well and there is a lot of talk of big clubs already looking at his progression. He is a player that can take the ball comfortably with real pressure on him. "He also has outstanding vision and you can set up your team to play through him. There are not many midfielders you can do that with. "I can understand from Crystal Palace's point of view - and particularly with Marc Guehi's situation - of [wanting] this guy tied down to a contract and possibly [with] a clause that suggests his figure might be minimum ¬£65m-¬£70m." Adam Wharton has four years left on his Crystal Palace contract

Title: Wirtz 'not a concern' for Liverpool
Content: Alan Pardew speaking on the Transfer Show: "I have a bit of insight on him because Freddie Woodman is the goalkeeper at Liverpool. He said he's unbelievable in training. So I don't think there's concern there. "What he was doing at Leverkusen was off the charts. He played in a slightly different position because he was wide off the left and would drift in, whereas now at Liverpool he's playing central. "I think he's finding that an issue. There's a lack of time, he isn't getting time on the ball. But Freddie tells me he's as good a player he's ever seen. "I would play him on the left for a little while and see how he evolves in the team. "I think he is a fantastic player who will settle."

Title: Guehi won't be thinking about January move
Content: Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam on the Transfer Show: "January would mark the final opportunity Crystal Palace would have to make some money before seeing their captain leave on a free in the summer. "There is still a chance they persuade him to stay. They did it with Michael Olise, why can't they do it with Marc Guehi. But, it's fair to say he won't be short of offers. In fact, they are all queuing up now, speaking with his representatives to see what a deal could look like. "On January 1st, he can sign a pre-contract agreement with a club outside the Premier League. "Every big club will want him. Every big club will want him. He‚Äôs a a captain, he‚Äôs a leader, he‚Äôs proven he can win silverware. "He will probably be a key member of Thomas Tuchel's World Cup squad in the summer. And he's at the right age where he is not yet at his peak as a central defender. "In terms of his position, he will be thinking of one thing and one thing only, Crystal Palace. He won't be thinking about a move in January. "He'll be thinking if 'I play well from now until May, I will get huge money, a huge club and a huge opportunity to play at the highest level.'"

Watford analysis: Pozzo has lofty ambitions
Content: Analysis from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Paulo Pezzolano is set to become the 12th manager Watford have sacked in just five years. He came in with high expectations and was billed as a ‚Äúpromotion specialist‚Äù - having reached the top division with clubs in Spain, Brazil and Uruguay. Owner Gino Pozzo has lofty ambitions of promotion to the Premier League and the club spent big in the transfer window, including the marquee signing of Nestory Irankunda from Bayern Munich. But it‚Äôs been a mixed start this season for Pezzolano - and it appears he hasn‚Äôt met the expectations of the club hierarchy. Watford fans chanted ‚Äúyou're getting sacked in the morning‚Äù as they trailed Portsmouth at half time last week. However, they did salvage a 2-2 draw at Fratton Park and followed it up with another comeback to beat Oxford United 2-1 at weekend. The club now sit in 11th place in the English Championship having won three, drawn three and lost three. They were knocked out of the EFL Cup in the first round to Norwich City. It‚Äôs understood Javi Gracia is the number one target to replace Pezzolano. He is due to fly to England for talks today. In his first spell at Vicarage Road, he steered the club to Premier League safety in 2018. The next season he took Watford to the FA Cup final and finished 11th in the league - their highest top-flight position since 1987. However, he was sacked in his third season - with the club sitting bottom of the Premier League in September 2019. That FA Cup run is still fairly fresh in the memory of the Watford support, who hold him in high regard. Gracia was last in charge of Leeds United, when he replaced Jesse Marsch in February 2023. The 55-year-old steered Leeds out of the relegation zone, but was relieved of his duties in May that year.

Title: 'Fernandes the most consistent'
