"Luiz Diaz set the world alight for Liverpool and left a Premier League champion. "And Alexis Mac Allister, phenomenal. When I watch him live, he conducts everything. He‚Äôs the number one."

Title: Strasbourg among European clubs tracking Carvalho
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas: Strasbourg are one of several European clubs continuing to track Fabio Carvalho's situation at Brentford. The French side, owned by BlueCo who also own Chelsea, have been interested in signing him in the last two transfer windows. Brentford were categorical that Carvalho was not available in the summer and head coach Keith Andrews has insisted he is part of his plans. But Carvalho has found regular games hard to come by and the likes of Lyon and Stuttgart are also watching his progress. Carvalho has been unlucky given the superb form of Mikkel Damsgaard and an array of other attacking players last season. Brentford have intended to play him this term and boss Andrews asked for "patience" after he scored the equaliser in the late draw against Chelsea in September. "I‚Äôve got a really good relationship with Fabio where he trusts me and knows that I believe in him," Andrews said. ‚ÄúI think the key with players is that you‚Äôve got to be constantly in communication with them whether they‚Äôre playing or not. ‚ÄúWhen they‚Äôre not playing it‚Äôs obviously a bit more difficult, but you still have to communicate with them and speak to them about the game. ‚ÄúWith Fabio I‚Äôve just asked for a little bit of patience because I truly believe he will be a big player for this club.‚Äù Carvalho has played only four further minutes in the Premier League since Chelsea, although he missed the win over Manchester United with a minor injury. He has played the full 90 minutes in both Brentford‚Äôs Carabao Cup wins over Bournemouth and Aston Villa,  scoring against Bournemouth.

Title: Which of Klopp's midfield trio ranks as top signing?
Content: Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor: 1. Ryan Gravenberch The main individual success story since Arne Slot came in. He now looks an absolute bargain just over two years after he arrived from Bayern Munich for ¬£34m and it's difficult to believe he‚Äôs still only 23. The key anchor of the Liverpool midfield  in last season‚Äôs title success, he‚Äôs more than just a screen in front of the Liverpool back four because his ability on the ball is as good as his ability to break things up. He can receive on the half turn, drive at the opposition and find the right pass. His opener in the Merseyside Derby is      a prime example of how impactful he can be at both ends of the pitch. 2. Dominic Szoboszlai The midfielder cost ¬£60m in July 2023. His ability to get round the pitch at pace putting opposing players under pressure was a big feature of Liverpool‚Äôs press in their title success last season. A goal scorer in the back to back wins over City and Newcastle in February felt like real key contributions on the back of the draw at Aston Villa. This season it was his stunning free kick that snatched all three points against Arsenal at Anfield - and he‚Äôs still only 24. 3. Alexis Mac Allister His versatility has been needed since arriving from Brighton for ¬£55m in June 2023, being able to play the No 6 role as well as further forward. His strike against Spurs at Anfield as Liverpool clinched the title won the club's goal of the season.

Title: 'Ronaldo more impactful than Fernandes'
'One of the best signings of the Emirates era'
Jesus a rogue shout for best signing?
Content: Sky Sports Nick Wright: Gabriel Jesus should be in the conversation for Arsenal's best signing of the last five years. Hear me out. Injuries have prevented the Brazil international from showing the kind of sensational form demonstrated in his first few months at the club consistently. His total of 26 goals in 96 games is undeniably modest. But his impact following his arrival from Manchester City in 2022 was transformative. The Gunners went from Champions League challengers to title contenders. He was the catalyst. Mikel Arteta said he changed their world. It was not just the Premier League title-winning experience he brought along with Oleksandr Zinchenko, but the way in which he attacked his new challenge and the quality he showed. Arsenal won 14 of the 16 games Jesus started before his knee injury in December 2022. It was thanks in large part to him that they were five points ahead of Manchester City at the top of the Premier League at the time. The team has evolved in his absence since then, with more setbacks bringing more spells on the sidelines. But Arsenal's trajectory might have been very different without him.

Title: Leeds monitoring winger market after failed Wilson move
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Zinny Boswell: Leeds United are understood to be monitoring the market for wingers ahead of the January transfer window after a Deadline Day move for Harry Wilson fell through. Nothing has changed regarding the club‚Äôs admiration for the Fulham player ‚Äì but Leeds are realistic about their chances of reigniting a deal after Marco Silva said he was confident of agreeing a new contract with the Wales international. Wilson had shown an eagerness to move to Elland Road by signing a deal sheet ‚Äì but that was when his already-limited game-time looked set to be reduced further by the additions of two new wingers Kevin and Samuel Chukwueze. However, Wilson has played in all seven of Fulham‚Äôs Premier League games so far this season ‚Äì starting in five of them ‚Äì and that will only strengthen the club‚Äôs pitch to the 28-year-old in talks over a new deal, with his current one expiring at the end of this season. Fulham also showed a reluctance to sell to Leeds over the summer in their pursuit of striker Rodrigo Muniz, due to not wanting to strengthen a rival in the Premier League. That only adds another potential layer of complication, though league position could shift that thinking. Leeds will have to be mindful of PSR if they do business in January. Managing director Robbie Evans said after the summer that ‚Äúwe are maxing PSR out this season‚Äù ‚Äì and if their more expensive targets, such as Igor Paixao, had joined, others would have had to be sold. Barring any changes to the club‚Äôs PSR position before the window, loan signings present the most likely avenue for Leeds to strengthen in January and it is understood they will be attentive if any players of interest become available for a temporary move. Leeds are happy with their summer business after spending just over ¬£100m on 10 signings to improve the spine of the team, although injuries to Dan James and Willy Gnonto early in the season have highlighted why there is a desire to add more depth out wide. The situation around targets could, of course, change between now and January depending on injuries, but there is a positive mood at Elland Road and a belief that so far Farke and his players have shown they can be competitive in the Premier League. Leeds have taken eight points from their first seven games back in the top-flight and sit four points above the relegation zone, with the battle to avoid the drop shaping up to be tighter than it has been for years.

Title: Arsenal's top three signings of the 2020s
Content: Sky Sports is asking the big question this midweek: who have been your Premier League club's best signings since 2020? Sky Sports News reporters have been selecting their top THREE Premier League signings for their respective club since the turn of the decade. Sky Sports' Sam Blitz: 1. Gabriel Go look back at an Arsenal line-up five years ago and the only Mikel Arteta purchase who is still around today is Gabriel. Since his arrival in the summer of 2020, Mikel Arteta has changed every part of the defence ‚Äì bringing in William Saliba from exile, adding Ben White and Jurrien Timber on the right, plus countless left-backs signed. But Gabriel has been the one constant. The Brazilian has ultimately epitomised the modern-day Arsenal under their manager ‚Äì excellent defensively but also a threat from set pieces. His total of 18 goals from set plays is six more than any other defender and, as Jamie Carragher pointed out recently, he is performing at the same level as his centre-back partner Saliba. 2. Declan Rice Declan Rice‚Äôs signing also cannot be understated. His ¬£105m price tag ‚Äì which saw Arsenal beat Bayern Munich and Manchester City to his signature ‚Äì was a defining moment that solidified Arsenal‚Äôs spot as a top Premier League team again. Then his two free-kicks earned the eye-catching 3-0 win over Real Madrid, which in turn rubberstamped the Gunners‚Äô status as a top team in Europe. 3. David Raya David Raya pips Martin Odegaard to third place, as it was a major call from Arteta, which underlined the Arsenal manager‚Äôs ruthlessness. Aaron Ramsdale was a popular figure at Arsenal but Arteta‚Äôs constant pursuit of higher standards, as well as his bold personality, was evident in this transfer. And Arteta came out on top in the debate, with Raya now in the top two or three goalkeepers in the world on current form.

Title: Palace transfer plans to be dictated by Guehi
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra: Crystal Palace‚Äôs short-term transfer plans will largely be dictated by what happens to their captain Marc Guehi. The winter window represents the last opportunity for Palace to cash in on the central defender ahead of Guehi ‚Äì as it stands ‚Äì becoming a free agent next summer. Palace would be willing to listen to serious offers for Guehi and are preparing for his seeming inevitable departure either in January or at the end of the season. The Eagles have got off to an impressive start this season, domestically and in Europe, and they will consider significant investment in January if they believe it can help them achieve something special in the second half of the campaign. The club have never finished higher than 10th in the Premier League era but have occupied the European qualification places in the early part of this campaign. Positive conversations have already taken place with Oliver Glasner about the long-term recruitment plans - despite the uncertainty around his own position.

Title: Silva a target for Forest
Content: Marco Silva is a long-term target for Nottingham Forest even though any approach for the Fulham manager is unlikely to happen before the end of the season, report The Daily Mail. Silva's contract runs out at the end of the campaign so would be a relatively simple deal for other clubs to complete. Forest boss Ange Postecoglou is set to hold talks with owner Evangelos Marinakis about his seven-game winless start over the international break.

Title: City back Gonzalez despite Bruno Guimaraes link
Content: Manchester City are yet to identify any priority positions to strengthen in January, and they are also backing Nico Gonzalez despite reports linking them with other central midfield players. Newcastle‚Äôs Bruno Guimaraes is one they have long been mentioned with, for example, but the 27-year-old is believed to be an unlikely target for City given their preference to sign younger players. City made a number of significant signings in January 2025, including Khusanov, mainly due to the difficulties they were having in the Premier League last season. And it would likely take a similar situation to force the same level of investment in the squad this upcoming winter window. City made four new outfield additions in the summer in Tijjani Reijnders, Rayan Ait Nouri, Rayan Cherki and youngster Sverre Nypan, who joined Middlesbrough on loan. They also signed three new goalkeepers; Gianluigi Donnarumma, James Trafford and Marcus Bettinelli.

Title: Man City cool plans to sign a right-back
Content: Manchester City are cooling plans to sign a new right-back due to the impressive performances of Abdukodir Khusanov. The Uzbekistan international ‚Äì primarily a centre-back ‚Äì featured at right-back in City's matches against Manchester United, Napoli and Arsenal instead of Rico Lewis. Khusanov would likely have carried on had he not picked up an injury against Arsenal, with Matheus Nunes filling in for the last few games, and he is expected to return in the next few weeks. City had been in the market for a right-back in the summer following the departure of Kyle Walker, but they did not make an addition despite interest in the likes of Brazil‚Äôs Wesley. And City could completely shelve plans to look for another right-back until at least next summer if Khusanov continues his excellent form in the position when he returns.

Title: Palace retain full belief in Esse despite recent omissions
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra: Crystal Palace retain full belief in Romain Esse. The 20-year-old has started just one Premier League match since joining from Millwall in January. He was substituted off at half-time during Palace's Carabao Cup tie against his former club last month. He has subsequently not featured in Oliver Glasner's last three Premier League matchday squads. However, there are currently no plans to sanction a loan move for the youngster in January. The attacking midfielder has been featuring for the club's under-21 side and scored an impressive goal against Birmingham U21s on Monday night. Palace have been impressed by the manner in which Esse has conducted himself despite a clearly challenging start to life at the club. He has impressed with his application, and there are no questions about his attitude. The Eagles handed a five-and-a-half-year deal to Esse in January. They remain confident that he will fulfil his undoubted potential at Selhurst Park.

Title: Frankfurt eyeing Osula move this winter - Sky in Germany
Content: Eintracht Frankfurt still have Newcastle striker William Osula on their radar for the winter transfer window, according to Sky in Germany. The Bundesliga side are considering a loan offer for the 22-year-old. A move to Frankfurt collapsed on this summer's Deadline Day. Sky Sports News' Keith Downie reported that day that there had been talks of a near-¬£30m move, but it did not go through. The Dane has scored twice in nine appearances for the Magpies this season.

Earick confirms he does not intend to make an offer for Tottenham
Content: Brooklyn Earick has confirmed to the London Stock Exchange that he does not intend to bid for Tottenham. A Spurs statement later read: "The Board of Tottenham Hotspur Limited (the "Club") notes the recent announcements from the Firehawk and Mr Earick's consortiums that they do not intend to make an offer for the Club. "The Board thanks them for the constructive approach taken in the discussions with the Club's and the Lewis family's representatives and respecting the clear position of the Lewis family that the Club is not for sale. "Following the announcements made by the consortiums, the Club is no longer in an offer period under the City Code on Takeovers and Mergers." Sky Sports News understands Tottenham are not, and never have been, for sale. There were three expressions ‚Äì of varying degrees of seriousness - in buying the club. As some Tottenham shares are still held by private investors, prospective bidders had to make their intentions clear, as set out in the Takeover Code. Sky Sports They have all now confirmed they will not be making bids. That means they cannot bid for six months ‚Äì unless someone else enters talks about buying the club. The Lewis family are committed to owning Tottenham and are looking forward to a sustained period of stability and long-term success. It was announced at the start of September that Spurs‚Äô majority owners ENIC had ‚Äúunequivocally rejected‚Äù two expressions of interest in acquiring the north London club, with one from a consortium of investors led by Dr Roger Kennedy and Wing-Fai Ng through Firehawk. Amanda Staveley‚Äôs PCP International Finance immediately confirmed via the London Stock Exchange on September 8 that it did not intend to make an offer for Tottenham and Firehawk followed suit a month later. On September 26, Tottenham's majority shareholder ENIC had received and unequivocally rejected an informal expression of interest in buying the club from a consortium led by Mr Earick. A source close to the Lewis family told Sky Sports News last month: ‚ÄúThis unsolicited and unnecessary interest does nothing to change the family‚Äôs resolve and commitment to do whatever it takes to drive success on the pitch. The club is not for sale.‚Äù

"As a young centre back, you need games to improve. I have always been learning from the best players around me," Quansah said. "It has been so good for my career but as a young centre back, I'm 22 turning 23, I am going to be needing hundreds of games to be where I want to be. "Overall, that is why the decision was made. Title: Rangers sack Martin
Content: Rangers have sacked Russell Martin following Sunday's 1-1 draw with Falkirk. "While all transition periods require some time, results have not met the club's expectations," said a club statement. "Russell and his staff have worked exceptionally hard throughout their time at the club. We thank them for their efforts and wish them well for the future." Sunday's result left Rangers eighth in the Scottish Premiership table with only one win from seven league games under Martin. A group of fans blocked the team bus outside the Falkirk Stadium and Martin was given a police escort to his car after being booed relentlessly during and after the game. Rangers also lost their first two Europa League games of the campaign against Genk and Sturm Graz. Former Southampton boss Martin had only been in charge of the club for 123 days, making his tenure the shortest of any permanent Rangers boss.

Title: Howe: Anderson‚Äôs Newcastle departure is very regretful
Content: Eddie Howe has admitted he would ‚Äúlove‚Äù to have Elliot Anderson back at Newcastle. The 22-year-old academy graduate found himself at the centre of a transfer window drama during the summer of 2024 when the Magpies reluctantly sold him to Nottingham Forest for ¬£35m in an ultimately successful bid to avoid Premier League sanctions under profitability and sustainability rules. Anderson has since established himself as a fixture in Forest‚Äôs midfield and as a member of Thomas Tuchel‚Äôs England squad to leave his hometown club wondering what might have been as he prepares to line up against them at St James‚Äô Park this weekend. Asked if he could see Anderson returning to Tyneside one day, head coach Howe said: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, but certainly from my perspective I would love him to. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm very respectful of the fact he is at another football club and I would never normally talk about a player in that way, so I won‚Äôt change that stance. ‚ÄúBut yes, it is very regretful a player from the academy who had given so much ‚Äì and the club had given so much too, the coaching staff, all those years here and how people tried to develop those talents ‚Äì for him not to be utilised here is a real shame.‚Äù Anderson‚Äôs departure, along with that of Yankuba Minteh to Brighton, dug the Magpies out of a financial hole, but in effect, they received only ¬£15m for one of their brightest prospects after they paid ¬£20m for goalkeeper Odysseas Vlachodimos, currently on loan at Sevilla, to make the deal happen. Asked if Forest got a bargain, Howe said: ‚ÄúYes, we knew that. We knew that the minute it was going to happen, or likely to happen, that we were massively selling him at a big discount. ‚ÄúBut the position we were in, we weren‚Äôt in a very strong negotiating position at all, and it was that or a points deduction. I‚Äôve said many times we had no choice but to make the sale, but it was not one we wanted to do.‚Äù

The Verdict: Forest fans show frustration at Ange after European defeat
'Entitled to their opinion' | Ange responds to 'sacked in morning' chants
Fans give verdict on Postecoglou
Content: Sky Sports‚Äô Adam Bate at the City Ground following Nottingham Forest's 3-2 defeat to FC Midtjylland: The atmosphere at the end was unpleasant, hardly how Nottingham Forest had wanted their big night to reach its denouement. It had begun with nostalgia and pyrotechnics. Forest are back. It concluded in acrimony with calls for Ange Postecoglou to depart. He is six games into this job so on one level it is absurd. And yet, given the popularity of his predecessor and the underwhelming reaction to his appointment, he needed an encouraging start to convince the doubters. Instead, he has not won a single game. Arsenal away was a daunting start but a cup tie against Swansea, two matches against promoted teams, and an inviting fixture at home to Danish opposition in a Europa League they kicked off among the favourites to win, provided a real opportunity for him. Instead, despite dominating possession in those games, he has been unable to offer a vision of how he can improve Forest. Indeed, some might argue it is because of dominating possession in those games. This was not what their success was built on. Perhaps Forest have to evolve away from their counter-attacking approach, add more to their repertoire if they are to progress. But for now, it seems they have lost what made them so good without adding anything of note. Too passive. Uncertain in both boxes. Postecoglou insists they are on the right track, but the sense at the City Ground on Thursday evening was that few would agree with that sentiment right now. Regardless of the coach, there would be concerns. But for many fans, the verdict on Postecoglou is in.

Robbie Thelwell - who has been at Norwich since July 2024 as the English Championship club's head of technical scouting and loan management - is one of many backroom moves expected to be announced in the coming days. He had also worked at the likes of Aston Villa and Wolves. SSN understands Rangers are aware the appointment will bring scrutiny following a poor start to the season but are confident he will deliver for the Ibrox club, after he came through a competitive process. Rangers will also appoint a new head scout - with Everton's Nathan Fisher set to join. The 36-year-old is well known by Thelwell and technical director Dan Purdy. Other changes around kit manager, head of performance and data insights lead are also expected to be announced by Rangers, who play Sturm Graz on Thursday in the Europa League.

Title: Cannavaro agrees terms with Uzbekistan
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Italy and Real Madrid legend Fabio Cannavaro has agreed terms to become the head coach of Uzbekistan. The 52-year-old has been out of management since April, when he was sacked by Dinamo Zagreb after just three months in charge.

Title: Gibbs-White opens up on 'stressful' Tottenham transfer saga
Content: Nottingham Forest midfielder Morgan Gibbs-White has opened up on his summer transfer saga. Tottenham triggered a ¬£60m release clause in his previous contract at the club and was set to undergo a medical ahead of a move to north London, before going on to sign a new three-year deal at the City Ground. "Really stressful time for me personally and my family. There were a lot of things that happened behind the scenes in my personal life, it was difficult to focus on football," Gibbs-White said. "In reality, your family is everything and you have to put them first. That is the decision I made, to be with my wife and newborn son. That is what happened in the summer."

Malacia back in first team training after Amorim talks
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Danyal Khan: Tyrell Malacia has been reintegrated into Manchester United's first team and was seen training with the squad for the first time today. This was always the plan and timeline for Malacia to rejoin the first team. Malacia met with manager Ruben Amorim earlier this week after he had been training with U23s in recent weeks. The 26-year-old's attitude has been described as outstanding with United's reserve squad and requested to feature for the side before he was reintegrated back into the first team. Malacia had trained separately away from the main group since pre-season, with a move away from the club failing to materialise in the summer. The Dutchman can, although of course unlikely, feature for United immediately in the league as he was in their squad list submitted at the start of the season. Malacia hasn't featured for United in the Premier League since January 26.

Title: Carragher: Wirtz needs dropping
Content: Liverpool summer signing Florian Wirtz needs dropping despite the Reds spending eight figures on the German midfielder, believes Sky Sports' Jamie Carragher. Wirtz arrived at Anfield with high expectations after lighting up the Bundesliga with Bayer Leverkusen, but has failed to register a single goal contribution in the Premier League or Champions League for his new club, despite starting seven of eight games across both competitions. Carragher caveated that the 22-year-old still had time on his side but told CBS:  ‚ÄúRight now, the balance of the team is not right, and the obvious one that stands out is Florian Wirtz, who is just not at the races at all. "He's a young boy, coming to a new league, and has plenty of time to go. "But right now, he needs to come out of the team, Liverpool go back to what they were last season, and try to build some confidence and some stability. Right now it looks like a mess."

Title: Silva: I know where my future lies after contract expiry
Content: Man City's Champions League clash in Monaco will see midfielder Bernardo Silva back at the club he left for City in a ¬£43.5million deal in 2017. Head coach Pep Guardiola promoted the Portugal international to club captain following the departures of Kyle Walker and Kevin De Bruyne, and Silva could yet follow them in leaving while in possession of the armband, with the 31-year-old in the final months of his contract. ‚ÄúI know exactly what I‚Äôm going to do but it‚Äôs not the time to focus on it,‚Äù Silva said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs to do my best, to put the club back to where it belongs. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had a lot of captains who‚Äôve left but it‚Äôs for the guys who have the most experience to pass it on to the young guys.‚Äù

Title: Fowler sign new City deal until 2027
Content: Manchester City have announced that Mary Fowler has signed a contract extension to the summer of 2027. Fowler has featured 87 times for City in all competitions, scoring 21 goals and assisting 22 times since joining from Montpellier in 2022. On signing her new deal, Fowler said: ‚Äú[City has felt like home for me for quite a while now so to continue this journey with them, I‚Äôm really proud to do that. I‚Äôm really excited to continue working with the girls. ‚Äú[There are a] few reasons [for my decision to extend]. Enjoying my football is a big part of me playing well and City has created an environment where I can flourish in that sense."

Title: Hurzeler: 'A lot of respect' for Amorim amid Man Utd rumours
Content: Brighton head coach Fabian Hurzeler has refused to be drawn on rumours he is in contention to replace under-pressure Man Utd boss Ruben Amorim if the Portuguese head coach were to get the chop at Old Trafford. The 32-year-old is said to be one of a number of potential replacements for Amorim after a bright first season at the Amex Stadium, where he led the Seagulls to eighth in the Premier League. Hurzeler is said to feature alongside Oliver Glasner and Andoni Iraola on a United shortlist if Amorim, who has lost three of his six Premier League games this season, is shown the exit door less than a year after his appointment. "Tough decisions and rumours are always part of this job so you have to accept it, you have to deal with it, but I really want to say that I have a lot of respect for Ruben Amorim so I won't talk about his job or any rumours that might come," he told Sky Sports. "Regarding him, I'm really privileged to be a coach for Brighton and Hove Albion, I'm very happy here and we still have a lot of work to do."

Title: Arteta delighted to keep Arsenal spine for trophy hunt
Content: Mikel Arteta believes Arsenal's key players are committing their futures to the club because they can fulfil their ambitions to win trophies in north London. William Saliba has become the latest Gunners star to sign a new long-term deal, despite interest from Real Madrid. The France defender's previous contract had been due expire in 2027 and he has now extended his stay to 2030. "It's big news, I'm very happy and it's congratulations to William," said Gunners boss Arteta. "He fully deserves his new contract, he has been phenomenal over the last few years and we are very happy to keep the spine of the team with us. "First of all it shows that they belong to this club and that they share the same ambition as the club and want to continue their careers here."

Title: McInnes: Shankland should hold onto WC dream
Content: Hearts manager Derek McInnes has told Lawrence Shankland to keep hold of his World Cup dream, despite missing out on the latest Scotland squad. Shankland put himself in the frame for a recall ahead of October‚Äôs World Cup qualifiers against Greece and Belarus after hitting seven goals in his first 10 matches of the season. However, Scotland head coach Steve Clarke named a very settled squad after starting the campaign with four points from two matches and stuck with Che Adams, Lyndon Dykes, Kieron Bowie and George Hirst as his strike options. Shankland has scored three goals in 16 internationals with his most recent appearance coming in November last year. When asked if he was surprised Shankland had not made the cut, McInnes said: ‚ÄúI was hoping that he would be and I had a brief chat with Lawrence on the back of the conversation I had with Steve. ‚ÄúBut Scotland‚Äôs two strikers particularly did well last time out and Steve said that, he was pleased with Dykes and Adams, and there are another couple of strikers. ‚ÄúListen, the motivation for Lawrence and all the players involved with Scotland, whether they are in this squad or not, is to try and get involved in a World Cup. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want Lawrence or anybody else to lose sight of that.‚Äù

Title: Howe defends Woltemade after Bayern comments
Content: Newcastle boss Eddie Howe has leapt to Nick Woltemade's defence after Bayern Munich executive Karl-Heinz Rummenigge claimed Stuttgart had found "an idiot" to pay ¬£69m for him. The 23-year-old Germany international arrived at St James' Park for a club record fee on deadline day as the Magpies reinvested some of the ¬£130m they had raked in for Alexander Isak. Bayern were also engaged in the race to sign Woltemade, but ultimately had to admit defeat, prompting Rummenigge to tell Blickpunkt Sport: "I congratulate Stuttgart, because they found an idiot who paid the money we didn't want to pay in Munich." Asked about the former Germany frontman's comments as he conducted his pre-match press conference in Brussels ahead of Wednesday night's Champions League clash with Union Saint-Gilloise, head coach Howe said: "The market forces dictate transfer fees, not necessarily any one club. We're very pleased to have Nick with us. "I think he's started very strongly in what's been a difficult period for him because he's thrust straight into action, no training time with us, really, of any note and I think he's done really, really well, so we're really pleased to have him with us and the transfer fee, for me, is absolutely irrelevant." Woltemade has scored two goals in his three Premier League appearances to date as he gets to grip with life in England's top tier and will hope for a first Champions League start against the Belgian champions. He could be forgiven for feeling the weight of his hefty price tag, but Howe is confident that will not be an issue. He said: "I don't think he's that kind of character. I don't think he necessarily over-thinks things too much, which is a really big strength. "What he's going to be judged on is how he performs in the team and what he gives to the club going forward."

Malacia reintegrated into Manchester United squad
Content: Tyrell Malacia will return to first-team training with Manchester United. The 26-year-old had been part of the so-called ‚Äòbomb squad‚Äô of players United had deemed surplus to requirements in the summer, along with Marcus Rashford, Alejandro Garnacho, Jadon Sancho and Antony. While the other four left the club, Malacia remained at United after a loan move to Spanish side Elche fell through. He has been training with the under-21s but the PA news agency understands he has now been reintegrated with the senior squad. Sources close to the club said this was a planned change and not in response to United‚Äôs form or to injuries suffered by other players. Malacia joined United in 2022, becoming the first signing of Erik ten Hag‚Äôs reign as head coach. He was a regular for the Red Devils in the 2022-23 season but suffered a long-term knee injury towards the end of that campaign which forced him to miss the whole of the 2023-24 season. He joined PSV Eindhoven on loan in the second half of last season, having featured eight times under Ruben Amorim prior to that.

Title: Bayern chief: We want to keep Kane
Content: Bayern Munich sporting director Max Eberl has hinted that Harry Kane is set for contract negotiations with the club. Kane has two years left on his Bayern contract amid rumours that a ¬£57m release clause could be active this summer. The England captain became the fastest player to score 100 goals for a club in Europe's top-five leagues at the weekend, doing so in 104 matches. "Harry is an exceptional player for us, a true leader," Eberl said. "He underscored his desire to join Bayern. He also said it's great to play with us and win titles. "We want to continue doing that with him for a long time to come. That's why we'll discuss the next steps with him in a relaxed way." Eberl also discussed the future of defender Dayot Upamecano alongside Kane, saying:  "I'm not surprised that many clubs are interested in Dayot. We're also interested in extending his contract. "It takes time, like the other contracts last year. ‚ÄúWe're trying to conduct the talks and convince him of the Bayern project. We definitely want to keep them both."

Content: Former Liverpool and Newcastle United midfielder Jonjo Shelvey has joined Dubai‚Äôs Arabian Falcon‚Äôs FC. The 33-year-old began his career at the age of 17, at Arsenal and West Ham before becoming the youngest Charlton Athletic player and goal-scorer in 2008. As well as stints with Liverpool and Newcastle, Shelvey has played for Swansea, Nottingham Forest and in Turkey with Caykur Rizespor, Eyupspor. He spent the second half of last season at Burnley. Shelvey made his debut from his new side on Saturday in their first match of the new league season. It was his first competitive appearance since starting for Burnley against Preston in the FA Cup fifth round in March. Shelvey has been assigned the number 53 shirt at his new club this season, making this the third different side he has played for already in 2025 after spells in both Turkey and England.

Title: Savinho ‚Äòclose‚Äô to signing new Man City deal, says boss Guardiola
Content: Pep Guardiola has said Manchester City have been clear in their desire to keep Savinho with the Brazil winger close to signing a new contract at the Etihad Stadium. Savinho was the subject of strong interest from Tottenham last month but talk of a ¬£69million move to north London ultimately came to nothing, and the 21-year-old is now expected to sign a new deal committing himself to City until 2031. ‚ÄúWe were so clear that we want to keep him,‚Äù Guardiola said after Savinho started in Saturday‚Äôs 5-1 win over Burnley, days after getting his first goal of the season in the Carabao Cup win over Huddersfield. ‚ÄúIt depends on the offer (from Tottenham). Maybe the offer was not good enough for the club, I don‚Äôt know. ‚ÄúBut of course, at his age, last season he played a lot of minutes. He can play on both sides, right and left, has pace that is unbelievable. So in that term, he‚Äôs really good.‚Äù Savinho is in line to follow a number of Guardiola‚Äôs squad in signing fresh terms. Nico O‚ÄôReilly was the latest player to sign a new contract on Friday, coming after new deals for Ruben Dias and Rico Lewis in recent weeks. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs happened with Rico, Nico‚Ä¶Savinho is close, and in the past, Ruben has done it as well,‚Äù Guardiola said. ‚ÄúSo we‚Äôll try to be sure to show a player that we want him. Do the effort that we need to stay a bit longer. So I‚Äôm really pleased. ‚ÄúNico is growing a lot. I think since he started to play, we lost just one game. The final FA Cup against Palace. ‚ÄúWhen he‚Äôs not been involved it was defeats all the time. So Nico helped us a lot, improved a lot in his aggressivity and set pieces and with the ball. We‚Äôre really, really pleased.‚Äù

Title: Rooney has no faith in Ruben Amorim to turn things around at United
Content: Wayne Rooney has no faith in Ruben Amorim to turn things around at Manchester United and believes the soul has gone from his former club. Head coach Amorim has taken 34 points from his 33 Premier League games in charge following Saturday‚Äôs 3-1 loss at Brentford and is yet to oversee consecutive top-flight wins. Rooney, United‚Äôs all-time leading goalscorer, said he goes to games expecting the team to lose and feels some players do not deserve to represent the club. Despite the ongoing poor form, which includes last month‚Äôs Carabao Cup exit at League Two Grimsby, Amorim reportedly retains the backing of United‚Äôs board. ‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs going on,‚Äù Rooney said. ‚ÄúI have tried my hand in management and it didn‚Äôt work out too well, so I get it. Ruben Amorim is my age, he‚Äôs still a young manager and I‚Äôm sure he‚Äôs got a massive future, but what‚Äôs going on at Man Utd, this is not Man Utd. ‚ÄúI honestly hope he can turn it round and he does. But‚Ä¶after everything I‚Äôve seen, honestly, I‚Äôve got no faith in it.‚Äù

Title: Nuno looking for fast start to life at West Ham
Content: Nuno Espirito Santo knows he needs to hit the ground running when he takes charge of West Ham for the first time at Everton on Monday Night Football. The 51-year-old was confirmed as the Hammers‚Äô new head coach on Saturday, just four hours after Graham Potter was sacked, and took training later that afternoon. Nuno, who was axed by Nottingham Forest less than three weeks ago, inherits a side lying 19th in the Premier League having lost four of their five matches and been knocked out of the Carabao Cup by Wolves. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm trying to, as soon as possible, know all the players,‚Äù he told West Ham TV. ‚ÄúI think I know them better than they know me, because it‚Äôs like that. We are coaches and we try to take all the info that we can about the players. ‚ÄúMany of them, we faced each other before and now it‚Äôs preparing for the game, a tough game against Everton.‚Äù

Title: Nuno was No 1 option - but is he right for West Ham?
Content: Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol: "We were told on Thursday by a very senior source that the next West Ham manager was going to be Nuno Espirito Santo. Perhaps the timing would have been better to wait until the international break because West Ham have got this difficult game away at Everton, followed by a game away at Arsenal. But it looks like it's going to be Nuno taking over. Other names who were linked were Slaven Bilic, Gary O‚ÄôNeil and Sean Dyche. "Our information all along was that Nuno was the number one target. The big question is:  Is he the right man for the job? Because this is a massive job, there are problems off the pitch, and there are issues with the London Stadium. "It‚Äôs undeniable that Nuno is a fantastic manager, but is he the right manager for West Ham? Will his style of football suit West Ham? "A lot of people in the game say Nuno is a fantastic manager when your side doesn‚Äôt have the ball; he‚Äôs good at counter-attacking football, but will that suit West Ham? Do West Ham have the kind of players that can play that football, or are they good enough defensively, like Nuno's sides at Forest and Wolves were? "We know he was the manager of Spurs for a short while, which didn‚Äôt work, but if he does the kind of job he did at Forest, then he will potentially be a success. "The first thing he needs to do if he gets the job is sort West Ham out defensively, stop them from conceding so many corners and get them out of the relegation zone."

Title: Guardiola ‚Äòfine‚Äô with manner of Walker‚Äôs Man City exit
Content: Pep Guardiola insists the way Kyle Walker‚Äôs time at Manchester City came to an end should do nothing to take away from his achievements during an eight-year spell with the club. Walker won six Premier League titles and the Champions League among 15 major honours with City but asked to leave the club in January, heading for a loan spell with AC Milan before signing a two-year deal in the summer to join Saturday‚Äôs opponents Burnley. Walker, who had been made club captain last summer, left City midway through the season in which Guardiola‚Äôs side fell well short of their usual standards before rallying to finish third in the Premier League. But Guardiola insisted he had no issue with Walker or the manner of his departure as he praised the 35-year-old as one of the best full-backs ever. ‚ÄúI would have loved the best Kyle (last season) but he was unhappy for reasons, or when I take a situation for a family reason or from his life,‚Äù Guardiola said. ‚ÄúObviously, you know all of you, sometimes I take a decision, but when the player isn‚Äôt happy or satisfied and cannot be there it‚Äôs my job and I have an agreement with the club. For me it‚Äôs fine.‚Äù Walker, who had signed a new contract with City only last September, had been appointed captain by his team-mates in keeping with a system long used by Guardiola. But ahead of this season the Catalan chose to name his own skipper as he handed the armband to Bernardo Silva, with Ruben Dias, Rodri and Erling Haaland as vice-captains. Guardiola insisted his change in approach was nothing to do with Walker‚Äôs exit. ‚ÄúAbsolutely not,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI never put responsibility on what happened on one person, so that‚Äôs why I never choose just one or team chooses just one (captain), there‚Äôs a lot of them in that position. ‚ÄúWhat happened last season, many things happened, not just for one person. It never happened for one person, absolutely. (The) captain left, there‚Äôs many reasons why, and then there are other captains but it‚Äôs a good lesson, so life is like that. ‚ÄúIt happens many times, many things, during one season, you just learn from that, and this season I decided that, and maybe next season I will decide completely the opposite.‚Äù

Title: West Ham sack Potter
Content: Graham Potter has been sacked by West Ham after just nine months in charge. Potter, who replaced Julen Lopetegui as head coach on a two-and-a-half-year contract in January, has been unable to turn the fortunes around at the London Stadium, with the club second-bottom of the Premier League. A club statement on Saturday morning - two days before their Monday Night Football game with Everton - read: "West Ham United can confirm that head coach Graham Potter has left the club. "Results and performances over the course of the second half of last season and the start of the 2025/26 season have not matched expectations, and the board of directors believe that a change is necessary in order to help improve the team's position in the Premier League as soon as possible." Title: Frank says Tottenham owners want to achieve ‚Äòsomething special‚Äô
Content: Thomas Frank believes the current Tottenham owners are ‚Äú120 per cent‚Äù committed to achieving something special after a third expression of interest to buy the club was rejected. Spurs addressed media speculation over a proposed ¬£4.5billion takeover bid on Friday with a statement via the London Stock Exchange that majority owners ENIC ‚Äì run by the Lewis family trust ‚Äì ‚Äúis not looking to sell its stake‚Äù in the club. The statement confirmed an informal expression of interest to acquire shares in Tottenham by a consortium led by American tech entrepreneur Brooklyn Earick had been ‚Äúunequivocally rejected‚Äù by ENIC. ENIC issued a similar statement earlier this month which confirmed expressions of interest by Amanda Staveley‚Äôs PCP International Finance and a consortium of investors led by Dr Roger Kennedy and Wing-Fai Ng through Firehawk Holdings Limited were also rejected. Takeover speculation has increased since the sudden departure of Daniel Levy on September 4 after 24 years as chairman. It was a move designed to help Tottenham target ‚Äúmore wins, more often‚Äù according to a source close to the Lewis family. Ahead of Saturday‚Äôs visit of Wolves, the third home fixture since a restructure of key roles which has left the Lewis family trust with greater power, Frank talked up their long-term ambitions. Frank said: ‚ÄúVery, very invested. 120 per cent committed to the club. ‚ÄúThey really want to achieve something special, want to build and want to add. Again, I think I like the phrase building layers because you never go to the top. You can‚Äôt jump five steps. That‚Äôs impossible. ‚ÄúSo, building layers, I think, is very important. I think that‚Äôs also more organic and more sustainable over time, but they‚Äôre very, very focused on what they can do to help the club.‚Äù

Title: Record-breaker Kane 'really happy' at Bayern amid transfer talk
Content: Harry Kane says he is "really happy" at Bayern Munich. The England captain broke a record held by Cristiano Ronaldo and Erling Haaland by scoring his 100th Bundesliga goal in just his 104th appearance in the competition as Bayern beat Werder Bremen on Friday night. That meant he'd reached three figures in a top-five league faster than any other player, with Ronaldo and Haaland taking 105 games to reach 100 goals for Real Madrid and Man City, respectively. Afterwards the striker played down recent talk he could be leaving Bayern in January or at the end of the season by telling Sky Germany: "I‚Äôm really happy here at Bayern. I have two years left on my contract. And to be honest, I‚Äôm enjoying every minute. "I enjoy playing here in front of the fans. I enjoy the team, the coach. So that‚Äôs not on my mind at all. I‚Äôm just looking forward to this season and hope we‚Äôll be successful."

Title: O'Reilly signs new Man City contract
Content: Nico O'Reilly has signed a contract extension at Man City which runs to 2030. The 20-year-old academy graduate had a breakthrough season last year and has so far made 27 appearances for Pep Guardiola's side. "I have been at city since the age of eight and to have made it into the first team and have played matches is a dream come true," he said. "To be rewarded with a new contract really is special. "But in truth, this is just the beginning for me. I have come so far, but I want to keep pushing now, improving every day, and become the best player I can be. Here at City, with Pep as manager, I know I can do that. This is the best place for a footballer to be."

Title: Joelinton: Isak departure won't derail Newcastle's season
Content: Joelinton has insisted Alexander Isak's departure will not derail Newcastle's season. The saga surrounding the 26-year-old Sweden international's big-money move to Liverpool rumbled on for much of the summer before eventually coming to a head on Deadline Day. However, Brazil midfielder Joelinton will not linger on the disappointment of losing a man who had played such a key role in the club's recent rise as he plots a path to further success. He said: "We are professional. We came back to the club to do our best. "We had a good pre-season. We know the noise around, but we are professional. We kept the focus and do what we have to do on the pitch, and everyone has done well. "We wish Alex the best. He did well for the club and now he's gone and we have to focus on the players that are here in the squad and keep going." The Isak transfer boosted the Magpies' coffers to the tune of ¬£130million, muchof which has since been invested in record ¬£69m signing Nick Woltemade and YoaneWissa, who cost a further ¬£55m. Woltemade's lack of Premier League experience and Wissa's knee injury means Howe's new-look frontline remains a work in progress. He said: "They are both great players with a lot of quality and are going to add a lot to the squad. "Nick is doing well so far. Wiss is unlucky to pick up the injury, but we hope he's going to recover quickly. We believe in ourselves and know we can play against anyone. "When he starts to play, we will try to help him and hope he settles quickly and scores a lot of goals for us."

Title: Is there regret over Guehi now Leoni is injured?
Content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot in his press conference: "I don't think - one day before we play them - I want to talk about that again. We have to prepare for Crystal Palace who's a very good team, they haven't lost for 17 games now and he's a big part of that team. "A difficult team to beat, as we've shown. We've beaten them once 1-0 and twice it was a draw. And we have more than enough options to replace, if needed, a player in the centre-back position,. "We have Virgil [Van Dijk], Joe [Gomez] and Ibou [Konate] and other options."

Title: Liverpool teenager Ngumoha signs first professional contract
Content: Liverpool teenager Rio Ngumoha has signed his first professional contract with the club. Sky Sports News understands the 17-year-old has signed a three-year deal at Anfield. FIFA regulations state that under-18s cannot sign contracts for longer than this length. Last month, the 17-year-old became the youngest scorer in Liverpool's history as he scored a stoppage-time winner in the 3-2 Premier League win at Newcastle, aged 16 years and 361 days old. The winger's goal also made him the fourth youngest scorer in Premier League history, behind James Vaughan, James Milner and Wayne Rooney. Ngumoha was born in Newham in East London on August 29, 2008. He joined Chelsea‚Äôs academy at the age of eight and moved to Liverpool in the summer of 2024. The England U19 international has made five senior appearances for Liverpool, with the most recent coming in Tuesday's Carabao Cup third-round win over Southampton as he started in the 2-1 win at Anfield. Ngumoha made his debut in the FA Cup third-round tie at home to Accrington in January and after impressing in pre-season was made a permanent member of head coach Arne Slot‚Äôs first-team squad. Title: Man Utd sign pre-agreement for Colombian starlet
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett: Manchester United have signed a pre-contract agreement with Fortaleza in Colombia for 17-year-old Cristian Orozco. The teenager is a highly promising defensive midfielder, who has represented Colombia at various age groups up to U17 level. He was part of the Colombia side that reached the final of the CONMEBOL South American Championships this summer, and United have high hopes for him in the future. It is expected that Orozco will officially move to Old Trafford in July, once he has turned 18. The South American market is a particularly attractive one for United, where the data shows there is an abundance of youth talent available at good value. The club has already signed 18-year-old full back Diego Leon from Paraguayan side Cerro Porteno in July, after agreeing a similar pre-contract agreement with him last January. Leon has twice been in Ruben Amorim‚Äôs matchday squad this season, but has yet to make his United debut.

Title: Palace accept Guehi's time is coming to an end
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra, Kaveh Solhekol and Mark McAdam: Crystal Palace realistically accept that Marc Guehi's time at the club is coming to an end. The club acknowledge it will be difficult to convince their captain to commit his long term future to Palace. Guehi is calm about his next steps having seen his deadline day move to Liverpool collapse. The two sides meet at Selhurst Park on Saturday after the Reds came close to sealing a ¬£35m purchase of Guehi at the start of this month. There's a sense that the England defender is equally likely to leave in January as he is to depart as a free agent next summer. A fresh approach from Liverpool to sign Guehi in January cannot be ruled out. Liverpool centre-back Giovanni Leoni faces months out with a torn cruciate ligament, according to Sky in Italy. However, Palace would not allow Guehi to leave on the cheap in the winter window. The 25-year-old can sign a pre-contract agreement with a foreign club in January. A number of major European clubs are watching him closely.

Title: Saliba agrees terms on new five-year Arsenal deal
Content: William Saliba has agreed terms on a new five-year contract at Arsenal. Saliba has established himself as one of the Premier League's best centre-backs during his time at the club, featuring in all 38 top-flight games in the 2023/24 campaign and missing only three matches last season. The 24-year-old centre-back had entered the final two years of his contract but is due to commit to the Gunners until June 2030. The Frenchman is set to join fellow defender Gabriel Magalhaes plus academy products Ethan Nwaneri and Myles Lewis-Skelly in committing to new Arsenal contracts in 2025. Saliba has been contracted to Arsenal since the summer of 2019 but had to wait three years until his competitive debut for the club at the start of the 2022/23 season. Since then, he has made 139 appearances in all competitions, scoring seven goals. Sky Sports

Title: Glasner preparing for long-term future at Palace
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News reporter  James Savundra & chief correspondent Solhekol: Oliver Glasner is planning for the long term at Crystal Palace - despite his contract expiring next summer. The Palace boss maintains a strong relationship with the club following a frantic end to the transfer window. Glasner has been engaging in conversations about Palace's medium to long term while his own future remains unclear. The FA Cup-winning coach had been left frustrated with a perceived passive approach from the club in the last two summer transfer windows. Sky Sports News reported earlier this month that the Eagles are relaxed about the managerial situation at the club. Glasner denied threatening to resign as manager if club captain Marc Guehi was allowed to join Liverpool on deadline day. Instead, the Austrian praised chairman Steve Parish for pulling out of the proposed transfer without a suitable replacement being secured. Following the international break, Glasner stated "there will be a time when we talk about my future". Title: Frank: Bissouma still has Spurs future
Content: Tottenham head coach Thomas Frank has revealed Yves Bissouma still has a future at the club. Bissouma is currently sidelined with a knee injury sustained on August 15, which ruined the prospect of the Mali international being sold before the summer transfer window shut earlier in September. Former Brighton midfielder Bissouma was dropped for the Super Cup due to being late multiple times and whilst out of action for the foreseeable future, the 29-year-old might not have played his last game for Tottenham after all. Asked when Bissouma would be back, Frank admitted: "That I actually don't know. "The players available now are the players I have available. Of course I know (about his recovery) but that is further down the line. "To be fair he has just started to run outside, so he is not part of the group but everything I have seen when I've said hello to him and every day with the players, he seems good. "There are no hard feelings at all. Not before, not now, not at all. Train well and everyone has an opportunity."

Title: Wilcox makes plea to Sir Jim Ratcliffe
Content: Manchester United director of football Jason Wilcox has made a plea to Sir Jim Ratcliffe to give the current leadership group at the club more time to turn things around. United are struggling at the start of the season under Ruben Amorim with their only win from four games being the 3-2 win over Burnley, which was won via a late controversial penalty. "I just pray that we get the opportunity to turn it around and I really feel that it's not will we win again, it's when we'll win again," Wilcox said in a Q&A at a gala dinner celebrating the 40th anniversary of the Association of Manchester United Players. "It has been a rollercoaster! I came in last April, around 18 months ago, and it's been a real challenge I can't lie. "I thought the club was in a much better place than it was. We had no football identity, we lacked alignment between ownership, the CEO, football and the academy and we've just been working so hard behind the scenes."

Title: The latest on Sterling and Disasi
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol: Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi are not always training on their own at Chelsea. They also now train with a younger group of players when possible. Sterling posted a picture on social media this week of a night-time training session, but that is something that happens very rarely. Multiple groups of players train at different times at Chelsea‚Äôs Cobham training ground and for scheduling reasons, that was an evening session. It is in everyone‚Äôs interest for the players to be in top condition so that it will be easier for them to move to new clubs when the window opens again in January. They are not training with the first-team squad because the sole focus of the first team is to prepare for games. It would make no sense for players who are not going to play for the first team to take part in those training session. The young players Sterling and Disasi train with are some of the best young players in the game and they benefit from working with experienced international players.

""I‚Äôve been incredibly happy here at Wolves, so it was tricky, but now I‚Äôm going to stay happy here. Signing a new deal shows that my commitment is going to be here for the next years. "I‚Äôm happy here, I love all my friends and teammates, the fans are amazing, and we just want to make it a better season than last year. We need to start winning and get out of the bad start we had. "They‚Äôve been a few tough weeks mentally and physically. I got the injury from a little kick, and it was worse than we thought which was annoying. "It‚Äôs such a small part of your body which causes so much pain, it‚Äôs getting better, so we‚Äôll see how many minutes I can contribute over the weekend, but hopefully as many as possible."

We stayed up, even though we struggled through the season, and hopefully we can avoid that this year, but I learned a lot from last season, and I‚Äôll take that into this season." It‚Äôs such a small part of your body which causes so much pain, it‚Äôs getting better, so we‚Äôll see how many minutes I can contribute over the weekend, but hopefully as many as possible."

Content: Marcus Rashford has said he wants to play "as many seasons as possible" at Barcelona after his two-goal heroics fired Barcelona to victory at Newcastle. Rashford fired twice in nine second half minutes to send the Catalan club to a 2-1 victory at St James' Park - in his first match back in England since leaving for Hansi Flick's side on loan from Manchester United. The double included a stunning long-range strike to put Barcelona 2-0 up in the North East. Asked how many seasons he wants to spend at Barcelona, Rashford replied: "As many as possible. We will see. Flick said in his press conference: "When we got this chance, it was ok: we have to do it. "I spoke with him before everything went the right way. I said: I want to have you in my team and I said, I‚Äôm happy. "For me, he‚Äôs an outstanding player. Also the team helps him a lot. We controlled the match a lot with Pedri, Frenkie De Jong, it‚Äôs not easy to press us. That gives the striker the opportunity to find the right spaces behind the opponent‚Äôs last line and in front. Title: Wolves confirm new deal for Pereira

Wolves are bottom of the table after losing their first four league games, but the club's hierarchy have placed their trust in the 57 year-old Portuguese ahead of a huge game at home to Leeds on Saturday. Chairman Jeff Shi said: "Vitor has made a very positive impact during his time at Wolves. He's brought clarity, energy and a team spirit that gives us a  foundation to be successful. "Now is a time for stability. Vitor needs time to work with the squad, to build a chemistry with new players, and we will do everything to support him and his staff."

Title: PFA contact Chelsea over Disasi, Sterling situations
Content: The Professional Footballers‚Äô Association have contacted Chelsea to make sure Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi are being treated according to the terms of their contracts. Both players are training away from the first-team squad after failing to secure moves away during the summer window. Sterling has two years left on his ¬£325,000 a week contract. Napoli and Bayern Munich were interested in signing him but he wanted to stay based in London for family reasons. Chelsea are working closely with the PFA and the players are training regularly. They have a dedicated coach as part of their sporting plan. Chelsea will try to find the players new clubs when the window opens in January. FIFA‚Äôs rules state that players who are excluded from squads under conditions which constitute ‚Äòabusive conduct‚Äô could be allowed to terminate their contracts. Cheslea head coach Enzo Maresca confirmed last Friday that the two players were not part of his plans. They train at different times from the first team and use a different pitch, dressing room and gym. ‚ÄúThey are Chelsea players, but they are training separately and the plan is to continue this way,‚Äù Maresca said. ‚ÄúSince the season started, I haven‚Äôt seen either of them.‚Äù Sterling moved to Chelsea from Manchester City in a ¬£50m deal in June 2022. Disasi was signed a year later from Monaco for ¬£38m. He has four years left on his contract. Sterling was on loan at Arsenal last season while Disasi spent the second half of the season at Aston Villa. West Ham, Sunderland and Bournemouth showed interest in signing Disasi this summer.

Title: Mourinho on retirement plans: I am hungrier than 25 years ago
Content: Jose Mourinho has promised a more mature and less egocentric version of himself as he was announced as Benfica's new head coach. Benfica reached a deal with Mourinho on Thursday, sealing his return to Portugal 21 years after he led Benfica's rivals Porto to the Champions League title in 2004. He also returns to Benfica 25 years after leaving the club during his first stint in charge in 2000. His contract is until the end of the 2026/27 season but he and the club have a non-renewal option at the end of this campaign. The coach was officially introduced in a news conference, and then oversaw the squad in a training session. Mourinho branded himself as the "Special One" during the peak years of his career during his first spell at Chelsea from 2004 to 2007, and now he says people can expect a different personality. "Today I think a lot more about the others. I'm last in line. I'm here to serve," he said. "I'm at a completely different moment as far as maturity. I'm not important. I'm more altruistic, less egocentric. I don't think about me as much. I think more about what I can do for others." The 62-year-old said the only thing that has not changed was his "desire to always win the next match". He said returning to Benfica does not mean an intention to retire soon. "I'll only stop when I feel that something has changed," he said. "And today I feel that I am hungrier than I was 25 years ago." Mourinho started his coaching career at Benfica in 2000 but lasted only three months before leaving in a contract dispute. "I'm now the coach of one of the greatest clubs in the world," he said. "None of the other giant clubs that I coached in the world made me feel so honoured and motivated as I am now as the coach of Benfica."

Content: Ademola Lookman will be welcomed back into the Atalanta squad with "open arms" despite the forward's two-week strike when he was not allowed to leave the club last month. Lookman has not featured for the club since his strike, but started both of Nigeria's World Cup qualifying games over the international break. The 27-year-old was also absent from Atalanta's squad for their trip to PSG in the Champions League on Wednesday night, but club president Antonio Percassi said he will feature for the club again - when he is ready. ‚ÄúThere's no going back," he told Sky Sports in Italy. "We're thinking about the future and the present. "We all know the player's technical value, but we all know that to play here you have to be 100-per-cent focused. "When he's ready, we'll be waiting for him with open arms.‚Äù

Title: Chelsea keeping tabs on Rogers Villa talks
Content: Chelsea are keeping an eye on developments around Morgan Rogers' contract talks at Aston Villa, according to The Sun. The report suggests Villa priced the 23-year-old England international out of a move away this summer with Chelsea, Arsenal and Tottenham said to be interested. Villa are said to be keen to renew Rogers' current terms for the second time in under a year after he penned a new deal last November. It is said the deal doesn't include a release clause, which Villa are suggested to be keen to add to an exit route for Rogers, which will guarantee a return as the club continue to navigate profit and sustainability rules. The attacking midfielder worked with Enzo Maresca before during the Italian boss' spell coaching at Manchester City's academy, where Rogers spent four years.

Title: Mendy joins Pogon Szczecin
Content: Former Manchester City left-back Benjamin Mendy has joined Polish club Pogon Szczecin. The 31-year-old has been a free agent since having his contract terminated at FC Zurich in the summer. Mendy left City at the end of his contract in 2023, the same year in which he was found not guilty of rape and sexual assault charges. Since, Mendy played the 2023-24 season for FC Lorient in France before injury ruled him out of the first half of 2024-25. He signed for Zurich in February this year but was released in July and now finds himself at ambitious Polish club Pogon. Chief executive Kesler is understood to have played a key role in negotiating with Mendy and bringing him to the club.

Title: Mourinho in talks with Benfica
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Gary Cotterill: Jose Mourinho is in talks to become the new manager of Benfica. The Portuguese club sacked boss Bruno Lage on Wednesday morning after they squandered a 2-0 lead in their 3-2 home defeat against Qarabag in the Champions League. Mourinho, 62, was axed by Fenerbahce in August when they were knocked out of the Champions League. He led Benfica for 11 games in his first managerial role in 2000 and faces the prospect of a reunion with his former club Chelsea should he be appointed ahead of their fixture on September 30. Benfica have been linked with Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim, who played for the club.

The Republic of Ireland international is a Man Utd academy graduate, who spent two years at Killie making 27 appearances. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt want to rush into anything, and I like to think that I did that, and I‚Äôm delighted to get the deal here as I think it is a good fit," he told the club website after signing. "I spoke with the faffer and Glen the goalie coach, and players who have played here in the past, and they all spoke highly of the club." O'Hara will wear No 13 for The Dee.

Title: PSG: Donnarumma left over contract demands
Content: PSG have confirmed that Gianluigi Donnarumma left this summer because they could not agree a new contract with the Italy goalkeeper. Donnarumma moved to Manchester City in a ¬£26m move on Deadline Day and he was in typically impressive form on his debut against Manchester United on Sunday. PSG decided to cash in on Donnarumma because they did not want to lose him on a free transfer when his contract was due to expire next summer. Speaking to RMC Sport, sporting director Luis Campos said: ‚ÄúThe club‚Äôs policy is to build a team more important than any individual. "Gianluigi Donnarumma asked for a salary at the level of the old PSG, not the current PSG. Our policy is closely tied to sporting performances, you earn more when you deserve it. "Gianluigi was the first player we approached about an extension, but we quickly understood that it will be difficult due to his demands. "We both took time to discuss Gianluigi‚Äôs situation - it‚Äôs a set of circumstances that led to his departure.‚Äù Donnarumma is likely to make his Champions League debut for City on Thursday against Napoli. PSG won the Champions League for the first time in May after building a new young team following the departures of Kylian Mbappe, Lionel Messi and Neymar.

Title: WATCH: Van Dijk on 'complete' striker Isak

Here's captain Virgil Van Dijk on what the Swedish forward will bring...

Title: 'Newcastle keeping eye on Mainoo ahead of January window'
Content: Newcastle are keeping tabs on Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo ahead of the January transfer window, according to talkSPORT. It is claimed the England international was desperate to leave Old Trafford in the summer after falling out of favour with boss Ruben Amorim, but United blocked an exit. Newcastle boss Eddie Howe is reportedly an admirer of Mainoo and would consider testing United‚Äôs resolve if the 21-year-old remains in the cold. The Man Utd academy graduate came off the bench in Sunday's 3-0 loss at Manchester City and is yet to start a Premier League game this season, with his only start coming in the Carabao Cup loss at Grimsby. The report says Mainoo‚Äôs team-mates are perplexed by Amorim‚Äôs lack of faith in the player who scored an FA Cup final-winning goal last year and also started for England in their Euro 2024 final loss to Spain.

Content: Manchester United players are losing confidence in Ruben Amorim's system, according to the Daily Mail. Title: Robertson promises to fight for starting spot at Liverpool
Content: Liverpool vice-captain Andy Robertson is not ready to sit on the sidelines and relinquish his position as first-choice left-back without a fight after admitting there was a chance he could have left for Atletico Madrid in the summer. The 31-year-old has been displaced in the starting line-up this season by ¬£40m signing Milos Kerkez, 10 years his junior. He was briefly linked with a move to Atletico, coincidentally Liverpool‚Äôs first Champions League opponents on Wednesday, but opted to remain at Anfield for the final year of his contract despite knowing he was most likely going to be a back-up. Robertson came off the bench 38 minutes into the 1-0 win at Burnley which extended Liverpool‚Äôs 100 percent record to four matches as head coach Arne Slot was concerned Kerkez, already on a booking, was in danger of being sent off in what has been a scratchy start at his new club. The Scotland captain, who played in the recent draw with Denmark and win over Belarus, brought an immediate improvement down the left side to provide a reminder he is far from a spent force. Asked whether there was a chance he could have been lining up against the Reds for the Spanish visitors on Wednesday, Robertson said: ‚ÄúMaybe at one point. ‚ÄúI do want to play games and be the starting left-back and I have got to keep pushing to try to produce the levels I know I can do. ‚ÄúThe international break was good for me as I was able to get two 90 minutes, get that match fitness and two really good results for Scotland and I took a lot of confidence from that."

Title: Barca's Lopez on Chelsea talks: I always wanted to stay
Content: Barcelona midfielder Fermin Lopez has revealed he always wanted to stay at the club amid rumours of a move to Chelsea. Lopez has featured in every LaLiga game for Barcelona so far this season and scored twice in Sunday's 6-0 demolition of Valencia. Sky Sports News reported during the transfer window that Chelsea were interested in the midfielder but only if they could move a midfielder on. ‚ÄúI have always wanted to be here and I will fight to be here for many years,‚Äù Lopez told Marca. ‚ÄúI never doubted being here. There was always speculation over my future at Barcelona. All of that is part of football. I was very calm about it all and I‚Äôm very happy to be here.‚Äù

Title: Brighton's Barber set for Australia role

Barber told the Brighton official website: ‚ÄúThis is an opportunity for both clubs to explore opportunities of how we can work together to achieve our own individual ambitions on and off the pitch. ‚ÄúMy day-to-day priority will always be Brighton & Hove Albion, but this is an opportunity for us to share best practice in multiple sporting and administrative departments across the two clubs ‚Äî while also representing Tony‚Äôs interests at Melbourne Victory.‚Äù

Title: Selles: I'm not worried about my job
Content: Sheffield United manager Ruben Selles speaking to Sky Sports after his side's 5-0 thumping away at Ipswich: "The business is like that. If you don't win football matches, your position is going to be discussed always, not only for me, for any coach in the world. That comes with reality. For us, I think there's only one way - to keep working hard until the very last second at the club and try to always give 100 per cent. "If you finish the job and you didn't get the result you wanted, at least you are clear in your principles, your values and your way to do things. "They [the Sheff Utd owners] have been supporting me until today. I didn't speak with them after the game. Things happen in football and people need to make decisions, as I need to make decisions with my line-up. "I'm not worried about that, I'm just worried about if we go for training, how we can do better, how we can get the boys' morale up, how we prepare for the next game. That's what it is for me. "I'm the first critic of myself and the first one that puts pressure and it's always going to be like that. "I believe in myself. I also know things can not go your way sometimes and you can make mistakes, but I think this is part of it. I have done that before and hopefully I will do it. "The one thing you will find with me is that I will be in front of absolutely everything. Now things are not going in the proper direction, I will also be in front of it. "Right now, you just need to let the people feel the pain. We are not going to solve anything tonight. In this situation, we just need to sit. There are parts of the game we need to re-analyse. "The good thing in football is you have a game in seven days and it's a new opportunity, a new opponent and things can change really quick."

Title: Rak-Sakyi joins Rizespor on loan
Content: Jesurun Rak-Sakyi has joined Turkish club Caykur Rizespor on loan until the end of the 2025/26 season from Crystal Palace. The 22-year-old winger has previously spent time on loan at Charlton and Sheffield United Rizespor finished ninth in the Super Lig last season.

Title: Andrews: I thought Wissa would stay
Content: Keith Andrews said he had been expecting Yoane Wissa to remain at Brentford until the closing stages of the transfer window. Wissa, who had refused to play for the Bees in a bid to push through a move, joined Newcastle on transfer deadline day after the two clubs agreed a ¬£55m fee. Andrews said: ‚ÄúAll along, I was very much that I expected Yoane to stay. Up until the very last press conference before we played Sunderland, it was nowhere near a move. ‚ÄúI wanted Yoane to stay. I didn‚Äôt really want to lose that amount of goals out of the building but at the same time I was very understanding of the way this club works. The medium to long-term future of the club is very important.‚Äù

Title: Dele-Bashiru set for Turkey loan move
