Title: Hurzeler delighted at Gruda development
Content: Fabian Hurzeler expressed his delight at the development of Brajan Gruda, adding that he will be an important player in the future. The 21-year-old midfielder has featured as a substitute in every Premier League game this season and came off the bench to score an 89th-minute winner as the Seagulls snatched a 2-1 victory over Manchester City before the international break. Speaking about Gruda, Hurzeler said: ‚ÄúI think every player who is in our squad is ready to start. He had a very good appearance against City when he came on the pitch. ‚ÄúNow he was away and had two games with the under-21s from Germany. Overall we‚Äôre very pleased with his development, we try to give him more and more game time. ‚ÄúIf it will be a start tomorrow or not, we have to make the decision, but he will be a very important player for us in the future no matter if he starts tomorrow or not.‚Äù

Title: Rodgers wants Maeda to park Celtic exit disappointment
Content: Brendan Rodgers has backed talismanic forward Daizen Maeda to park any disappointment about not securing a move away from Celtic. The Japanese revealed on international duty last week that he hoped to leave the Hoops before the transfer deadline but a proposed move was blocked because the club were unable to source adequate replacements. Rodgers said: ‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt surprised by that [revelation from Maeda] because I‚Äôve known since the end of February where Daizen was at. ‚ÄúWe spoke a lot and he‚Äôs continued to give everything in his game and his training. He had a few options to go and it would have been great for him and his family in terms of his life, but it didn‚Äôt materialise, so it‚Äôs now my job to convince him to go again. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve done that with players before. I had Luis Suarez nearly at the end of my first season (at Liverpool) when it was deemed he was going to Arsenal. I had to convince him to stay and then he ended up having an amazing season and then after that went to Barcelona, so it‚Äôs not new to my career. ‚ÄúPlayers will have challenges but I think everyone sees the integrity of which Daizen works, how he plays and how if I can reconnect all of that again then I‚Äôm pretty sure he will give his all whilst he‚Äôs playing.‚Äù Rodgers, who has always been open to allowing players to move on when they express a desire to leave, admitted that in an ideal world Celtic would have been able to let Maeda, last season‚Äôs Premiership Player of the Year, move on. ‚ÄúI still feel that if a player does want to move on then we have to be prepared for that,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI think in this window we clearly weren‚Äôt prepared for it. It just couldn‚Äôt happen but my feelings are still the same. ‚ÄúEspecially if you‚Äôve got a player who‚Äôs been here for years giving his absolute all and he wants to have another challenge before maybe going back to Japan, then that was maybe the right thing for him. ‚ÄúBut certainly the position we were in and it being so late, we couldn‚Äôt make that happen for him sadly.‚Äù

Title: Potter: No regrets in selling Kudus to Spurs
Content: Graham Potter insists he has no regrets about selling Mohammed Kudus to West Ham‚Äôs London rivals Tottenham. Kudus has already become a firm favourite with Spurs fans following his ¬£55m summer switch. However, Hammers boss Potter said: ‚ÄúSometimes players indicate that it‚Äôs time for a new challenge and we‚Äôre at the stage now where you want players that are fully committed to West Ham, that want to be here. ‚ÄúThen, once that‚Äôs the position, you have to try and get the best deal that you can, the best financial position for the club, and hopefully grow the team and improve the squad. ‚ÄúIt allowed us to sign some players as well. So it‚Äôs part of the football world, part of the football business. ‚ÄúOnce the player feels that it‚Äôs time to move on, then it‚Äôs best for all parties to find the best deal and then to move forward as a club.‚Äù

Title: Lewis signs new deal at Man City
Content: Manchester City defender Rico Lewis has signed a new two-year deal at the club. The fresh terms will see the 20-year-old remain at the Etihad Stadium until 2030. Lewis, a City academy graduate, has made 97 appearances for the club and won seven trophies. Speaking in a statement released by the club, Lewis said: ‚ÄúManchester City mean everything to me so to have been given the opportunity to sign this new contract is such a special moment both for me personally and my family. ‚ÄúI am still improving and developing as a player, and I know that the opportunity to carry on working with Pep, his coaching team and our amazing squad will only help me to keep getting better. ‚ÄúI have spent so much of my life at this club. City means everything to me, so to be able to stay longer makes me incredibly happy. ‚ÄúI will give everything to try and help us look to achieve more success both this season and beyond and with the world-class squad we have, I am very excited about what the future holds for the club.‚Äù

Title: Arteta gives positive update on Saka, Saliba contract talks
Content: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says contract talks with Bukayo Saka and William Saliba are going well. Two of Arsenal's key players are out of contract in 2027 but the Gunners are in discussions about extending those deals. "The collaboration between the club and what Andrea [Berta, sporting director] is doing  and the agent is very, very good. "I think the good thing is that the players want to remain here and they want to be a big part of the history of this club in the next few years and that is always positive and they will drive that and see where we go."

Title: Glasner denies making quit threat
Content: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glanser has denied he threatened to quit if Marc Guehi left the club for Liverpool on Deadline Day. Guehi was poised to join the Premier League champions before the deal fell through in the final hours of the transfer window. "I think it‚Äôs the last time I want to talk about it," Glasner said. "Crystal Palace fans deserve to really hear how it was. So many things were written. "Number one: I never threatened to leave the club. Never."

Title: Amorim explains Onana departure
Content: Manchester United boss says Andre Onana needed a change after the goalkeeper secured a season-long loan move to Turkish side Trabzonspor. The 29-year-old shotstopper lost his place as United's out-and-out No 1 after missing pre-season due to injury. Following a series of errors, United signed another 'keeper in Senne Lammens for ¬£18.2m on deadline day. Asked whether Onana could have stayed to fight for his No1 spot back, Amorim said:"For us, he could [have continued], but I think not just us as a club, but also Andre - I think we understood that this needed a change. "Sometimes it's up to a point to why it's not the performance, but it's the moment, the bad luck in some moments, was hard on him, was hard on us, and we think it's time to have a change in the goalkeepers, but I wish the best for Andre Onana. "He was, it was really good working, trying to help the players, but sometimes you can have all the quality in the world, but sometimes you need to change the environment to return to your level. "That, I think, was the feeling, not just from us."

Title: Howe: Relationship with Isak became 'difficult'
Content: Newcastle boss Eddie Howe has admitted his relationship with Alexander Isak became "difficult" after he went on strike in an attempt to force through his move to Liverpool. The 25-year-old Sweden international missed the club's pre-season tour to Singapore and South Korea and was left training by himself on the squad's return before eventually getting his wish with a deadline day move to Anfield, which netted the Magpies ¬£130m. Asked about his relationship with the man he signed from Real Sociedad for ¬£63m during the summer of 2022, head coach Howe said: "Alex and I always enjoyed a great relationship. I loved working with him and I hope he loved working with us. "It was mutually beneficial. We helped him become the player that he is today, and he helped us as a team achieve some unbelievable milestones. He was part of a very successful team. "But to give you a bit more on that, the moment he went on strike, our relationship did change. "I think that was probably a turning point in our relationship. Communication became difficult from that point onwards. I won't go into any more detail than that."

Title: Maresca: I wish Jackson all the best but club acted within their power
Content: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca has wished Nicolas Jackson all the best after completing a Deadline Day move to join Bayern Munich on loan. Jackson flew to Germany after agreeing an initial move to join the Bundesliga champions before a dramatic U-turn from Chelsea after Liam Delap picked up an injury. A new deal was then agreed with fresh terms that will see Bayern pay an increased loan fee of ¬£14.25m (‚Ç¨16.4m) from ¬£13m (‚Ç¨15m), with an obligation to buy the player for ¬£56.25m (‚Ç¨65m) depending on appearances made. When asked about Jackson ahead of the game against Brentford, Maresca said: "Nico is quite easy. In this moment, he is a Bayern player, I sent him a message and wished him all the best. "He was very good and was working well. I wish him all the best." Maresca was then pushed for an answer regarding the saga, where he insisted the club acted within their rights when pulling out of the first deal, as Jackson was still their player. He added: "The club decided something different because the club still has the power to do that."

Title: Elliott move in best interests of everyone, says Slot
Content: Liverpool boss Arne Slot says Harvey Elliott's move to Aston Villa was in the best interests of everyone involved. The midfielder has joined Villa on loan from Liverpool with a ¬£35m obligation to buy after struggling for consistent gametime at Anfield. "Harvey is in a very good place and going to a very nice club in Aston Villa," said Slot. "It's in the interests of everyone. He didn't get the playing time he probably deserved for the quality player he is and he conducted himself so well. "He's completely ready now to show the quality he has at Aston Villa." Sky Sports

Title: 'It's a pity for the player' - Slot on failed Liverpool Guehi move and coy on future bid
Content: Arne Slot believes it is "a pity" for Marc Guehi he didn't get a deadline day move to Liverpool and said "let's see" when asked whether the Reds would try again for the Crystal Palace captain in the January transfer window. Guehi looked primed to join Liverpool on the final day of the summer window but with Palace unable to sign a replacement they pulled the plug on the deal. Speaking to the media for the first time since that day, Slot said: "It would be ridiculous if I were to deny we were close to signing him. That is so out in the open. "These things happen in football. We would have liked to have signed him, of course. If we feel we can strengthen the team we never hesitate to do so. "It's not like all of a sudden we don't have options in that position. It's a pity, not only for us but also for the player, I think. "But he's in a good place, playing for Palace, where he won the Charity Shield and the FA Cup, with a very good manager as well. "Let's see what the future brings for him and for us."

Title: 'A challenging window' - Howe on transfers
Content: Eddie Howe speaks on a 'challenging' transfer window: "A lot happened. I'm excited about the possibilities of this squad. "We've sold a couple of players we didn't want to - we hope to be in a position where we don't have to do that again in the future. "You want to make football-based decisions, not financial decisions. That's key. "We always have challenges, it was a challenging window but a successful one. Time will be the best judgement of that."

Title: Swansea chief leaves after internal review

Title: Paqueta suggests this is his final season with Hammers
Content: West Ham star Lucas Paqueta has indicated this will be his final season with the Hammers. The midfielder was linked with a move away from the London Stadium this summer but has remained at West Ham after dismissing those exit rumours with his celebration after scoring in the win at Nottingham Forest before the international break. However, in a social media post explaining why he chose to stay, Paqueta said: "It's not time to say goodbye yet! Let's go together for one more season!"

Title: Guehi in good spirits despite collapse of Liverpool move
Content: Latest from James Savundra and Kaveh Solkehol: Marc Guehi returned to Crystal Palace in good spirits after the international break despite the collapse of his proposed move to Liverpool on Deadline Day. The defender is back at his club preparing for his side's Premier League game against Sunderland on Saturday. Guehi was left frustrated after his transfer to the Premier League champions broke down, but he linked up with England and produced an excellent performance in the 5-0 win in Serbia scoring his first senior international goal. A number of leading European clubs are closely monitoring Guehi. Palace are realistically planning for their captain to depart in the next summer window following the expiration of his contract. Yet, nothing has been ruled out in regard to a potential departure in January ‚Äì if a suitable offer is lodged. Guehi will be able to hold discussions with foreign clubs in January and sign a pre-contract agreement.

Title: Could Diaz and Alvarez have swapped places?
Content: Liverpool were interested in swapping Luis Diaz with then-Man City Madrid forward Julian Alvarez in the summer of 2024, claims the Daily Telegraph. The paper states Diaz, who eventually joined Bayern Munich this summer, was already unsettled at Anfield - but the Reds' hopes of a swap deal were quickly ended with City unwilling to sell Alvarez to a direct rival.

Title: Onana completes Trabzonspor loan move
Content: Man Utd goalkeeper Andre Onana has completed his loan move to Trabzonspor. Sky Sports News understands the goalkeeper's full wages are being covered by Trabzonspor. After a series of errors, Onana had lost his Premier League starting spot at United and now leaves the club following the ¬£18.2m arrival of Senne Lammens from Royal Antwerp on Deadline Day. Onana made just one appearance for United so far this season, in the defeat to League Two side Grimsby Town on penalties in the Carabao Cup. United signed Onana in a ¬£47.2m deal from Inter Milan in July 2023. Sky Sports

Title: Laporte joins Athletic
Content: Aymeric Laporte has returned to his former club Athletic Club after FIFA reversed their original stance on blocking his transfer from Al Nassr. FIFA had originally blocked the move after ruling it had not been completed in time before the Spanish transfer window shut on September 1, with Spanish media claiming the Saudi side had not submitted documents related to the transfer in time. However, the world governing body have now reversed their decision, with Athletic confirming Laporte's arrival. Spanish newspaperAS states the required documents were submitted in time - but because of their sheer size, were only received after the cut-off. Laporte has paid tribute to his former club in a message on X.

Title: Liverpool linked with Olise move
Content: Liverpool are plotting a move for Bayern Munich winger Michael Olise next summer, reports the Liverpool Echo. The Reds are reportedly interested in Olise as a potential long-term replacement for Mo Salah, who will turn 34 at the end of this season.

Title: Martial close to Mexico move
Content: Anthony Martial is closing in on a move to Mexican side Monterrey, reports the Daily Mail. Martial joined AEK Athens on a free transfer at the end of his Man Utd deal in 2024, but has not featured in any of their last six matchday squads. Mexico's transfer window shuts on Saturday.

Title: 'Top player!' | Nobbs and Parris review the best debuts from WSL and WSL 2
Pitch to Pod: WSL opening weekend review, hard launches and throwing it forward
Content: Opening weekend done! The WSL 25/26 season has got underway and Jordan and Nikita are ready to review. They look back at London City's defeat to Arsenal and how the newly promoted club look to bounce back. The pair also pick their favourite debuts from the weekend as Olivia Smith and Ellie Carpenter make a statement. They finish off the episode by throwing it forward to next weekend, where Nikita looks to conquer her old team Manchester United and Jordan is ready for Newcastle's first home game of the season. Title: Brooks pens new Bournemouth deal
Content: David Brooks has signed a new four-year Bournemouth contract, keeping him at Vitality Stadium until 2029. The 28-year-old has made over 150 appearances since joining from Sheffield United in the summer of 2018. Brooks told the club's website: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm delighted to sign a new deal. The past seven years have come with some ups and downs, of course nothing to do with the club, but I‚Äôve really enjoyed being here and I‚Äôm looking forward to the years ahead. ‚ÄúI think my standout moment so far has to be making my Premier League debut. That‚Äôs every young boy‚Äôs dream and I got to fulfil that here, so now I hope to push forward and make more memories.‚Äù

Title: 'I knew it was coming' | Postecoglou says Spurs sacking was 'not a surprise'
Brownhill signs for Al Shabab
Content: Josh Brownhill has signed for Saudi Pro League side Al Shabab. The former Burnley midfielder has agreed a two-year deal which will see him earn more than ¬£100,000-per-week. The 29-year-old rejected a fresh contract offer from Burnley and held talks with a number of Premier League clubs - including Wolves. Brownhill was heavily sought after this summer having fired Burnley back to the Premier League with 18 goals and six assists from midfield. Al Shabab have also signed AC Milan midfielder Yacine Adli.

Fabrizio Romano shared a picture on X of Onana on his way to Turkey to seal the move. Title: Hamano extends Chelsea Women stay
Content: Maika Hamano has signed a contract extension at Chelsea Women, keeping her at the club until the summer of 2029. She initially joined the club in January 2023 and after a loan spell in Sweden, has gone on to make 39 appearances for the Blues with nine goals. The 21-year-old told the club's official website: "Being able to work alongside amazing players and staff, and to give our all toward the same goal throughout a long season - that's incredible. "Of course, the fans are with us every step of the way, too. Through the fans, I've learned just how amazing it is to be part of Chelsea."

Title: Man Utd goalkeeper Onana on way to Turkey for Trabzonspor medical
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth, Vik Varange and Danyal Khan: Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana is currently on his way to Turkey for a medical with Trabzonspor. This comes after a broad agreement reached between the two clubs for a season-long loan move for the Cameroon international to join the Turkish side. Onana has only made one start for United this season, which came in the Carabao Cup defeat to Grimsby, with Altay Bayindir having started all three Premier League games. Manchester United also signed Belgian goalkeeper Senne Lemmens on Deadline Day for ¬£18.2m from Royal Antwerp.

Title: Shields offered East Bengal move
Content: East Bengal have offered former Motherwell striker Connor Shields a one-year deal. The 28-year-old is a free agent after leaving Chennaiyin FC, where he became player of the year twice in his two years at the club - breaking a number of records in the Indian Super League. The Scottish striker has been attracting interest from other ISL teams and clubs across Asia. In July, Shields knocked back an approach from Thai club Kanchanaburi Power.

Title: Karlsson: Thelin reunion can boost my career
Content: Jesper Karlsson is hoping his reunion with Jimmy Thelin at Aberdeen can make his career ‚Äúfly‚Äù again following his Deadline Day move from Bologna. Karlsson admitted the presence of Thelin, who was his manager at Elfsborg between 2018 and 2020, was key to his decision to join. ‚ÄúI have a good relationship with Jimmy since I played in Sweden, so this was a good choice for me,‚Äù he said in a club interview. ‚ÄúHe was a big factor in me coming here. ‚ÄúI was young when he came in (at Elfsborg), but I remember well his way of treating players. Very professional, but also very good on the human side. ‚ÄúHe made my career fly a bit when it was the same situation that I didn‚Äôt play. Then he was a little bit hard on me and then I started to play. ‚ÄúWe had good times together in Sweden and we have kept in contact also when I was in Holland and Italy.‚Äù

Content: Ange Postecoglou is has returned to the Premier League as Nottingham Forest's head coach. He was known for his 'Angeball' tactics at Spurs but inherits a team drilled in low-block, counter-attacking football - so will it work at the City Ground? Sky Sports

Title: White: Gyokeres is a monster!
Content: Ben White has described Arsenal team-mate Viktor Gyokeres as a "monster" and "one of the most professional trainers I've ever seen". The Swedish striker is a few weeks into his Arsenal career following his ¬£63.5m move from Sporting CP, with two goals so far to his name. White was also Gyokeres' team-mate in the Brighton youth team and is confident he will be a success in north London. "He‚Äôs a monster! He lives for goals doesn‚Äôt he? He‚Äôs a constant threat," White told the Arsenal official website. "You really don‚Äôt want to get in his way when you are playing against him, because he‚Äôll just move you out of the way anyway! "He‚Äôs such a big presence, and I think it will be a massive help that he‚Äôs already played in English football. You see a lot of people come to the Premier League and they've had no taste of what it's like, and it can be a struggle. "But for Viktor, he's well used to it. He played at Coventry, and I played loads of games with him at Brighton. So he‚Äôs seen it, he knows what it's going to be like and what to expect from the defenders. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt say a bad word about him, to be honest. He‚Äôs one of the most professional trainers I‚Äôve ever seen; he‚Äôs right up there with Martin Odegaard in that respect."

Title: Dundee Utd boss signs new deal
Content: Dundee Utd boss Jim Goodwin has signed a new 12-month rolling contract with the club. Goodwin has been in charge at the Scottish Premiership club for two years and has been backed with 15 new signings this season. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a tremendous journey throughout the past two years and I‚Äôm incredibly pleased with what we‚Äôve built here ‚ÄúI said when I arrived that I wanted to give the supporters a team that they can be proud of and I believe, as a collective, we have achieved that thus far. ‚ÄúWhen I first came through the doors at Tannadice, the club was at a real crossroads - but there was a clear vision from the board and a hunger from the fans to get this club back to where it belongs. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had to make difficult decisions, rebuild the squad on numerous occasions, and push through some real tests of character - but the buy-in across the club and fanbase has been nothing short of incredible."

Title: Wolfsburg complete deal to sign Eriksen
Content: Wolfsburg have completed the free signing of Christian Eriksen. The Danish midfielder was a free agent after leaving Manchester United at the end of June.

Title: Ange: I love winning things!
Content: Ange Postecoglou is determined to take Nottingham Forest back to "its rightful place" in English football. Postecoglou was appointed as Nuno Espirito Santo's successor at the City Ground - only four months on from being sacked by Tottenham following their Europa League success. "I love winning things. That's what I've done," Postecoglou said in a in-house interview. "From my perspective now it's about implementing my own ideas. It's no secret I like my teams to attack, I love my teams to score goals. "That is sometimes misconstrued as me just playing one way, but the reason I want my team to play that way is because I love winning things and that is what I want to do here. "When you look at what the club has achieved in recent times, it's an outstanding feat to be where we are right now. "Other clubs that have won promotion have struggled to stay in the league, but in a short space of time we're back in Europe and competing for honours, which is a great credit to everyone involved. "I get a sense that the club wants more and that's certainly what I want, so I think it's a really exciting time. "I'm honoured and I'm humbled, but more importantly I'm determined to make sure this football club takes its rightful place."

Title: Vardy sees similarities between Leicester and Cremonese
Content: Jamie Vardy has admitted he sees some similarities between his new club Cremonese and his former team Leicester. Just like was often the case at Leicester, promoted Cremonese faces a challenge to stay up in the top division and has a lot of doubters. Cremonese  have also exceeded expectations with two straight wins, stunning AC Milan at the San Siro and then producing a dramatic late win over Sassuolo. Vardy said at his presentation Wednesday that he was convinced to join the Italian club during a long Zoom call with Cremonese coach Davide Nicola, who is known as an expert at avoiding relegation. "Just looking in his eyes and seeing what he wanted, that really resonated with myself and I think as a footballer it's always nice to feel wanted," Vardy said. "Having sat down with the manager and the owner, the main task is making sure we stay in the league. And if I'm honest, that's how it was when I was at Leicester."

Title: Bournemouth agree Saudi loan for Faivre
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam: Bournemouth have agreed a season long loan deal with Al-Taawoun FC for midfielder Romain Faivre. The deal includes an option at ‚Ç¨10 million (¬£8.7m) The 27-year-old is in Saudi Arabia now finalising the move before an official announcement. Faivre made six appearances for Bournemouth joining in the summer of 2023.

Title: Vardy: I rejected other clubs to join Cremonese
Content: Jamie Vardy has revealed he rejected approaches from other clubs to join Italian side Cremonese. The 38-year-old was unveiled by the Serie A club on Wednesday after signing a one-year contract with the option of a further year if Cremonese stay in the Italian top-flight. Sky Sports News understands Vardy rejected a late approach from Dutch side Feyenoord, while he was also linked with moves to Wrexham and Celtic. "I don't feel like naming the clubs I rejected. I made the decision with my family and I'm very happy," said Vardy. "When we talked about this possibility, I took many factors into consideration: first and foremost, my family. "Luckily, technology helped us. I spoke on video with the coach for about 45-60 minutes, and he instilled his passion in me. "I'm working to be ready when the coach needs me. If I think of Italy and an idol, I say Del Piero. I watched him a lot as a child."

Title: Fabianski returns to West Ham
Content: West Ham have announced that Lukasz Fabianski has rejoined the club on a contract until the end of the season. The Polish goalkeeper departed the London Stadium at the end of last season but has come back to Graham Potter's first-team. ‚ÄúWe are really pleased to have ≈Åukasz back with the group,‚Äù Potter confirmed. ‚ÄúRegardless of him being here previously, the main factor is that he is still a top goalkeeper and a top professional, and the perfect choice for the role we needed to fill. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a signing that makes perfect sense for everyone. ≈Åukasz knows the Club extremely well, is very well respected and popular among everyone here. His personality and character will be a great example, especially to our younger players, and he is someone who really cares about West Ham United and wants to help us in any way he can. We are very happy to have him back with us.‚Äù Fabianski has been allowed to return after third choice goalkeeper Wes Foderingham left the club this week to join Aris Limassol.

Title: Forest confirm Postecoglou staff
Content: Nottingham Forest have confirmed that coaches Mile Jedinak, Nick Montgomery, Sergio Raimundo and Rob Burch have joined the Club. Following the arrival of Ange Postecoglou as the Club‚Äôs new Head Coach, the quartet are taking up crucial roles within the coaching team. Postecoglou is set for a swift return to north London as Forest visit Tottenham's rivals Arsenal in the Premier League on Saturday lunchtime. Postecoglou's first four games in charge at Forest are all away, with his first home match not until September 27 against Sunderland, live on Sky Sports.

Title: Onana error sees Cameroon WC qualification hopes dented
Content: Manchester United shotstopper Andre Onana is under fire once again as his nation, Cameroon, suffered a 1-0 defeat to Cape Verde during their World Cup qualifying group fixture on Tuesday. Dailon Livramento tightened Cape Verde's grip on top spot, as he ran from the centre circle after dispossessing United-linked Carlos Baleba to finish past Onana as Cameroon were hit on the counter. The 29-year-old, who Sky Sports News understand has a broad agreement in place to join Trabzonspor in an imminent loan move, was rooted to his line as Livramento approached one-on-one. A video emerged on social media following the game, appearing to show a frustrated Onana shoving a fan who stormed the pitch at full-time. Defeat for Cameroon means their hopes of qualifying for the World Cup have been dented with two games. Cape Verde need three points to fully ensure their automatic World Cup qualification as they now boast a four-point gap over Cameroon in second. Onana's United team-mate, Bryan Mbeumo, played 87 minutes. Should Cameroon finish in second place in Group D, they will hope to enter the playoffs as one of the four best runners-up. At present, the Indomitable Lions are the fifth-best runner-up. Cameroon play Mauritius and Angola next month in a bid to keep their World Cup qualification dreams alive.

Title: Tuchel praises 'perfect team-mate' Guehi after failed Liverpool move
Content: Thomas Tuchel praised Marc Guehi for being an "example" to the other England players after missing out on a move to Liverpool before the international break. The day before Guehi turned up to England's September camp, the Crystal Palace defender saw a ¬£35m fall through in the final hours of Deadline Day. But Tuchel says Guehi has been a "perfect team-mate" after scoring his first international goal in the 5-0 away win at Serbia. "He's the example of how the boys were in this camp," said Tuchel to ITV. "Exactly like this. They put their personal interests aside and he was the best team-mate possible. And he put in a fantastic performance. "He was very strong for Crystal Palace and showed it today on the pitch."

Title: Lester joins Brentford's coaching team
Content: Jack Lester has joined Brentford as assistant first team coach. The 49-year-old - best known for successful spells at Nottingham Forest and Chesterfield as a player - will focus on individual player development at the west London club. Lester coaching CV includes time as head of Sheffield United's academy and as the Blades' first team coach, as well as taking charge of Forest's U18s and U23s. He also managed Chesterfield for 37 games in 2017/18 and spent time as assistant to Wales boss Rob Page. ‚ÄúThis is a position we‚Äôve been keen to fill for some time,‚Äù said Brentford head coach Keith Andrews. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve discussed the role with Jack during these last few weeks and, as a club, we feel that he is the right person for this job. ‚ÄúIndividual player development is an area we really focus on. We are a club that helps players improve and get to their very highest level, it is part of our ideology. "We want Jack to bring this area together and build on the impressive work done by Steven Pressley over the past four years. ‚ÄúJack and I worked together at Sheffield United and got on really well - I‚Äôve seen first-hand how he can develop players, and how passionate he is about developing players. His values tie in with what we are as a football club.‚Äù

Cooper takes on new role in Denmark
Content: Steve Cooper has been appointed the new head coach of Danish club Brondby. The Welshman has signed a contract until 2028 to replace Frederik Birk. Cooper, 45, had been out of work since November 24 last year, when he was sacked by Leicester after just 15 games in charge. In a translated statement on the club's official website, Brondby director of football Benjamin Schmedes said: "Steve is that rare combination of youth and experience, vision and personality. "He is a man who can embrace a club like ours and lift both the individual player and the entire club to a new level. "We want to accelerate our development so that we can achieve the ambitious sporting goals we have and, not least, install a winning culture within the walls of Brondby Stadium. "This requires a mentality, leadership and a pair of broad shoulders that we have no doubt Steve possesses. That is why we are very pleased that he has agreed to take on the challenge."

Title: Marinakis: Ange has the credentials to win Forest trophies
Content: Nottingham Forest owner Evangelos Marinakis says new head coach Ange Postecoglou has the right credentials to help the club win trophies. He said: ‚ÄúWe are bringing a coach to the club who has a proven and consistent record of winning trophies. "His experience of coaching teams at the highest level, along with his desire to build something special with us at Forest, makes him a fantastic person to help us on our journey and achieve consistently all our ambitions. ‚ÄúAfter gaining promotion to the Premier League, then building consistently season after season to secure European football, we now must take the right step to compete with the very best and challenge for trophies. "Ange has the credentials and the track-record to do this, and we are excited he is joining us on our ambitious journey."

Title: Postecoglou confirmed as Nottingham Forest head coach
Content: Nottingham Forest have confirmed the appointment of Ange Postecoglou as their new head coach. He replaces Nuno Espirito Santo, who was sacked on Monday evening. Evangelos Marinakis has been an admirer of Postecoglou, whose family are of Greek origin, for some time, and he was quickly identified as the leading candidate to succeed Nuno. It means Postecoglou has been given another crack at the Premier League and European football. The 60-year-old is set for a swift return to north London as Forest visit Tottenham's rivals Arsenal in the Premier League on Saturday lunchtime. Postecoglou's first four games in charge at Forest are all away, with his first home match not until September 27 against Sunderland, live on Sky Sports. Sky Sports

Title: Hill signs new Bournemouth deal
Content: Bournemouth have announced James Hill has signed a new contract at the club. The defender's new deal will see him remain at the club until 2029. Hill said: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm absolutely buzzing to put pen to paper. ‚ÄúEver since coming to the club when I was 19 years of age, I‚Äôve felt that this place was home. It‚Äôs not just the players inside the club that have made me want to stay, but the fans as well, I‚Äôve felt really welcomed since the first day I stepped through the door. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm happy to continue and I can‚Äôt wait to get started for the next four years. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs really exciting here. Every day we‚Äôre developing, learning and it‚Äôs such a young and hungry group that, going into every game, there‚Äôs a possibility to win. ‚ÄúWe go into every game thinking that we can win and that mindset in the changing room in terms of wanting to get better and wanting to push as a group is really exciting.‚Äù

Title: Why has Marinakis chosen Postecoglou?
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui: "It‚Äôs clear Evangelos Marinakis wants Nottingham Forest 3.0 in the Premier League. "Steve Cooper got them up, Nuno took them to Europe and now Ange Postecoglou is in charge of making this team more dynamic and successful. "Forest have spent big on attackers in the summer, it's now up to the former Tottenham boss to unlock their potential. "¬£35m was spent on Omari Hutchinson, a similar fee also splashed out on Dan Ndoye and Dylane Bakwe, plus James McAtee came in for up to ¬£30m, ¬£25m went to Rennes for Arnaud Kalimuendo and Igor Jesus wasn't cheap from Botofogo. "They've also given big contracts to Callum Hudson-Odoi and Morgan Gibbs-White. "Forest can easily name three different front-three capable of competing in the Premier and Europe, it's down to Postecoglou to unleash them. "Forest missed out on the Champions League by just a point despite only having the ball for 40 per cent on average in games last season. "To put that into context, only Everton and Ipswich had less possession on average. "Ignore the lazy narrative about club owner Marinakis wanting Postecoglou because he was born in Athens. "To paraphrase the words of Forest hero Brian Clough, Marinakis 'wants to win but wants to win it better'. He believes he's found the man to do just that."

Title: Analysis: How changes under Edu and break down of trust led to Nuno departure
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett: "Nuno Espirito Santo got his wish, in the end. Even though he denied it, he wanted to be sacked. "Evangelos Marinakis has now opted for a replacement head coach in his own image: Ange Postecoglou is a dominant man, head strong, principled, who doesn‚Äôt suffer fools gladly. "Nuno was never going to resign, but he'd had enough of life at the City Ground. As soon as Marinakis appointed Edu as his global head of football, the writing was on the wall. "Edu was officially appointed in June, but his influence over the Forest owner stretches back longer than that. Nuno saw Edu as the third wheel: an awkward middle-man, who meant that his symbiotic relationship with Marinakis was now one stage removed. "He couldn‚Äôt understand why, when he and the Greek billionaire had always been so close, the owner had put a barrier in between them. "There were significant differences of opinion over transfer policy too. Even before Edu‚Äôs arrival, Nuno never had much of a say over recruitment, but he was consulted and his opinion mattered. In truth, not much changed in that regard with Edu at the helm, but Nuno felt it had, and he was bitter. "He has always liked a small, tight-knit squad to work with, but with European football and big ambitions, the owner and Edu knew they needed more strength in depth. "After a season of real success, unparalleled in the previous three decades, the relationship between owner and head coach was shot. Nuno knew it, and he said so in two explosive news conferences. "To criticise Marinakis in public once is brave, or foolish. To do it twice in seven days was terminal. The trust was gone, and Marinakis was furious. "He could not understand why the manager, on the eve of the new season - a season where the fanbase and everyone connected with the club was more optimistic than they had been for years - why the club figurehead and leader of the football team would go nuclear, and cause unnecessary noise and disruption inside and outside the club. "Once that trust was gone, it was impossible to find a way back, and Marinakis didn‚Äôt want to try. He had already moved on. "Sky Sports News understands Marinakis is philosophical about what has happened, and sees this as a positive new step in the club‚Äôs evolution. "Steve Cooper got the club back into the Premier League. Nuno got it back into Europe. Now, in Postecoglou, they believe they have a man at the helm who can take them to the next level - which is very clear in Marinakis‚Äô eyes - he wants to win trophies. The ambition is relentless."

West Ham in talks over Fabianski return
Content: West Ham are in talks with Lukasz Fabianski over re-joining the club. Third-choice goalkeeper Wes Foderingham left the club on Monday to join Aris Limassol. 40-year-old Fabianski had left the club at the end of last season after having been there since 2018.

Title: Marinakis: Ange has the credentials to win Forest trophies
Content: Nottingham Forest owner Evangelos Marinakis says new head coach Ange Postecoglou has the right credentials to help the club win trophies. He said: ‚ÄúWe are bringing a coach to the club who has a proven and consistent record of winning trophies. "His experience of coaching teams at the highest level, along with his desire to build something special with us at Forest, makes him a fantastic person to help us on our journey and achieve consistently all our ambitions. ‚ÄúAfter gaining promotion to the Premier League, then building consistently season after season to secure European football, we now must take the right step to compete with the very best and challenge for trophies. "Ange has the credentials and the track-record to do this, and we are excited he is joining us on our ambitious journey."

Title: Postecoglou confirmed as Nottingham Forest head coach
Content: Nottingham Forest have confirmed the appointment of Ange Postecoglou as their new head coach. He replaces Nuno Espirito Santo, who was sacked on Monday evening. Evangelos Marinakis has been an admirer of Postecoglou, whose family are of Greek origin, for some time, and he was quickly identified as the leading candidate to succeed Nuno. It means Postecoglou has been given another crack at the Premier League and European football. The 60-year-old is set for a swift return to north London as Forest visit Tottenham's rivals Arsenal in the Premier League on Saturday lunchtime. Postecoglou's first four games in charge at Forest are all away, with his first home match not until September 27 against Sunderland, live on Sky Sports. Sky Sports

Title: Hill signs new Bournemouth deal
Content: Bournemouth have announced James Hill has signed a new contract at the club. The defender's new deal will see him remain at the club until 2029. Hill said: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm absolutely buzzing to put pen to paper. ‚ÄúEver since coming to the club when I was 19 years of age, I‚Äôve felt that this place was home. It‚Äôs not just the players inside the club that have made me want to stay, but the fans as well, I‚Äôve felt really welcomed since the first day I stepped through the door. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm happy to continue and I can‚Äôt wait to get started for the next four years. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs really exciting here. Every day we‚Äôre developing, learning and it‚Äôs such a young and hungry group that, going into every game, there‚Äôs a possibility to win. ‚ÄúWe go into every game thinking that we can win and that mindset in the changing room in terms of wanting to get better and wanting to push as a group is really exciting.‚Äù

Title: Why has Marinakis chosen Postecoglou?
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui: "It‚Äôs clear Evangelos Marinakis wants Nottingham Forest 3.0 in the Premier League. "Steve Cooper got them up, Nuno took them to Europe and now Ange Postecoglou is in charge of making this team more dynamic and successful. "Forest have spent big on attackers in the summer, it's now up to the former Tottenham boss to unlock their potential. "¬£35m was spent on Omari Hutchinson, a similar fee also splashed out on Dan Ndoye and Dylane Bakwe, plus James McAtee came in for up to ¬£30m, ¬£25m went to Rennes for Arnaud Kalimuendo and Igor Jesus wasn't cheap from Botofogo. "They've also given big contracts to Callum Hudson-Odoi and Morgan Gibbs-White. "Forest can easily name three different front-three capable of competing in the Premier and Europe, it's down to Postecoglou to unleash them. "Forest missed out on the Champions League by just a point despite only having the ball for 40 per cent on average in games last season. "To put that into context, only Everton and Ipswich had less possession on average. "Ignore the lazy narrative about club owner Marinakis wanting Postecoglou because he was born in Athens. "To paraphrase the words of Forest hero Brian Clough, Marinakis 'wants to win but wants to win it better'. He believes he's found the man to do just that."

Title: Analysis: How changes under Edu and break down of trust led to Nuno departure
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett: "Nuno Espirito Santo got his wish, in the end. Even though he denied it, he wanted to be sacked. "Evangelos Marinakis has now opted for a replacement head coach in his own image: Ange Postecoglou is a dominant man, head strong, principled, who doesn‚Äôt suffer fools gladly. "Nuno was never going to resign, but he'd had enough of life at the City Ground. As soon as Marinakis appointed Edu as his global head of football, the writing was on the wall. "Edu was officially appointed in June, but his influence over the Forest owner stretches back longer than that. Nuno saw Edu as the third wheel: an awkward middle-man, who meant that his symbiotic relationship with Marinakis was now one stage removed. "He couldn‚Äôt understand why, when he and the Greek billionaire had always been so close, the owner had put a barrier in between them. "There were significant differences of opinion over transfer policy too. Even before Edu‚Äôs arrival, Nuno never had much of a say over recruitment, but he was consulted and his opinion mattered. In truth, not much changed in that regard with Edu at the helm, but Nuno felt it had, and he was bitter. "He has always liked a small, tight-knit squad to work with, but with European football and big ambitions, the owner and Edu knew they needed more strength in depth. "After a season of real success, unparalleled in the previous three decades, the relationship between owner and head coach was shot. Nuno knew it, and he said so in two explosive news conferences. "To criticise Marinakis in public once is brave, or foolish. To do it twice in seven days was terminal. The trust was gone, and Marinakis was furious. "He could not understand why the manager, on the eve of the new season - a season where the fanbase and everyone connected with the club was more optimistic than they had been for years - why the club figurehead and leader of the football team would go nuclear, and cause unnecessary noise and disruption inside and outside the club. "Once that trust was gone, it was impossible to find a way back, and Marinakis didn‚Äôt want to try. He had already moved on. "Sky Sports News understands Marinakis is philosophical about what has happened, and sees this as a positive new step in the club‚Äôs evolution. "Steve Cooper got the club back into the Premier League. Nuno got it back into Europe. Now, in Postecoglou, they believe they have a man at the helm who can take them to the next level - which is very clear in Marinakis‚Äô eyes - he wants to win trophies. The ambition is relentless."

Title: Isak on Liverpool move: 'Not everyone has the full picture'
Content: Alexander Isak said "not everyone has the full picture" on his record-breaking move from Newcastle to Liverpool after the striker made his first appearance of the season in Sweden's 2-0 World Cup qualifying defeat to Kosovo. The saga of Isak's move finally came to an end on Deadline Day when Liverpool paid a British record fee of ¬£125m. "Not everyone has the full picture, but that's something for another day," Isak told Swedish media. "I can't control everything that's said or written. But I'm happy that I became a Liverpool player." Isak came on as a second-half substitute for his first appearance of the season after not featuring for Newcastle in pre-season. After being an unused substitute in Sweden's draw with Slovenia on Friday, he played the final 18 minutes against Kosovo as he builds up to a potential Liverpool debut against Burnley, live on Sky Sports on Sunday. "It's great that everything was settled before the camp and that I could focus on playing football again," Isak said. "It's been a fairly new situation for me, but you always learn and develop mentally off the pitch as well."

Title: Marinakis 'hurt and angered' by Nuno comments
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam and Rob Dorsett: Evangelos Marinakis has spent the last week deciding if his relationship with Nuno Espirito Santo could be resurrected. However, Sky Sports News has been told that the Forest owner was deeply hurt and angered by his head coach speaking out against him and the club in public twice in the space of seven days. In his pre-match interviews before the opening game of the season, Nuno was openly critical of the senior figures at Forest overseeing their transfer strategy, saying his squad was ‚Äúunbalanced‚Äù and ‚Äúvery, very far‚Äù from being ready for the new season. In the following week, Forest spent ¬£118m on four new players. Then, ahead of Forest‚Äôs next match against Crystal Palace, Nuno said in his news conference that his relationship with the owner was seriously flawed and had deteriorated since the arrival of Edu as Marinakis‚Äô right-hand man and head of global football. Nuno said there was ‚Äúno smoke without fire‚Äù amid reports his job was in jeopardy. Nuno admitted he had not spoken to Edu, and had no regrets about speaking out against his bosses. ‚ÄúI said it, and I don‚Äôt regret it,‚Äù Nuno said. ‚ÄúFor me, it‚Äôs important that everyone at the club shares the same vision and same commitment. I have to speak to the owner.‚Äù Sky Sports News has been told that the meeting that Nuno wanted with the Forest owner never happened. Instead, the Greek billionaire has decided it is better to replace Nuno with a new head coach, feeling it is the only way to move the club forward.

Title: The managers Forest like amid head coach search
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam and Rob Dorsett: Sky Sports News has been told that no one has yet been lined up to replace Nuno Espirito Santo as Nottingham Forest boss. Reports are suggesting that former Tottenham boss Ange Postecoglou is expected to take over. Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner, Bournemouth boss Andoni Iraola, USA head coach Mauricio Pochettino and Fulham's Marco Silva are all also widely admired by the Nottingham Forest hierarchy. Forest chiefs Edu Gaspar and Ross Wilson will oversee the appointment of a new head coach for the club. The club announced the sacking of Nuno Espirito Santo at 12.15am on Tuesday morning.

Title: Forest confirm Nuno sacking
Content: Nottingham Forest have confirmed the sacking of head coach Nuno Espirito Santo. A club statement read: "Nottingham Forest Football Club confirms that, following recent circumstances, Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo has today been relieved of his duties as head coach. "The club thanks Nuno for his contribution during a very successful era at The City Ground, in particular his role in the 2024/25 season, which will forever be remembered fondly in the history of the club. "As someone who played a pivotal role in our success last season, he will always hold a special place in our journey."

Title: Kane on Levy exit: I didn't see it coming
Content: Tottenham's record goalscorer Harry Kane paid tribute to "fantastic chairman" Daniel Levy following his recent exit. Levy is understood to have been asked to stand down from his position last week following a review of operations at the north London club, ending a 24-year stint in charge. The 32-year-old eventually got a move to Bayern Munich in 2023 and is surprised that Levy's time at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium is over. "Obviously, it's a bit of a surprise, if I'm honest," he said. "I didn't expect it, didn't see that coming. "Daniel has been a fantastic chairman for Tottenham in the 20 years or so he's been there. "Considering where the club was and where it is now, I think it's been a big change, not just on the pitch, but off the pitch as well. "At any stage there's always going to be change in clubs, and change in the higher positions. "Obviously I don't know too much about why or what happened. All I can say is I wish Daniel all the best in whatever's next for him. "We obviously built a relationship over the time we had together. I'm sure at some stage we'll catch up. "Overall for Tottenham, it's a new chapter they're trying to create now."

Title: Donnarumma makes errors in Italy win
Content: New Man City goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma was accused of making some glaring mistakes in Italy's 5-4 World Cup qualifying win over Israel. The ¬£26m Deadline Day signing was playing his final game before being in contention to start his first game for Manchester City in Sunday's derby vs Man Utd, live on Sky Sports. Donnarumma's unreliability from set pieces was highlighted again as he failed to come out to claim a free-kick which led to Israel's fourth goal. The Italy captain also punched a corner into his own net with the scoreline at 0-0 - but the referee gave a foul for a soft push on the goalkeeper.

Title: Isak plays but Sweden lose to Kosovo
Content: Alexander Isak played his first minutes of the season as a late substitute in Sweden's 2-0 loss to Kosovo. The Liverpool striker - who became a British record transfer from Newcastle earlier this month - came off the bench in the 72nd minute with Sweden already two goals down. Isak was booked nine minutes into his comeback which brings to an end a poor international camp for the striker and his country. The forward was an unused substitute Sweden's 2-2 draw against Slovenia last season because he had not done enough training sessions before the match, according to head coach John Dahl Tomasson. Arsenal striker Viktor Gyokeres played the entire match in the defeat to Kosovo - which gives Sweden a mountain to climb if they are to qualify for next year's World Cup.

Title: Isak on bench again for Sweden
Content: Liverpool's British record signing Alexander Isak is among the substitutes for Sweden's World Cup qualifier against Kosovo tonight. Arsenal forward Viktor Gyokores starts up front. Title: Eze: I'm grateful for Arsenal move

Title: Marinakis 'hurt and angered' by Nuno comments
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam and Rob Dorsett: Evangelos Marinakis has spent the last week deciding if his relationship with Nuno Espirito Santo could be resurrected. However, Sky Sports News has been told that the Forest owner was deeply hurt and angered by his head coach speaking out against him and the club in public twice in the space of seven days. In his pre-match interviews before the opening game of the season, Nuno was openly critical of the senior figures at Forest overseeing their transfer strategy, saying his squad was ‚Äúunbalanced‚Äù and ‚Äúvery, very far‚Äù from being ready for the new season. In the following week, Forest spent ¬£118m on four new players. Then, ahead of Forest‚Äôs next match against Crystal Palace, Nuno said in his news conference that his relationship with the owner was seriously flawed and had deteriorated since the arrival of Edu as Marinakis‚Äô right-hand man and head of global football. Nuno said there was ‚Äúno smoke without fire‚Äù amid reports his job was in jeopardy. Nuno admitted he had not spoken to Edu, and had no regrets about speaking out against his bosses. ‚ÄúI said it, and I don‚Äôt regret it,‚Äù Nuno said. ‚ÄúFor me, it‚Äôs important that everyone at the club shares the same vision and same commitment. I have to speak to the owner.‚Äù Sky Sports News has been told that the meeting that Nuno wanted with the Forest owner never happened. Instead, the Greek billionaire has decided it is better to replace Nuno with a new head coach, feeling it is the only way to move the club forward.

Title: The managers Forest like amid head coach search
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam and Rob Dorsett: Sky Sports News has been told that no one has yet been lined up to replace Nuno Espirito Santo as Nottingham Forest boss. Reports are suggesting that former Tottenham boss Ange Postecoglou is expected to take over. Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner, Bournemouth boss Andoni Iraola, USA head coach Mauricio Pochettino and Fulham's Marco Silva are all also widely admired by the Nottingham Forest hierarchy. Forest chiefs Edu Gaspar and Ross Wilson will oversee the appointment of a new head coach for the club. The club announced the sacking of Nuno Espirito Santo at 12.15am on Tuesday morning.

Title: Forest confirm Nuno sacking
Content: Nottingham Forest have confirmed the sacking of head coach Nuno Espirito Santo. A club statement read: "Nottingham Forest Football Club confirms that, following recent circumstances, Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo has today been relieved of his duties as head coach. "The club thanks Nuno for his contribution during a very successful era at The City Ground, in particular his role in the 2024/25 season, which will forever be remembered fondly in the history of the club. "As someone who played a pivotal role in our success last season, he will always hold a special place in our journey."

Title: Kane on Levy exit: I didn't see it coming
Content: Tottenham's record goalscorer Harry Kane paid tribute to "fantastic chairman" Daniel Levy following his recent exit. Levy is understood to have been asked to stand down from his position last week following a review of operations at the north London club, ending a 24-year stint in charge. The 32-year-old eventually got a move to Bayern Munich in 2023 and is surprised that Levy's time at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium is over. "Obviously, it's a bit of a surprise, if I'm honest," he said. "I didn't expect it, didn't see that coming. "Daniel has been a fantastic chairman for Tottenham in the 20 years or so he's been there. "Considering where the club was and where it is now, I think it's been a big change, not just on the pitch, but off the pitch as well. "At any stage there's always going to be change in clubs, and change in the higher positions. "Obviously I don't know too much about why or what happened. All I can say is I wish Daniel all the best in whatever's next for him. "We obviously built a relationship over the time we had together. I'm sure at some stage we'll catch up. "Overall for Tottenham, it's a new chapter they're trying to create now."

Title: Donnarumma makes errors in Italy win
Content: New Man City goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma was accused of making some glaring mistakes in Italy's 5-4 World Cup qualifying win over Israel. The ¬£26m Deadline Day signing was playing his final game before being in contention to start his first game for Manchester City in Sunday's derby vs Man Utd, live on Sky Sports. Donnarumma's unreliability from set pieces was highlighted again as he failed to come out to claim a free-kick which led to Israel's fourth goal. The Italy captain also punched a corner into his own net with the scoreline at 0-0 - but the referee gave a foul for a soft push on the goalkeeper.

Title: Isak plays but Sweden lose to Kosovo
Content: Alexander Isak played his first minutes of the season as a late substitute in Sweden's 2-0 loss to Kosovo. The Liverpool striker - who became a British record transfer from Newcastle earlier this month - came off the bench in the 72nd minute with Sweden already two goals down. Isak was booked nine minutes into his comeback which brings to an end a poor international camp for the striker and his country. The forward was an unused substitute Sweden's 2-2 draw against Slovenia last season because he had not done enough training sessions before the match, according to head coach John Dahl Tomasson. Arsenal striker Viktor Gyokeres played the entire match in the defeat to Kosovo - which gives Sweden a mountain to climb if they are to qualify for next year's World Cup.

Title: Goztepe make bid for Bristol City's Armstrong
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas: Goztepe have made an ¬£868k (‚Ç¨1m) bid for Bristol City‚Äôs Sinclair Armstrong. The player is not in their plans and is understood to want to leave and join the Turkish club.

Title: Isak on bench again for Sweden
Content: Liverpool's British record signing Alexander Isak is among the substitutes for Sweden's World Cup qualifier against Kosovo tonight. Arsenal forward Viktor Gyokores starts up front. Isak was named on the bench for Sweden's 2-2 draw against Slovenia and didn't come on. He has not played any football for club or country since the end of the last Premier League season. Title: Eze: I'm grateful for Arsenal move
Content: Eberechi Eze has said he is "grateful" over his move to Arsenal from Crystal Palace this summer. Eze was due to join Tottenham Hotspur but then the midfielder's boyhood club Arsenal swooped in to sign the England international for a ¬£67.5m fee. Asked if he was worried that his Arsenal move would not come about, Eze said while on England duty: ‚ÄúWorried? No. Because I play football. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what I do and wherever I am, I want to be the best I can be and I‚Äôm confident I‚Äôll do that wherever I am. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm grateful that it‚Äôs Arsenal and that I‚Äôve got the opportunity to play there and do what I do and I‚Äôm looking forward to it. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lot going on, it‚Äôs fun for me. This is why I play football. These are opportunities that you want. This is for me so I am enjoying it as much as I can. And do what I can.‚Äù

Title: Why are Celtic fans unhappy with the club?
Content: Following an open letter from fans to the club, Celtic's statement in response and a vote of no confidence towards the board, we look at what is going on at the Scottish Premiership side. We also discuss Brendan Rodgers' future with podcaster Paul John Dykes.

Title: Raskin: I don't want to leave Rangers
Content:
Nicolas Raskin wants to return to Rangers and resolve a "complicated" situation at the Ibrox club. The 24-year-old Belgium international, who starred for the Light Blues last season, was left out of the goalless Old Firm  clash at Ibrox before the international break by Gers boss Russell Martin. Raskin went off on international duty and scored his first goal for the Red Devils in the 6-0 win over Kazakhstan in Brussels on Sunday. Raskin was quoted in Dutch language media outlet Voetbalkrant saying: "My situation at the club is complicated. I will return, work hard, and try to get playing time again. "But it's not just up to me. I know this is an important year, and I
absolutely want to be part of this campaign with Belgium. "Football is simply a game of ups and downs. I absolutely love Rangers. "I've had some great moments there and have a strong bond with the fans. I always try to give my all. "A transfer? No, that's out of the question. I want to continue to resolve this at the club."

Title: Spurs CEO: The club is not for sale
Content: Following Daniel Levy‚Äôs departure, Tottenham Hotspur CEO Vinai Venkatesham outlines the club‚Äôs vision. Credit: Tottenham Hotspur FC.

Title: 'It hurts' - Tel opens up on Spurs CL exclusion
Content: Tottenham forward Mathys Tel has admitted that his exclusion from Spurs' Champions League squad "hurts" but the forward has respected Thomas Frank's choice on the matter. Tel was left out of Spurs' Champions League squad for the league phase along with Radu Dragusin, James Maddison, Dejan Kulusevski and Yves Bissouma. Tel completed a ¬£29.8m permanent move from Bayern Munich to Spurs after a loan spell last season. Asked about how Frank delivered the news, Tel told Le Telegramme: "Quite simply, with respect. He called me, he simply told me his choice and then you could see the list appear on social media. "It's clear that when you're not on a list, it definitely hurts, but I'm someone who stays pretty positive, no matter the situation, because I think I've worked a lot on the mental aspect. "So today it's definitely a disappointment, I would have liked to be there. But the coach's choice is the coach's choice, we can only respect it and we're going to work to come back in the best possible way."

Title: Explained: Why Man City and Premier League settlement is significant
Content: Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol explains the settlement between Man City and the Premier League over Associated Party Transaction rules. This legal action is separate to their charges for alleged breaches of financial rules. The club deny the charges.

Title: LISTEN: FPL Gameweek 4 - Is Grealish worth the hype?
Content: James Savundra and Mark Briggs are joined by Josh Cuthbert for this week‚Äôs episode of the Sky Sports Fantasy Podcast. The international break is almost over, which means the Premier League is back very soon. Everton attacker Jack Grealish is the most bought player ahead of Gameweek 4 - but is he really worth bringing in? James, Mark and Josh also reflect on a dramatic Deadline Day which saw Alexander Isak join Liverpool. Is it too early to buy him in FPL, though? And our experts explain why it could be a mistake to sell your Aston Villa players despite the fact that they‚Äôve had a poor start to the season.

Title: Man City and PL reach settlement over APT rules
Content: Manchester City and the Premier League have reached a settlement in their dispute over the rules governing associated party transactions (APTs). Under the settlement, City accept that the current rules governing APTS are ‚Äúvalid and binding‚Äù. City had launched arbitration proceedings on January 20 against the current rules, which are designed to ensure that deals between clubs and entities linked to their ownership are done at fair market value. City‚Äôs challenge was understood to have included criticism of the way the Premier League treated shareholder loans under the rules. The league and City have agreed to make no further comment on the matter. Sky Sports

Title: 'Wolves open new contract talks with Strand Larsen'
Content: Wolves have opened contract talks with striker Jorgen Strand Larsen, according to The Telegraph. The reported negotiations come after Newcastle had multiple bids rejected for the Norway international last month. The Magpies' highest offer was ¬£55m for Strand Larsen, but Wolves insisted he was not for sale. The report says Wolves were ready to reject a third bid of ¬£60m from Newcastle. It is now claimed that the 25-year-old will be rewarded with an improved deal at Wolves, but the new contract is unlikely to include a release clause. Strand Larsen signed a four-year contract with Wolves at the start of July when he joined permanently for ¬£23m from Celta Vigo. He initially moved to Wolves on loan from Celta Vigo last summer, and the deal became permanent after certain clauses in his contract were met.

Title: Leverkusen appoint Ten Hag's successor
Content: Former Denmark boss Kasper Hjulmand has been appointed as Bayer Leverkusen's new head coach. Hjulmand replaces Erik ten Hag, who was sacked on September 1. He has signed a two-year deal with the German club. The 53-year-old was most recently Denmark's manager, leading his country for four years and to a Euro 2020 semi-final, where they lost 2-1 to England in extra-time. He has previously managed in Germany, taking charge of Mainz 05 in the 2014/15 season.

Title: 'Palace agree compensation package to sign Arsenal teenager Casey'
Content: Crystal Palace have agreed a compensation package with Arsenal for the signing of teenage midfielder Dan Casey, according to Fabrizio Romano. The 18-year-old will reportedly undergo a medical in the next 24 hours before joining Palace‚Äôs U21s. Casey is eligible to represent both Italy and England at international level. Casey joined Arsenal in 2015 and made 21 appearances in the U18 Premier League last year, scoring 18 goals.

Title: American NFL owners interested in Spurs takeover
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Amar Mehta: Sky Sports News understands that there is interest in Tottenham Hotspur from American NFL owners. Spurs said on Sunday night that they have "unequivocally rejected" two expressions of interest in the club, with ENIC confirming the club is not for sale. The parties include PCP International, led by Amanda Staveley and another consortium fronted by Dr Roger Kennedy and Wing Fai-Ng, who is the chief executive of Triller, which is a TikTok rival. Sky Sports News reported on Sunday that Staveley had been in discussions with prospective backers of a bid for the club in recent weeks.

Title: Tottenham Hotspur 'not for sale': What we know so far...
Tottenham ‚Äònot for sale‚Äô as Staveley‚Äôs firm backs down
Content: Tottenham‚Äôs board have said the club is ‚Äúnot for sale‚Äù, as Amanda Staveley‚Äôs firm pulled out of a potential takeover move. On Monday morning, PCP International Finance, the investment vehicle led by former Newcastle shareholder Staveley, confirmed it had been interested in a potential move. But it confirmed that ‚Äúit does not intend to make an offer for Tottenham‚Äù. Takeover rules mean the company cannot return with an offer for the Premier League club in the next six months. It came amid growing speculation a takeover of the club could be imminent following the sudden departure of long-standing executive chairman Daniel Levy last week. Levy was the Premier League‚Äôs longest-serving chairman, having held the role for 24 years. On Sunday evening, Tottenham‚Äôs board confirmed they had received takeover interest from two parties but did not plan to sell. ENIC Sports & Developments Holdings Ltd, the majority shareholder of the club, said it had interest from PCP and a consortium of investors led by Roger Kennedy and Wing-Fai Ng through Firehawk Holdings Limited. Sky Sports

Title: 'Onana set to earn higher salary at Trabzonspor'
Content: Andre Onana will earn a higher salary at Trabzonspor when his loan move from Manchester United is confirmed, according to Fabrizio Romano. It is claimed that the deal for the goalkeeper to join the Turkish side is set to be announced this week. The 29-year-old will reportedly earn bonuses and a signing-on on fee, as well the Turkish club covering his salary structure. Sky Sports News reported last week that a departure in the goalkeeping department at United couldn't be ruled out following the arrival of Senne Lammens. Onana has made just one appearance for United so far this season, which arrived in the defeat to League Two side Grimsby Town on penalties in the Carabao Cup.

Title: 'No January move for Guehi, Liverpool eyeing free transfer'
Content: Liverpool will not try to sign Crystal Palace defender Marc Guehi in the January transfer window with Arne Slot's side looking to sign him for free next summer, according to The Times. Guehi's ¬£35m move to Anfield fell through on Deadline Day due to Palace failing to sign a replacement at the club. Sky Sports News reported Oliver Glanser's insistence on not wanting to lose his captain played a key role in the decision by Palace to pull the plug. The Reds are reportedly not set to pursue a move for the England international due to his contract expiring at the end of the season.

Title: Ekitike relishing 'tough competition' from Isak
Content: Hugo Ekitike is looking forward to the "tough competition" Alexander Isak will provide at Liverpool following the Deadline Day arrival of the Sweden international. Isak and Ekitike arrived at Anfield this summer for a combined fee of ¬£204m. Ekitike has enjoyed an impressive start to life in Arne Slot's side, scoring three goals across his first four appearances, but will now face tough competition from Isak moving forward. "When you play for the best teams, you inevitably expect to be competing with the best players," Ekitike said when asked about competing with his new teammate. "Isak is a player I used to watch, so seeing him arrive is a pleasure. "It's going to be tough competition, but I'm going to work hard to be good and perform well so that it's just the coach's problem."

Title: Tottenham 'not for sale' after two expressions of interest rejected
Content: Tottenham say they have "unequivocally rejected" two expressions of interest in the club and majority shareholder ENIC confirming it is not for sale. One of the interested parties was PCP international, a vehicle controlled by former Newcastle United joint-owner Amanda Staveley, and another from a consortium led by Dr Roger Kennedy and Wing Fai-Ng through Firehawks Holdings Limited. "The board of the club and ENIC confirm that Tottenham Hotspur is not for sale and ENIC has no intention to accept any such offer to acquire its interest in the club," a statement from the club read. We begin with England‚Äôs struggle to entertain against Andorra. Jonathan praises Elliot Anderson and Noni Madueke but Jacqui questions whether England are on track, as fans need to believe they can win ahead of the World Cup next year. Next to Daniel Levy‚Äôs Tottenham exit.  Jonathan discusses the ex-chairman‚Äôs longevity, but will Levy‚Äôs twenty-four-year stint in charge be seen as a success, ultimately failing to reach the glory of the bigger trophies? Title: Did football leave Levy behind? 'Clubs did not want to deal with Tottenham'
Content: Jonathan Northcroft of The Sunday Times told Sunday Supplement that Daniel Levy lost his reputation as a master dealmaker - and that other Premier League sides did not want to negotiate with him. The former Tottenham chairman stood down after 25 years in a shock move earlier this week.

Title: 'Onana leaving is a risk for Man Utd'
Content: Jason Burt of The Telegraph believes it is a risk for Manchester United to sell Andre Onana and rely on new signing Senne Lammens and Altay Bayindir this season. Lammens, 23, completed an ¬£18.2m move from Royal Antwerp to Old Trafford on Deadline Day. "I question the strategy here. If they wanted to move Onana on, they should have done it by now," he said on Sunday Supplement. "You have got Bayindir, who has not been convincing, so you're putting everything on a young goalkeeper who has not played a lot of games in the Belgian Pro League. "He has promise but was bought as a project. They started the summer with their eggs in the striker basket, that's where they put their money. "They knew two other issues, goalkeeper and midfield. They thought they could get away with one more year of Onana. Now they've suddenly said now we won't. "Maybe Onana wants to go but if I were them, I'd be stronger and say you need to compete to be the No 1. "It's a risk. There are enough risks at Man Utd at the moment."

Title: Onana considering Trabzonspor offer
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Vik Varange: Manchester United keeper Andre Onana is understood to be mulling over an offer to join Trabzonspor. Content: Germany head coach Julian Nagelsmann insists he is not concerned about his job security as he goes into Sunday‚Äôs World Cup qualifier against Northern Ireland on the back of three straight defeats. After the disappointment of losing to both Portugal and France in the Nations League in June, Germany lost their first-ever World Cup qualifier away from home when their Group A campaign began with a surprise 2-0 reverse to Slovakia in Bratislava on Thursday. That has left Nagelsmann under pressure going into Sunday‚Äôs game in Cologne as criticism in the German media intensifies. ‚ÄúTo be frightened is never a good point,‚Äù Nagelsmann said in a press conference on Saturday. ‚ÄúI am still brave enough, and I want to win every game. Title: Pochettino 'shocked' to see Levy leave Tottenham
Content: Former Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino has admitted he was shocked to see Daniel Levy leave his role as chairman at the club. The current USMNT head coach worked as the Spurs boss from 2014 to 2019 under Levy's watch, guiding the club to the Champions League final in his final year in north London. Spurs confirmed on Thursday that Levy would be stepping down from his role as chairman, which he had held for nearly 25 years after succeeding Sir Alan Sugar in 2001. Pochettino also highlighted the strong relationship he had with Levy during his time at Spurs, as he discussed the departure in the aftermath of his exit. "I knew the news about Daniel Levy yesterday," Pochettino said. "I am a little bit in shock, because he was my former president. I don't know what happened there. "Of course, I sent a text to him and I sent a text to different people that were very close to him. "Still no answer (from Levy). I don't have more information. What I want to say is I wish all the best for his life and his family time. "My relationship was always very good. I was in shock like many people that know him."

Title: Maeda reveals Celtic refused to let him leave this summer
Content: Daizen Maeda has revealed he hoped to leave Celtic in the summer transfer window closed but a proposed move was blocked by the Parkhead club. Last season‚Äôs Scottish Premiership Player of the Year was eager to take the ‚Äúnext step‚Äù in his career after receiving a tempting offer from elsewhere. Maeda, speaking while on international duty with Japan, said he was late in joining up with his country this week due to ‚Äúclub circumstances‚Äù, with the transfer window closing on Monday night. ‚ÄúI received an offer,‚Äù Maeda said. ‚ÄúI had been telling the club that I wanted to take the next step, but Celtic hadn‚Äôt been able to strengthen their squad properly, so in the end they told me they couldn‚Äôt let me go.‚Äù Maeda, who has scored 63 goals since joining Celtic in January 2022, had been linked with Brentford, but the 27-year-old refused to divulge if it was a Premier League club who tried to sign him. ‚ÄúPersonally, I had agreed, so I wanted to take on the challenge,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe national team also delayed my joining, and I really asked Celtic until the last day, but it didn‚Äôt happen.‚Äù Maeda, who has another two years on his contract, has accepted that he will be remaining with Celtic at least until January. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve decided to stay at Celtic, so I want to do my best as a member of the team,‚Äù the forward added. The sale of talisman Maeda would have heaped further pressure on the Celtic board at a time when they are already under fire from their supporters after being deemed to have failed to adequately replenish Brendan Rodgers‚Äô attack following the departures of Kyogo Furuhashi, Adam Idah and Nicolas Kuhn this year.

Title: Burn: No animosity towards Isak but glad saga over
Content: Dan Burn says there is no animosity towards Alexander Isak after the striker's protracted move from Newcastle to Liverpool, but the defender is glad the saga is finally over. Burn said: "I'm glad it's done. We wanted the transfer window to close to have a bit of clarity on it. "I've been in football long enough to understand that for a player, careers are short. They have things that they want to achieve. "So, for me, I'm happy it is over. Alex is a mate, so it was a tough situation. You want him to be around to help the team, but you also understand for him what he needs to do personally. He added: "I've got nothing but good wishes for Alex. There's no animosity. "As a Newcastle fan, we are very protective of our club and our city. you want players to be there who want to play for Newcastle. Naively, you don't want them to think there is anywhere to go other than Newcastle. "So, I understand why our fans are frustrated but I've been in the game long enough to understand what goes on. "I wish Alex all the best apart from when we play Liverpool."

Title: Everton set to open Pickford contract talks
