The 31-year-old's proposed new contract could take Pickford past his 36th birthday. Currently in his ninth season at the club, Pickford has long established himself as England‚Äôs first choice despite Everton‚Äôs well-documented struggles against relegation. Everton believe Pickford is happy, settled and open to the idea of committing the majority, and possibly all, of his remaining years playing at the highest level to the club. They are hopeful the positivity of the new stadium, new ownership, the encouraging upturn in form under David Moyes and a successful summer transfer window in which the signing of Jack Grealish has been a real signal of the club‚Äôs ambitions, will enhance that.

Title: O'Hara: Levy never wanted more
Content: Former Tottenham player Jamie O'Hara speaking on Sky Sports FC: "I think where the club is at, looking at the foundations, he‚Äôs done a really good job. They are a massive, global franchise football club now ‚Äì but you cannot say the success on the pitch has been there. "Two trophies in 24 years is not good enough, while Spurs are a massive football club. I think this move is from the Lewis family who have sat down and gone: now is the time to make the change. "Off the pitch, Spurs are in an unbelievable state. The stadium, the finances, where they are in terms of being able to spend money ‚Äì the options are there. On the pitch, the team has not been successful enough. There have always been moments in Daniel Levy‚Äôs reign when there was a time to kick on as a football club and it just didn‚Äôt feel like he did it. "I played under Daniel Levy and won the 2008 League Cup ‚Äì but it never felt like he wanted more. Can we go to the next level? Can we go and be a big football club? It never felt like we were ever going to go on and be a Liverpool, Man Utd or Arsenal and dominate. It was: amazing, we‚Äôve won the Carabao Cup."

Title: 'Levy may have been asked to step down'
Content: Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol: "What's interesting is that in the official statement from Tottenham, it says that Levy is stepping down. But it looks like he may have been asked to step down by the ultimate owners of the club, the Lewis family. "I think their thinking is that even though he has achieved so much at Spurs, especially building the stadium, turning them into one of the richest football clubs in the world, they just want a little bit more success on the pitch."

Title: 'Levy exit could loosen purse strings'
Content: Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol: "There is the feeling that Levy was maybe holding Spurs back a little bit, especially if you look at their wages. They were paying about 42 per cent of their revenue in wages to players. That is much, much less than other clubs, other rivals in the Premier League. "Their fans have been saying there's no reason why we shouldn't be competing to win the Premier League, that we need to  buy better players and also pay them more. "Everybody knows that Levy was quite cautious when it came to transfer dealings as well. So I think maybe going forward, we are going to see the loosening of the purse strings a little bit more. "Maybe Tottenham will start paying higher wages and maybe they'll start spending more in the transfer market. Although in my personal opinion, Daniel Levy has built an exceptional squad. But the fans want just a little bit more."

Title: Man City announced Clinton arrival
Content: Manchester City have announced the signing of Grace Clinton on a four-year deal from Manchester United. United lost Alessia Russo, Ona Batlle and Mary Earps across recent years due to expiring contracts. She has twice been named in the PFA's WSL Team of the Year, doing so when on loan at Spurs in the 2023/24 season and last year under Marc Skinner at Man Utd. Clinton was also part of England's Euro 2025-winning squad this summer. Speaking after her move, Clinton said: ‚ÄúCity, for me, has always played an amazing style of football. Keeping the ball, it looks lovely, and there are amazing players [here]. "I want to get better and grow and learn things in my career and I think there are amazing people here to learn things from. ‚ÄúTo play this style of football will be really enjoyable.‚Äù

Title: Man Utd confirm Park signing
Content: Manchester United Women have confirmed the signing of Jess Park from rivals Manchester City Women on a four-year deal. United made Park their top target on Deadline Day after reluctantly accepting a bid from City for Grace Clinton, a Lionesses teammate of Park, on Wednesday. Park scored five goals and picked up one assist in 21 WSL games last season. The 23-year-old has 20 national team caps to her name and was a part of England's Euro 2025 winning squad in July. Sky Sports After signing for Man Utd, Park told the club's media: "I am really happy to be here and can't wait to get started. "I wanted to break out of the boundaries and push myself to take on a new challenge. I'm the sort of person who wants to keep improving and pushing limits, and I think this is the perfect place for me to do that. "I'm a player who wants the ball, and when I get it I like to look up and try and make things happen for my teammates, so I think I can fit in really well here. I know the ambitions are very high and I want to help the team push towards them."

Title: Lewis family not preparing to sell Spurs share

A source close to the Lewis family has told Sky Sports News tonight: ‚ÄúGenerations of the Lewis family support this special football club and they want what the fans want ‚Äì more wins more often. In Vinai (Venkatesham), Thomas (Frank) and Peter Charrington, they believe they are backing the right team to deliver on this. This is a new era.‚Äù

Title: Who is new Spurs chairman Peter Charrington?
Content: Peter Charrington joined Tottenham in March as a non-executive director. He is the director of ENIC ‚Äì the company that holds a majority stake in Spurs ‚Äì and a former CEO of Citi Private Bank. He spent over 25 years at the financial firm. Charrington also holds a number of other roles. He is a senior partner at Nexus Luxury, which runs a resort in the Bahamas. He is also a senior advisor to One Equity Partners and UST Global, who work in digital technology. He is the board member at other companies: wealth management group Avaloq AG, investment group Saranac Partners and engineering companies Amey and Acteon. Now, he steps into the non-executive chairman role at Tottenham, the first time he has held such a role in the sports sector.

Title: Levy steps down as Tottenham chairman

Content: Sonia Bompastor has confirmed star striker Sam Kerr will be in the squad to face Manchester City on opening night following a 20-month injury absence. Kerr has not been seen since rupturing her ACL in training in January 2024. She has not featured competitively for Chelsea since the end of 2023. "Sam Kerr will be in the squad," Bompastor said on Thursday. "She will be involved in the game. We don't know yet if she will start or not. She's in the squad and in a good place. "She's been training well and physically in a good position. She's one of the players everyone wants to see on the pitch, and for me it's nice to have her leadership and experience. "At the same time, she's been away from the pitch for a long time so we have to be patient. It's normal not to be at the best level yet. Hopefully soon. It's a good step for us that she's in the squad."

Title: Bompastor reveals Bronze is 'weeks away' from return
Content: Sonia Bompastor speaking about the return of Lucy Bronze following this summer's England exploits: "It's difficult to put a timeframe on Lucy's return but she's doing well. She's in a good place mentally and physically. "Hopefully she will come back soon, but I think she's still a few weeks away from a full return on the pitch."

Title: Bompastor: Ramirez a big loss
Content: Sonia Bompastor on losing Mayra Ramirez to injury on the eve of the new season: "It's sad for everyone, first of all for her. She has had successful surgery, which is positive, but she's a really important player for us so it's sad. "You never want to be in that situation, but it happens. As a staff, we have to give her a speedy recovery. She's a big loss for us."

Title: Bompastor: Chelsea 'open' if there is opportunity to strengthen
Content: Chelsea boss Sonia Bompastor speaking about the prospect of signing young American forward Alyssia Thompson: "There is always speculation on the transfer window. For me, the most important, from the beginning of the week, I said that I want to focus on the game. And on my players, that's the correct thing to do. We are facing a big opponent, it's a big opening game, so all of my focus is on that. "It's so important to have quality and talent in the squad when you want to achieve success. It's also important for us to have depth, because we want to compete in all four competitions we play in. That's crucial. "If there are some opportunities we will be open to that, but for now, I have to focus on the game. "People get excited by great players. It's not just one player. When you see players with talent, who can create, you enjoy that. This is what we want in the women's game more and more."

Title: Liverpool sign Szymczak
Content: Liverpool have signed midfielder Emilia Szymczak on loan from Barcelona. The Poland international is the club's second signing on Deadline Day after Beata Olsson joined on a permanent deal. She told the club's official website: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs amazing to be here. This is a big club and I‚Äôm so happy to be a part of it. ‚ÄúI just felt Liverpool has a bright future and I know the WSL and this league is so strong, and I know I can develop more as a player here and try, and the club can offer me the best.‚Äù

Title: London City have dominated the window - PSG star Geyoro next?
Content: Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui: "London City Lionesses have dominated the market. Look at the look at experience they‚Äôve brought in. "A Euros winner in Nikita Parris, a Champions League winner, Daniella van de Donk, and another Champions League winner in Jana Fernandez. "And yet, the biggest deal of the lot may well happen today, because London City Lionesses are in talks with Paris Saint-Germain, Captain Grace Geyoro. "She is a superstar player in France. Arguably the biggest player in France. "It will cost a lot of money. She's got three years left on her current contract at PSG, who do not want to sell. "It will be a big money move for London City Lionesses, as we've seen, they're not afraid to splash the cash. "But leaving the biggest signing to last, is a big move. It's a baller move, this late in the window. "London City Lionesses are trying to prove they are not just here to make up the numbers. "They want to make a big push on the WSL this season. Grace Geyoro, in talks. "She wants the move PSG, don't want to sell it unless they get big, big money."

Title: Aston Villa meet UEFA's requirements
Content: UEFA have confirmed that Aston Villa have met the transfer requirements imposed upon them after being fined earlier this year. Villa were fined ¬£9.5m in July for failing to comply with UEFA rules which allows clubs to lose no more than ¬£60m over a three-year period and not spend more than 80% of the club‚Äôs revenue on wages - a further ¬£12.9m fine was conditional of compliance. Part of the requirement was for Villa to have a positive transfer balance by the end of the summer window, which was largely achieved by selling Jacob Ramsey to Newcastle for ¬£39m. Villa could have been prevented from registered new players for the Europa League this season had they not met UEFA‚Äôs stipulations but summer signings Harvey Elliott, Jadon Sancho, Victor Lindelof, Evan Guessand and Marco Bizot were all included in the squad submitted yesterday. UEFA have said today ‚ÄúAston Villa had a transfer restriction included in their settlement. The List A submitted to UEFA fully complies with all related conditions.‚Äù Villa, who reached the quarter finals of the Champions League last season, are playing in Europe for a third successive season and start their Europa League campaign against Bologna on September 25th.

Title: London City Lionesses snap up Barca's Corrales
Content: London City Lionesses have completed the signing of Lucia Corrales from Barcelona. The Spain left-back/winger has signed a four-year deal. London City have paid a fee of around ¬£430,000 for the 19-year old.

Title: Chelsea pursuit of Thompson could go down to the wire
Content: Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui: "Chelsea want to sign Alyssa Thompson. She is a whirlwind winger, a fantastic player with the US. "She made her US debut at the age of 17. She's now 20 years of age, seen as one of the brightest talents in world football. "She wants to make the move to Chelsea now, she is she got a flight late last night from LA to come over to London to try and finalise the deal. "The problem is Chelsea and the NWSL and Angel City, her club, they're all still in discussions about trying to get this deal. "Our sources are telling me conflicting things. One source is telling me this will be a world record fee. "Another one is telling me it won't necessarily be a world record, but it will be a million pounds plus. The player wants to move. "Chelsea want the move because Lauren James is injured, and they confirmed on Wednesday, an injury to Mayra Ramirez as well. "So up front and on the wide areas, they are a little lighter than they want to be going into the new season. "That's why they're pursuit of Thompson has ramped up in the last few days. "Chelsea wants to get this deal done. It might go late, though."

Title: WSL2 side Birmingham sign Bance on loan from Brighton
Content: WSL2 side Birmingham have signed midfielder Libby Bance on a season-long loan from Brighton. The 23-year-old replaces Emily van Egmond, who joined Leicester from Birmingham earlier today.

Title: Why have the Manchester clubs done business for Clinton and Park?
Content: Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui: "Grace Clinton has been Manchester City‚Äôs biggest target all summer. They wanted to try and get a deal done before the Euros, but it all went quiet. "But obviously, towards the end of the window, that box-to-box midfielder that Manchester City have wanted all window, and that being Grace Clinton, they ramped it up again. "Manchester United said, well, actually fine, maybe because she's in the last year of a contract. We don't want to repeat the mistakes of Alessia Russo, Mary Earps, and Ona Batlle in the past. There is a fee that we could do business, but we want Jess Park. "And now Park has completed her medical and agreed a long-term contract with Manchester United. "It's interesting, isn't it, because of the women's game, we've seen players move between the Manchester clubs in the past. "Ella Toone left Manchester City when she was a youngster to go to Manchester United, and you had obviously Alex Greenwood, who's obviously still at Manchester City. She‚Äôs played for all four of the North West clubs. "So it's not as controversial, but as the rivalry gets bigger, remember, this is the team that finished third and fourth, that competed potentially for the last Champions League spot this season. They're doing business. It's an interesting one, but it's interesting, I think suits both parties."

Title: Free agent Brownhill agrees to join Saudi side Al Shabab after Burnley exit
Content: Exclusive from Sky Sports News' James Savundra: Free agent Josh Brownhill has agreed to join Saudi Pro League club Al Shabab. The former Burnley midfielder is set to sign a deal which will see him earn more than ¬£ 100,000 per week. Brownhill is due to travel to Saudi Arabia tomorrow to conduct a medical and wrap up the deal. The 29-year-old rejected a fresh contract offer from Burnley and held talks with a number of Premier League clubs - including Wolves. Brownhill was heavily sought after this summer, having fired Burnley back to the Premier League with 18 goals and six assists from midfield.

Title: Leicester sign Van Egmond from Birmingham
Content: Leicester have signed midfielder Emily van Egmond from Birmingham in a permanent transfer on WSL Deadline Day. The 32-year-old has signed a two-year contract at the King Power Stadium, with the club holding an additional one-year option. The Australia international told Foxes Hub: ‚ÄúI'll bring my experience to the club and hopefully help the team win games. "I want to show my mentality and show what it takes to win games in this league. "I've been involved in the game for a number of years now and I'm excited to see what we can do together."

Title: Olsson joins Liverpool
Content: Liverpool have signed Swedish striker Beata Olsson. The 24-year old has joined from Kristianstads DFF and is the first signing for new head coach Gareth Taylor. This is such an historic football club and the best league in the world and I think it‚Äôs a great step for me and I‚Äôm so excited to be here. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve always wanted to play in England and to play for a club like Liverpool is just a dream. Title: Parish pulled plug on Guehi's Liverpool deal at 4pm on Deadline Day
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol: Crystal Palace chairman Steve Parish made the decision to pull the plug on Marc Guehi‚Äôs ¬£35m transfer to Liverpool at 4pm on Deadline Day because Palace could not sign a replacement. Parish showed respect for his captain by explaining why he made the call in face-to-face talks with Guehi and his family later in the evening, after the window closed at 7pm.

Title: Spurs made a late enquiry for Palace striker Mateta before window closed
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol: Eberechi Eze and Marc Guehi were not the only Crystal Palace players who were in demand this summer. Palace did well to keep players such as Jean-Philippe Mateta and Daniel Munoz, who attracted a lot of interest from rival clubs before the window closed on Monday. Palace turned down bids worth up to ¬£50m for Mateta from Champions League clubs earlier in the summer. There was also a late enquiry - but no bid - from Tottenham Hotspur before they signed Randal Kolo Muani on loan from Paris Saint-Germain on Deadline Day. Atalanta, AC Milan, Juventus and several Premier League clubs were also linked with moves for Mateta. Palace signed Mateta in January 2021 from Mainz, initially on loan, in a deal worth about ¬£15m. He has gone on to establish himself as one of the best No. 9s in the Premier League, and his goals have helped Palace win the FA Cup and the Community Shield and qualify for Europe for the first time. The 28-year-old has two years left on his contract.

Title: Newcastle appoint Hopkinson as new CEO
Content: Newcastle have appointed David Hopkinson as the club's new Chief Executive Officer. Hopkinson replaces the outgoing Darren Eales, who is stepping down from the role this month due to health reasons. Eales announced his exit a year ago, but he will now conduct a comprehensive handover to Hopkinson before ending his three-year stay at St James' Park. Hopkinson joins the Magpies after serving as President and Chief Operating Officer at Madison Square Garden, where he led the business operations of the NBA team - the New York Knicks - and the NHL team - the New York Rangers. Hopkinson said: "I am incredibly honoured to join Newcastle United at such an exciting time in the club's history. "This club represents something truly special. It has extraordinary history and heritage, incredibly passionate supporters, and ownership, players and staff who are committed to excellence. "Having worked with iconic teams across different countries, I understand what it takes to build sustainable success at the highest levels of global sport. "I greatly admire what has been achieved by the club so far, and I am excited and motivated by what is ahead as we strive to position Newcastle United among the world's elite clubs."

Title: WSL Deadline Day latest as Clinton and Park close in on moves
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui: A midfielder swap in Manchester is moving closer, with Grace Clinton set to join Man City from Man Utd while Jess Park will move the other way in separate deals. Park has agreed her contract at Man Utd and has completed her medical, with the deal close to completion. Clinton is to have her Man City medical today and complete her move before tonight's 11pm deadline. There could be a ¬£1m plus transfer on WSL Deadline Day with Chelsea in discussions with US side Angel City over signing Alyssa Thompson. The USA forward flew to London last night, and she wants to complete the move. The two clubs have been in discussions for some time about the fee. Sources are split over whether it will be a new world record women's transfer fee. Meanwhile, London City Lionesses arein talks with PSG about signing midfielder Grace Geyoro. The France international is keen on moving to the WSL but has three years left on her contract, and the fee is expected to be a large one for the 28-year-old. Sky Sports

Title: Walti leaves Arsenal to join Juventus
Content: Lia Walti has ended her seven-year stay at Arsenal to join Juventus on a permanent transfer. Earlier today, Walti had announced her Gunners exit and the midfielder's move to Italy has now been confirmed. The Switzerland international joined from German side Turbine Potsdam in July 2018, and went on to make 183 appearances for Arsenal, winning the WSL, two League Cups and the Champions League. Arsenal Director of Women‚Äôs Football, Clare Wheatley, said: ‚ÄúLia has been an important part of our recent history at Arsenal. "One of the most talented midfielders of her generation, Lia has brought joy to our supporters and worn our jersey with class. "We wish Lia every success after her seven special years with us, and she will always be welcome back in north London."

Title: Salah: Elliott will 'do big things' at Aston Villa
Content: Liverpool star Mohamed Salah believes Harvey Elliott will "do big things" at his new club Aston Villa after he left the Reds on Deadline Day. Villa secured the signing of Elliott on an initial loan deal with a ¬£35m obligation to make the move permanent. Liverpool included both a buy-back clause and a sell-on clause in the deal. The Japan international had two years left on her previous deal, but has penned a two-year contract extension. The 28-year-old has made 95 appearances in all competitions since joining from West Ham in 2022. Hasegawa said: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm very happy to have signed my contract extension, I‚Äôm so excited. ‚ÄúI really want to win the title at this club and there are players I want to play with. This is one of the biggest reasons [why I wanted] to stay here. ‚ÄúI think the new things always have a good impact on the team, so the new manager and new players are so good, and it makes me have to work hard.‚Äù Manchester City Women Director of Football, Therese Sjogran, added: ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs one of the world‚Äôs best in her position and will be a key part of our quest to compete with the world‚Äôs best on a regular basis. ‚ÄúYui deserves all the respect and recognition that comes her way, and we can‚Äôt wait to see what the future holds with her at the Joie.‚Äù

Title: UEFA confirm Chelsea have balanced books to comply with financial rules
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol: UEFA have confirmed Chelsea successfully balanced their transfer spending this summer to comply with the terms of a settlement agreement for breaking financial rules. Chelsea were fined ¬£26.9m (‚Ç¨31m) in July for breaking UEFA‚Äôs football earnings and squad cost ratio rules. As part of a settlement agreement, Chelsea could only register new signings for their Champions League squad if their transfer fees were offset by selling players who were in their Conference League squad last season. The departures of players such as Noni Madueke, Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall, Christopher Nkunku and Nicolas Jackson means Chelsea have been able to include new signings Liam Delap, Joao Pedro, Alejandro Garnacho, Jamie Gittens and Jorrel Hato in their squad for the league phase of the Champions League. The Blues made a record ¬£314m from selling 23 players this summer. They spent ¬£296m on new signings to end the transfer window with a profit of ¬£18m. UEFA say they checked Chelsea‚Äôs Champions League squad to make sure it complied with their requirements: ‚ÄúThe squad list submitted fulfilled the criteria of the settlement agreement and it was therefore already reviewed and approved before publication on UEFA's website.‚Äù Chelsea are playing Bayern Munich, Benfica, Ajax, Qarabag, Barcelona, Atalanta, Pafos and Napoli in the league phase of the Champions League. Their first game is in Munich on September 17.

Title: Walti announces Arsenal exit
Content: Lia Walti has announced her Arsenal exit on WSL Deadline Day. The 32-year-old will leave the Gunners after seven years, having made 183 appearances for the club It is rumoured that the Switzerland international is set for a move to Juventus before the transfer window closes, but this has not yet been confirmed by either club.

Title: Mead to stay at Arsenal amid London City Lionesses interest
Content: Sky Sports News understands that Beth Mead will be staying at Arsenal to fight for her place despite a significant offer from London City Lionesses earlier in the transfer window. Ahead of their debut WSL campaign following promotion last season, London City Lionesses lined up an ambitious move for Mead, a member of England's Euro 2025-winning squad. Mead, who also helped Arsenal win the Women's Champions League last season, is considered a really important part of Renee Slegers' squad. The 30-year-old has been at Arsenal since 2017, scoring 78 goals in 225 games. She has netted 37 times in 74 appearances for England, also winning Euro 2022 and being named player of the tournament after winning the Golden Boot.

Title: 'Man Utd failed in late Gallagher loan move'

Title: Brighton sign Tsunoda on WSL Deadline Day

The 20-year-old, who has played more than 40 games for Urawa since her debut in 2022, joins on WSL Deadline Day. Brighton boss Dario Vidosic said: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre delighted to bring Fuka to the club. FIFA: Record high transfer numbers in summer window
Content: FIFA have said there were a record high number of transfers in the 2025 summer window, in data released today by the world governing body. In the men's game, almost 12,000 international transfers were concluded. Spending on transfer fees rose to a record $9.76 billion (¬£7.26m) - that's an increase of more than 50 per cent on the same period last year. As previously reported, English football was by far the highest spender both in terms of players acquired and money spent. According to FIFA's records, 535 players were bought by English clubs during the summer window, with Portugal second globally on 479 incomings and Brazil third with 425. Women's football experienced the biggest growth both domestically and around the world, with spending up around 80 per cent on 2024. Germany, England and the USA saw the most incoming transfers completed during the summer window.

Title: I'm getting better every day at Man Utd
Content: New Man Utd striker Benjamin Sesko says he is getting better every day at his new club, adding that the level is 'much higher' in England. He arrived from RB Leipzig this summer and has featured in all three Premier League games so far. Speaking to the media at a meet and greet with fans while on international duty with Slovenia, he said: "The level of the matches is certainly much higher, the players and teammates are also at a higher level. ‚ÄúAfter all, English football is at the highest level in the world of football. ‚ÄúBut I am very much looking forward to the coming period, also because I am getting better and faster in every training session, and I am also progressing in my football mentality every day.‚Äù

Donnarumma: I'm joining best team in the world
Content: New Manchester City goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma says he is "excited" to join the "best in the world", after leaving PSG on deadline day. Speaking ahead of Italy's World Cup qualifiers, Donnarumma said: "I couldn't wait to go to City, they strongly wanted me, the manager wanted me and this made me feel very proud. "To be wanted by a team I believe to be the best in the world, you can't be but proud for the work I have done. I still need to work hard, but I am happy and excited. On leaving PSG, he added: "I've always had a good relationship with the manager (Luis Enrique). I appreciated him being so direct with me when we started the training camp. Not sure if I'm disappointed, everyone chooses what they believe to be best. It's right for a manager to make his choices, to have that power. "My goal is to win as much with possible, it's not easy, there's work to do. We want to win as much as possible with Man City and with the Italian national team. "No, I don't think so (to have problems with using the feet). For what I've accomplished from when I started playing in Serie A at age 16. There can always be mistakes, there will always be, but I think I've accomplished great things. Of this I'm certain."

Title: DOF Giles: Wissa's public spat with Brentford 'not ideal'
Content: Brentford director of football Phil Giles has admitted Yoane Wissa's public transfer saga before his eventual deadline day move to Newcastle was 'not ideal' - but insisted that "in many ways" the summer window had been no trickier than any other he has dealt with. Wissa was not involved in any of the Bees' first four games after refusing to train with his team-mates amid ongoing interest from the Magpies, before he eventually released a public demand to leave the club in the final days of the window - eventually getting his wish. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been an interesting last few days and in fact, an interesting last few weeks,‚Äù Giles told Brentford's official website. "The big story is selling Yoane Wissa. He was a fantastic player for us, started off playing wide and evolved to take on the No 9 position and had a brilliant season last year. ‚ÄúHe was a really good, infectious character who was positive around the players and the fans. I personally liked him a lot as well, so there‚Äôs nothing but positive things to say about his performances on the pitch for us. ‚ÄúTransfers are always complicated. There‚Äôs always a little bit of emotion, friction and dialogue. That normally stays in house but obviously this one spilled out. It‚Äôs not the only one this summer that has spilled out a little bit more into the public domain which is, from my point of view, not ideal. ‚ÄúYou have got to take the emotions out of it and got to ultimately make the decisions for the club. Every decision I make or we make collectively during a transfer window will strip all of the emotion out of it and focus purely on what is the right decision in this moment in time for the club overall. "To some extent, it‚Äôs been no more difficult than many other transfer windows personally. ‚ÄúIt maybe just slipped out publicly a little bit more this time than normal, so people got a bit more insight into how things tend to play out."

Title: How Newcastle beat the clock to sign Wissa on Deadline day
Content: Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: Yoane Wissa‚Äôs Deadline Day move to Newcastle was completed with under 30 seconds to spare. Wissa had failed to sign one of the forms, and it was left to one of his representatives to sprint through Newcastle's training ground to find the striker and get him to hurriedly sign the document with a couple of minutes of the deal sheet extension period left. Eventually, the signing was ratified at 8.59pm, just under two hours after the initial 7pm transfer deadline. Wissa had driven up to Newcastle from London through the night on Sunday to be in position to undergo a medical and formalise his transfer. And the travelling doesn't stop now for the striker. He is now en route to join up with his DR Congo international teammates ahead of their World Cup qualifier away to South Sudan on Friday.

Title: Gundogan speaks ahead of impending Galatasaray move
Content: Ilkay Gundogan is on the brink of a move to Turkish giant Galatasaray from Manchester City. The 34-year-old midfielder brings an end to a second spell at City after returning to the club last summer from Barcelona. Speaking at the airport ahead of a deal being formally announced, Gundogan said: "I'm very happy. It's a proud day for me and my family. We're very excited. We're very happy to be here. Hopefully, we'll adapt to the team quickly, meet my teammates and play some fun football." "There were transfer talks, but I wasn't keen on anything. Talks with Galatasaray started in May or June. There were other issues. They sorted out Osimhen and Sane. We had to wait a bit, but thankfully, we'll make all the signings on the last day and become part of the Galatasaray family." "Sane and I are good friends. We play well together. I met with Coach Okan two days ago. After that, everything moved very quickly. I'm looking forward to working with him. I'm very happy." "It's a very proud day. We've returned home. We're very happy about that. It's a great pride to be a part of the Galatasaray community. We've reunited. I'm looking forward to the moment I put on that jersey and step into the stadium."

Content: Jamie Carragher has praised the signing of Gianluigi Donnarumma for Manchester City. City completed a ¬£26m deal to sign the Italy international on Tuesday, with Ederson being sold to Fenerbahce prior to his arrival. Carragher said: "He‚Äôs a great goalkeeper, a great addition to the Premier League. I think the standard of goalkeeping over the past few years hasn‚Äôt been as high as it has been in the past. "This is a guy who we unfortunately remembered from how good he was at the European Championships and winning Italy the trophy in 2021. "Last season, with the Champions League, his performances against Liverpool were fantastic. But in his time at PSG, it hasn‚Äôt gone as he would have liked because there was a lot of criticism, particularly early on, for his actual goalkeeping. "I don‚Äôt think Luis Enrique was ever a fan of how he was with his feet. "Yes, we know Pep Guardiola wants that for all of his goalkeepers but it‚Äôs very difficult to find somebody who is fantastic with his feet and is also a fantastic goalkeeper. This guy was the best option out there for Guardiola. "With Ederson leaving, they did have to bring in a goalkeeper. James Trafford has been given the nod in the first two games, he was fantastic for Burnley last season. "But if you‚Äôre Pep Guardiola and Man City, you‚Äôre probably thinking about winning the Premier League and the Champions League and right now, Trafford is not quite ready for that. Donnarumma is a Champions League winner."

Can Martinez be reintegrated at Villa?
Content: Sky Sports' Patrick Rowe: Just under four months ago, Emiliano Martinez walked off the Villa Park pitch with tears in his eyes. At the time, supporters were as upset as he looked. That support has now turned to anger. Martinez was absent from the match-day squad for the 3-0 loss to Crystal Palace recently. "We need the players focused and 100 per cent. He wasn't," said Unai Emery after the game. A move to Manchester United didn't materialise but the intention was clear. From Villan, to villain. Martinez has seemingly tarnished his club legend status within 48 hours and Villa will now have to navigate a difficult reintegration to the squad for him, with an exit looking unlikely. It's not impossible. Jhon Duran showed there is a pathway to forgiveness with the Villa supporters after going public with his desire to join West Ham last summer on social media. So, Villa fans, do you want Martinez back in the starting line-up for the game against Jack Grealish's Everton after the international break?

Title: 'Villa happy to keep Martinez'
Content: Aston Villa are happy to keep Emiliano Martinez at the club for this season with no exit expected, according to Fabrizio Romano. The Argentina international wanted the move but Ruben Amorim's side opted to sign Senne Lammens in an ¬£18.2m deal from Royal Antwerp. The club viewed him as the right choice. Villa posted a birthday message for Martinez, who turns 33 today, with several fans responding to the post. "He should leave," one supporter wrote. Martinez is reportedly not keen on a move to the Turkish league and is prepared to stay at the club. The Turkish window closes on September 11.

Title: Marseille sign O'Riley on loan - but he still has Brighton future

Why Wilson's move to Leeds fell through
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Zinny Boswell: Fulham pulled the plug on Harry Wilson's Deadline Day move to Leeds at the very last minute, Sky Sports News understands. Fulham insist they were clear that Wilson was not for sale, while Leeds feel they were encouraged to increase their offer for the Wales international on Deadline Day. Leeds were first made aware of Wilson's potential availability over the weekend as Fulham pursued the signings of Kevin and Samuel Chukwueze. Wilson was keen on the move as his opportunities were already limited at Fulham and both players will be directly competing with him for minutes, only decreasing his chances of playing. Although there is frustration over missing out on Wilson, Leeds are understood to be very happy with their business this summer. The priority for the window was strengthening the spine of Daniel Farke's team for the Premier League return - and they managed to do that with plenty of time to spare by bringing in the likes of Anton Stach, Jaka Bijol and Lucas Perri. Leeds have backed Farke to the tune of more than ¬£100m this summer with 10 new additions.

Content: Sky Sports News chief reporter Kaveh Solhekol: "We've heard a lot about player power, this was a case of manager power. He's already lost Eberechi Eze, and made it very publicly clear that they could not afford to lose Marc Guehi. "Contrast that with what Steve Parish has been saying on TV, that Guehi can't leave on a free transfer next summer, that he either signs a new contract - which he wasn't going to do - or is sold. "There was some tension between the chairman and his manager, and in the end the manager has a very close bond with Guehi and said to the player, whose player has been exemplary, that he wanted to keep him for one more year because they could have more success together."

Title: Explained: How Guehi‚Äôs move to Liverpool collapsed!

Title: Why did Guehi deal fall through?
Content: Sky Sports News understands Liverpool's proposed signing of Marc Guehi fell through after Crystal Palace withdrew from the deal late on - having missed out on the preferred replacement they had hoped to sign, Igor Julio. As we reported earlier on Monday, Palace initially accepted Liverpool‚Äôs ¬£35 million offer and granted permission for a medical to proceed. Liverpool submitted a deal sheet to the Premier League before the 7pm deadline, which would have allowed them to complete a move for the 25-year-old by 9pm. Brighton's Igor Julio took a medical with Palace but decided to pursue a move to West Ham, before, Palace informed Liverpool that they were withdrawing from the deal. Eagles boss Oliver Glanser's insistence on not wanting to lose his captain played a key role in the decision. This is why, despite interest from a number of clubs in the Premier League and Europe, Liverpool never wanted to let Joe Gomez leave the club, especially with the Reds hierarchy impressed with the significant contribution they felt he made off the bench in Sunday‚Äôs win over Arsenal.

Title: Guehi's move to Liverpool is OFF

Brighton defender Igor Julio, who was meant to be Guehi's replacement at Selhurst Park, had a medical at the club earlier today before changing his mind and join West Ham instead - although that deal isn't done yet either. That may have scuppered the move. It means Guehi will stay at Crystal Palace, but they may now lose out on ¬£35m if he leaves on a free transfer next summer. Title: Latest EFL deals

Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Danyal Khan at the Manchester United training ground: "Senne Lammens has been in Manchester all afternoon undergoing his medical before putting pen to paper on a five-year contract for ¬£18.2million from Standard Liege. "The initial approach United made just over a week-and-a-half ago clearly demonstrated their serious interest in him. Manchester United have been exploring their options in that position for some time. They considered other goalkeepers, including Emiliano Mart√≠nez, but ultimately decided to go for Lammens. "He is just 23 and has only had one full season as the first-choice goalkeeper in the Belgian league. He is expected to compete for the No 1 spot alongside Andre Onana. "This deal is not expected to go down to the wire, and United are likely to complete it well before the deadline, though official confirmation is still pending. Title: 'Guehi deal hangs in the balance'
Content: Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett: With about half an hour to go before the deadline, Marc Guehi's move to Liverpool hangs in the balance. Sky Sports News has been told by two separate sources that Palace will not cancel the deal at this late stage. The Palace captain has undergone a medical with Liverpool and a deal is in place. There has been no indication to Liverpool that the deal is in doubt. But Palace are yet to bring in a replacement and as things stand appear no closer to doing so. The message from Selhurst Park has consistently been that they would need to bring in a suitable successor for Guehi to go. Palace chairman Steven Parish has gone on record to say Palace may have to sell Guehi if he doesn't sign a contract as he has entered the final year of his deal. Oliver Glasner has said on numerous times over the past week that Guehi is irreplaceable at this late stage of the window and that he has to stay. Palace could in theory still cash in on Guehi in the winter transfer window, but it is unlikely they would be able to generate the ¬£35m fee Liverpool have committed to. If Guehi is sold without an adequate replacement they risk leaving their head coach short ahead of their first season in Europe.

Title: 'Guehi move still possible; But Gomez staying put'
Content: Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor at the Liverpool training ground: "This one has been full of twists as well. What I know is that Liverpool and Crystal Palace have agreed a ¬£35million deal, and Guehi has been given the green light to have his medical. That medical is happening down in London, which Liverpool planned in advance to make sure there were no timing issues with the 7pm deadline. "The sticking point has been Crystal Palace needing a replacement before they let him go. They thought they had that lined up with Igor Julio, but that deal collapsed. Even so, Palace haven‚Äôt told Guehi to abandon the medical or head back, so as far as I can tell, there‚Äôs still a very real chance this transfer goes through. "Meanwhile, Joe Gomez is staying put. AC Milan were interested, and Palace had looked at him as a potential option, but there simply wasn‚Äôt enough time to get a deal done. So Gomez remains a Liverpool player, and the focus now is on getting Guehi‚Äôs signing completed. "If Liverpool manage to finalise it, the club‚Äôs total spending this window will rise to over ¬£480 million, with a net spend north of ¬£250 million and ¬£160 million committed on Deadline Day alone."

Title: 'Isak move to Liverpool closer than ever'
Content: Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor at the Liverpool training ground: "It‚Äôs now closer than ever. Isak has been pushing hard for the transfer, and late last night the two clubs finally agreed on a fee. "I‚Äôve been at Liverpool‚Äôs training ground all day, and at first the atmosphere was very open. But a while ago, we were asked to stay outside the building, away from the reception area, and remain in the car park. "That‚Äôs always a sign something is happening, and sure enough, Isak was inside completing his media duties, the photographs, the interviews, all of it, ahead of the official announcement. "That announcement will confirm him as a British record signing at ¬£125 million, joining Liverpool from Newcastle United on a six-year contract. His arrival gives the club another attacking option and has allowed Harvey Elliott to move on, with a potential deal lined up at Aston Villa. "This has been one of the big sagas of the transfer window, and Liverpool making a huge deadline-day splash like this feels like the perfect ending to the story."

Having secured the ¬£69 million signing of Nick Woltemade late last week, the Magpies were keen to add a player with proven Premier League experience to bolster their attack. Wissa, who has established himself as a consistent performer in England‚Äôs top flight, fits that profile perfectly. "The drawn-out nature of the deal has mirrored the lengthy saga that saw Alexander Isak leave Newcastle earlier in the summer, a move that required patience from all parties. Now, Newcastle have their man, with only the final confirmation from the club left to make the transfer official. "Wissa is expected to inherit the vacant No 9 shirt, following the departures of both Isak and Callum Wilson earlier this summer. The combined fees for their replacements, Woltemade and Wissa, amount to the exact sum Liverpool paid Newcastle for Isak, underlining the club‚Äôs strategic reinvestment in their attacking options."

Title: Why are Liverpool able to spend so much this summer?
Content: Former Aston Villa chief executive Christian Purslow: "It‚Äôs absolutely fascinating. For most of their [the Fenway Sports Group] time in charge, which is now over 15 years, they‚Äôve run a balanced transfer budget ‚Äì outs paying for ins. "They‚Äôve done it successfully and have been competitive. "But it‚Äôs fair to say we‚Äôre seeing a complete change of strategic approach from Fenway now. They‚Äôre making massive net investment and I think the question is why? "My suspicion is two things. They‚Äôre looking at the competitive position for the first time in many years and they see a genuine opportunity to really dominate British and European football in a way that perhaps hasn‚Äôt been true over the last few years. "The second element is the financial rules. These are heaven-made for a club like Liverpool. "They have the most superb sponsorship revenue in football ‚Äì there are household brands around the edge of the pitch every week, massive levels of commercial turnover. "They redeveloped Anfield very successfully, it‚Äôs packed every week, so their revenues are high and the rules favour clubs like that. "I think they‚Äôre sensing the financial rules may be changing. We‚Äôre starting to hear for the first time fans question if the rules are right, and it‚Äôs stopping big clubs from spending money, like Newcastle and Aston Villa. "My sense is Liverpool are making hay while the sun shines, loading up on talent to put themselves in a position where they‚Äôre virtually impregnable. "It‚Äôs brilliant strategic management, terrifying from a football point of view because adding Isak and Guehi to that team makes them nailed-on favourites and other clubs should be fearful and respectful of how they‚Äôre running their club."

Title: Why have Newcastle left it so late on Isak?

"It all depends on whether it works. You can have the best players in the world, but if it doesn‚Äôt gel, you don‚Äôt have the chemistry. When Liverpool were at their best, it was Mane, Salah and Firmino. Firmino would drop off, Salah would make those runs in, and Mane too, there was chemistry. "For me, Firmino wasn‚Äôt a ¬£125m player, but he made it all tick. Unless this new set-up gels, time will tell. Title: Donnarumma In, Ederson Out?
Content: Analysis from Sky Sports News' Sanny Rudravajhala: "Well, what a move this would be for Manchester City. On the surface, bringing in one of the best goalkeepers in the world would be a boost for any club. "At City, though, it raises several questions. We understand it would allow Ederson to move on, with Fenerbah√ße emerging as a strong possibility. But what would this mean for James Trafford? "Learning from Donnarumma would benefit any goalkeeper. At just 26, the Italian already has a decade of first-team experience, and still has many years ahead of him. "Trafford, who returned to City for ¬£31m in the summer, could make his England debut during the international break. However, he has endured a mixed start, with costly mistakes in the defeat to Spurs and in the loss at Brighton on Sunday. "Ederson, now in his ninth season at the club, looks likely to leave. But how would Donnarumma fit into Pep Guardiola‚Äôs system? We saw with Joe Hart‚Äôs replacement by Claudio Bravo that Guardiola prefers ball-playing goalkeepers. Donnarumma doesn‚Äôt quite fit that mould. He has also faced criticism for struggling with crosses and set pieces. On those fronts, could Trafford be the better option? Still, it would be hard for City to turn down the chance to sign a Champions League winner, no matter what the repercussions might be."

Title: Neville: Goalkeeper a priority for United
Content: Speaking on his Sky Sports podcast, Gary Neville says Man Utd need to sign a new goalkeeper. United are linked with a deadline day move for Aston Villa's Emi Martinez, as well as Royal Antwerp‚Äôs Senne Lammens. "It's just really clear that Manchester United need to bring a goalkeeper in," said Neville. "They weren't brilliant yesterday night but I thought they should have been 2-0 or 3-0 up at half time. They missed some big chances. I thought they were far better than Burnley. "But you know going in at 1-0 that Burnley are going to come and have a period and obviously then you end up with a nervy second half because there's just an anxiousness around United at this moment in time and you know late on it was a big relief. "But a much-needed win doesn't clear the clouds completely. I think they'll come back in a couple of weeks, there are big games against City and against Chelsea coming up in the Premier League. "[Saturday] was a good moment for [Ruben Amorim] in the end but it's bloody hard work winning football matches like that and if your goalkeeper is making mistakes it undermines everything that you do. "That ground is the most unforgiving for goalkeepers. The fans get behind managers, the fans get behind all the players but I've said it before about the Manchester United goalkeeper spot and I'll say it again: the toughest position in English football bar none. "If you give goals away at United and you're a goalkeeper you'll get scrutinized heavily. Centre forward is just behind it. "You have to have a goalkeeper that's got a massive personality and character and it's not about the fact that they won't make a mistake. A Manchester United goalkeeper, a Liverpool goalkeeper, any goalkeeper will make mistakes. It's how you make mistakes, how you recover from them, how you look in your body language and how you look authoritative. "I have to say the two that they've got are not going to feel that so they have to get a goalkeeper in my mind I thought it for a number of months. Every United fan thinks it. "The midfield is equally as big a problem by the way but I think that that's going to be too much of an ask but that's a big problem in midfield as well. There's holes in there like you wouldn't believe."

Title: Emery: I don't know if Martinez will stay

Speaking in his post-match press conference, Emery said: "We will see tomorrow. I cannot tell anything more. I don't know, this is the reality. We will see tomorrow. "It is not helping us. One of the circumstances not helping. "Tomorrow we will see how we close the transfer window.  We have a lot of circumstances that are not helping us be mentally like we were last year. On why Martinez was not involved against the Eagles, Emery added: "He was not available. Tomorrow is the deadline, we will see how we finish. "We need the players focused and 100 per cent. He wasn't." Marco Bizot started in place of Martinez, with Emery then confirming he would like Bizot, a young goalkeeper and Martinez or a replacement in the squad after the window closes. He said: ‚ÄúI want [Marco] Bizot, young players and Emi [Martinez] - or another.‚Äù

Title: Guehi: Palace means a lot to me
Content: Crystal Palace captain Marc Guehi speaking to Sky Sports: "It's a blur! I can't remember much. When you score goals like that, it's down the team performance. The credit should go to the team." On his celebration in front of the fans: "I was tired! So much running. It's important we stay humble, we'll see what the future holds." On what the club means to him: "A lot. I'm a south London boy, grew up in south London and captained the club from a uoung age. They have been fantastic to me and my family. A pleasure to play for this club." On transfer rumours surrounding him: "I'm okay. I guess so. I don't like the limelight. "I'm glad I have a good club and good teammates around me. When you focus on what is important, the football, it makes it a bit easier."

Title: Emery on struggles, Deadline Day and Martinez future
Content: Aston Villa boss Unai Emery speaking to Sky Sports: "Frustrated but we played first half well. We followed the game plan we were expecting and were dominating the match. "We were dominated. We made one mistake, the penalty. "We are sad for our supporters but we have to accept it and be together. "We have started badly but tomorrow is first of September, the finishing of the window." On transfers and Deadline Day: "We need some players. We have to try get balance again, more than just the transfer window. "When we get to this level, to keep it is not easy. But I am confident we can get balance and recover our structure." On Emi Martinez's future: "It is one thing we have to fix. Tomorrow is finishing the window and we are expecting something to improve our squad. Keep calm. "One of the circumstances is Emi Martinez, we will see tomorrow and then we try get the balance and work after the break."

Title: Glasner: We have to keep Guehi

I told the players it was a good start, for a great start we need to win here and this is what the players did. "But it‚Äôs just a start. The first step is made. And for playing a successful season we need Marc. "It‚Äôs not possible within one day to find the replacement who can play immediately in the Premier League, knows how‚Ä¶ when you see our defensive set-up, this is our foundation, everybody knows exactly what he has to do, everybody can rely on each other. Marc isn‚Äôt a small part in this, he‚Äôs our captain. "We have to keep him. I told this to the chairman. It‚Äôs not for me. "I like Marc, he‚Äôs such a professional player, and is such a nice guy but it‚Äôs for the future of Crystal Palace, it‚Äôs for playing a successful season. We have to keep him. We‚Äôve talked about this situation and said, OK, we‚Äôre just selling Marc if we have the right replacement. If we don‚Äôt have the right replacement for me it‚Äôs clear to keep him."

Title: Newcastle target Wissa releases bombshell statement as he demands Brentford exit
Content: Newcastle target Yoane Wissa has released a bombshell statement in which he has accused Brentford of "unduly standing in his way" of a move and wants to leave the club before tomorrow's 7pm deadline. He said on Instagram: ‚ÄúI have stayed silent for much of the summer, but with just hours remaining of the transfer window I feel compelled make it clear that I want to leave Brentford. I believe the club are unduly standing in my way despite a series of fair offers throughout the summer. ‚ÄúEarlier this summer, I held open discussions with the club‚Äôs senior management, including key directors and the new head coach. I made clear my intention to explore a new challenge. ‚ÄúDuring these conversations, it was confirmed to me and my representatives that the club would not stand in my way if a reasonable offer was received. This was also put in writing. ‚ÄúBased on this understanding, I sought to find a new club, keeping Brentford informed with full transparency at every step. ‚ÄúI received a formal offer from another Premier League club and communicated I wanted to join. I was under the impression, from all my conversations with Brentford, that there was a mutual agreement to part ways. ‚ÄúYet as the window comes to an end, the club has now significantly changed its position, going against what was communicated. This has left me in a difficult and frustrating position. The promise that I could leave this summer has not been fulfilled. It saddens me to have to write that, and I maintain total respect for the club and its fans. ‚ÄúI want to make it clear that I have not acted unprofessionally, nor do I wish to leave Brentford on bad terms. I have been transparent in my position throughout. I have continued to communicate openly with the club and conduct myself in a way that reflects my values as both a footballer and a human being. ‚ÄúI remain hopeful that a fair and reasonable resolution can still be found before the transfer window shuts. ‚ÄúIn the meantime, I must do what I feel is right for my career and family and insist that Brentford honour their promise to let me join a new club and at a fair price. ‚ÄúBeing made to stay beyond this summer will only tarnish four wonderful years at this incredible club and so I ask Brentford‚Äôs owners and directors to now honour their promise to let me leave in the final hours of the window."

Title: Howe looking forward to 'clarity' on squad, but says group is stronger
Content: Eddie Howe says he is looking forward to 'clarity' on what his squad looks like ahead of the transfer deadline, but adds is group is stronger than at this time last year. There has been plenty of speculation around his team that remains unresolved, especially on the future of Alexander Isak. Howe said he was not party to the talks on the striker so did not know how the situation would pan out. Speaking about the deadline, Howe told Sky Sports: "We're really looking forward to that clarity in terms of what our squad looks like. "Once we have that, we'll move forward and I'm sure we can do really well this year." When asked if he was hoping for new arrivals, Howe added: "I'm not sure on that really. Being the manager, you're always hopeful. "You think that you can add maybe one more that can make a difference, but there's no guarantees on that. We'll keep working to the end of the window. "We're really pleased with what we've done so far. I genuinely feel we're a lot stronger squad-wise than we were last year. "We've had an issue at the top end of the pitch [at the start of this season] so fingers crossed we might be able to do some more." Newcastle announced new signing Nick Woltemade before Saturday's draw at Leeds, and Howe gave an insight into his striker. "He's a really good technician. His size will be a talking point because he's obviously a big presence, but he's not really a target man, although he can head the ball. "It's his creativity around the box. It's his link play. He dribbles with the ball really well for someone so big and he's got real creativity around the box. He will find passes that not many other players can see. "He can add a dimension that we currently don't have and it will lift confidence because when you feel you have goalscorers in your team,  the general level of your whole squad goes up. "You've got to have lots of strings to your bow to be successful in England and he has them. I'm really looking forward to seeing him play in our team."

Title: Chelsea sign Garnacho from Man Utd
Content: Chelsea have signed winger Alejandro Garnacho in a ¬£40m transfer from Manchester United. They have now spent nearly ¬£300m on nine new arrivals this summer - but have a positive net spend as things stand after recouping more than ¬£314m in sales. Garnacho, 21, has signed a long-term deal at Chelsea and says he is happy to be joining "the best team in the world". Sky Sports A compromise over Garnacho's valuation had to be reached as United valued him at ¬£50m, which was more than Chelsea were prepared to pay. United negotiated the fee up from an initial Chelsea offer of ¬£25m and are understood to feel it is a good, pragmatic deal, delivering their largest sale fee for five years. They also believe it is a good solution for the player, who has been pushing strongly to leave. The deal, which includes a 10 per cent sell-on fee, represents the fourth-largest sale in United's history after those of Cristiano Ronaldo, Romelu Lukaku and Angel Di Maria - and the club's largest sale of an academy graduate.

Title: Liverpool make ¬£35m bid for Guehi

Palace would be willing to accept a deal of ¬£35m plus ¬£5m in add ons, but Liverpool have currently offered a 10% sell on clause as well as the initial fee. However, the south London club do not want to sell the defender until they have a replacement. Sky Sports News understands Liverpool's Joe Gomez has become a part of discussions between the clubs. Palace have an interest in Gomez - and it would be a separate deal - but how keen he is on the move to Selhurst Park at this stage is unknown. Liverpool would not allow Gomez to leave on loan and they are also reluctant to sell a player who offers so much versatility in their backline. Gomez is also on the lists at AC Milan and Tottenham, although Thomas Frank has appeared to cool his interest in signing a new centre-back. Milan appear to be prioritising Manchester City's Manuel Akanji at the moment - another player of interest to Palace and on Spurs' radar. Guehi's future could go right to the wire with Deadline Day approaching on September 1. Palace boss Oliver Glasner has pleaded for the player to stay at the club until his contract expires next summer. Palace could sign more than one new centre-back. Separately from the Guehi situation, they are progressing with a ¬£22.5m deal for Toulouse's 19-year-old Jaydee Canvot.

Title: Selles: Sheffield United future out of my hands

Selles said: ‚ÄúI cannot control the situation. I will expect to go to my house tonight and then tomorrow go to work and then continue as normal. It‚Äôs not in my hands to make a decision. ‚ÄúAnd until the very last moment, I will just do my best and try to do my things. When the situation is not in my control, I don‚Äôt think too much about what is going to happen in the future. Because realistically, I do as much as I can. ‚ÄúAt least if I go out, whether that‚Äôs tomorrow or if it‚Äôs in three years, I will always go out with the feeling that I made the decisions that I want to make. Obviously that includes my mistakes, but my decisions were honest and what I thought was the correct thing to do in every single moment.‚Äù Selles, who previously managed Reading during the Royals‚Äô off-the-field struggles and transfer embargoes, added: ‚ÄúI have been in worse situations and I end up just making the things happen and changing totally around the dynamics. ‚ÄúSo I don‚Äôt have a doubt about it. I‚Äôve been in situations where I haven‚Äôt been paid on time, situations when they get points deductions, situations where we didn‚Äôt know if we would be able to train the next day at the training ground. ‚ÄúAnd the reality is that we turned things around at the moment of connection. Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam, Elliot Cook and Kaveh Solhekol: Chelsea are in talks with Brighton over the loan signing of Facundo Buonanotte. The deal under discussion does not include an option or an obligation to buy. Chelsea now considered the frontrunners for the 20-year-old's signature. There was interest from other Premier League clubs, including Leeds United. Brighton have insisted that they only want to loan the Argentina international to a club in England. Sky Germany reported earlier in the window that Borussia Dortmund had made a loan offer for the player. This would be just the latest Brighton player - or member of staff - to make the move to Chelsea since Todd Boehly and Clearlake Capital's takeover at Stamford Bridge in 2022.

Title: Frank teases Simons signing ahead of arrival
Content: Thomas Frank teased the imminent arrival of Xavi Simons in his pre-match press conference ahead of Spurs' game with Bournemouth, and said he hopes fans get "good news" by the end of Friday. Simons has completed his Tottenham medical but is yet to be formally announced as their newest arrival, even though Frank's press conference was delayed by an hour with no official reason given. "I can confirm we‚Äôre working very hard to get someone over the line," he said when asked whether Simons had been the reason behind the reschedule. "That I can confirm, but right now I am happy to speak more about Djed Spence and other players in the squad!" When further pressed on whether fans could receive some good news by the start of the weekend, he added: "I hope the fans get good news later today for various reasons. We‚Äôre trying to sign players, and that we will try to do until the end of the window."

Title: Emery: We are very busy
Content: Sky Sports' Adam Bate at Aston Villa's training ground: Unai Emery acknowledged that Aston Villa‚Äôs start to the season has been ‚Äúpoor‚Äù and does not expect it to get easier against a Crystal Palace side that has proven a tricky match-up for his side under Oliver Glasner. The Villa boss is hoping to get some help in the next few days before the transfer window closes, however. ‚ÄúWe are very busy. We are working here, we are active,‚Äù he said. Asked by Sky Sports about the possibility of Marco Asensio returning, he added: ‚ÄúI don't want to speak about some players because we have different options. Of course, you are asking me about Marco Asensio, I was so happy with him [last season] in general.‚Äù

Title: Arteta: Martinelli not leaving Arsenal
Content: Mikel Arteta insists Gabriel Martinelli remains a "super-important" player to Arsenal. Martinelli has been linked with a move away from the club following the additions of Noni Madueke and Eberechi Eze this summer. But when asked if the Brazilian could be sold, Arteta said: "No. I think Gabby has been a super-important player for us and he is going to remain very important. "I'm very happy with what we have."

Title: Who's spent what?
Content: Arsenal leapfrogged Man Utd as the Premier League's top net spenders this summer after signing Eberechi Eze from Crystal Palace last week. At the other end of the scale, Bournemouth are ¬£79m in profit, primarily from selling Illia Zabarnyi, Dean Huijsen, Milos Kerkez and Dango Ouattara.

Title: Roma close to agreeing Tsimikas loan deal
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor: Roma are close to agreeing a loan deal with Liverpool for left-back Kostas Tsimikas. The left-back has been given permission to travel to Rome to undergo a medical. Tsimikas is currently third-choice left-back at Anfield after the signing of Milos Kerkez. He has not featured in any of Liverpool's squads so far this season.

Title: Roma close to agreeing Tsimikas loan deal
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor: Roma are close to agreeing a loan deal with Liverpool for left-back Kostas Tsimikas. The left-back has been given permission to travel to Rome to undergo a medical. Tsimikas is currently third-choice left-back at Anfield after the signing of Milos Kerkez. He has not featured in any of Liverpool's squads so far this season.

Title: Lions complete Taylor signing from West Brom
Content: Millwall have completed the signing of centre-back Caleb Taylor from West Brom. The Lions are signing Taylor after defender Japhet Tanganga was sold to Sheffield United.

Title: Newcastle remain in market for another striker amid Woltemade signing
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: Newcastle are still in the market for another striker ‚Äî and both Jorgen Strand Larsen and Yoane Wissa remain possibilities. The signing of either would allow Alexander Isak to move to Liverpool, but Newcastle are currently fully concentrated on getting ¬£69m Nick Woltemade over the line. Signing only Woltemade would give them a decision to make on Isak, but the ideal situation would be two strikers ‚Äî and they‚Äôre trying hard. Newcastle have had two bids turned down for both Wissa and Strand Larsen.

Title: Ajax sign McConnell on loan from Liverpool
Content: Ajax have confirmed Liverpool midfielder James McConnell has joined on a season-long loan. The 20-year-old will link up with former Liverpool coach John Heitinga, after the Reds were impressed with the plan Ajax put forward for McConnell.

Title: Woltemade completes Newcastle medical
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: Nick Woltemade has completed his Newcastle medical. He is now at St James‚Äô Park finalising his ¬£69m transfer. Sky Sports

Title: Moyes backs Grealish to rediscover form at Everton
Content: David Moyes has backed Jack Grealish to rediscover his best form and fire Everton to a third consecutive victory against Wolves on Saturday. The Man City loanee provided both goals in Everton‚Äôs 2-0 win against Brighton last weekend and also played an hour in the Toffees‚Äô 2-0 Carabao Cup triumph against Mansfield. Moyes said: ‚ÄúHe is a real talent and someone we‚Äôre hoping can get back to the levels he‚Äôs produced before. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs helped us already and I hope we can continue to build on it, get him fitter, stronger and used to playing again.‚Äù

Title: 'He needs to fight for his place' | Amorim responds to Mainoo transfer rumours
Crystal Palace complete Pino signing
Content: Crystal Palace have completed the signing of Yeremy Pino from Villarreal. The 22-year-old has signed a five-year deal in south London for a fee of ¬£21m plus ¬£5m in add-ons. Pino had 45 goal contributions in 175 appearances for Villarreal, as well as three goals in 15 caps for Spain. Chairman Steve Parish told the club's media: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fantastic news that Yeremy ‚Äì an exciting young talent, with already such an impressive record in domestic, European and international football ‚Äì has chosen us as the next step in his career. ‚ÄúWith an exciting season ahead for the club, competing on multiple fronts, he is a player whose talents Palace fans will particularly appreciate ‚Äì and I look forward to seeing him step out at Selhurst Park.‚Äù

Title: Maresca confirms Garnacho Chelsea medical | 'I know he is around here!'
Content: Enzo Maresca confirmed that Alejandro Garnacho is currently at the Chelsea training ground and he expects him to fit into the Blues squad as a winger.

Title: Guardiola: I am happy if squad size stays as it is
Content: Man City manager Pep Guardiola on how he feels about his squad size after previously saying he would like to work with a smaller squad: "I'm not a manager that has complained much here about the squad. "It is what it is because I know the club is doing as best as possible in all terms. "Even when I lose a game, the typical reaction of the manager is blame to the players and so on what has happened. "I proved for many years and last year was the biggest example of that and I am very proud of that because I know my players tried desperately to do well. "I said that I didn't like to have players at home but the reality has been like that for a long time and if it stays as it stays, then I will be more than pleased and I'll handle it day by day."

Title: Maresca 'has no idea' what will happen to Chelsea outcasts
Content: Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca on what happens now with those players who do not secure a move away before Monday: "No idea, to be honest. I don't know. They are not even with us, they are training at different times on different pitches. So I do not have any idea, I do not know. "We will see when the window closes and we decide."

Title: Maresca: Anything can happen in the window
Content: Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca on whether some players would now be leaving following Garnacho's arrival: "You can expect anything, the transfer window is open - anything can happen in and out." Confident with his current squad? "I joined the club one year ago saying I was in love with the squad and the squad is getting better and better. So my feeling is exactly the same."

Title: Maresca: It's quite clear Garnacho's position is a winger
Content: Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca on where he sees Alejandro Garnacho's best position: "I know that he is around here. I don't know exactly where he is. He is a player who it's quite clear his position is a winger and I see him as a winger."

Title: Guardiola refuses to speak on transfers
Content: Man City manager Pep Guardiola when asked about transfers: "Monday is the finish of the transfer window. Next press conference, you can ask me. "Don't ask me about rumours or potential rivals or potential flies." On whether he is happy with his squad: "I always have been."

Title: McCrorie leaves Kilmarnock on loan
Content: Kilmarnock goalkeeper Robby McCrorie has joined Danish side Esbjerg fB on loan until the end of the season. Max Strydek and Eddie Beach were signed by Killie this summer with McCrorie struggling for game time after recovering from a thigh injury suffered while away with Scotland at the end of last season.

Title: Amorim: I want Mainoo to stay
Content: Ruben Amorim has said he wants Kobbie Mainoo to remain at Manchester United to fight for his place in the starting line-up. Sky Sports News reported Mainoo had informed the club of his desire to leave on loan before Deadline Day on September 1. Mainoo started the Carabao Cup tie at Grimsby Town on Wednesday night, but was an unused substitute in both of United‚Äôs Premier League games this season. ‚ÄúI want Kobbie to stay and he needs to fight for his place. We need Kobbie. That is not going to change," he said when asked about the future of Mainoo ahead of facing Burnley tomorrow. ‚ÄúThe players not playing with be disappointed but everyone will have opportunities. You have to fight in the week.‚Äù

Title: Amorim: Sometimes I want to quit
Content: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim has said sometimes he wants to quit his role of head coach at Old Trafford. ‚ÄúIf you are one way and this behaviour, you have things that are good and you have the other side of the coin," he said when asked about the comments he made about change being needed at the club following the defeat to League Two side Grimsby Town in the Carabao Cup. "Sometimes I want to quit, sometimes I want to be here for 20 years. Sometimes I don‚Äôt want to be with my players. I need to improve on that.‚Äù

Title: Spurs delay pre-match press conference - Simons imminent?
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Michael Bridge: Tottenham's press conference will now take place at 2.30pm - a one-hour delay. There's been no official reason given for the schedule being pushed back - it may well be because training has run over. Or, could it be, that they are about to make an announcement...?
