Title: Barca yet to receive Chelsea approach for Fermin Lopez
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Amar Mehta and Kaveh Solhekol: Barcelona are yet to receive any official approach from Chelsea for Fermin Lopez. The 22-year-year old is of interest to Chelsea with less than four days remaining of the transfer window and a player who has been on their radar for a long-time. It is understood they are prepared to approach Barcelona if they gain encouragement from the attacking-midfielder that he wants the move. And a source in Spain has told Sky Sports News that, if Fermin was to request the move and an ‚Äúunrefusable‚Äù offer was made, Barcelona would consider it. It is understood neither of these conditions have been met at this point, and no talks have yet been held with any interested clubs. Chelsea have also been among the clubs to hold an interest in Morgan Rogers this summer.

Title: Glasner confident of more signings this window
Content: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner is confident the club will bring in new players before Monday's deadline. However, he expressed disappointment that the club could not make more signings before the season started, allowing the players more time to integrate into the squad. He said: "Frustration is maybe the wrong word. We had a meeting in March and we were talking about the strategy for the summer. "We knew that Eberechi could leave the club so at the beginning, it was not in our hands but we knew we had to be prepared. "We knew the situation about Marc and we had to be prepared. "We wanted to bring the players in at the beginning of pre-season, to be in a good position of negotiating and to integrate the players. "Now having to integrate four or five players delays being successful. This is the missed opportunities to bring in the players early enough. "Usually when you are busy at the end, you missed something at the beginning. Everywhere is the same. "We know we have to sign a few players. It's a responsibility of Crystal Palace to be competitive in the Premier League, the Conference League and the cup competitions again. "I'm still confident we'll get the right players in."

Title: Leeds advancing in Buonanotte pursuit
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook: Leeds United have advanced in their pursuit of Brighton attacking midfielder Facundo Buonanotte. Brighton have been keen for the 20-year-old to go on loan to an English club to gain more experience after his spell at Leicester last season. Bounanotte fits the profile of player Leeds have been looking for as they try to bolster their creative options in the final third. The Argentina international, who has been attracting interest from Champions League clubs, can play as a No 10 and on the right wing. Buonanotte's departure from Brighton would be a straight loan with no obligation involved in the deal. Sky Germany reported earlier in the window that Dortmund had made a loan offer for the player.

Title: Guehi 'has to' stay at Palace beyond deadline, says Glasner
Content: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner says Marc Guehi will likely not be leaving the club in the current transfer window The Eagles defender is into the final year of his current deal and had been linked with a move away this summer, but that has not materialised. Glasner says there is now no time to find a ready-made replacement for the club captain, adding that Guehi remains committed to the Eagles. Glasner said: "From my side, he has to [still be a Crystal Palace player] because it's not possible at the moment to find a Marc Guehi replacement who can play straight in the Premier League, being a starter, being consistent. "When we see our foundation of success in the last few months, it's our defence... Marc is a crucial part. "Getting the right replacement in now is almost impossible. "He shows in every game that he's focused. If Marc had said 'I want to leave Crystal Palace', it would already have happened weeks ago. "Marc is fully committed to the team, he shows it every third day at the moment... it is my point of view that we need to keep Marc."

Title: Miovski set for Rangers medical
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Sahil Jaidka: Girona striker Bojan Miovski is undergoing a medical ahead of his ¬£4.2m move to Rangers. Once completed, the North Macedonia international is due head to Glasgow to finalise the paperwork on a four-year contract. Sky Sports News revealed on Thursday that the clubs had agreed an initial fee of ¬£2.6m, with ¬£1.6m in add-ons.

Title: West Brom set for Gilchrist signing
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol and Lyall Thomas: West Brom are set to sign Chelsea‚Äôs Alfie Gilchrist in an initial ¬£1.2m deal. Gilchrist is having a medical with Albion today. There are some bonuses agreed in the deal also. The 21-year-old spent last season on loan at Sheffield United, making 32 appearances.

Title: Falkirk land Wilson loan from Swans
Content: Falkirk have signed Kyrell Wilson on a season-long loan from Championship side Swansea City. The 20-year-old spent the second half of last season on loan with National League side Yeovil Town The winger is expected to be in contention for Sunday‚Äôs league fixture away to Aberdeen.

Title: Birmingham make offer for Yang

It‚Äôs understood the Hoops are considering the offer and talks are continuing. Sky Sports News revealed on Wednesday that Birmingham had an approach for the South Korea international. Yang had signalled to the club that he would like to explore a new challenge earlier in the window, amid interest from Norwich City.

Title: Villa in talks for Asensio return
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol, Lyall Thomas and Sky Germany: Aston Villa are understood to be in talks with Paris Saint-Germain for Marco Asensio. The French club want a permanent deal for the Spain international, who only has one year left on his contract. He was on loan at Villa last season and Sky Sports News have already reported Villa have been interested in signing him again. Nicolas Jackson remains another player Villa have an interest in before the deadline.

Title: Ageu becomes Hearts' club-record signing
Content: Hearts have signed midfielder Ageu in what will be a club-record transfer deal. The 23-year-old Brazilian midfield joins from Portuguese top flight side Santa Clara on a four-year contract for an undisclosed fee. He spent last season on loan at Liga Portugal 2 side Alverca, helping the club to promotion. He also earned promotion with Santa Clara in the 2023/24 season.

Title: Could Amorim walk away from Man Utd?
Content: The Guardian reports this morning that Ruben Amorim's tactics and man-management are being questioned by some in the Manchester United dressing room and there is a feeling at the club that the head coach may resign unless results pick up. The report says Amorim's 'stubbornness' to stick with his preferred formation could see him walk away as early as next week. Players also reportedly review his man-management approach as well-meaning but sometimes counter-productive. Director of football Jason Wilcox is said to be aware of these issues and could move to address these.

Title: O'Hara: Amorim is out of his depth‚Ä¶ get Ole at the wheel!
Norwich announce Mattsson signing
Content: Norwich City have signed midfielder Pelle Mattsson from Danish Superliga side Silkeborg. He has signed a three-year deal with the option of a further year, and Sky Sports News understand the deal is worth ¬£3m deal - ¬£2.7m plus ¬£300k in add-ons. Mattsson told the club's media: "When I first heard of the interest from Norwich, I was proud. It's been a long time since the first interest and now we're finally here, I'm just ready. "I can't wait to get going, stepping out onto that pitch and wearing the yellow jersey."

Title: Roma make offer for Chelsea's George
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Adrian Kajumba: Roma have made an offer to sign Chelsea forward Tyrique George. Sky Sports News understands Fulham and Crystal Palace are the top-flight clubs keeping an eye on his situation. Bayern Munich have also shown an interest, but they have explored a loan. Chelsea's preference is to do a permanent deal.

Title: Chelsea signings 'exit dependent' with seven players expected to leave

Their priority up until Thursday was to complete a deal for Alejandro Garnacho. Players expected to leave include Raheem Sterling, Ben Chilwell, Nicolas Jackson, Tyrique George, Axel Disasi, Alfie Gilchrist and David Datro Fofana. The club decided not to make a bid for Xavi Simons and they have other targets. As reported previously, their valuation of the player was ‚Ç¨50m (¬£43.4m) to ‚Ç¨55m (¬£47.7m).

Title: Man Utd yet to find agreement over Lammens

Title: Saints complete Azaz signing
Content: Southampton have signed Finn Azaz from Middlesbrough on a four-year deal. Sky Sports News have previously reported the deal being worth¬£15m - ¬£12m plus ¬£3m in add-ons. Boro signed him from Aston Villa in January 2024 after he excelled on loan at Plymouth. Azaz told the club's media: ‚ÄúIt feels amazing. Obviously it‚Äôs been talked about for a little while, and I‚Äôm really happy to be here. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm really, really excited to prove I can play for a Premier League club. I know we‚Äôre in the Championship now, but we‚Äôre trying to operate at Premier League level to ultimately get promoted, win the league and get back to the Premier League.‚Äù

Title: Forest defender Carmo makes loan move
Content: Nottingham Forest defender David Carmo is joining Real Oviedo on loan. The deal also includes an option to make the deal permanent. The Angola international joined Forest last summer but was spend last season on loan at Olympiakos.

Title: Ipswich sign Nunez from Norwich
Content: Ipswich have signed midfielder Marcelino Nunez from Norwich on a four-year contract. Ipswich will pay an initial ¬£7.5m with a further ¬£2.5m in add-ons. It is the first time in 24 years that a player has moved directly between Norwich and Ipswich. Goalkeeper Andy Marshall was the last to move directly between the clubs. He left Norwich for Ipswich in 2001, with his contract due to expire.

Title: Howe uncertain on Isak future as Slot coy on potential Liverpool bid
Content: Newcastle have opened the door for Liverpool to make a British-record bid for Alexander Isak with their move to bring in Nick Woltemade. However, speaking on Friday, Magpies boss Eddie Howe said he was uncertain on Isak's future, while Liverpool head coach Arne Slot hinted the Reds would continue to look for the right opportunities in the market before Monday's deadline. Asked if Isak would stay at Newcastle, Howe said: "It's difficult for me to give you any clarity. I don't know what the future holds in that respect because I'm not dealing with it myself. "I've got no update from what I spoke about the other day. I'm concentrating on trying to bring players to the club." Slot was equally coy, saying: "If it's true, Newcastle have signed a new No 9 and that's very nice for Eddie because Anthony Gordon is suspended and Isak has not been training. "As always, we try to sign players who can help us. There's no reason, after the first two games, to complain, to think we need more. But if we can strengthen the squad, we will try to do that if it's for the right money and the right player. "Let's see if we do something and if we can, what we can do."

Title: Sancho could still be Man Utd player after deadline
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Adrian Kajumba: Jadon Sancho could still be a Manchester United player when the window closes. A number of clubs are in talks with his representatives over a loan deal. Roma have been pushing hard to sign him, but Sancho wanted to explore other options. A potential move there cannot be totally ruled out. There is interest from Turkey and Saudi Arabia and their windows close on the September 11 and September 10 respectively. United want to do a permanent deal but accept a loan is most likely deal if he is to leave.

Title: Igamane seals Rangers exit after 'injury' controversy as Lille land striker
Content: Hamza Igamane has left Rangers to join Lille in a ¬£10.4m deal. The 22-year-old's departure comes just days after he refused to play for the club in a Scottish Premiership match at St Mirren, claiming he was injured. Two days later, the Morocco international was missing from training - despite scans showing there was no injury - as Rangers prepared for their Champions League play-off second leg away to Club Brugge. Hours later on Tuesday, Rangers confirmed they had accepted a bid from Lille after Igamane's release clause was met. Sky Sports

Title: Celtic in talks for Dolberg
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Celtic are in talks to sign Anderlecht striker Kasper Dolberg. It‚Äôs understood the Hoops explored the conditions of a deal earlier this month and were quoted a price of around ¬£10m. However, the Belgian club are open to negotiation after being knocked out of Europe last night. Sky Sports News revealed last night that Celtic had made the Denmark international their number one striker target before Monday‚Äôs transfer deadline.

Title: Davies pens first pro deal at Man City Women
Content: Mayzee Davies has signed her first professional contract with Man City Women. The 19-year-old joins recent Girls‚Äô Academy graduates Gracie Prior, Lily Murphy and Codie Thomas, who signed their first professional contracts in 2024. The Welsh defender was a regular in first team matchday squads last season and has also earned five senior caps for Wales.

Title: Raso makes Frankfurt switch
Content: Hayley Raso to join Eintracht Frankfurt Women on a permanent basis from Tottenham Hotspur Women. The Australia international spent a season with the club after joining last summer, making 16 appearances across all competitions.

Title: Bid rejected for Boving
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Sturm Graz have rejected a ¬£2.6m bid from Mainz for forward William Boving. The Bundesliga club remain in talks, but face competition from a number of English Championship clubs. Girona are also monitoring the situation.

Title: Wolves also interested in Hackney

West Ham, Fulham and Everton have all shown interest in Hackney this summer ‚Äì but there have been no formal offers yet from them either. Boro feel it is too late in the window to sign an adequate replacement, and they have made a strong start to the campaign. Sky Sports News understands Hackney has made it clear to the club that if a Premier League club comes in, it is his dream to play in the top flight. Boro were believed to be open to selling Hackney earlier in the window, but no Premier League offers materialised. Hackney turned down a potential move to Championship rivals Ipswich earlier in the window. Rangers‚Äô Nico Raskin has also been on Wolves‚Äô radar but the club currently don‚Äôt have space available for a non-homegrown player.

Title: Chelsea make move for Thompson

The 20-year-old has eight goal involvements in her 16 NWSL appearances so far this season. Chelsea begin their latest WSL title defence against Man City on Friday September 5, live on Sky Sports.

Title: Woltemade won't be registered in time for Leeds
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: Nick Woltemade unlikely to be registered in time to face Leeds United tomorrow. He‚Äôs currently having his Newcastle medical ahead of ¬£69m move. Sky Sports

Title: West Ham confirm Fernandes signing

The Hammers will pay an initial fee of ¬£38m plus ¬£4m in add-ons for the 21-year-old, who will be available to face Nottingham Forest on Sunday, live on Sky Sports. Speaking in a statement released by the club, Fernandes said: ‚ÄúI'm very happy to be here. I'm very excited to play for West Ham. I think it's a big step for me. ‚ÄúIt's a big club, a massive club. The project, the stadium, the city, everything. ‚ÄúI want to try to play football, enjoy football, not just run and try to score, but try to play good football. ‚ÄúI think the most important thing is to try to give everything every day.‚Äù Sky Sports

Title: Arsenal pushing to complete Hincapie deal
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Arsenal are still pushing to get a deal done for Bayer Leverkusen defender Piero Hincapie. Sky Sports News understands that, while some progress is being made, there is still work to do. The clubs remain in talks over a loan with an obligation to buy. Hincapie wants the move to the Emirates and personal terms are not expected to be an issue. Leverkusen want Hincapie to stay and are holding out for as much of his release clause of ¬£52m ‚Äì a figure Arsenal are negotiating - as they can. Arsenal‚Äôs pursuit of Hincapie could accelerate Jakob Kiwior‚Äôs move to Porto. A loan plus an obligation worth at least ¬£26m is in place. Arsenal bought Kiwior from Spezia for ¬£20m in January 2023.

Title: Who is Nick Woltemade?
Content: Sky Sports‚Äô Adam Bate: ‚ÄúWent to Stuttgart earlier this month to see Nick Woltemade in action against Bayern Munich in the Franz Beckenbauer Supercup having also seen him this summer in Bratislava in the final of the European Under-21 Championship. Unusual player. ‚ÄúSpoke to legendary Stuttgart strikers Cacau and Jurgen Klinsmann about him and the former Bayern Munich forward Claudio Pizarro for his perspective too. The Bundesliga club were extremely reluctant to let him go to Bayern but it seems that Newcastle have now swooped in." Sky Sports

Title: Millwall reject Parma bid for Ivanovic
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Peter Smith and Rob Dorsett: Millwall have rejected a ¬£7m bid from Parma for striker Mihailo Ivanovic. The 20-year-old forward scored 12 goals across 37 appearances in the Championship last season. He has one assist to his name in three starts so far in the current campaign. Title: How long will Amorim last at Man Utd?
Content: Sky Sports' Paul Merson on The Premier League Show: "I will be shocked if he's still in charge if Man Utd don't beat Burnley. "But they will beat Burnley! It's a nice game. Ten Hag had that as well: the three or four games without a win and then second-bottom of the league came. They just won that game and then lost three or four games again. It's just going to keep on covering the cracks. They will be called Pollyfilla United! "I don't think Amorim will be shy to go: I've had enough. I can't do anything. I've done what I can. "I don't think he is one to put himself through pain to get his pay-off. I don't know the man, but coming across, I think he's an honest man and will be honest with himself. But I think they will beat Burnley."

Title: Merse BAFFLED with Sesko for taking 10th pen
Content: Paul Merson was left speechless by Man Utd's decision to put their new star striker signing of Benjamin Sesko on the 10th penalty in the Red Devils' shootout defeat against Grimsby in the Carabao Cup.

Title: Merson on if Man Utd had to prioritise a new GK this summer
Content: Sky Sports' Paul Merson on The Premier League Show: "For me, I would have said yes. You don't win league titles, World Cups or European Championships without good goalkeepers. "Onana doesn't save points, the goalkeepers lose points at Man Utd. So as soon as you lose points, that's a worry. "They need a new goalkeeper. I see Donnarumma's around - why don't they go for him? But again, they've used their money in other positions."

Title: Merson: Man Utd got wrong man in Amorim
Content: Sky Sports' Paul Merson on The Premier League Show: "When Amorim came in everybody knew he could play three at the back. Everybody knew. Man Utd knew. The owners knew. "He got that job by going the way he played. They never had the players to play that way - ever. "I could have seen him go in at Chelsea with Malo Gusto, Reece James - attacking wing-backs who can make things happen and cross the ball. They're up and down. Chelsea have three centre-backs who would have suited the way he played. "They got the wrong man for the players they had. He had changed the whole lot. They're not going to do that and he's not going to change his system for Man Utd. "He came in from Portugal to one of the biggest jobs in world football playing the way he played. Why would he change? "He didn't want to come in during the middle of the season because he knew they were not his players. No wing-backs. Then he had to come in, it was a mad struggle and this season he hasn't got it. "He has probably just gone: I just have to outscore teams. With Mbeumo, Cunha and Sesko up front. Fernandes playing as well. And I don't think he'll do that. "Everybody went mad after the Arsenal game. Why? They lost. Last season they drew 1-1 with them and should have won that game. "They need legs in midfield. No-one has ever won a tournament or league without legs in midfield."

Title: Merse: Man Utd players' attitude stinks!

Title: Merson on who is to blame at Man Utd
Content: Sky Sports' Paul Merson on The Premier League Show: "It's the players. "The system? He wants to play this way by getting rid of the wingers. Garnacho is going, Rashford is gone. But he wants to play this system so get used to it. "These are good players. They bought Sesko for ¬£70m and he's taking the tenth penalty? I thought he had a broken leg when he stepped up. I thought he must be that injured that he's taking the tenth penalty. "And then I heard people saying that he didn't want to miss or take that pressure. He's a ¬£70m player! He's coming to score goals for Man Utd to take them back to where they should belong and he's taking the tenth penalty? He has to be in the top five. "He's taking a penalty from 12 yards and the goalkeeper can't come off his line! "I forgot that he was playing and then when he stepped up for the tenth penalty, I went: Wow. That's when it's about the players."

Title: Merson on Amorim's 'talk really loud' comments
Content: Sky Sports' Paul Merson on The Premier League Show: "When he said: my players talk really loud - that means he has seen enough to know that they're not really playing for him, in my opinion. "Then he turned around and said 'I can't change all 22 players', to go: it will have to be me [to leave]. "I was a manager at Walsall. You just know, and you get a feeling, when things aren't right." On if his 3-4-2-1 formation is an issue: "These are players. It's just a system, get the ball, pass the ball quickly, move the ball, work hard. There's no systems anymore, people go from right-back into centre midfield to pick the ball up. "They shouldn't be getting beaten by Grimsby Town. Grimsby were outstanding, magnificent, unbelievable. Even at their best, they should get near Man Utd."

Title: Merson: Half of Man Utd players' attitude STINKS!
Content: Sky Sports' Paul Merson on The Premier League Show: "I watched the whole game and all the way through to the penalties and: hard work. You have to put in the hard work. You could be some of the most talented players in the world but you have to work hard. "No disrespect to Grimsby, they shouldn't be on the same pitch as Man Utd. If Man Utd turn up with the attitude Grimsby had, there's only one result and everyone would have been turning over at half-time, looking for something else to watch. That wasn't the case. "Half of them turned up thinking: 'I'm only playing because it's Grimsby. I won't be playing against Burnley on Saturday'. Instead of: 'When I walk off that game, those Grimsby fans and players will go: I didn't know he was that good.' That's not the case. "Their attitude stinks from half of them. Back in the day, there were shocks, the pitches were a joke. That pitch was immaculate and they should go out and destroy Grimsby. "Cristiano Ronaldo doesn't' get to the top by just his talent. And if he has to work hard as one of the greatest players of all-time, why can't the Manchester United players? It's arrogance. "Who can knock on the door this weekend and go: why am I not playing? And they all want to leave! Where are they going to go? Who's going to take them?"

Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas: Newcastle youngster Trevan Sanusi is attracting interest from French clubs Auxerre and Le Havre. The clubs are negotiating a loan with Newcastle. The England U18 international made his first-team debut for Newcastle in January. A loan move is viewed as a good opportunity for the 18-year-old to secure more regular playing time.

Title: Simons in London for Spurs and Chelsea talks
Content: Latest from Sky in Germany: Xavi Simons is in London to hold talks about his future amid interest from Tottenham and Chelsea. RB Leipzig have excused the forward from training today. The German club want a package worth around ¬£60m for the Netherlands international.

Mateus Fernandes has also been undergoing a medical today. West Ham agreed a deal worth ¬£42m deal with Southampton for the midfielder.

Title: Forest discussing termination of Dennis deal
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Nottingham Forest and Emmanuel Dennis are discussing a mutual termination of his contract. The 27-year-old spent the second half of last season on loan at Blackburn Rovers. His last competitive appearance for Forest came in the 2022-23 season.

Title: Leicester sack Miquel
Content: Leicester have sacked manager Amandine Miquel just 11 days before their first WSL match of the season against Man Utd. Miquel had only been in charge for one season, guiding the Foxes to a 10th‚Äëplaced finish last term. Assistant manager Amaury Messuwe has also left the club. A statement released on Thursday read: "The squad continues its preparations under the wider coaching team ahead of the new WSL campaign, while we will provide a further update once the process of appointing a new LCFC Women manager has been concluded."

Title: Millwall sign keeper Coleman
Content: Millwall have signed goalkeeper Joel Coleman on a free transfer. The 29-year-old played for Bolton Wanderers last season.

Title: Brighton open to offers for Sarmiento
Content: Cremonese are also in talks over the signing of Brighton winger Jeremy Sarmiento, according to Sky in Italy. Brighton are open to letting him go before the window closes. Sarmiento has spent the last three seasons on loan at different clubs in the Championship. The 23-year-old played for Burnley in the previous campaign as they gained automatic promotion to the Premier League. He has two years left on his current deal at Brighton.

Title: Southampton using Fernandes fee to fund incomings
Content: Latest from Sky Sports' Mark McAdam, Lyall Thomas and Florian Plettenberg: Southampton are putting the Mateus Fernandes money - who is set to sign for West Ham - to good use already. They have agreed deals to sign Tom Fellows from West Brom and Casper Jander from Nurnberg. Fellows could ultimately cost Southampton ¬£10m - agreeing to pay an initial ¬£8m plus ¬£2m in add-ons. He is due for a medical tomorrow. Saints have also agreed a deal with Nurnberg for promising 22-year-old midfielder Jander, who is travelling to England today and will then undergo a medical. The fee will be ¬£10.4m (‚Ç¨12m) inclusive of add-ons.

Title: Vardy edging towards Cremonese move
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett: Jamie Vardy is inching closer to a deal to play in Italy's top division with Cremonese. Sky Sports News has been told that talks have progressed well, and the free agent would be keen on a move to the newly-promoted Serie A side. Cremonese see Vardy as more than just an experienced goalscorer, and hope if they can secure an agreement with him it will also increase their international profile. Their first game following promotion saw them win 2-1 at AC Milan last weekend. However, there has so far been no formal commitment from either side, and talks with Vardy's representatives continue. The 38-year-old has already amassed a number of options from clubs in England and Europe and isn't in a rush to finalise his future, knowing this next move must work for him and his family.

Title: Millwall finalising deal for Taylor
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Peter Smith and James Savundra: Millwall are finalising a deal for West Brom centre-back Caleb Taylor. Once that is completed, the defender is set to undergo medical and agree formalities of the move. Millwall are bringing in Taylor after Japhet Tanganga's move to Sheffield United was confirmed earlier today. Meanwhile, West Brom are wrapping up a deal for Bournemouth's Chris Mepham to replace Taylor.

Title: Andrews wants to keep Ajer at Brentford
Content: Kristoffer Ajer will not be leaving Brentford if head coach Keith Andrews has his way - but he admits the decision over the Swedish defender's future may be out of his hands. The Bees rejected a bid from Wolfsburg forAjer earlier this week,  with the offer understood to be worth an initial ¬£11m, rising to a total of just under ¬£13m (‚Ç¨15m). Andrews said he was unaware of any such bid, but said director of football Phil Giles would be the one calling the shots over the 27-year-old. He said: "For me Kristoffer's someone I definitely don't want to lose. Whether something's happened in my time on the grass in what I've been doing today, I'm not sure. "It's one for Phil [Giles] to deal with but Kristoffer is a big part of the group, he played very, very well at Bournemouth and he'll be in the squad on Saturday. "He really likes the football club, he's been a big part of it and he's been here four years. He's part of our leadership group, he's a big character and personality."

Title: Palace could sign as many as FIVE players before deadline
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra: Crystal Palace could look to sign as many as FIVE players before the end of the transfer window. Oliver Glasner called on the club to sign at least two players prior to Eberechi Eze‚Äôs departure to Arsenal. They are close to confirming the signing of Yeremy Pino from Villarreal. However, they are still looking to recruit another forward as they bid to add depth in the attacking areas. It is unlikely at this stage that the club reopen discussions to sign Leicester City‚Äôs Bilal El Khannouss. There remains a strong interest in Club Brugge forward Christos Tzolis. However, the Belgian club are very unlikely to sanction his departure after sealing Champions League qualification. The Eagles made initial contact with Wolves around forward Hwang Hee Chan last week. Yet, it‚Äôs a deal that Palace are unlikely to pursue at this stage. Palace are one of several Premier League clubs that have asked about Conor Gallagher's situation at Atletico Madrid. However, there is an acceptance that it will be difficult to prize the England international away from Atletico this summer.

Title: 'No appetite at Man Utd to sack Amorim'
Content: Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol: "If you look back at the recent history of Manchester United and all the changes they've made, you can make a very good case for saying they should have just stuck with the manager they had. "I don't think there is any appetite whatsoever at Man Utd to carry on chopping and changing the manager. They've backed him financially in the transfer market, spending over ¬£200m. "They've backed him on his judgement that he doesn't want players like Garnacho, Sancho, Antony, Rashford and Hojlund at the club. "But under Jim Ratcliffe, he's quite a ruthless person. He didn't get to where he is in business by settling for second best. So this cannot carry on. Ruben Amorim knows that himself. "If you're asking me if Manchester United are going to sack their manager today, not that I've heard."

Title: Palace want TWO new defenders if Guehi leaves
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra: Crystal Palace will look to sign two central defenders if Marc Guehi departs in the final days of this transfer window. The club would want to have a ready-made replacement for Guehi lined up if they were to sanction his departure. Sky Sports News reported earlier this week that Palace had approached Manchester City for Manuel Akanji. At the same time, they are looking at signing a centre-back with a younger profile who may become a key first-team player further down the line. They have strong interest in Rennes centre-back Jeremy Jacquet. The France U21 international extended his contract with the French club this summer until 2029. It is understood that the Ligue 1 club would like to keep the 20-year-old for at least one more season.

Title: Andrews: No Wissa in squad for Sunderland
Content: Brentford boss Keith Andrews does not expect Yoane Wissa to be a part of his squad for this weekend's Premier League game at Sunderland - but he still expects him to stay at the club. The Bees boss had suggested the wantaway striker could be involved in his team to face Aston Villa last weekend, but he was eventually omitted with Andrews saying he wanted to concentrate on players who were fully-focused on the task at hand. Wissa has been training with the club for over a week following a stand-off over his desire to leave the club and join Newcastle this summer. The Magpies have had two bids turned down for the forward, the latter an offer worth up to ¬£40m rejected last week. "It's copy and paste from the other day, nothing's changed in terms of my stance," he said. "I don't see any movement behind the scenes. "No [he won't be involved]. We focus on the group that's settled and not got ongoing issues which clearly Yoane has. The squad will be pretty much the same. "We're in constant dialogue, I keep saying about the level of respect I have for Yoane. It's been difficult, for obvious reasons, but what we say will remain between us." Asked whether he remained confident the forward would stay at Brentford beyond September 1, he said: "I still feel that. The football club want to hold onto him, the kind of player he is, the person he is, I don't want to lose Yoane."

Title: Enciso back at Brighton after injury derails move
Content: Fabian Hurzeler says Julio Enciso has returned to Brighton to continue his rehabilitation amid reports his move to Strasbourg could be off. Enciso was expected to join the French club for around ¬£20m, with a deal close to being finalised this time last week. However, the attacking midfielder, who does not feature in Hurzeler's plans, is now back at Brighton with less than five days of the window to go. Asked to clear up Enciso's situation, Hurzeler said: "It is not a big injury, so he is back in rehab training. "It is very important that the players now are our plans for the future. "We have an open conversation with Julio and then we will see what happens in the next days."

Title: Hurzeler '100 per cent sure' Baleba stays at Brighton

The midfielder has been the subject of interest from Man Utd this summer, but the Seagulls have remained firm in their stance that Baleba is not for sale. "If there was a number higher than 100 I would give you that," Hurzeler said in his pre-Man City press conference on Thursday. He also added that his gut instinct is there won't be any more incomings at Brighton, and reiterated his happiness with the shape of the squad.

Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Sahil Jaidka and Anthony Joseph: Rangers have agreed a deal with Girona to sign striker Bojan Miovski. The Lions had rejected bids from Sassuolo and Verona earlier in the window, with Tanganga understood to have a ¬£1.5m release clause for interested Premier League clubs only. Title: Rangers rebel Igamane in Lille for medical
Content: Rangers striker Hamza Igamane is undergoing a medical in France ahead of his ¬£10.4m move to Lille. Sky Sports News revealed yesterday that the 22-year-old flew to Brussels last night as he closes in on a transfer to the Ligue 1 club. Once his medical is completed, Igamane is expected to finalise the paperwork on a five-year contract. Head coach Russell Martin revealed on Sunday that Igamane refused to come on as a second-half substitute during Rangers' draw away to St Mirren, claiming he was injured.

Title: Moyes: I've got no defenders
Content: David Moyes has suggested defensive reinforcements could be on the agenda as Everton consider further business before next week's transfer deadline. Injuries to Jarrad Branthwaite, Nathan Patterson, Seamus Coleman and Vitalii Mykolenko have limited Moyes' options in the opening weeks of the new season. Veteran captain Coleman and Mykolenko were eased back into action with starts in Wednesday's comfortable 2-0 Carabao Cup defeat of League One Mansfield at the Hill Dickinson Stadium. Moyes, however, still feels short in the department and decided he could not afford to rest senior centre-backs James Tarkowski and Michael Keane for what was a straightforward assignment against lower-division opposition. The Toffees manager said: "We wanted to try and give as many players (as possible) a game. I've not got any defenders. I'm very limited to what I can choose defensive-wise. "It already has changed a lot of my plans because, obviously, we're without Jarrad and we have been without Myko for, certainly, the first couple of games. "We had this at the end of last season as well, we've had it all through the summer. It's not as if we've necessarily got it better. "We've got people back, but others are injured. We've just got to make sure that we're not short again if we can help it - and certainly we were short for the first two games in the Premier League."

Title: Brighton working on reducing squad size
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett and Elliot Cook: Serie A club Como are showing an interest in signing Brighton defender Igor on loan. Content: Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett: "A Premier League-ready replacement. That's the point. "Jorgen Strand Larsen is a key part of the Wolves side, he's such an important player for them. "It would be a good level of profit of them. he was on loan at Celta Vigo last season and there was an obligation to buy him for ¬£23m. They've just spent ¬£23m on him and they could then sell him for ¬£60m. "That sounds like a good bit of business - until you start thinking about where they are going to get a replacement from."

Title: Wolves reject second bid from Newcastle for Strand Larsen
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: Wolves have rejected a second offer of ¬£55m from Newcastle for Jorgen Strand Larsen. Sky Sports News reported Newcastle had an initial ¬£50m offer rejected by Wolves on Monday. Football is football. Every player has a price, I believe. "I understand football, but for me, he is very, very important for us. We'll see what happens.‚Äù

Title: Wolves boss on Strand Larsen: Every player has a price
Content: Wolves boss Vitor Pereira has been speaking about the importance of keeping Jorgen Strand Larsen after the striker who is linked with Newcastle scored twice to beat West Ham in the Carabao Cup. "If it's my decision, of course. Of course. Because he's a very important player. "It's not only about the technical and tactical, it's about the character. He's a player with character. I can imagine his mind in this moment because he listens to a lot of things, reading a lot of things, and then he keeps the commitment. "Until now, Jorgen is our player. We'll see what happens. I understand football. Football is football. Every player has a price, I believe. Even Messi or Cristiano. I understand football, but for me, he is very, very important for us. We'll see what happens." Pereira added that there was no indication that Strand Larsen's mind was elsewhere and he had become distracted by the talk of a move to Newcastle. The Portuguese insists the player will not force a move but stopped short of saying he would stay. "I know him. In the last seven or eight months that I'm with him. I know him very well. He will never, never force. But of course, we know football is football. He must be ready for everything. But I want to keep the best players and this kind of player with us, of course."

Title: Martin expects Igamane to leave Rangers soon after Lille bid accepted
Content: Rangers boss Russell Martin expects Hamza Igamane to soon leave the club. Rangers have accepted a ¬£10.4m bid from Lille for Igamane after he reported an injury when the Gers boss asked him to come off the bench in Sunday's 1-1 draw at St Mirren. So looking forward to a big, big game tomorrow. ‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt seen him (Igamane), he had a scan yesterday and got assessed. ‚ÄúAnd then, obviously stuff‚Äôs happening today, so he wasn‚Äôt in, so it hasn‚Äôt been disruptive, moving forward, at all. It‚Äôs happened, we moved forward, we dealt with it. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs got what he wanted, well, it looks likely to get what he wanted, to play somewhere else. ‚ÄúAnd it means we‚Äôve got a sum of money that we wanted for him. ‚ÄúSo ideally it wouldn‚Äôt have happened, but it did and now we move forward and we can move on.‚Äù Asked if Igamane‚Äôs scan revealed an injury issue, Martin said: ‚ÄúI expect him to pass his medical.‚Äù Sky Sports

Title: Club Brugge boss hopes under-pressure Martin will be given time at Rangers

Krejci - a centre-back who can also play defensive-midfield, which are two positions Wolves have been looking to strength - is set to have a medical. He has agreed terms on a contract until 2030.

Title: Forest approach Leicester over left-back
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett: Nottingham Forest have made an approach to Leicester for left-back Victor Kristiansen. Forest boss Nuno Espirito Santo said after the explosive row with owner Evangelos Marinakis that he still wants a new goalkeeper and two full-backs before the window closes.

Title: Brazilian club claim to have signed Palace forward
Content: Brazilian club Vasco da Gama say they have reached an agreement with Crystal Palace forward Matheus Franca. Franca arrived in Rio de Janeiro on Tuesday morning for a medical and to finalise his move, according to the club's social media account. Reports in Brazil claim the deal is a straight loan that does not include an option to buy. Vasco da Gama did not specify in their post. Palace signed Franca as a teenager from Brazilian club Flamengo for around ¬£26m in the summer of 2023. He has scored once and provided two assists in 14 Premier League appearances. If the deal were to go through, Franca would be returning to Rio de Janeiro, which is where he grew up and began his professional career with Flamengo.

Title: 'Isak repeats desire to join Liverpool'
Content: Alexander Isak remains adamant he wants to leave Newcastle United, according to The Telegraph. Isak is said to have repeated his desire to be allowed to join Liverpool, even though Newcastle have not received a bid that comes close to matching their valuation. Newcastle directors Jamie Reuben and Jacobo Solis visited Isak at his house on Sunday ahead of the game with Liverpool. Vickery: Paz is a left-footed version of Bergvall
Content: South American football expert Tim Vickery on Sky Sports News' Transfer Talk: "Nico Paz plays for Argentina. He's just started his international career. "But he's European, born and bred. He's the son of Pablo Paz, who was a World Cup defender for Argentina. "He made his most of his career in Europe. So Nico Paz came up through the youth ranks with Real Madrid. "He's at Como, but Real Madrid have an interest in him and they have a buy-back. Paz, so they're watching his progress very, very closely. "Paz has a really sweet left foot. If you're thinking of Tottenham's and long-term strategies, he's a little bit of a left-footed version of Bergvall, someone who, possibly, if you were to put him in the Premier League right now, might find that a little bit of a step up at this stage of his career. "But Tottenham would be thinking long-term. The stumbling block there, though, is that Real Madrid have a long-term interest in this player."

Title: Vickery: Celtic loan could unlock Saracchi's potential
Content: South American football expert Tim Vickery on Sky Sports News' Transfer Talk: "I saw a lot of him on the way up. He's a, he's a stocky little left back, very, very quick. And when he first came through, I had immense hopes for this player, real hopes. "I thought he was the future of Uruguay at left back. And I thought he was on for a brilliant career, and so far, it's proved a little bit of a disappointment. "So he's been through Germany without doing a great deal, Turkey a little bit more, a little bit in Spain, and then back to Argentina. So he's bounced around. "I think what he perhaps needs in his career is a bit of stability. "But as as an attacking left back, I think there's plenty that Celtic can get out of him, especially because, you know, he's clearly, he's in a league where Celtic can never be on the front foot for the vast majority of the time."

Title: Pisa close in on Celtic and Leicester target Stengs
Content: Latest from Sky Italy's Gianluca Di Marzio, Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett and Anthony Joseph: Pisa are closing in on the signing of Celtic and Leicester City target Calvin Stengs, according to Sky Italy. It‚Äôs understood the Serie A club are close to agreeing a loan deal, with an option to buy for ¬£6m, for the Feyenoord winger. Sky Sports News revealed that Leicester had opened talks for the Netherlands international, but were only likely to pursue a deal if they sell Bilal El Khannouss. Celtic have also explored the conditions of a deal earlier this month and were only likely to follow up their interest if they made it through to the Champions League.

Title: West Ham eye Forest's Sangare as additional midfield signing

The idea is an initial loan that could become an obligation to buy if certain thresholds are met. They have also agreed on a fee for Monaco‚Äôs Soungoutou Magassa, but there is still work to do on the deal. West Ham also have interest other defensive midfielders including Strasbourg‚Äôs Junior Mwanga and Middlesbrough‚Äôs Hayden Hackney. At the same time, the Hammers are also exploring a deal to sign a more attacking midfielder in Werder Bremen's Romano Schmid before Deadline Day. Title: Dortmund sign Chukwuemeka from Chelsea
Content: Dortmund have signed midfielder Carney Chukwuemeka from Chelsea for around ¬£24m. Chukwuemeka played 32 times and scored two goals for Chelsea after signing from Aston Villa in 2022 for a fee in the region of ¬£20m. His departure takes Chelsea's overall sales in this window to more than ¬£270m.

Title: Porto close to agreeing deal to sign Arsenal's Kiwior

The proposal is for a loan with an obligation to buy. Porto and Arsenal have been discussing a total package that would be worth ¬£26m, including the loan fee. That amount could rise even further depending on player and team performance. Arsenal bought Kiwior from Spezia in January 2023 in a deal worth ¬£20m.

Title: Vickery: Pereira could leave Fulham very soon
Content: South American football expert Tim Vickery on Sky Sports News' Transfer Talk: "Andreas Pereira could leave Fulham today or tomorrow, and Palmeiras are very, very keen. "This is a bit cruel, but he's already a hero with the Palmeiras fans. In his previous spell at Brazil, he played for Flamengo, and they met Palmeiras in the final of the Champions League. "He got caught in possession and gave away the winning goal to Palmeiras. So the Palmeiras fans love it, but he's an extremely gifted player. "I think what is happening here is that he is trying to position himself with a top side, a side that is chasing silverware in the run-up to the World Cup. "And Palmeiras, they've got lots of money. It's a very strong squad. Some of your old friends, Felipe Anderson once at West Ham, they just bought Ramon Sosa, the Paraguayan winger, from Forest. "And I think Andres Pereira thinks that if he shines there for Palmeiras, when he is in front of the Brazilian fans and the Brazilian media, that can really catapult him into the squad for the World Cup."

Title: Vickery: Arsenal target Hincapie has grown into a terrific defender
Content: South American football expert Tim Vickery on Sky Sports News' Transfer Talk: "Hincapie is a left-footed defender, he's a centre-back who can also play at left back as well. "He's not a flyer up the wing kind of left back. He likes to bring the ball out of the defence. "I remember the first time I saw him in Ecuador, they threw him in as a teenager, and I had had my doubts. "I thought too spindly, maybe, and he's got mistakes in him. It's been great to be proved wrong, because he's grown and grown and grown and really is a terrific defender. "My little doubt here is, why would Arsenal want to spend so much for a player in this position when they have both Gabriel Magalhaes and Calafiori. So you've got cover there in both the positions that Hincapie offers. "So it's a little bit of a surprise to me why it's Arsenal, and based on what we've seen so far in the season, I think you would have thought that this is a player that Liverpool could really do with another."

Title: Igamane not in Rangers training ahead of CL play-off clash
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Gordon Duncan and Sahil Jaidka: Striker Hamza Igamane is not training with the Rangers squad ahead of tomorrow's Champions League play-off clash against Club Brugge. Sky Sports News understands the 22-year-old is not injured, with the club believed to be preparing for life without the Moroccan international. Head coach Russell Martin revealed on Sunday that Igamane refused to come on as a second-half substitute during Rangers' draw away to St Mirren, claiming he was injured. Speaking after the game, Martin told Sky Sports that Rangers had rejected a bid for the player and added: "The issue is that the transfer window is still open. There are a lot of people, one eye out the door and one in and we need people to be all in all the time in this football club. We really need that. At the minute, there are still too many people uncertain or still trying to think, 'maybe there's something there for me'. The window needs to shut quickly. "In-house, we need to make sure that we have people who really want to be here, so the people that come in and the people that stay really want to be here. We'll see." Sky Sports News reported on Monday that Lille want to sign Igamane during the final week of the transfer window. Fresh talks have taken place with the Ligue 1 expected to table another bid, after their first offer for a loan deal was turned down last week. Dutch outfit Feyenoord are also keen on the 22-year-old, who scored 16 times in his first season at Ibrox.

Title: Could Vardy join Serie A side Cremonese?

Title: Gordon offers apology for red card vs Liverpool
Content: Newcastle forward Anthony Gordon has taken to social media to apologise for being sent off during his side's defeat to Liverpool. The England international was shown a red card for a challenge on Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk on the brink of half-time. Gordon was initially shown a yellow before VAR recommended an on-field review, by which it was overturned by referee Simon Hooper. Newcastle were behind at the time of the sending off but managed to fight back after conceding again shortly after the break and make it 2-2 despite being a man down. However, substitute Rio Ngumoha scored a late dagger to stun Newcastle. In a message posted on Instagram, Gordon said: "I want to sincerely apologise to my team-mates and the fans. My intentions were pure. I was just trying to create energy in the game and I mistimed the tackle. "I would never intend to tackle somebody like this on purpose. We spoke after and he [Van Dijk] knows that. "More importantly, I'm so proud of the time I spent on the pitch and how we played tonight. The atmosphere is what makes St James Park so special. "I love everything we stand for as a club, no more than right now. I'll be back and better, the same as every other setback I have faced."

Title: Howe calls for clarity over Isak future
Content: Eddie Howe has called for clarity over Alexander Isak's future after seeing his side edged out by suitors Liverpool in a five-goal thriller at St James' Park. Chairman Yasir Al-Rumayyan amid reports the owners had met Isak earlier on Monday . Howe insisted after the game he was not party to what was said during those discussions, but admitted a decision over the Sweden international - the subject of a rejected ¬£110m bid from the Reds - was needed sooner rather than later. Howe said: "I've not been party to talks on this for a long time now. I've been preparing the team and giving all my energy to the players that want to play for Newcastle. I think that is where my energy is best put at the moment. "We want clarity, we want to move forward, we want the narrative to change because we're in the start of the season now. "We're into the action and we've got to get results, and we've got to try to focus on what we can control. We've given two really, really good performances, we've ended up with one point. That's tough for us to take, especially in this moment where you're looking for positives to cling to. "But we battle through and we now go on to Leeds."

Title: 'Spurs and Villa monitoring West Ham's Paqueta'

The report suggest Paqueta is open to leaving the London Stadium before the transfer deadline after enduring a difficult year in relation to betting allegations. Tottenham have reportedly earmarked the 27-year-old as an option to fill a gaping hole in creative midfield after James Maddison's ACL injury and missing out on Eberechi Eze to rivals Arsenal. Spurs are said to be aware of Villa's interest who are suggested top be eyeing the Brazil international to bolster their own midfield. Title: Man City goalkeeper Ederson left out of Brazil squad amid Galatasaray interest
Content: Brazil boss Carlo Ancelotti has not included Manchester City goalkeeper Ederson in his latest squad for the September internationals. Ederson has not featured for Man City in the first two Premier League fixtures, with Pep Guardiola preferring summer signing James Trafford. Galatasaray are seriously interested in Ederson, who is into the final year of his Man City contract. Meanwhile, Neymar has also been left out by Ancelotti, who took over as Brazil's head coach at the end of last season. Tottenham striker Richarlison has been rewarded for his early-season form with a call-up, while new Chelsea winger Estevao is also included.

Title: How Napoli's Hojlund loan proposal could become permanent...
Content: Latest from Sky in Italy's Gianluca Di Marzio: Sky in Italy are reporting that Napoli's proposal to Manchester United could see Rasmus Hojlund's loan become permanent if certain thresholds are met for the striker. Under such an agreement, the mandatory buy option would be tied to number of appearances, goals and Napoli qualifying for the Champions League. The Italian champions are proposing a deal worth nearly ¬£39m all in for the 22-year-old.

Title: Dibling: Everton 'perfect fit' for me
Content: New Everton signing Tyler Dibling says his new club is the "perfect fit" for him after completing his ¬£42m move from Southampton. The 19-year-old winger told evertontv: ‚ÄúI'm buzzing to sign. I felt the Club already, even before I was in the building, just from social media and from people telling me about the Club. I've never been so excited to play football and I'm just ready to get going. ‚ÄúI think it's the perfect match because of where the Club is right now. Obviously with the new stadium, the fans here are unreal and it has a family feel to it. I think it was the perfect fit and was a no-brainer to join. ‚ÄúI think I‚Äôve come to Everton at the perfect time and hopefully I can be here for many years. ‚Äú[The Brighton win] gave me a feel for the Club. It looked unbelievable. I also played in the last Men‚Äôs game at Goodison. It was so loud. I was looking around and thinking, 'This is quality'. That was a really good insight for me into what it's like here with the fans and the atmosphere they can create. ‚ÄúThere's no better feeling than when you're doing well in football and to feel that love from the fans is one of the best feelings ever. I'm excited to play here.‚Äù

Title: Sheff Utd agree deal to sign Millwall defender Tanganga
Content: Latest from Sky in Italy's Luca Bendoni and Sky Sports News' Peter Smith: Sheffield United have agreed a deal with Millwall for Japhet Tanganga. The defender is expected to undergo a medical and complete the formalities of the move over the next few days. Tanganga was left out of Millwall's squad for Saturday's win at the Blades.

Title: Everton sign Dibling from Southampton in ¬£42m deal
Content: Everton have completed the signing of teenage winger Tyler Dibling from Southampton in a ¬£42m deal. Sky Sports News understands the deal includes ¬£6m worth of easily achievable add-ons and a 20 per cent sell-on clause. The 19-year-old has signed a four-year deal at the Toffees. Dibling becomes David Moyes' eighth new signing of the summer transfer window, following the arrivals of Thierno Barry, Jack Grealish, Carlos Alcaraz, Mark Travers, Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall, Adam Aznou and Tom King. Dibling's arrival takes the Toffees' spending to ¬£124m this summer.

Title: Carra: Newcastle should sell Isak
Content: Sky Sports' Jamie Carragher speaking on Monday Night Football: "I think Newcastle should sell Isak. ‚ÄúThe reason I say that is that there will be so many people outside telling Newcastle and Eddie Howe what they need to do. You have to be strong. You have to show Liverpool or any other club that players cannot just come in and demand to go. ‚ÄúBut they don‚Äôt have the problem of Isak every day. They don‚Äôt have the problem that Eddie Howe has of going to every press conference and being asked about it. ‚ÄúIt is a cloud over the club constantly. ‚ÄúThe reason I say that is because I have experience of it. We had this with Fernando Torres at Liverpool where he did not really want to be at the club. ‚ÄúHe ended up staying and we sold him in the January. That four or five months was a nightmare for the club and everyone at the club could not wait for him to move on."

Title: Roma target Tsimikas not in Liverpool squad to face Newcastle
Content: Roma target Kostas Tsimikas is not in Liverpool's squad tonight to face Newcastle. He was also absent against Bournemouth in their Premier League opener and for the Community Shield against Crystal Palace. Roma are among a number of clubs interested in Tsimikas. Sky in Italy are reporting that the Serie A side are considering a loan move for the 29-year-old. Tsimikas, who has two years left on his contract at Liverpool, is competing for minutes with Milos Kerkez and Andy Robertson this season at left-back. Sky Sports

Title: Bayern one of at least five clubs interested in Chelsea striker Jackson
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol: Bayern Munich are one of at least five clubs that want to sign Chelsea striker Nicolas Jackson. Bayern would prefer a loan deal, but that is not of interest to Chelsea. The Blues would only let Jackson leave on loan if there was an obligation to buy in the deal. There will be developments on Jackson this week once it becomes clearer after tonight‚Äôs Newcastle vs Liverpool game whether Alexander Isak is staying or leaving. Aston Villa, Newcastle and Liverpool are among the Premier League clubs who still want to sign a forward in this window. Jackson ‚Äì and Christopher Nkunku ‚Äì are both still training with the Chelsea first-team squad. That means they could be reintegrated quickly if they stay at the club. Chelsea still want to sign Alejandro Garnacho and Xavi Simons but signings are exit dependent.

Title: Justin: I'm over the moon to join Leeds
Content: New Leeds signing James Justin is "over the moon" to have completed his ¬£10m move from Leicester. ‚ÄúObviously to join a club of this size and to have the history it has had, and being back in the Premier League was a massive thing for me, so I‚Äôm over the moon to have joined,‚Äù James told the club‚Äôs official website. ‚ÄúEveryone that I‚Äôve spoken to about the club and the area has had great things to say about it. So I‚Äôm excited to join the lads and get to work. ‚ÄúThe stadium has obviously got one of the best atmospheres in world football. ‚ÄúAnd it‚Äôs always a daunting task to come here as an opposing team, but I‚Äôm happy to have the fans behind me this time.‚Äù

Title: Rodgers confirms Celtic "close to one or two" signings
Content: With Celtic closing in on the signings of Michel-Ange Balikwisha and Marcelo Saracchi, manager Brendan Rodgers confirmed the club are ‚Äúclose to one or two things.‚Äù The Hoops boss was speaking in Kazakhstan ahead of the second leg of their Champions League play-off against Kairat Almaty ‚Äì with the play-off tie level at 0-0. When asked if progress was being made around incomings, Rodgers smiled and said: "There might be. "I think by the time we get back, hopefully, we'll be close to one or two things." Sky Sports

Title: Roma interested in Liverpool's Tsimikas with loan move considered
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Sky in Italy's Gianluca Di Marzio: Roma are among a number of clubs interested in Liverpool left-back Kostas Tsimikas. Sky in Italy are reporting that Roma are considering a loan move for the 29-year-old. Tsimikas, who has two years left on his contract at Liverpool, is competing for minutes with Milos Kerkez and Andy Robertson this season at left-back.

Title: Leeds sign defender Justin from Leicester in ¬£10m deal
Content: Leeds have signed defender James Justin from Leicester in a ¬£10m deal. The Whites will pay an initial ¬£8m fee plus ¬£2m in add-ons for the 27-year-old, who has signed a four-year deal at Elland Road. Justin becomes Leeds' 10th signing this summer and takes the club's spending beyond the ¬£100m mark. Sky Sports News understands Leicester are satisfied with the deal because Justin had only one year left on his Foxes contract. The Championship side would have demanded a much higher price if he had longer on his contract.

Title: Real Betis still pushing for Antony deal with Man Utd
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Real Betis are still pushing to do a deal for Manchester United forward Antony. The clubs are in contact, but up until now, Betis have been unable to match United's preference. United do not want to do another straight loan - they want a permanent element attached to any deal for the 25-year-old. So far, Betis have proposed creative loans. Antony enjoyed an impressive loan spell at Betis in the second half of last season ‚Äì he scored nine goals in 24 starts. Sky Sports News has previously reported that Antony has attracted interest from the Saudi Pro League. Atletico Madrid, Bayer Leverkusen and Bayern Munich have also monitored the Brazil international's situation. Antony joined Man Utd from Ajax for a fee of ¬£86m in the summer of 2022.

Title: Werder Bremen agree Sugawara loan deal with Southampton
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Sky in Germany's Florian Plettenberg: Werder Bremen have agreed a deal with Southampton to sign right-back Yukinari Sugawara. The deal is for a loan with an option to buy. Sky in Germany are reporting that he has been having a medical on Monday.

Title: Bournemouth goalkeeper Paulsen to join Lechia Gdansk
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam: Bournemouth goalkeeper Alex Paulsen is set to join Polish side Lechia Gdansk on loan. The 23-year-old is highly regarded by the hierarchy at Bournemouth, and they feel more experience will aid his development in a bid to one day be Bournemouth‚Äôs number one. His medical was completed on Monday morning and an announcement is expected this evening.

Title: Lille and Feyenoord want Rangers striker Igamane
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Sahil Jaidka and Anthony Joseph: French club Lille want to sign Rangers striker Hamza Igamane during the final week of the transfer window. It is understood that the Ligue 1 side are expected to table another bid, after their first offer for a loan deal was turned down last week. However, Dutch outfit Feyenoord are also keen on the 22-year-old, who scored 16 times in his first season at Ibrox. No deal has been agreed for the player to depart Glasgow, with Rangers expected to hold out for the right fee if they are to sell the player. Igamane refused to come on as a second-half substitute during Rangers‚Äô draw away to St Mirren on Sunday, after claiming he was injured.

Title: Wolves striker Silva closing in on Dortmund move
Content: Wolves striker Fabio Silva is edging closer to a move to Borussia Dortmund. The clubs have been in talks for some time, and Dortmund are about ¬£4.3m (‚Ç¨5m) away from Wolves‚Äô valuation. The West Midlands club are looking for a deal totalling ¬£26m (‚Ç¨30m).

Title: Celtic close to agreeing deal for Boca left-back Saracchi
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Celtic are close to agreeing a deal for Boca Juniors left-back Marcelo Saracchi. It is understood the clubs are discussing a loan deal, with an option to buy in the region of ¬£2m. The Uruguay international has two years left on his Boca contract, but has fallen out of favour at the Argentinian side. Saracchi joined Boca in 2023 from Levante for ¬£1.5m. Celtic have been in the market for another left-back to cover for first-choice Kieran Tierney.

Title: 'Newcastle are spinning plates as deadline approaches'
Content: Sky Sports News reporter Keith Downie: ‚ÄúFor Newcastle it feels very much at the moment like spinning plates. We don't yet know what is going to happen with Alexander Isak whether he will remain a Newcastle United player or not but they're ensuring that they're doing everything they can to get in replacements should he move to Liverpool. ‚ÄúIt will be interesting to see whether Newcastle go in with an improved bid for Strand Larsen - clearly Eddie Howe looking for striking reinforcements. ‚ÄúThey don't want to overspend though. I spoke to him just a couple of days ago in the build-up to this game. He said they don't want to overspend but they know they need strikers in because they're playing not just in the Premier League this season but they've got a Champions League campaign to contend with as well.‚Äù

Title: Derby agree ¬£3.5m deal for Johnston
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Derby County have agreed a deal worth ¬£3.5m for Sturm Graz right-back Max Johnston. It‚Äôs understood the Championship club will pay an initial fee of ¬£2.2m, with ¬£1.3m in add-ons. Derby are now in process of agreeing personal terms with the Scotland international, with talks at an advanced stage. Once agreed, Johnston will travel to England for a medical. The 21-year-old was today named in Steve Clarke‚Äôs Scotland squad to face Denmark and Belarus in the World Cup qualifiers.

Title: Chukwuemeka completes Dortmund medical; Anselmino due for his
Content: Carney Chukwuemeka has completed his medical with Borussia Dortmund, according to Sky in Germany. The Chelsea midfielder is set to re-sign for Dortmund in a permanent deal worth around ¬£24m. Sky in Germany report that Chukwuemeka has agreed a deal until 2030 with Dortmund. Meanwhile, Chelseadefender Aaron Anselmino has today arrived in Germany ahead of completing his loan move to Dortmund, according to Sky in Germany. He is now expected to undergo a medical and complete the formalities of his move.

Title: Wrexham in talks to sign ex-Birmingham midfielder James
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Wrexham are in talks to sign Rennes midfielder Jordan James. The Wales international is the club‚Äôs prime target for the central midfield position. James, 21, has three years left on his contract with the Ligue 1 club. Wrexham, who have broken their transfer record three times this summer, hope to find an agreement with Rennes. Southampton‚Äôs Will Smallbone is also of interest to the newly-promoted Championship club.

Title: Wolves reject ¬£50m Strand Larsen bid from Newcastle
Content: Wolves have rejected a ¬£50m bid from Newcastle for Jorgen Strand Larsen. Wolves‚Äô position is he is not for sale in this window. They believe he is too important and the lack of time left in the window is not enough to find a Premier League-ready replacement. Newcastle are targeting Strand Larsen as the Callum Wilson replacement. Brentford forward Yoane Wissa has been another player they see potentially coming in for Wilson. The Bees rejected a ¬£40m bid for Wissa last week. Sky Sports

Watford target 10th and 11th signings of the summer
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Watford are still looking to add two more signings before the end of the transfer window. The club have brought in eight players, so far, this summer and are on the brink of a ninth ‚Äì barring any issues with Nikoloz Chikovani‚Äôs medical. Sky Sports News understands the Championship club are in the market for a centre-back and defensive midfielder. Watford are looking for more experienced players to fill those roles, rather than young talents.

Title: Anderlecht eyeing loan for Cardiff teenager
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Mark McAdam: Anderlecht are considering a loan offer for Cardiff‚Äôs Tanatswa Nyakuhwa. Cardiff have ruled out the permanent sale of the Wales youth international to the Belgian club. The 19-year-old would benefit from regular first-team games but Cardiff would also be happy for him to stay. Cardiff‚Äôs preference is to loan him into League One or Two level in England. Nyakuhwa has one appearance for Cardiff‚Äôs senior team.

Title: Tilio's Celtic exit confirmed
Content: Marco Tilio has completed a ¬£1.3m move from Celtic to Rapid Vienna. The 24-year-old winger has signed a four-year deal with the Austrian club. Tillio only played two first team games after joining from Melbourne City in 2023.

Title: Watford agree ¬£500k deal for Georgian teenager
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Sky in Italy's Luca Bendoni: Watford have agreed a ¬£500,000 deal to sign Dinamo Tbilisi winger Nikoloz Chikovani. It‚Äôs understood the Georgia U19 international is due to undergo a medical today. Watford see the Chikovani as a project signing and the 18-year-old is expected to be sent out on loan.

Title: Andrews: Wissa wont be involved against Bournemouth
QPR expecting two further incomings
Content: QPR are expected to announce the arrivals of Rhy Norrington-Davies and Koki Saito on permanent deals after signing Isaac Hayden earlier this afternoon. Left-winger Saito spent last season on loan at the Championship club from Belgian side Lommel. Left-back Norrington-Davies is joining from Sheffield United.

Title: Fulham awaiting Pereira bid
Content:
Fulham are expecting a bid from Palmeiras for Andreas Pereira. The 29-year-old is believed to be keen to go back to his native Brazil and Palmeiras have made their interest known.
Pereira was left out of the squad for Sunday‚Äôs 1-1 draw at home to Manchester United. The Brazil international has one year left on his Fulham contract plus an option year.

Title: Bournemouth agree to sell Adu-Adjei
Content: Bournemouth have agreed a deal with HNK Rijeka for the sale of striker Daniel Adu-Adjei. The 20-year-old will join the Croatian side on a permanent deal four years after signing for Bournemouth. The Premier League club have a sell-on clause inserted into the deal.Adu-Adjei made one senior appearance for Bournemouth in the FA Cup in January 2024. He spent last season on loan at Carlisle United.

Title: Newcastle chairman set to attend Liverpool clash
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: Newcastle United chairman Yasir Al-Rumayyan is set to attend St James‚Äô Park tonight to watch Newcastle vs Liverpool. The PIF governor last attended a home match in February against Nottingham Forest. Al-Rumayyan was at Wembley back in March when Newcastle beat Liverpool in the Carabao Cup final. Watch Newcastle vs Liverpool on Monday Night Football, live on Sky Sports from 6.30pm; kick-off 8pm.

Title: Forest in talks to sign Bakwa
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Zinny Boswell: Nottingham Forest are in talks to sign Strasbourg winger Dilane Bakwa. However, they are yet to agree with Strasbourg on a valuation for the 22-year-old. Leeds United have also been interested and there is the chance more clubs come in for him this week. Bakwa is expected to play in Thursday‚Äôs Conference League play-off second leg against Brondby, after which an exit from the club could accelerate. Forest boss Nuno Santo has said he also wants to strengthen his full-backs. Sevilla‚Äôs Jose Angel Carmona, who can play both right and left-back positions, remains one of three options the club are working on.

Title: Leicester in talks to sign Dutch winger
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Rob Dorsett: Leicester City are in talks to sign Feyenoord winger Calvin Stengs. It‚Äôs understood Feyenoord are open to selling The Netherlands international in this window. Celtic and Pisa have also explored the conditions of a deal. The Scottish champions enquired earlier this month and are more likely to follow-up their interest if they make it through to the Champions League. Stengs, 26, has two years left on his Feyenoord contract. He joined from Nice in 2023 for ¬£5.3m.

Title: Dibling Everton medical on Monday
Content: Tyler Dibling is undergoing a medical with Everton today. His proposed ¬£42m transfer from Southampton is progressing. Everton agreed the deal, which includes ¬£6m worth of easily achievable add-ons and a 20 per cent sell-on clause, with Saints on Friday. Everton boss David Moyes said after they beat Brighton on Sundaythat Dibling‚Äôs move was ‚Äúmoving on‚Äù and ‚Äúhopefully it will be done‚Äù.

Title: Spurs' Paz chase hits Real snag
Content: Latest from Sky Sports' Lyall Thomas and Michael Bridge: Tottenham look increasingly unlikely to sign Como‚Äôs Nico Paz. The Argentina international has been among several of interest for a new No.10. But Real Madrid ‚Äì his former club ‚Äì still have financial interests in the player that make any deal extremely complicated. Real have incremental buy-back clauses beginning at ¬£8.6m (‚Ç¨10m) this summer, and increasing for summer 2026 and 2027, as well as a 50 per cent sell-on clause. It means Real Madrid essentially have the final say on any Spurs offer and, even if it was agreed, would take half the fee due to Como. According to Sky in Italy, Como want almost ¬£61m (‚Ç¨70m) guaranteed plus add-ons on top. Sky in Italy have reported Spurs have been willing to pay upwards of ¬£56m guaranteed plus around ¬£8.7m in add-ons. Spurs  want to sign a No.10 and a winger before the deadline and have interest in Monaco's Magnes Akliouche and Manchester City's Savinho among others.

Title: Hayden rejoins QPR after Newcastle exit
Content: Isaac Hayden has rejoined QPR on a free transfer after leaving Newcastle at the end of last season. The 30-year-old midfielder previously spent four months with the club on loan in 2023/24. ‚ÄúLast year when I was at Portsmouth, it was quite difficult to play against the guys,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI felt like I was lining up on the wrong team! ‚ÄúIt was a special four months that I had at the club and you get a feeling sometimes of a place that is kind of like home. And it was just one of those situations where, for me, it was a no-brainer to come back. ‚ÄúI feel like I can add a lot of value, not just on the pitch, but off the pitch as well and help drive the group forward.‚Äù

Title: Andrews: I fully expect Wissa to stay at Brentford
Content: Keith Andrews says he "fully expects" Yoane Wissa to still be a Brentford player after the summer transfer window closes. The forward has not played for the Bees this season, as speculation around his future continues to swirl. "It's very similar, stroke the exact same, as where we were pre-Villa," he said in a press conference on Monday afternoon. "He won't be involved tomorrow [vs Bournemouth in the Carabao Cup]. Again, it's just a decision based around what I feel is best for the group. "The focus is on the group tomorrow. Yoane won't be involved. "As far as I'm concerned, there's been no movement in any way and I fully expect Yoane to be here come next Tuesday." Asked if Wissa would be able to be reintegrated into the squad if he does not leave west London, Andrews added: "That's the plan. If I didn't think it would be, my stance on it would probably be different. "We've got a phenomenal group of players and staff that has been built over numerous years, where there's a real culture of togetherness, a real underpinning of respect throughout the building. "People walk in and they feel that. Anybody that's not attached to the football club can sense the club is run in a certain way."

Title: WATCH: The state of play with a week to go
Man City want to keep Ederson - but have Donnarumma's name in mind
Content: Latest from Sky Sports' Lyall Thomas, Dharmesh Sheth, Amar Mehta and Kaveh Solhekol: Manchester City‚Äôs intention remains to keep Ederson and James Trafford as their goalkeepers beyond the deadline. However, with Ederson into his final year and serious interest from Galatasaray, the club do not want to be left short and are making contingency plans. Prime among those is PSG‚Äôs Gianluigi Donnarumma and there is understood to have been initial contact between the clubs. There have been no negotiations yet, however, and the inquiry identified a gap in their respective valuations. PSG value the Italy stopper at between ¬£35m (‚Ç¨40m) and ¬£43m (‚Ç¨50m). Contrary to reports, City have not agreed personal terms with the player's representatives. Donnarumma waved goodbye to the PSG fans on Friday night as he was left out of the squad for their Ligue 1 win over Angers. But with a little over a week to go in the window, there is no guarantee he joins Man City unless Ederson leaves. Ederson was on the bench as City lost 2-0 at home to Spurs, with Trafford between the sticks and partly at fault for the second goal.

Title: Palace among clubs interested in Gallagher
Content: Crystal Palace are one of several Premier League clubs to have asked about Conor Gallagher‚Äôs situation at Atletico Madrid. Atletico are happy with the midfielder, however, and would have no interest in loaning him out. The Spanish club have given no encouragement to a sale either at this point, and so it is most likely that he stays. Gallagher signed for Atletico in a ¬£36m deal from Chelsea last summer. Palace are looking to make additions to replace Eberechi Eze‚Äôs role at No.10. They have been close to a deal with Leicester for Bilal El-Khannouss for some time while the likes of Christos Tzolis are also of interest.
