Title: Arsenal interested in Hincapie
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Arsenal are exploring a deal to sign Bayer Leverkusen defender Piero Hincapie, Sky Sports News understands. Although Arsenal‚Äôs focus remains on departures, they are working to be in a position to act on the left-sided centre-back. Hincapie has four years left on his Leverkusen deal and they would like to keep him, according to Sky in Germany. However, Sky in Germany report he has decided he wants to leave and the player has a ¬£52m (‚Ç¨60m) release clause in his contract.

Title: Antwerp winger to head to UK for Celtic move
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Royal Antwerp winger Michel-Ange Balikwisha is due to arrive in the UK this week to undergo a medical with Celtic. It‚Äôs understood a deal worth up to ¬£5m has been agreed by the clubs. The 24-year-old was not part of the squad that faced KV Mechelen yesterday, but was given a send-off on the pitch after the match. Balikwisha has verbally agreed terms with Celtic and will finalise the paperwork on his contract when he arrives in Glasgow.

Title: Into the final week!
Content: With now just seven days to go of one of the busiest transfer windows of all time, the Premier League has already set the record for the most money spent in one summer - with more to come. Here's what's still in the ether as we enter the final straight: Alexander Isak will not be in Newcastle United's squad for Monday Night Football‚Äôs clash against Liverpool - the club trying to sign him Newcastle remain keen to sign Brentford‚Äôs Yoane Wissa, who was not involved in the win against Aston Villa on Saturday Manchester United are advancing in talks over a ¬£17.3m deal for Royal Antwerp goalkeeper Senne Lammens Rasmus Hojlund was left out of Manchester United‚Äôs squad to face Fulham amid a potential move to Napoli Chelsea will press ahead with moves for Alejandro Garnacho and Xavi Simons this week if Nicolas Jackson, Christopher Nkunku and Tyrique George all leave Fulham, Crystal Palace and West Ham could be potential movers for Chelsea‚Äôs Raheem Sterling Gianluigi Donnarumma is training away from the PSG first-team squad amid interest from Manchester City - though City maintain they do not want to sell Ederson before the transfer deadline

Title: Napoli remain in Hojlund talks
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Napoli remain in talks with Manchester United over a deal to sign striker Rasmus Hojlund. Discussions are understood to be positive - with Napoli exploring a loan with an obligation to buy. It is thought Hojlund is very open to the move as negotiations continue with his camp. AC Milan failed with a move for Hojlund after they proposed a loan with an option to buy. And while United and Hojlund prefer a permanent element attached to any deal, the prospect of Champions League football is believed to be a big sway - regardless of what deal can be struck. Hojlund was once again omitted from the United squad for yesterday's game at Fulham.

Title: Roma consider move for Tsimikas
Content: Latest from Sky in Italy: Roma are interested in Liverpool‚Äôs Kostas Tsimikas if they lose left-back Angelino. It has been reported the Italian side are looking to sign the 29-year-old on loan with Anass Salah-Eddine also looking for a new club, according to Gazzetta dello Sport. Tsimikas made nine Premier League starts for the Reds last season, but is yet to feature for the club in 2025/26.

Title: Antwerp forced Lammens to miss game amid Man Utd interest
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Dharmesh Sheth: Royal Antwerp made the decision to remove goalkeeper Senne Lammens from the squad to face KV Mechelen yesterday, despite his desire to play the game. Sky Sports News understands the Belgian club did not want to harm the deal with Manchester United by risking a potential injury. Talks are advancing over a ¬£17.3m deal for the 23-year-old, with the payment structure under discussion. Personal terms for Lammens are not expected to be a problem.

Title: Rodgers is Forest's 'top target' if Nuno leaves
Content: Brendan Rodgers is Nottingham Forest's top target when they make their move for a new boss, reports The Sun. The Celtic manager is "hugely admired" by owner Evangelos Marinakis, the paper claims, with current head coach Nuno Espirito Santo suggesting on Friday his own relationship with him had soured. He insisted he wants to stay in charge of the club on Sunday, and revealed he will hold talks with owner Marinakis and transfer chief Edu Gaspar to resolve his future. "This narrative is absurd," Nuno said. "I wouldn't ever walk away. I don't know how many years I have of coaching, and many of you guys have known me for many years. Now I came to Wolves and the Championship. I love what I do. The moment that I don't enjoy it, it's over."

Title: Sevilla in loan talks over Everton's Patterson
Content: Sevilla are in talks to sign Nathan Patterson on a season-long loan from Everton. The 23-year-old, who has not yet been involved in Everton‚Äôs two Premier League games so far, made 10 league appearances last season. Patterson is therefore expected to go out on loan for regular first-team games. Sevilla right-back Juanlu Sanchez is in talks to sign for Napoli.

Title: Slot hints Liverpool may not need Isak
Content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has hinted his team does not need another forward this summer - as the club continue their pursuit of Alexander Isak. The Reds have seen a lot of change in their forward line with Darwin Nunez and Luis Diaz leaving the club - as well as the tragic passing of Diogo Jota. The club have recruited Hugo Ekitike in the centre forward area but Slot still believes they have two players for each forward position. ‚ÄúIt depends how you want to look at it,‚Äù said Slot. ‚ÄúIf you see Florian Wirtz as an attacking option as well, you can make it five [forwards available]. ‚ÄúYes we‚Äôve sold Darwin, we‚Äôve brought in Hugo, Luis is gone, but maybe you can see Florian as his replacement. Then you have Jeremie Frimpong who, when he is fit, is definitely an option to play as a winger as well. So then we end up at six. We have six players who can play in three positions. ‚ÄúI would consider Florian in more games for that position. There were games last season ‚Äì [Manchester] City away and Villa away ‚Äì where we did play with an extra midfielder, I think Curtis Jones. It depends not only on being an extra midfielder, but also the tactics and how the opposition line up.‚Äù

Title: Next Up: Max Dowman
Content: Max Dowman is the latest player in the Next Up series. The 15-year-old became the second-youngest Premier League player ever when he made an impressive cameo in Arsenal's 5-0 win over Leeds. Sky Sports

Title: Jesus returns to the Arsenal training pitch
Content: Gabriel Jesus has posted footage of him back on the Arsenal training pitch as he steps up his recovery from injury. The Brazilian forward has been out since January after picking up an ACL injury sustained in the FA Cup third round defeat to Manchester United. News of Jesus' return to the grass is a boost for Arsenal - who have just lost Kai Havertz to an injury. Bukayo Saka and Martin Odegaard were also injured in Arsenal's 5-0 win over Leeds, but Sky Sports News understands their injuries are not as bad as first feared.

Title: Fabregas confident Paz will stay at Como amid Spurs interest
Content: Cesc Fabregas is confident that Nico Paz will stay at Como this season amid rumours of an approach from Tottenham. Paz has been linked with a move to Spurs in recent weeks but continued his fine form for Fabregas' side with a goal and an assist in Como's 2-0 win over Lazio - including a superb free-kick strike. According to Fabrizio Romano, Spurs have seen a ¬£60m bid for Paz rejected by Como, as Thomas Frank's look for their next attacking midfield target after failed pursuits of Morgan Gibbs-White and Eberechi Eze. "I know he's very, very happy here," said Fabregas to Sky in Italy after the game. "He wants to become a top, top player." Speaking after the game, Paz said about the Como support: "Since the very first day, I've felt the love of the fans. "That has helped me a lot because on the pitch, I feel a sense of trust and that makes me calmer. I can say that I feel at home here and I'm grateful for all the fans and their constant support. "For me, it's an honour to give them the joy, which keeps me going."

Title: Howe: Newcastle won't be left without a striker this season
Content: Eddie Howe is confident that Newcastle will not leave him without a recognised striker as the Alexander Isak situation rumbles on. Isak remains away from the Newcastle picture as the Magpies prepare for their first Premier League home game of the season against Liverpool. Isak was the subject of a ¬£110m bid from Liverpool and has not featured for Howe's first-team in a match since the Magpies players returned from pre-season. Howe was asked if there is a situation where Isak is sold and Newcastle do not bring a replacement in. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think the club will allow that situation to happen,‚Äù  said Howe. ‚ÄúWe certainly can‚Äôt go through the season with no recognised striker at the football club ‚Äì and that‚Äôs no disrespect to Will Osula. ‚ÄúI think he‚Äôs doing really well and he‚Äôs progressing really well, but he‚Äôs got limited experience in the Premier League, although I‚Äôm really happy with his career progression. ‚ÄúBut Alex at the moment would be the only striker we have with Premier League history of goals and appearances and starts, so we can‚Äôt leave ourselves in that position.‚Äù

Title: Roma chief: Sancho doesn't have motivation to leave
Content: AS Roma transfer chief Frederic Massara has accused Jadon Sancho of not having the right "motivation" to complete a move to the club. Roma put in a ¬£20m bid to Manchester United for the English winger and held talks with the player - but are now seeking other options. "Sancho is a strong player, who was linked with all the Italian clubs," Massara told SportMediaset. "At the moment, [ a move] is only a suggestion, because it doesn't seem as if there are the right conditions and above all, the motivation to carry on these negotiations."

Title: Ramazani set for Valencia loan
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Zinny Boswell: Leeds United winger Largie Ramazani is expected to join Valencia on loan. Ramazani was left out of Daniel Farke's squad for Saturday's 5-0 defeat at Arsenal amid talks with the Spanish club. The 24-year-old, who has three years left on his Leeds contract, was also an unused substitute for Leeds' Premier League opener against Everton. Ramazani has struggled for game-time at Leeds since joining last August from Spanish side Almeria.  He has not started a league match for the club since suffering an injury in October 2024. Leeds are still in the market for attacking players - having already added Noah Okafor from AC Milan in an ¬£18m deal earlier this week - which could further limit his minutes. Ramazani will be working under former West Brom and Huddersfield boss Carlos Corberan if the deal goes through without a hitch.

Title: Amorim: Mainoo is competing with Fernandes in midfield
Content: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says Kobbie Mainoo is competing for Bruno Fernandes' spot in his team. The England international was an unused substitute for a second Premier League game in a row in the 1-1 draw against Fulham. With United needing a goal in the first half, Amorim took off Casemiro for Benjamin Sesko - leaving Mason Mount to play alongside Bruno Fernandes as a sitting midfielder. Asked why Mainoo did not come on - and why he was not preferred for that holding role, Amorim said: "He's fighting for the position now with Bruno. "I let Mason Mount there because we want to score a goal. When I changed, I felt the team needs to return to one holding midfielder near Bruno. He just needs to fight for the position with Bruno."

Title: Neville: Man Utd need to do business in midfield
Content: Gary Neville explains how his cautious optimism for Manchester United has been slightly checked after their draw to Fulham...

Title: Leeds agree deal with Leicester for Justin
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett and Zinny Boswell: Leeds United have agreed a deal with Leicester City for James Justin. Sky Sports News understands the total package is worth up to ¬£10m. The initial fee is ¬£8m plus ¬£2m in add-ons. The 27-year-old has already completed a medical with Leeds, who have been looking to strengthen at full-back. Talks with Leicester were delayed after Justin picked up an injury last weekend - but resumed once it became clear it was nothing serious. It‚Äôs thought Leicester are satisfied with the deal, because Justin has only one year left on his current contract. The price they demanded would have been much higher, if his contract were longer.

Title: Eze: I felt I was on trial at Arsenal when with Palace at the Emirates
Content: Eberechi Eze admitted he had a "feeling" he was going to end up back at Arsenal after completing a ¬£67.5m move to the Gunners. The England international made the move from Crystal Palace and in his first interview with the club, Eze said he feels like he has been "on trial" on his four visits to the Emirates Stadium with the Eagles. Eze is a boyhood Arsenal fan and was even on their academy books until he was released aged 13. "I've been on trial for four years, if I'm being honest," he said in an interview with Ian Wright on the club's official website. "Every time I came to Arsenal, I looked at the seat that I used to sit on when I used to come to games with my brothers, and I've said every single time: 'This is it - it's time, this is an opportunity'. "I'm not going to say I knew it was going to happen, but that's the feeling."

Title: Neville tells Fulham: Don't be disheartened over no signings
Content: Sky Sports' Gary Neville on the Gary Neville Podcast: "I thought Fulham were really good, really organised. "I know that there's a lot of talk at Fulham about the fact they've not made signings and there's a little bit of despair. When a club doesn't make signings everyone feels a little bit sort of downbeat about it. "But I looked at the Fulham team and I saw the Fulham bench, I thought: Fulham are okay, Fulham have got a good team already, they've got a good bench. "Liverpool famously didn't really add too much to their team last year and won the title and sometimes not adding players can be as good as adding players because you can sort of freshen it up for no apparent reason. "From what I saw today of Fulham, the team that started did well and the four or five that came on did really well and they actually made them a lot better. "You think of sort of Ra√∫l Jim√©nez coming off the bench, Emile Smith Rowe, Antonee Robinson, Harry Wilson, they were really bright and they were too sharp for United in that last period of the game. "So maybe one or two coming in this week would add a little bit of a spark that naturally a new signing does, but don't be too disheartened Fulham fans about it. "The team that I saw consistently do well last season, I think will do well this season. The fact that you've come back in two games, you've shown a spirit, you've played well, I think it was a good performance from Fulham in the end. "You think of the investment of Manchester United compared to Fulham and it's night and day, so you have to say that they're you know well out punching their weight and I thought they had a good day."

Title: Silva: We need to sign three players before Deadline Day
Content: Fulham boss Marco Silva wants to sign three players before the transfer window shuts on September 1. Benjamin Lecomte marks the only signing for the Cottagers of the summer, with Silva hoping for further reinforcements after admitting his squad is short in the certain areas. "We have eight or nine days to correct some things. We need to sign at least three players before the end of the market," he said after the 1-1 draw with Manchester United at Craven Cottage. "We have a lot of games and have injuries; in some positions, we are short."

Title: Has Frank stamped the Spursy out of Spurs already?
Content: Thomas Frank is living up to his name as a shrewd technician following Tottenham's impressive 2-0 win over Man City at the Etihad; Sky Sports' Laura Hunter takes a look at the positive impact of his 'aggressive' managerial style as Spurs show early-season promise Sky Sports

Content: Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo reacted angrily in his post-fight press conference to suggestions he is trying to engineer an exit from Nottingham Forest.

Title: Nuno on future: Hopefully we can move forward
Content: Nottingham Forest boss Nuno Espirito Santo to Sky Sports after he was seen applauding the club's fans at full-time: "The bond that has been created between the team and the fans, it‚Äôs there to stay. It‚Äôs unbreakable, due to the fantastic moments that we lived last season together. "It was a beautiful journey, it will stick in our memories forever. No matter what happens, we will always have this." On his talks this week with Edu Gaspar and Evangelos Marinakis: "I believe that‚Äôs the only way to operate at a football club: if everybody is one the same page and it‚Äôs happening in the same direction. "Hopefully we can do that this week and move forward and take these nonsense questions and the narrative that‚Äôs going around."

Title: Everton nearing Dibling deal, says Moyes
Content: Asked about Southampton winger Tyler Dibling, Everton boss appeared to confirm that the youngster will soon be joining the Toffees. Speaking in the press conference following Everton's 2-0 win over Brighton, Moyes said: ‚ÄúWell, I'm hearing that it's moving on and hopefully that will happen, yes.‚Äù

Title: Saka and Odegaard injuries not as bad as first feared
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Adrian Kajumba: Arsenal are optimistic Bukayo Saka and Martin Odegaard's injuries are not as bad as initially feared after the pair had scans on Sunday. The duo were both forced off in Arsenal‚Äôs 5-0 win against Leeds United on Saturday at the Emirates. The full severity of both players‚Äô injuries and whether they will be sidelined for Arsenal‚Äôs trip to champions Liverpool on Sunday is not yet confirmed but the early signs are understood to be encouraging for the Gunners following the initial tests. Winger Saka had to come off with a hamstring issue in the second period after he ‚Äúfelt something while sprinting". Manager Mikel Arteta added that ‚Äúfor Bukayo to come off, for sure it looks like something that is significant". Saka missed over three months last season after undergoing surgery on his right hamstring. The problem he picked up against Leeds is in his left leg. Captain Odegaard was withdrawn in the first half against Leeds with a right shoulder problem. Due to the treatment he is receiving on his injury, Arsenal were forced to postpone a store signing event Odegaard was due to attend on Monday.

Title: Nuno reveals how many more signings Forest need
Content: Nuno Espirito Santo has revealed what he wants from Nottingham Forest in the final days of the transfer window: two new full-backs and a goalkeeper. Amid multiple outbursts of frustration about Forest's window so far, Nuno guided his side to a 1-1 draw against Crystal Palace on Sunday. During the match, Forest were able to call on a quartet of new signings from the substitutes' bench including James McAtee, Arnaud Kalimuendo, Igor Jesus and Omari Hutchinson - with Douglas Luiz unused. "That‚Äôs basic for us," said Nuno about having those options from the bench. "Honestly, I say again that we need some more options, especially in the full-back [position] because we are always afraid if something happens to Ola [Aina] and Neco [Williams]. What are we going to do? Are we going to put a centre-half there? "So I hope this week we can complete the squad, and next a goalkeeper ‚Äì to really be safe. "Now we have good options and talented players and now we are trying to assess them. We finished almost with [solely] new players, but the flow is still not there. And with work and their belief, I think it can work out. "These three bodies that we need ‚Äì one goalkeeper and two full-backs ‚Äì in terms of numbers we will then be at 23 or 24 players. That‚Äôs what I think gives us the right balance to face what we have. "Now it‚Äôs only Premier League but in a quick turnaround we‚Äôre going to play Europe and cups. We need players."

Title: Grealish: I felt it was time for a change
Content: Jack Grealish has revealed he felt it was "time for a change" this summer after an explosive first start for Everton in their 2-0 win over Brighton. The former Man City winger left the Etihad Stadium this summer after four years to join David Moyes' Toffees on loan - and then set up both goals as Everton welcomed the Hill Dickinson Stadium era with victory over the Seagulls. It was the first time Grealish had set up two goals in a game for three years. "It was massive," said Grealish. "I absolutely loved my time at Man City - I had a great four years there and won a lot of things. "But this summer, I felt like it was time for a change and I've said before - as soon as I spoke to David Moyes on FaceTime, I knew this was the place that I wanted to come to. "There were lots of reasons and today shows why."

Title: Boyd questions Rangers' Igamane 'injury'
Content: Kris Boyd was not convinced Hamza Igamane refused to play due to an injury and said if the striker doesn't want to 'knuckle down' then Rangers should show him the door.

Title: Silva on Muniz, Pereira futures
Content: Fulham head coach Marco Silva to Sky Sports on Rodrigo Muniz starting today: "It is important for Rodrigo to be focused on what he can control and what we, as myself as a manager and a squad, can control.  They can play a bit in their heads, I know footballers, it's normal with the rumours around. "But if he's keeping focused on our football club, he's always an option to start or not or be in contention for the game. He was last week and this afternoon he starts. On Andreas Pereira being absent from the squad: "About Andreas, it's not just about him. Issa [Diop] is not involved as well, Martial [Godo] is not involved. "Andreas has been a very important player for us, this afternoon is he not involved. "I don't know what is going to happen before the end of the window but he could be involved on Wednesday [in the Carabao Cup] and next Saturday. "It's part of my decisions. Other players, like Issa who has been crucial for us, is not in contention to play. We decided also to have Jorge Cuenca on the bench."

Title: Amorim explains Sesko and Onana calls
Content: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim to Sky Sports about picking Altay Bayindir again over Andre Onana: "It's the same kind of decision a manager has to do. I try to see the game, I try to imagine the next game, I try to put the best players to win the game. So I did that." On Sesko being named on the bench: "We try to imagine what is going to happen during the game. Our game needs to be consistent, the way we control the game. We need to have options to play a different game from the bench. "Sesko has had two weeks with us so it's trying to understand everything. I try to understand how these small things are for the player. I talk to the players often and sometimes we need to wait a little bit in order to help the player. We just want to win the game."

Title: Martin reveals Igamane refused to come on vs St Mirren
Content: Russell Martin admitted he tried to introduce Hamza Igamane as a second half sub at St Mirren but the Rangers striker told him he was injured. Igamane has been linked with a move away from Ibrox in the final weeks of the window...

Title: Hojlund absent for Man Utd amid Napoli links
Content: Latest by Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Manchester United striker Rasmus Hojlund has once again been omitted from the squad for today's game at Fulham. Napoli are still working on a deal to sign Hojlund and are hopeful they can come to an agreement with United and the player. Napoli are exploring a loan with an obligation. Both United and Hojlund prefer a permanent element attached to any deal. Hojlund is open to the idea of joining Napoli as they can offer Champions League football. AC Milan were trying to sign Hojlund this month but could not come to an agreement.  United value Hojlund at around ¬£40m.

Title: Onana named on Man Utd bench
Content: Andre Onana was named on Manchester United's bench ahead of their Premier League game with Fulham. The United goalkeeper, who missed virtually the whole of pre-season due to injury - was not named in the matchday squad for the season opener against Arsenal. Altay Bayindir and Tom Heaton were chosen by Ruben Amorim in place of the Cameroon international - but Onana returned to the squad, albeit on the bench, for the trip to Craven Cottage. United have been linked with a move for Royal Antwerp goalkeeper Senne Lammens, which in turn could allow Onana to leave the club. United striker Benjamin Sesko was also named on the bench, as he awaits his first start for the club. United XI to play Fulham: Bayindir; Yoro, De Ligt, Shaw; Amad, Casemiro, B.Fernandes, Dorgu; Mbeumo, Cunha, Mount

Title: Chelsea's Garnacho and Simons moves hinge on exits of Jackson, Nkunku and George
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol: Chelsea will press ahead with moves to sign Alejandro Garnacho and Xavi Simons this week if Nicolas Jackson, Christopher Nkunku and Tyrique George all leave. Multiple clubs are trying to buy Jackson and Nkunku, and take George on loan. Seventeen players have left Chelsea this summer, bringing in around ¬£270m - but more need to go for Chelsea to carry on securing their top targets. If only one of those three leaves, they may only sign one more player - or none at all. Chelsea are expecting developments on departures after Monday Night Football, which sees Newcastle host Liverpool, live on Sky Sports.

Title: FC Midtjylland in advanced talks to sign Bournemouth's Billing
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam: FC Midtjylland are in advanced talks to sign midfielder Philip Billing from Bournemouth. The package being discussed is a permanent move worth around ¬£5m in total. The 29-year-old joined Bournemouth in the summer of 2019 for around ¬£14m from Huddersfield. Billing is keen to return to Denmark, and Bournemouth would save money on his high wages.

Title: 'Of course I want to stay' - Forest boss Nuno reveals talks to be held over future
Content: Nottingham Forest boss Nuno Espirito Santo says it is "nonsense" that he is trying to leave the club and has revealed he will hold face-to-face talks with owner Evangelos Marinakis and transfer chief Edu Gaspar amid intense speculation over his future. Asked by Sky Sports in his pre-match interview before Sunday's match at Crystal Palace whether he was trying to engineer an exit from Forest, he replied: "That's nonsense, that doesn't make any kind of sense. "The state is that we are focused on the game, that's more important." Questioned if he wants to continue as Forest coach, he said: "Of course! Of course." Asked whether he would hold face-to-face talks with Marinakis and Edu, he responded: "Yes. That's what we need to do, and we're going to do it. "Not today, of course, because it's the match, but soon, of course. The 51-year-old added: "There's no speculation around anything. What we have is to communicate - how we're going to approach the final days of the market, how we're going to approach the new season, how we're going to prepare our boys." Sky Sports

Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Celtic target Michel-Ange Balikwisha is not in the Royal Antwerp squad to face KV Mechelen today. The Hoops remain in talks with the Belgian club over a ¬£5m deal for the winger.

Title: Rowe joins Bologna after Marseille bust-up with Rabiot
Content: England U21 international Jonathan Rowe has joined Bologna in a permanent move from Marseille after he was transfer-listed by the French club following a bust-up with Adrien Rabiot. Rowe and Rabiot clashed in a heated argument after the opening Ligue 1 loss at Rennes, which was widely reported in France to have become physical. The ex-Norwich forward has now found a new club after sealing a ¬£16.9m (‚Ç¨19.5m) move to Serie A side Bologna, with Marseille having a 10 per cent sell-on clause in the deal.

Title: New Barca signing Rashford taken off at HT before stunning comeback
Content: Marcus Rashford was substituted at half-time before Barcelona left it late to beat Levante 3-2 in LaLiga. The Spanish champions went 2-0 down in the first half thanks to goals from Ivan Romero and Jose Morales, but battled back after the restart. Hansi Flick substituted Rashford and Marc Casado for Gavi and Dani Olmo at the break, with Pedri then pulling a goal back for Barca within three minutes of the changes with a long-range stunner. Ferran Torres netted the equaliser shortly after (52) and an Unai Elgezabal Udondo own goal in the 91st minute then secured all three points, lifting the visitors to the top of the table.

Title: Man Utd goalkeeper target Lammens not in Royal Antwerp squad today
Content: Manchester United target Senne Lammens is not in Royal Antwerp's squad for today's game against Mechelen. Man Utd are in talks with the Belgian club for the goalkeeper. Title: Sheff Utd agree Tanganga fee with Millwall
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Peter Smith and Sky in Italy's Luca Bendoni: Sheffield United have agreed a fee with Millwall for defender Japhet Tanganga. The clubs are now working to finalise the last details of the deal. Tanganga was left out of Millwall's squad for yesterday's 1-0 win at the Blades. Millwall boss Alex Neil said Tanganga was absent due to talks over a move away progressing. Neil said: ‚ÄúThe fact that I took him out of the game, obviously, things have moved on. "As far as I know, things are not at a conclusion stage just now. I had a good chat with Japhet earlier today. So we‚Äôll see what transpires over the next couple of days.‚Äù

Title: Arteta: Eze will create 'magic moments' for Arsenal
Content: New Arsenal signing Eberechi Eze will create ‚Äúmagic moments‚Äù and take the club to a different level, manager Mikel Arteta claimed. Eze was presented to the Emirates crowd in the minutes before Arsenal‚Äôs 5-0 demolition job of Leeds, which fired the Gunners to an early sight of the Premier League summit. Eze, who joined from Crystal Palace in a ¬£67.5m deal, could be handed his debut against Liverpool at Anfield next Sunday, live on Sky Sports. And Arteta said of his latest recruit: ‚ÄúHe (Eze) has the capacity to create these magic moments. He can do it from different positions, different situations. He‚Äôs got that flair and he‚Äôs got that charisma about him that is very contagious. ‚ÄúIt shows how much we want to take this club to a different level. His talent is unquestionable. He‚Äôs experienced in this league. The personality is unbelievable. ‚ÄúHe can play different positions. We know he can play as an attacking midfielder, right or left. He doesn‚Äôt care. And you can tell that what happened on that pitch (before the game) meant the world to him so I am delighted to have him.‚Äù

Title: Richarlison: I never wanted to leave Spurs
Content: Reinvigorated Tottenham forward Richarlison is loving working under meticulous new boss Thomas Frank at a club he never wanted to leave. The 28-year-old was mentioned as a possible makeweight in Spurs‚Äô attempt to sign Crystal Palace‚Äôs Eberechi Eze, but the forward has never had any intention of leaving north London. The Brazil international made that clear to Frank on his first day in the job, and the new manager‚Äôs supportive response was music to his ears. ‚ÄúIt was very important,‚Äù Richarlison said of that chat. ‚ÄúSince I got here, every time the transfer window opens, my name is circled as one who could leave ‚Äì going back to Brazil or wherever. ‚ÄúBut I‚Äôve always been focused on Tottenham and I‚Äôve never had a conversation about leaving. Content: Pep Guardiola has admitted he does not know what will happen with several players at Manchester City regarding their futures. Winger Savinho and defensive duo Manuel Akanji and Nathan Ake have been linked with moves away from the Etihad before the summer window closes on September 1. Guardiola added: "To be honest, I don't know what is happening with a few players - I don't know who is coming, who is staying, who is leaving, I don't know. "All the clubs I had the feeling that it is the same, we are not an exception. "Because the agents make the roles, the club have their opinions, the players have theirs, and after that we see what happens."

Title: Arteta: This is the best Arsenal team of my reign
Content: Mikel Arteta admitted he is walking around with a huge smile on his face after assembling what he now believes is the best squad of his Arsenal reign. Eberechi Eze's imminent ¬£67.5m arrival from Crystal Palace will take Arsenal's spending spree to ¬£250m amid a summer of transformation at the Emirates. Eze, who it is understood underwent a medical at Arsenal on Friday, is set to become the club's seventh new arrival with competition for places now fierce across the pitch. And when asked if he is now armed with the most complete squad of his near seven-year tenure, Arteta replied: "In terms of numbers and quality, yes for sure. "When you shake the tree and bring in more players, there are always things that can happen. "The spirit of that is to be more competitive, to be better and learn from the past, and with the squad we had last year we made life very, very difficult for ourselves if you look at the size and depth of other squads and the resources they had. "So, we all have big smiles on our faces with the understanding that we have done really well, but the market is not closed and we have to stay very alert because there are a lot of things that can happen still. But so far, so good."

Title: Redknapp: Eze miss a nightmare for Spurs - but typical of Levy
Content: Sky Sports' Jamie Redknapp: "It's a nightmare situation for them. It's unfortunately typical of what happens at Tottenham with Daniel Levy. "It was an opportunity to get someone across the line, they had two weeks - probably haggling, trying to mess around with the deal instead of just paying the money, saying 'this is the exit clause, this is what you've got to pay, this is what Eberechi Eze wants'. Get it done. "This is one of those players that is going to make such a difference. You've not got James Maddison, Dejan Kulusevski looks like he's out for a while. They've slept and Arsenal have come in. "It's a great move for Arsenal. I'm so disappointed because I thought he'd have been a magnificent No10 for Tottenham. He'd have been perfect for them. "But it's happened before, it happened with Morgan Gibbs-White earlier in the season and we've seen it again. Over-negotiating. Just get the deal done."

Title: Sancho 'confident' Man Utd exit will happen
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Jadon Sancho is confident he will secure a move away from Manchester United before the window closes, Sky Sports News understands. AS Roma are looking at alternatives after Sancho wanted to explore other options. Roma had previously made a bid worth ¬£20m and held talks with the player. Besiktas also showed an interest ‚Äì but, as it stands, they are not in active discussions. Borussia Dortmund are one of several clubs who want to be kept updated on his situation.

Title: Palace wanted Eze to stay but now targeting replacement
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol: Crystal Palace were happy for Eberechi Eze to stay at the club and the final decision to leave was made by the player. Nobody was pushing him out of the club. Palace did not want to sell Eze and they don‚Äôt want to sell defender Marc Guehi, who is a target for Liverpool. The Eagles were aware of interest in Eze and they had a price in mind if he was to leave. A ¬£67.5m deal was agreed with Arsenal, with the 27-year-old playmaker now edging closer to completing his move to the Emirates. They have been unable to move quickly to bring players in this summer because of the uncertainty surrounding which European competition they would be playing in this season. It was a challenge to make moves for players until the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) confirmed 11 days ago that they would be playing in the Conference League. It has also been difficult to sign players with question marks over the future of key players Eze and Guehi. Palace are now working hard to strengthen Oliver Glasner‚Äôs squad.

Title: 'Bizarre situation unfolding at Forest'
Content: Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett: "It's bizarre. It's an extraordinary situation at Nottingham Forest. They had a fantastic win on the opening day of the season and are in the Europa League group stages. "All things looked rosy. But suddenly, there are serious doubts about the future of Nuno Espirito Santo as the Nottingham Forest manager. "Evangelos Marinakis and the Nottingham Forest bosses are baffled by what he had to say to the media. There is no intention of sacking him as the manager. "However, those words today have caused people within the club to question his commitment in the job going forward. "It is extraordinary. I understand there is real anger at the timing of this. "The headlines as I see it are that there is a growing rift between the co-owner Marinakis and manager Nuno. "There is a real possibility that he will not be in charge of Forest for their second game of the Premier League season."

Title: EXCLUSIVE: Nuno comments baffle Marinakis and throw Forest future into doubt
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett: Sky Sports News has been told co-owner Evangelos Marinakis and the Nottingham Forest bosses are baffled by Nuno Espirito Santo‚Äôs latest comments, and there has been no intention of sacking him as the club‚Äôs manager. However, Nuno‚Äôs comments today, saying his relationship with the Forest owner is "not the same...it is not so good as it was (last season)‚Äù has caused some within the club to seriously question his commitment to the job. There is growing speculation elsewhere that he may now be trying to manufacture a situation where he is sacked. There is now a real possibility Nuno may not be in charge for Sunday‚Äôs game against Crystal Palace. There is also understood to be anger that the manager has spoken out like this, two days before a crucial and emotive game against Crystal Palace, who missed out on the Europa League while Forest progressed. Today‚Äôs comments from the Forest boss come a week after he said in an exclusive interview with Sky Sports ahead of the opening game that his squad was ‚Äúunbalanced‚Äù and ‚Äúvery, very far‚Äù from being ready for the new season. Since Nuno said that, Marinakis has sanctioned over ¬£118m worth of spending on four new players in the last week. That level of spending, the Greek billionaire feels, is proof that the manager still had his full confidence and backing. The root of Nuno‚Äôs upset is not wholly understood, however it‚Äôs thought he has a difficult relationship with Forest‚Äôs new global head of football, Edu, who was appointed last month to oversee the recruitment strategy for Forest and the other clubs in Marinakis‚Äô multi-club empire - Olympiakos in Greece and Rio Ave in Portugal. Nevertheless, despite Edu‚Äôs arrival, the club structure at the City Ground and Nuno‚Äôs role have not changed since he took over in December 2023. While he has had a say in transfer strategy and the players being targeted, his role has been to galvanise and organise that group of players as the head coach in charge of the first team. Title: Fulham, Palace, West Ham potential clubs for Sterling
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol and Rob Dorsett: Fulham, Crystal Palace and West Ham United could be potential clubs for Raheem Sterling as Chelsea work to present opportunities to the player before deadline day. Sterling is set to leave Chelsea before the window closes and his preference is to remain in London where his family are settled. Fulham would be an attractive option as would the chance to work with head coach Marco Silva. Sterling also had a very good relationship with West Ham head coach Graham Potter when they worked together at Chelsea. Palace would also represent a great opportunity to play regularly again in the Premier League. Chelsea signed Sterling from Manchester City three years ago in a ¬£47.5m deal and he has two years left on his contract. Sterling has not played for Chelsea since he scored against Bournemouth in the final game of the 2023/24 season.

Title: Moyes: We have money to spend on players - but no European football hindering us
Content: Everton manager David Moyes has money available for this transfer window but is struggling to spend it as the lack of European football is proving a barrier. So far the club have spent ¬£75m on six players, and while the loan signing of Manchester City winger Jack Grealish is by far the most high-profile, Moyes is finding it tough to bolster a squad which saw seven first-teamers depart in the summer. ‚ÄúWe have money to spend and we are trying to spend it,‚Äù he said of Everton's first competitive match in their new Hill Dickinson Stadium. ‚ÄúIt is not we don‚Äôt have the money to spend, we do have, but we‚Äôre finding it very difficult to spend the money at the moment. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve really gone for some top players but unfortunately we‚Äôve not been able to get them, so we might be finding ourselves coming down the ladder to find players because we are short on numbers generally. We are going to have to adjust.‚Äù Asked what was preventing Everton securing a lot of their targets, Moyes added: ‚ÄúAbsolutely Europe. If you have European football you attract a a different level of player, you are more attractive. ‚ÄúWe have got to build an awful lot of trust with players and maybe agents to show we are a club moving in the right direction. ‚ÄúI think our ownership have come in and helped us and they will give us a chance to spend more money but I believe the better players want European football, most of them or a lot of them do.‚Äù

Title: Man Utd in talks to sign goalkeeper Lammens
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Anthony Joseph: Manchester United are in talks with Royal Antwerp over the signing of goalkeeper Senne Lammens. The clubs are discussing the structure of a deal worth ¬£17.3m (‚Ç¨20m), Sky Sports News understands. Any deal for the 23-year-old - if it were to go through - is seen as a long-term strategy, rather than bringing in a new number one. Head coach Ruben Amorim has publicly said he is happy with his goalkeeping department. Furthermore, there have been no offers for either Andre Onana or Altay Bayindir. Title: Arteta's Eze joke showed why he will will love life at Arsenal
Content: Sky Sports News' Gary Cotterill from Mikel Arteta's press conference: "Mikel Arteta was in a good mood today. Even mum got a mention! "Every journalist. Every fan. Everyone, in fact, knows that Arteta won‚Äôt discuss a new player until that new player is officially in the building. "The fact Steve Parish and Oliver Glasner have already said goodbye to  Eberechi Eze is neither here nor there. "Arteta isn‚Äôt yet ready to say hello. However, he is up for a joust. "In fact, he enjoys a good bit of banter in the press conference room. "Was the ‚Äòthree-letter word‚Äô I wanted to talk about ‚Äòmum‚Äô he wondered. "No. Of course it wasn‚Äôt. A back-and-forth about Eze ensued. Well, not actually about Eze by name. "But the whole room knew what he meant. This kind of thing, the twinkle in Arteta‚Äôs eye, is one reason why I think Eze will flourish at Arsenal. "Players love Arteta. The vibe is excellent. The team ethic is superb. "Just like at Palace. He‚Äôs leaving one set of good guys for another. "For Eze, coming to Arsenal will be like coming home. In more ways than one. "Meanwhile, hidden away in a corner of the training complex, it looks to me like cameras are being set up for some club interviews and pictures. "Don‚Äôt tell anyone. "Mum‚Äôs the word."

Title: Hurzeler hopeful of transfer activity, but happy with forward options
Content: Fabian Hurzeler is hopeful Brighton will still be active during the rest of the transfer window, but is content with his forward options before Sunday‚Äôs trip to Everton. Title: Amorim: Clear some players want a different club
Content: Man Utd head coach Ruben Amorim has said it is 'clear' some players want a new club as they 'train for the next chapter. Before their pre-season tour to the USA, Amorim said five players - Marcus Rashford, Jadon Sancho, Alejandro Garnacho, Tyrell Malacia and Antony - would not be going along with the squad. Rashford has since joined Barcelona, but the latter four remain training at the club, although are not in included with the first team as it stands. Amorim said: "I know it's not a good thing to have players in this situation, but it's clear that they want to play in a different club. "We try to arrange everything for both parts to be happy. I have to imagine having training with the guys who I think are going to be the future and then the other guys are training for the next chapter. "When the window is closed, we have to receive the players and then new life, anything can happen."

Title: Amorim on transfers: It's not one in, one out in terms of players

"I'm just focused on the performance on Sunday and to try and win the game. "We talk every day. It's not a formal meeting, but we are talking about all the situations. We are trying to see every situation. "It's not an idea that 'these players are going to leave and then we'll receive another player'. We don't know what is going to happen but we are not waiting to take out someone to bring another player [in]. "One thing is not responsible for the other. "The players you're talking about are not players who are training with the group in this moment. "We have a group training so it's not going to affect a lot."

Title: Howe: No Isak this weekend, but I want to see him back in a Newcastle shirt

Isak went public with his criticism of 'broken promises' from the Newcastle hierarchy this week, suggesting he had been assured of a move away this summer. But the Magpies immediately hit back and refuted the claims, before Howe looked to calm tensions ahead of the Monday Night Football clash with Liverpool - the team most interested in buying the 25-year-old. "No, there's been no change [in Isak's situation]," he said. "He won't be part of the squad for this weekend's game. "My preference for these things is that it doesn't happen publicly because everything is better dealt with behind closed doors. "But needs must and the club has spoken, probably justifiably so in that moment. "Of course [I hope he can be re-integrated]. He is contracted to us, he's our player. "My wish is he would be playing on Monday night with us, but he won't be and that's regrettable. "But I want to 100 per cent see him in a Newcastle shirt."

Title: Celtic eye winger and striker reinforcements
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Celtic are pursuing a deal for Royal Antwerp winger Michel-Ange Balikwisha. Sky Sports News understands a fee in the region of ¬£5m will be enough to secure the 24-year-old. The Hoops are yet to replace striker Kyogo Furuhashi, who was sold to Rennes for ¬£10m in January and has subsequently moved to Birmingham City. They have signed Callum Osmand and Shin Yamada, but both appear to be project signings. While the club are looking to sign another striker, if they can bring in two new wingers, it would allow Daizen Maeda to play as the No 9 with Adam Idah, Yamada and Johnny Kenny as back-up. Celtic may have brought in club legend Kierney Tierney as their first-choice left-back ‚Äì but they need cover. Greg Taylor left Glasgow for Greece last month, when he joined PAOK after his contract expired. Tierney is unlikely to be able to play all fixtures this season, so the Hoops are looking for someone to share the role with him. Celtic know it is not as easy to sell for a second-choice left-back, but whoever they bring in will get a sufficient amount of game time. At the moment, it looks like the Hoops are searching for a young player to fill that role and develop. But if they can‚Äôt secure that, they may have to go with a more experienced option, or a loan.

Title: Celtic targeting wingers, striker and a left-back - targets identified

They may also be forced into the market for a right-back depending on the severity of Alistair Johnston‚Äôs hamstring injury, which he picked up last night. The Canada international had scans today and is awaiting the results. Many of the top-level targets that Rodgers and the recruitment team want in are waiting to see if Celtic make the Champions League before making a decision. Celtic need a winger to replace Nicolas Kuhn, who left for Como for ¬£16.5m this summer ‚Äì and also provide cover for Jota, who is out injured until January. Feyenoord winger Calvin Stengs fits that bill. The Scottish champions have made an enquiry for the Netherlands international but are unlikely to make a move unless they secure Champions League football, as it would require a sizeable fee and big wages to sign him. Sky Sports News understands the Hoops are still in the race for Go Ahead Eagles attacking midfielder Jakob Breum. Fresh talks have been held today for the Denmark U21 international. It‚Äôs understood the Eredivisie club are looking for at least ¬£5m for Breum. Celtic have already had two bids rejected ‚Äì the latest offer being ¬£2.6m last month. The 21-year-old, who can also play on both wings, has two years left on his contract.

Title: Parkinson: Doyle signing is a 'statement of intent'
Content: Wrexham boss Phil Parkinson believes the eye-catching acquisition of Manchester City defender Callum Doyle is a "statement of intent" from the ambitious Championship new boys. Wrexham have paid an initial fee of ¬£5m for the England U21 international, with ¬£3m in add-ons. Sky Sports News City have a buyback clause of ¬£7.5m for Doyle and also inserted a 25 per cent sell-on clause into the deal. The Red Dragons have been busy this summer as Ryan Reynolds and Rob Mac's men rebuild for their first season back in English football's second tier since the 1981-82 campaign. Doyle is Wrexham's 10th permanent signing since promotion and follows last week's club-record ¬£10m purchase of Nathan Broadhead from Ipswich. "Callum's a player we've obviously been looking at over the summer," Wrexham boss Parkinson said. "Always difficult deals to get because there's a player in demand. We've had to compete with some really good clubs to bring him here. "He's only 21, he's got a lot of Championship experience, an England Under-21 international. I think he's a player of huge potential. "This hasn't broken the transfer record. It's in line with other transfers we've made already this summer. "But I think it is a statement of intent that we've won the signature over some established Championship clubs, who've been in the division and Premiership before recently, and obviously clubs in other European leagues."

Title: Merse: Selling Jackson is a mistake - he'll come back to haunt Chelsea
Content: Sky Sports' Paul Merson on The Premier League Show: "I like Jackson, I've seen a lot of him. He's a bit messy and his touch will be poor - but I'd love to play with him. The position I played in, I'd love to have played with him because he opens games up. If I were Aston Villa or Newcastle, I'd buy them all day long. He goes the other way, and on a big pitch like Newcastle's you could get Bruno Guimaraes or Sandro Tonali more on the ball. "If you asked a lot of defenders, I reckon after the game - even though he is messy and needs more coaching - I don't think there would be too many centre-halves who would say: that was easy. He gives you a hard time, he's willing to run. "I'm pretty shocked with Chelsea. He made Cole Palmer and Palmer made Jackson. They worked as a pair and really stretched the game and it got Palmer on the ball and let him do his stuff. "Now I don't see that. Joao Pedro  wants to come short and compresses Palmer's game. I know we're one game in, btu Palmer is going further and further back to get the ball. You don't want him there, you want him around the box as he can weave his magic as he is the X-Factor. "I don't think this is a great move for Chelsea. I think it's a mistake. Jackson could come back to haunt them if he went to Newcastle of Villa, by scoring a few goals."

Content: Sky Sports' Paul Merson speaking on The Premier League Show: "I don‚Äôt think he walks straight in and plays this weekend against Leeds, but when they put their best team out against Liverpool and Manchester City at home, he plays. He‚Äôs the X-Factor, the missing piece of Arsenal winning the Premier league. "The pressure is now on to win the Premier League. Mikel Arteta has bought amazingly. They needed a holding midfielder, they bought a top-drawer one in Martin Zubimendi. They needed a centre forward, they bought a centre forward. Now they‚Äôve bought someone who can break defences and who can get into a lot of teams. "I watched Arsenal a lot, when the pressure is on they find it hard to break teams down. They rely on Martin Odegaard, when he doesn‚Äôt do it ‚Äì and he didn‚Äôt do it last season ‚Äì they struggle. Bukayo Saka got injured, he‚Äôs the other one they rely on. But Eze is different class. Sky Sports "In my opinion, he‚Äôs a more significant signing than Viktor Gyokeres. With Eze in the team, he makes things happen. He‚Äôs not going to run around, the fans need to understand that. He‚Äôs like Mesut Ozil, who just glides around. He‚Äôs not going to track back 60 yards. But give him the ball, he will make things happen. "These Arsenal players need to win the Premier League, the more top drawer players they get in at the top end of the field, the better they will be. When you play for your Arsenal, Chelseas, Liverpools and Man City, you kick off and they put 10 players behind the ball. You have to break them down. "Eze just glides past people, he doesn‚Äôt even touch the ground sometimes. He wins free-kicks, he makes things happen. No disrespect to Palace where he was outstanding, he can play with even more top quality players now and go up a level. "I‚Äôm so excited, I don‚Äôt get too excited for signings too often. I thought if Liverpool go and get Isak it would be another year of second for Arsenal, but they are right, right, right in it now."

Title: Can Isak get out of his Newcastle contract?
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett: From a legal standpoint, there is very little Alexander Isak can do to get out of his Newcastle contract. Reports have suggested the striker had a verbal agreement with the club to leave this summer. Newcastle denied that any such commitment was made to the player in their statement responding to Isak‚Äôs post on Instagram. Legally, such an arrangement ‚Äì if it did exist - is irrelevant to a player‚Äôs contract and in no way binding under Premier League rules. There are only two scenarios in which a player can annul their contract ‚Äì when they haven‚Äôt been paid or the club has breached the terms of the contract- and neither seem to be valid in Isak‚Äôs case.

Title: Deadline Day countdown!
Man Utd shut down summer interest in me - Maguire
Content: Harry Maguire says it would be ‚Äúsilly‚Äù to leave rebuilding Manchester United right now after revealing Ruben Amorim‚Äôs side shut down summer interest in him. United triggered a one-year extension in the 32-year-old's contract at the turn of the year and have rebuffed summer interest in the England international, who has yet to speak to the club about his future beyond this campaign. ‚ÄúLast year was the clause in their hands so there was no option for me there,‚Äù Maguire said. ‚ÄúThere was no talking. It was just they activated it and it got extended. ‚ÄúThis year, obviously I‚Äôm up at the end of the year. I‚Äôm pretty sure the club have made it aware this summer that I can‚Äôt leave the club on any terms with other clubs enquiring about my things and my position with my contract. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure over the next few months they‚Äôll sit down, and we‚Äôll have to have a conversation about where we want to go and if they want to extend or obviously the transfer window will open again in January. ‚ÄúObviously I have something in my mind about what I want to do and what I want to be. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to put it out there to everybody but it‚Äôs an amazing club to play for and you‚Äôd be silly if you wanted to jump out of it as soon as you could.‚Äù Asked whether United indicated this summer he was staying despite interest, Maguire added: ‚ÄúYes. I think there was a couple of clubs who maybe enquired or spoke with them and I think they got a quick response. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre in a good place, positive as a club and I feel like the hierarchy has come in and Jason (Wilcox, director of football) and the manager, I feel like they‚Äôre taking it in the right direction."

Title: Electric Eze will unlock defences for Arsenal
Content: Sky Sports' Peter Smith: Eberechi Eze is electric. The 27-year-old is a delight to watch with his poise and swagger on the ball and craft to open up defences, not to mention his penchant for scoring spectacular strikes himself. He finished last season as one of the hottest prospects in the country, scoring in six games in a row, including both the FA Cup semi-final and final at Wembley as he helped inspire Crystal Palace to their first ever major honour. Last season wasn‚Äôt all plain sailing, though. ‚ÄúI think Ebere has had a strange season,‚Äù said Palace boss Glasner at the end of March. ‚ÄúHe hasn‚Äôt had many goals in the Premier League and he has been unlucky, but he keeps going. He‚Äôs also struggled with strange injuries.‚Äù Those comments came after Eze had ignited Palace in a FA Cup tie at Fulham, scoring one and setting up another. That standout display came on the back of a first goal for England. Fit and full of confidence, Eze was back to his best during the run-in. It is that livewire maverick Arsenal will hope can unlock deep defences and bring a spark to their previously at-times predictable patterns of attack. He offers something completely different to Leandro Trossard and Gabriel Martinelli, the current wide left options and Viktor Gyokeres will be relishing the prospect of latching onto the type of passes which have proved so productive for Jean-Philippe Mateta. After being released by the Gunners as a 13-year-old, Eze will be motivated to seize a second-chance in north London ‚Äì and, in his prime, he looks set to do just that and make a big impact for Mikel Arteta.

Title: What can Bournemouth expect from Adli?
Content: Sky Sports' Adam Bate: The skilful Amine Adli looks a coup for Bournemouth given his involvement in Bayer Leverkusen‚Äôs domestic double under Xabi Alonso, a season in which he reached double figures for goals in all competitions. At the age of 25, he is coming into his peak years as a player. Capable of playing anywhere across the front line, the left-footed Adli has had most of his success playing from the left. He had a key role in Leverkusen‚Äôs cup success and sparked the comeback against Stuttgart that helped preserve their unbeaten Bundesliga run. Last season was more difficult for Adli as his minutes were restricted. Although he featured in 20 of their Bundesliga matches, only half a dozen of those appearances came from the start and he was on the pitch for less than a quarter of the campaign. Statistically, that makes him a tricky player to evaluate. He ranked among the top 25 players in the Bundesliga last season for passes completed in the final third, dribbles completed and possessions won in the final third ‚Äì all of that based on per-90 data. Some analysts take the view that appearing as a regular substitute can favourably distort those numbers but essentially Adli has hinted that he can do the sort of things that Andoni Iraola demands at Bournemouth. Be creative and press high at pace. More of that will be expected of him in a Bournemouth shirt but crucially they are acquiring a player who has been a little frustrated at his lack of opportunities to impress. This could be a case of the right move at the right time for player and club.

Title: Glasner: No issue with Guehi after Chelsea game
Content: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner has played down the idea of a spot between he and club captain Marc Guehi following the 0-0 draw with Chelsea on Sunday. Guehi has been linked with a move to Liverpool this summer, and has just one year left on his contract at Selhurst Park. The pair appeared to exchange looks at one another as Guehi left the pitch, but his manager has said that his emotional reaction was to do with being upset with the result. "He was upset that we didn't win the game, and I love this," Glasner explained. "Emotionally after the game you are exhausted and sometimes I shouted to my colleagues, it's just that there wasn't a camera. Marc was just disappointed that the goal was disallowed and we didn't win the game. "I think it was reported in a negative way. I see it as completely the opposite. I see it as the best sign Marc could show as to how ambitious we all are."

Title: Analysis: Huge focus on Gyokeres amid Havertz setback
Content: Sky Sports' Sam Blitz: Just days ago, the topic of debate was which striker out of Kai Havertz or Viktor Gyokeres should start in Arsenal's big game against Liverpool next week. "I think Mikel Arteta will go back to Havertz in the big games," said Jamie Carragher. "I would be very surprised if Havertz doesn't play." Now it seems that decision has been taken out of Arteta's hands. No matter the severity of this Havertz knee injury, the German will be a major doubt for the trip to Anfield - placing a huge focus on Gyokeres in the first big game of his Arsenal career. But once again, Arsenal are talking about injuries after it derailed them last season. Havertz, Gabriel Jesus and Bukayo Saka all missed over a dozen league matches due to injury last term - only the latter is fully fit at the start of this one. Arsenal do know that Mikel Merino can fill in as an emergency option but that was an awkward scenario last season which Arteta and the Arsenal team made the most of. Playing the Spaniard as a No 9 again is a situation they are wanting to avoid, if possible. What this situation does tell us, though, is that Arsenal will have to get Gyokeres on song soon, after a slightly underwhelming Premier League debut at Manchester United last weekend. Saturday's game against Leeds - which Gyokeres will almost certainly start now - is important in the early context of Arsenal's season. Goals are needed. Sky Sports

Title: Liverpool have capacity to keep spending big
Content: Financial expert Kieran Maguire speaking on Sky Sports News' Transfer Talk: "Part of the reason why Liverpool can afford Isak is that when you sign a player, you spread the cost over the life of the contract. "Liverpool have done really well this season as far as the summer trading is concerned on the exit door as well. Diaz has gone, Nunez has gone. Quansah has gone. He was an academy player so that's pure profit. "So Liverpool, who always operate a very smart system and are never in danger of PSR issues have a lot of capacity to spend money as far as this summer is concerned."

Title: What would it take for Newcastle to sell Isak now?
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: "Newcastle talked last night about the conditions of a sale. "There were two conditions. "One, the valuation of the player is ¬£150 million. "That is what Newcastle's valuation is. I still think they would probably do a deal for a little bit less than that. But I think Liverpool's ¬£110m offer that landed a few weeks ago is way short. So if Liverpool were to really seriously want Isak, they would have to come to the table with a higher bid. "The second is that Newcastle need to find a replacement. They tried on Benjamin Sesko, they tried on Hugo Ekitiki, failed on both of those. "They're actually even struggling right now, as we can see, to bring in a replacement for Callum Wilson, who left on a free contract. We've been telling you for weeks now that they've been trying to sign Yoane Wissa from Brentford. But he's seen as the Callum Wilson replacement rather than the Alexander Isak replacement. "So they can't even get the second striker in, if you like. "If they were able to land Wissa in the next few days - and I am expecting a bid in the next couple of days - and Liverpool came to the table offering ¬£130m then Newcastle might have a decision to make. "However, it would leave them very light on striker reinforcements."

Title: 'Newcastle tried to find Isak replacements this summer'
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: "Newcastle have tried to facilitate [Isak's exit]. They tried to sign Hugo Ekitiki, who would have been a like-for-like replacement. They tried to sign Benjamin Sesko, who would have been a like-for-like replacement. And they've got down, right down to the nitty-gritty in both those deals and lost out, ironically, to Liverpool and then to Manchester United. "Newcastle feel that they have tried. But just from the tone, the wording of their statement last night, it feels very much like a resignation that they're unable to or have been unable to get a replacement in with just under two weeks of the window left. "It feels very much like they're digging their heels in and Alexander Isak will remain a Newcastle United player beyond the end of the transfer window. "What will be really interesting will be if and when Isak returns to the pitch wearing black and white stripes."

Title: 'He only wants Chelsea' | Garnacho turns down Bayern
Wissa not seen as direct Isak replacement
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: "Yoane Wissa was seen as the Callum Wilson replacement, not the Alexander Isak replacement. If they were able to land Wissa in the next few days, and I am expecting a bid in the next couple of days and Liverpool came to the table offering ¬£130 million then Newcastle might have a decision to make. "If they are unable to bring in Wissa, then Isak will not be going anywhere and that was what the statement was saying last night. "If they were to find a gem with two weeks of the window to go, and bring in Wissa and Liverpool came to the table with a significantly higher bid, then I think Isak will be allowed to go." "I think there's been a lot of people saying throughout this summer that Isak is not for sale. He's not for sale in that Newcastle don't want to lose him, but they were aware that he was unhappy, they were aware he was agitating to leave. They have tried to facilitate that, but the options for them in this window for a striker have been few and far between, and the two big-name strikers they have gone for, Ekitike and Sesko, they have lost out at the bitter end of tense negotiations. "It feels very much like Newcastle have been angered by what Isak said on his social media last night, and that they will dig their heels in. "I think the only way that Isak could go between now and the end of the transfer window is if they either manage to get two strikers in, which is going to prove really, really difficult, and Liverpool up their offer significantly, or B, they manage to bring in Wissa and Liverpool up their offer significantly, I think there's a small chance of that happening."

Title: ICYMI: Newcastle respond to Isak statement
Content: Newcastle have released a statement in response to Alexander Isak's comments. It reads: "We are disappointed to have been alerted to a social media post by Alexander Isak this evening. We are clear in response that Alex remains under contract and that no commitment has ever been made by a club official that Alex can leave Newcastle United this summer. "We want to keep our best players, but we also understand players have their own wishes and we listen to their views. As explained to Alex and his representatives, we must always take into consideration the best interests of Newcastle United, the team and our supporters in all decisions and we have been clear that the conditions of a sale this summer have not transpired. We do not foresee those conditions being met. "This is a proud football club with proud traditions and we strive to retain our family feel. Alex remains part of our family and will be welcomed back when he is ready to rejoin his teammates."

Title: 'The relationship can't continue' - Isak goes public on Newcastle future
Content: Liverpool target Alexander Isak says he "can't continue" at Newcastle and has accused the club of "broken promises". The Magpies striker has broken his silence, releasing a statement on Instagram in which he said he has "lost trust" in the club. He said: "I'm proud to be recognised by my fellow professionals with a place in the PFA Premier League Team of the Season for 2024/25. "First and foremost I want to thank my teammates and everyone at Newcastle United who has supported me along the way. "I'm not at the ceremony tonight. With everything going on, it didn't feel right to be there. "I've kept quiet for a long time while others have spoken. That silence has allowed people to push their own version of events, even though they know it doesn't reflect what was really said and agreed behind closed doors. "The reality is that promises were made and the club has known my position for a long time. To now act as if these issues are only emerging is misleading. "When promises are broken and trust is lost, the relationship can't continue. That's where things are for me right now - and why change is in the best interests of everyone, not just myself." Title: Farke: Leeds need to sign more quality up front

Title: Brentford's Wissa angry that move to Newcastle has not materialised yet
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Yoane Wissa remains angry that a transfer to Newcastle from Brentford has still not materialised. He believes the club is being difficult, and the move Wissa made on Monday in deleting all traces of Brentford from his social media was a representation of his current stance. Newcastle have been expected to move again for Wissa, despite Brentford's club-record signing of Dango Ouattara giving no guarantees he would be sold, but it has not come yet. There has been no new contact between Newcastle and Brentford so far this week, and there is no new bid on the table as things stand. Wissa has been of interest to several clubs since January and has been talking to Brentford about a potential exit since then - and he is adamant he was given assurances he would be allowed to go. Brentford sources insist he has never been given any such assurances, however. The club are willing to engage with Newcastle, but his valuation must be met, and they want to replace him. Wissa believes all his actions - including his intention never to play for the club again - are warranted. Brentford have not fined or disciplined him, and Wissa feels that is because he has done nothing wrong.

Hobbs has already reportedly started work and will be involved in plans to make new signings before the summer transfer deadline on September 1.

Content: Leeds boss Daniel Farke is convinced the signing of Dominic Calvert-Lewin is a gamble worth taking. The 28-year-old striker, hindered by injury in recent seasons, became a free agent this summer, ending nine years at Everton and signing a three-year deal with Leeds on Friday in a bid to revive his career. He could make his debut against his former club on Monday when the two sides launch their Premier League campaigns at Elland Road, live on Sky Sports. Farke said: "Let's be open about it. "But the second part of the truth is that if he had his prime season last season, he wouldn't be on the market for us. "He wouldn't be a free agent and affordable for a newly promoted side, so you have to think about the balance of risk and reward."

Title: Milan director: Hojlund is a good option for the club
Content: AC Milan sporting director Igli Tare believes Rasmus Hojlund is a "good option" as they push to sign a striker in this window. Tare is adamant that a striker must be brought in before the window shuts and says Juventus' Dusan Vlahovic is another potential target for Milan. "Hojlund is a good option for us," Milan's sporting director told SportMediaset before Sunday's Coppa Italia win over Bari. "We're evaluating him these days, but the transfer market is unpredictable.
