"I've been following it pretty closely all the way back to Arsenal's initial interest two months ago. "It's another angle that they haven't followed through which did seem to leave a clear way for Spurs. Up to about 5pm or 6pm yesterday it sounded like Spurs were getting closer. "I heard last night that it encountered a few difficilties - not the kind which could make it collapse as sometimes happens. "But there has been a slight twist this morning, that Palace are going to consider starting him; that would be a u-turn because the expectation had been that he wouldn't play. "It doesn't suggest that the transfer is about to collapse, but it does hint that it could have a while to go yet."

Title: WATCH: Pep says City must sell more players
Could De Gea end up back at Man Utd?
Content: Man Utd are making "hush-hush" checks about a remarkable return for keeper and club legend David de Gea, reports The Sun. De Gea left Old Trafford in 2023 after 13 years in the north west, having made 545 appearances for the club in that time. The 34-year-old made a "good impression" in Fiorentina's 1-1 draw at Man Utd earlier this month, the paper adds - and claims they have been alerted to a clause in his contract which means he could leave Italy for a "relatively small sum".

Title: WATCH: Diaz doubles Bayern's lead on debut!
McAtee joins Forest in ¬£30m deal from Man City
Content: James McAtee has signed for Nottingham Forest from Manchester City in a deal worth up to ¬£30m. McAtee has signed a five-year contract and becomes Forest's second signing of the day following the arrival of Omari Hutchinson. Sky Sports News understands that sell-on and buy-back clauses have been included in the agreement. Forest initially had a bid in the region of ¬£25m rejected.

Title: Brentford sign Ouattara for club-record deal
Content: Brentford have signed forward Dango Ouattara from Bournemouth on a five-year contract in a club-record deal of ¬£42m. Bournemouth were reluctant to sell, but after Ouattara made it clear he wanted to leave, the club had no option but to allow him to go for a price they feel is fair market value, which includes add-ons. The transfer surpasses Brentford's previous club-record deal of ¬£30m when they signed striker Igor Thiago from Club Bruges last summer. Ouattara joined Bournemouth from Lorient in January 2023 and has made 88 appearances, scoring 11 goals and providing nine assists. Sky Sports

Title: Rangers hold talks with Brentford over Meghoma
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Sahil Jaidka and Adrian Kajumba: Rangers have held initial talks with Brentford over a deal to sign left-back Jayden Meghoma on loan. The 19-year-old moved to the Premier League club from Southampton in a deal worth around ¬£10m last year, and spent last season on loan at Preston. Ibrox boss Russell Martin worked with Meghoma briefly during his time at Southampton and the England youth international is highly rated. Rangers are looking to sign a left-back with Jefte closing in on a move to Brazilian club Palmeiras. The clubs are working to finalise a deal that would see Rangers net a sizeable profit, after the player moved to Glasgow for around ¬£800,000 last summer. Ahead of Rangers‚Äô League Cup match against Alloa, Martin said Jefte is ‚Äúlikely‚Äù to depart, after the player was left out of the club‚Äôs Champions League play-off squad. Jefte has played 56 times for Rangers, scoring one goal and providing four assists.

Title: Rangers pull out of move to for Betis defender
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Sahil Jaidka: Rangers have pulled out of a deal to sign defender Nobel Mendy from Real Betis. The defender was in talks to move to Ibrox, but it has fallen through after Rangers were unable to reach an agreement. Russell Martin and co are looking at other potential signings. Rangers have made nine new additions this summer.

Title: Eze might not face Chelsea amid Spurs interest
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas, Dharmesh Sheth, Michael Bridge and Kaveh Solhekol: Eberechi Eze's involvement in Crystal Palace's opener against Chelsea on Sunday, live on Sky Sports, is in question amid a potential move to Tottenham. Spurs are in discussions with Palace over a deal as they look to add a new No 10 before the deadline. A bid has not yet been made and Palace value him at ¬£70m, with two years left on his contract, but Eze has been one of Spurs' top targets this summer. Palace boss Oliver Glasner said on Friday that he expected Eze to be involved but admitted things could change quickly. Eze was one of several players Arsenal looked into in the first few weeks of the window. Since then, their focus was on other positions. Arsenal's priority at the moment has switched to player departures. Spurs, who beat Burnley 3-0 in their season opener, also want to sign another winger and interest remains in Savinho at Manchester City.

Title: Kalimuendo set for Forest medical
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas: Arnaud Kalimuendo is flying into the UK for a medical with Nottingham Forest on Sunday. The club have agreed a ¬£26m (‚Ç¨30m) deal with Rennes for the striker. Forest also signed Omari Hutchinson from Ipswich  for ¬£37.5m on Saturday.

Title: Silva: Muniz deserves 'respect' for playing amid uncertain future
Content: Marco Silva says Rodrigo Muniz deserves "respect" for earning Fulham a point at Brighton with a late equaliser amid speculation over his future at the club. The striker has been strongly linked with a move away from the club following an approach from Atalanta, but rescued a draw for Fulham after coming off the bench. After the full-time whistle, the travelling fans sang "We want you to stay" and boss Silva also praised the striker. "I think [Muniz] deserves respect for [playing despite speculation over his future]," said Silva. "The week from him was very, very good in terms of preparation, work ethic and all that stuff was very good and as simple as that, of course he was able to help the team. "He was rewarded for that, he helped the team. I know Rodrigo very well but he show for everybody - amid the noise around him - how he's a professional football player and how he respects myself, the team-mates as well. "Sometimes it's not the rumour around themselves, the people around themselves, you are talking about their jobs as well and a lot of things around but I think he's going to handle in the future even better this type of moments."

Title: Morrison: West Ham need new signings
Content: Clinton Morrison on Soccer Saturday after West Ham's 3-0 loss at Sunderland: "West Ham need new signings. "Their next game is at home against Chelsea. They're struggling. "Sunderland have been outstanding. It's a hard place to go with the atmosphere and first game back in the Premier League." During commentary of the match on Soccer Saturday, Morrison simply concluded: "West Ham are struggling."

Title: Wrexham boss wants more signings
Content: Phil Parkinson wants Wrexham to sign more players after falling to a second straight Championship defeat against West Brom. ‚ÄúThe lads we‚Äôve brought in at the moment are really good and I‚Äôm pleased with the way they‚Äôve settled in,‚Äù said Parkinson. ‚ÄúWe probably do need a couple more players, we‚Äôre looking at that. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs ongoing, it‚Äôs obviously busy for all managers and clubs at the moment when you‚Äôre preparing for games and looking to improve the squad.‚Äù

Title: 'Eze closing in on Spurs move'
Content: Eberechi Eze is closing in on a move to Tottenham, reports the Press Association. The England international has reportedly reached an agreement with Crystal Palace that he will not play for them at Chelsea on Sunday. Eze was a critical player as Palace won the FA Cup last season and also featured as the Eagles saw off Liverpool to lift the Community Shield last weekend. The 27-year-old ‚Äì who has long been linked with a move across London ‚Äì joined Palace in 2020 from QPR and has gone on to win 11 England caps.

Title: Analysis: Fans show anger at Isak with transfer in balance
Content: Sky Sports News' Keith Downie at Villa Park: "The growing sense of frustration and anger from the Newcastle fans was evident at the end of the game when they sang 'There's only one greedy *******' as the players left the field. "Eddie Howe had asked the fans to back the team. They left it till the end to make their feelings clear. "Howe said afterwards the door is still open for Alexander Isak, and that only one person can give a resolution to the situation, and they need one. However, the strength of feeling from the Newcastle fans would, for me, make it even more difficult for Isak to return. "Could their minds be changed? Time will tell. But I felt watching that today, it was such a sad situation. Newcastle had all their players available, apart from their talisman. With Isak in the team, they would have won. "The supporters are upset, they're angry. They don't understand why a player earning ¬£150,000 per week can be so unhappy. They would give their right arm to be the No 9 for Newcastle, and they can't get their heads around why Isak wouldn't want to be, or why he would conduct himself the way he has. "There are young kids with 'Isak 14' shirts everywhere you look in Newcastle. There's fans with Isak tattooed on their arm because he scored in the cup final. "He reduced tens of thousands of them to tears with that goal against Liverpool. Who would have thought that, just a few months later, he would have angered them the way he has? "Where do Newcastle go from here? It's hard to tell. I still think it's 50/50 whether he leaves or not. If he stays, it feels like this circus will carry on and that's something Howe will not want. He said today he's made it perfectly clear what his stance is - he wants Isak back. But he's going to have to do the mother of all man-management jobs on Isak to get him back firing. "If I had been given a pound for every time I had been asked what's happening with Isak, I could have bought him myself."

Title: Forest sign Hutchinson from Ipswich in ¬£37.5m deal
Content: Nottingham Forest have completed the signing of Omari Hutchinson from Ipswich in a ¬£37.5m deal. Forest initially had a bid worth ¬£35m rejected by Ipswich while Brentford also held an interest in the forward earlier in the window but failed to agree a deal. Hutchinson signed for Ipswich in June last year, having enjoyed a successful loan spell from Chelsea in which he helped the club win promotion to the Premier League. The 21-year-old made 32 appearances last season, scoring three goals and providing two assists. Sky Sports

Title: Ederson absent from Man City squad
Content: Ederson has not been named in Manchester City's squad for their season-starting game at Wolves, live on Sky Sports, amid doubts about his future. Galatasaray have made an offer of around (¬£8.6m) ‚Ç¨10m for the Brazil goalkeeper. Man City manager Pep Guardiola said Ederson's absence is due to illness. "He had stomach problems yesterday, he vomited and didn‚Äôt feel good," said Guardiola. "The doctors decided he should stay in Manchester." James Trafford, a summer signing from Burnley, starts for Pep Guardiola's side at Molineux with Stefan Ortega named on the bench.

Title: Howe: 'Outstanding' Ramsey will add midfield depth
Content: Eddie Howe has described Jacob Ramsey as an "outstanding player" and admitted that Newcastle's deal to sign him from Aston Villa is nearing completion. Newcastle have agreed to pay ¬£39m plus ¬£4m in add-ons for the midfielder, who was not involved in Saturday's goalless draw between the two sides at Villa Park. "It's getting closer for us but I don't know the stage it is at," said Howe. "He will offer strength in depth in that midfield area after losing Sean [Longstaff] and Joe [Willock]. "He's an outstanding player."

Title: Merson: Xhaka gives Sunderland the slightest chance of survival
Content: Sky Sports' Paul Merson: "What a signing for Sunderland Xhaka is. What a signing. "I'm not going to say they're going to stay up but it's still going to be a major struggle. But it gives them the slightest chance. "I'm so surprised - and no disrespect to Sunderland - that no-one has come in for him because he's a top midfield player. "I know he's a few years older than what he was at Arsenal but he was a top player and he will give them that experience. He will give them the slightest chance of staying up."

Title: Howe: Door 'well and truly' open for Isak to return
Content: Eddie Howe says the door remains open for Alexander Isak to be reintegrated at Newcastle and hopes the situation surrounding his future will be resolved soon. Isak was not in Newcastle's squad for their goalless draw with Aston Villa on Saturday as he continues to push for a move to Liverpool. The 25-year-old was missed as Newcastle spurned a series of first-half chances at Villa Park, with fans heard chanting against him during a post-match interview with Anthony Gordon. "Nothing has changed," he said in his press conference. "The door is well and truly open. He has to decide what he wants to do. "We would like a resolution. We need that clarity. You don't need any kind of distraction. "I am not in control of that. There is one person who can control that. "Let's wait and see. I have made my stance clear. I am concentrating on the team." Newcastle supporters appeared to chant "one greedy *******" about Isak after the game. "The supporters acted really well today," added Howe. "If afterwards, they want to say something, they are free to do that."

Title: Hurzeler delighted Baleba is back
Content: Brighton head coach Fabian Hurzeler speaking to Sky Sports: "We know that Carlos is a great player. "Not only is he a great player but a great person too. "We are very happy he's in our team and stays in our team."

Title: Donnarumma not a target for Chelsea
Content: Gianluigi Donnarumma is still not a Chelsea target. The Blues were reportedly considering a move for Gianluigi Donnarumma after he was not included in Paris Saint-Germain's 22-player squad for the UEFA Super Cup last Wednesday, according to The Sun. His existing contract at PSG is due to expire next summer.

Title: Garnacho and Simons arrivals dependent on Chelsea exits
Content: Latest from Sky Sports' Kaveh Solhekol: Chelsea will only sign Alejandro Garnacho AND Xavi Simons if at least two first-team forwards leave before the window closes. Christopher Nkunku, Nicolas Jackson and Tyrique George could all move and incomings are exit dependent. If all three players leave, Chelsea would be in a strong position to sign both Garnacho and Simons. If only one of those three players leaves, Chelsea may sign just one more forward - or none at all. Chelsea value Garnacho at about ¬£30m. Meanwhile, Gianluigi Donnarumma is still not a Chelsea target.

Title: Howe on Isak saga - has anything changed?
Content: As expected, no Alexander Isak for Newcastle against Aston Villa today. Here's what Eddie Howe said when asked by TNT Sports about the latest: "No different to how it has been for a number of weeks. We are without him [Alexander Isak]. We are adapting to that and still trying to be competitive. Today will be a big test for us. "We feel in good spirits. It is a strong team he [Unai Emery] picks, so hopefully we go well. "We believe in the team we have picked today. There have been distractions through pre-season, but that's been for me, and not the players." Asked if he felt let down by Isak, Howe added:"Now is not the time to discuss that. All my emotions are towards this game. This is a tough place to come. We have got to be there mentally, me included."

Title: Fenerbahce interested in Zinchenko
Content: Latest from Sky Sports' Dharmesh Sheth: Fenerbahce are interested in signing Arsenal defender Oleksandr Zinchenko. It's understood they have explored the conditions of a deal. Arsenal are listening to suitable offers for Zinchenko. He has entered the final year of his contract.

Title: Dickov joins Mansfield after Brentford departure
Content: Mansfield Town have announced the signing of forward Max Dickov on a one-year deal following his departure from Brentford.

Title: 'Challenging summer for Villa' - Emery calls for PSR review
Content: Unai Emery says the Profit & Sustainability Rules (PSR) have impacted Aston Villa, with the financial regulations making it a challenging summer for the club. Speaking in his programme notes ahead of Villa's clash with Newcastle, Emery, went on to call for a review of PSR, claiming it is restricting ambitious clubs "We cannot avoid that the summer has been challenging because the financial rules were  conditioning our investment and our squad," Emery said. "This is a situation that we knew, we accept responsibikity and we will overcome trying to work harder and be accurate in our decisions. "Financial control rules came to football to avoid bankruptcies and payment defaults, with good purpose. But as professionals we should review it, for this good tool to "become a limitation for the clubs that are doing good management, who will never be allowed to dream and get higher goals because the revenue, ley for these financial rules, needs time to come to reality after sporting success."

Title: Top half, European spot or title contenders? What is a good season for Man Utd?
Content: Gary Neville reveals what he thinks will be deemed a successful Premier League season for Manchester United.

Title: Milan's Lazetic set for Aberdeen medical
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Luca Bendoni: AC Milan striker Marko Lazetic is due to arrive in Scotland today ahead of his move to Aberdeen. The 21-year-old is scheduled to undergo a medical on Sunday, after the Dons travel to face Greenock Morton in the League Cup on Saturday. Content: Tottenham are hoping Roma will make a move for midfielder Yves Bissouma, according to the Daily Mail. Spurs would reportedly accept a bid in the region of ¬£20m for the player, who was recently left out of the UEFA Super Cup squad to face Paris Saint-Germain due to disciplinary issues. Roma are losing midfielder Manu Kone to Inter Milan, with talks regarding the deal currently ongoing.

Title: 'Forest keen on Lewis - City want ¬£30m+'
Content: Nottingham Forest are keen to sign Manchester City defender Rico Lewis, according to the Daily Mail. City are reportedly open to letting the England international leave for a fee in excess of ¬£30m. Lewis' current contract at the Etihad Stadium is set to expire in 2028.

Title: 'Ederson considering Man City future'
Content: Manchester City goalkeeper Ederson is considering his future at the club, according to The Guardian. City secured the signing of James Trafford from Burnley earlier in the window but Sky Sports News reported Pep Guardiola wants the Brazil international to stay at the club and remain their number one goalkeeper. Ederson has been of interest to Galatasaray in Turkey and clubs in Saudi Arabia

Title: More depth, fewer excuses: Arsenal and Arteta have nowhere to hide now
Content: Mikel Arteta has taken Arsenal to three runners-up finishes in the Premier League - so will the Gunners get over the line this season after an aggressive transfer window? Sky Sports

Title: Arteta: Old Trafford is the 'perfect stage' for Gyokeres PL debut
Content: Mikel Arteta has said Old Trafford is the "perfect stage" for Viktor Gyokeres to make his competitive debut for Arsenal. The Sweden international has featured three times for the Gunners since completing his ¬£63.5m switch from Sporting CP this summer. He is now in line to make his Premier League debut for the club when Arsenal travel to Old Trafford to face Manchester United, live on Super Sunday. "I think that Arsenal is the perfect stage for him to show what he can do for the team and the incredible teammates around him to make sure that he fulfils that," Arteta said. Arsenal were also linked with Benjamin Sesko, the former RB Leipzig striker who has since gone on to join United. When asked if Gyokeres was always their first choice, Arteta added:  "We've done the process like we always do. "To analyse every single option, it's not only about what we like about the player, it's many aspects that have to, at the end, come together and we're extremely happy that it's Victor."

Title: The art of the rebuild with Guardiola and Neville...

Title: Sesko signing could define Amorim's Man Utd reign
Content: Benjamin Sesko is a big prospect but one with plenty to prove and his success could be crucial to Manchester United‚Äôs rebuild under Ruben Amorim, writes Adam Bate. Sky Sports

Title: Roma pushing to sign Sancho and Bailey
Content: Roma are pushing to sign both Jadon Sancho and Leon Bailey, according to Sky in Italy. Sancho's representatives have been in talks with officials from Roma after the Italian club made a ¬£20m bid for the Manchester United forward. Sky in Italy report that they are working to reach a final agreement with Sancho. Roma's talks for Aston Villa forward Bailey have been for a loan with an option to buy. Title: Everton sign goalkeeper King from Wolves
Content: Everton have signed goalkeeper Tom King from Wolves on a two-year contract. The Wales international becomes the Blues‚Äô seventh signing of the summer transfer window, following Charly Alcaraz, Thierno Barry, Mark Travers, Adam Aznou, Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall and Jack Grealish. Title: Carroll: It's a shame how Isak's acting
Content: Former Newcastle striker Andy Carroll says everyone at the club wants Alexander Isak to stay and admits it's a shame how he is acting during the transfer window.

Title: Newcastle interested in PSG striker Ramos
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: Newcastle are interested in PSG striker Goncalo Ramos. Newcastle are looking for a potential replacement for Alexander Isak should he depart for Liverpool and Ramos is one they are considering. They are aware it would be a difficult deal to do, but they are scoring the market after missing out on Benjamin Sesko. The 24-year-old has scored nine goals in 16 caps for Portugal.

Title: Arteta: Arsenal have added a lot of quality
Content: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says his side have added a lot of quality in the transfer window with the signings of Noni Madueke, Viktor Gyokeres and Martin Zubimendi.

Title: Palace value Liverpool target Guehi at over ¬£40m
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol: Crystal Palace value Liverpool target Marc Guehi at more than ¬£40m. A player moving in the opposite direction has also been discussed. Liverpool have held talks about signing Guehi, but at the moment there is a gap in valuation. The Premier League champions are the favourites to sign him. The question is whether they can negotiate a fee now or wait to sign him as a free agent next summer. The player is happy to stay at Palace and play in Europe. If Palace were to agree a fee with Liverpool then he would be happy to talk to them but that has not happened. Multiple big clubs in the Premier League and across Europe are aware that Guehi may be available as a free agent next summer.

Title: Murray extends contract with Celtic
Content: Dane Murray has signed a contract extension with Celtic. The 22-year-old will remain at Celtic Park until June 2028, having started in the club's academy aged six.

Title: Transfer targets Eze and Guehi set to start vs Chelsea
Content: Eberechi Eze and Marc Guehi are set to start for Crystal Palace at Chelsea on Sunday despite the pair being linked with a move away. Eagles head coach Oliver Glasner expects the pair, who were key performers in a season which ended with the club winning the FA Cup for the first time, to be involved from the beginning at Stamford Bridge. Midfielder Eze has been linked with a move to Arsenal or Tottenham, while Liverpool have held talks with Palace over defender Guehi. ‚ÄúMarc has trained the entire week with us, every single training session, the same with Ebs,‚Äù Glasner said at his pre-match press conference on Friday afternoon. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôve prepared the best way for the Chelsea game on Sunday afternoon. I‚Äôve been in the football business for too long, so I know that at any time of any day, things can happen. If you ask me now, I expect both Marc and Ebs to start on Sunday.‚Äù

Title: Plymouth waiting for Celtic decision on Welsh
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Plymouth Argyle are still waiting for Celtic to decide on whether centre-back Stephen Welsh can join them on loan. The League One club have made an improved offer of a season-long loan deal, with an option to buy. Celtic are considering the offer, but are being mindful of other players who may leave the club on loan. Last year, new FIFA rules stipulated that one club can only have six players out on international loans at a time. Celtic already have three players out on international loans - Luis Palma at Lech Poznan, Odin Thiago Holm at LAFC and Maik Nawrocki at Hannover 96. The club have also agreed a loan deal with Rapid Vienna for Marco Tilio, but are yet to sanction the move. Plymouth are looking at other centre-back targets in the meantime.

Title: Leoni joins Liverpool to take summer spending over ¬£300m
Content: Parma defender Giovanni Leoni has signed for Liverpool, taking their summer transfer spend over ¬£300m. Liverpool will pay a fee of ¬£26m plus add-ons for the 18-year-old, who has signed a six-year contract and becomes the club's sixth major signing, with their business now totalling ¬£321.5m in paid transfer fees so far. That is currently the third-biggest transfer outlay from a Premier League club in a single window. If Liverpool complete a deal to sign Newcastle striker Alexander Isak, which could cost well above ¬£100m, then the Reds could become the biggest summer transfer spenders of all time. Liverpool, though, have recouped over ¬£200m this summer by selling seven players for fees, including ¬£65m for Luis Diaz, ¬£56.6m for Darwin Nunez and ¬£35m for Jarell Quansah. Sky Sports

Title: Man Utd pull out of Baleba move
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook and Dharmesh Sheth: Manchester United are unlikely to pursue a move for Brighton midfielder Carlos Baleba this summer. Brighton have been adamant that they do not want to sell the 21-year-old and head coach Fabian Hurzeler said earlier today that he was "very confident" Baleba would be staying. United remain huge admirers of Baleba and could revive their interest in another window. But for now, they have decided to consider other potential targets that could bolster Ruben Amorim's midfield.

Title: London City Lionesses sign Barcelona defender
Content: London City Lionesses have signed defender Jana Fernandez from Barcelona. The 23-year-old won the Women‚Äôs Champions League in 2021 and 2023, as well as four Liga F titles and three Copa de la Reina trophies during her time with Barca. Most recently, Fernandez was called up to Spain‚Äôs Euro 2025 squad, where they reached the final. Fernandez said: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs an ambitious project; I‚Äôm really looking forward to the start of the season. London City have made really good signings. "I‚Äôm excited to get to know the coach, learn how we want to play and I‚Äôm so excited to be in the WSL! ‚ÄúWe have a really good team, a really good environment and the girls are really nice, so we can make really good things happen. I‚Äôm really excited, both this club and myself is so ambitious."

Title: Dortmund submit offer for Echeverri
Content: Borussia Dortmund have submitted an offer to Manchester City for Claudio Echeverri, according to Sky Germany. Dortmund are pushing for a loan deal with an option to buy for the 19-year-old, who is under contract with City until 2028. There are other teams believed to be monitoring the youngster, including La Liga club Girona, who are a part of the City Football Group. It is unknown whether City would accept a deal that included a buy option within it.

Title: United 'not planning' Baleba move
Content: Manchester United are not planning to make a formal move for Brighton's Carlos Baleba, according to The Athletic. United's interest in the 21-year-old has been widespread in recent weeks, but Brighton have remained steadfast that they did not want to sell the player, with a fee north of ¬£100m needed to open negotiations. Brighton boss Fabian Hurzeler said that he was 'very, very confident' that Baleba would remain at the club on Friday and that there had been no change in the situation. It is understood that United are not prepared to pay what Brighton would want to sell the player this summer, which is said to be more than the ¬£115 million the Seagulls sold Moises Caicedo to Chelsea for.

Title: Barcelona awaiting Rashford registration decision
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Zinny Boswell: All the documents, including the bank guarantee, have been submitted to LaLiga by Barcelona in order to get Marcus Rashford registered for the new season. Barcelona are waiting for officials to review it, but as today is a public holiday in Spain, a decision is more likely to come on Saturday. A decision tonight cannot be ruled out. Hansi Flick will announce the squad list for the match against Mallorca at midday on Saturday.

Title: Chelsea refusing loan bids for Chukwuemeka

We have a squad that is unbalanced, doesn‚Äôt have many options in many positions - we are taking a risk.‚Äù Sky Sports News reported earlier this week that the CAS decision to maintain Forest‚Äôs place in the Europa League (at the expense of Crystal Palace) would act as a starting pistol for owner Evangelos Marinakis to sanction a number of new transfer deals. Now, we have been told Omari Hutchinson is due to undergo a medical in Nottingham today, after a fee of ¬£37.5m, and a mutual structure of payments, has been agreed with Ipswich Town. Three other clubs tried to hijack Hutchinson‚Äôs move to the City Ground, but the player decided he wanted to join Forest. He is expected to travel to Nottingham later today to undergo a medical. Similarly, James McAtee is due to undergo a medical after a ¬£30m fee was agreed yesterday with Manchester City. McAtee was at the Man City training ground this morning to say his goodbyes, ahead of his move to Nottingham Forest. Callum Hudson-Odoi (who has only 12 months remaining on his existing deal) has verbally agreed the terms of a new and improved contract at the City Ground, and he is expected to sign the paperwork shortly. He took charge of the club in 2022 and has led the club to three consecutive top six finishes in his three full seasons in charge. Robinson also led St Mirren back to the European stage in 2024 after securing the club‚Äôs highest league finish since 1985. Last October he had signed a deal until 2027, so this marks a further one-year extension. Assistant manager Brian Kerr has also agreed a new contract. Speaking on the new deal in a club statement, Robinson said: "I‚Äôm glad the board have appreciated the hard work that Brian and I have done over the last three years with three top six finishes. Title: Nuno: Forest have a major problem, we are far from where we should be
Content: Nottingham Forest boss Nuno Espirito Santo says his "unbalanced" side have a "major problem" as the Premier League returns, warning they are "very, very far" from where they should be. Speaking exclusively to Sky Sports News' David Craig ahead of the new season, Nuno said: "We are very far - very, very far - from where we should be. We are very far in terms of preparation, in terms of planning, in terms of the squad. "So we are all very worried that in two or three days time we are playing for the Premier League, the most demanding competition in the world. And we are very far. Very, very far. "The plans that we had didn't come through. The preparation in terms of squad was not ideal. We didn't have a chance to create the bond - and this is what I think is more important. "Because we don't know which squad we have. We have players working here that know they're going to leave on loan. We have a major problem."

Title: Deadline Day countdown!
Analysis: Guehi quality clear - but where he fits for Liverpool not so straightforward
Content: Sky Sports' Peter Smith: "Marc Guehi has established himself as one of the Premier League's elite centre-backs, the 25-year-old is first-choice for England and, after leading Crystal Palace to back-to-back trophy successes at Wembley, looks like an absolute bargain signing at around ¬£40m. "Liverpool have opened talks with Palace, whose chairman Steve Parish admitted it makes sense to cash in if the one year left on Guehi's contract can't be extended. Guehi is also believed to be open to an Anfield switch and Reds boss Arne Slot is in need of defensive reinforcements. "But while that all adds up, where Guehi would actually fit into Liverpool's team is not quite so straightforward. "Guehi plays on the left of a back three at Crystal Palace. He has shown with England he can play on the left side of a back four - the preferred set-up at Liverpool and of Slot - but that is where captain Virgil van Dijk plays. The Dutchman started 37 of 38 Premier League games last season. "The assumption seems to be that Guehi would play alongside Van Dijk, in place of Ibrahima Konate, who only has a year to run on his own Liverpool deal. Being a right-footer, it's not a huge leap for Guehi but does require some adaptation - and breaks up a championship-winning partnership. "With Van Dijk aged 34 and Konate's contract situation uncertain, Guehi would future-proof the Liverpool defence. But does he want to risk being a back-up or rotation option at Liverpool in a World Cup year? "A creative alternative could be for Slot to turn to an unfamiliar back three, with Guehi remaining in his favoured left-side role, Van Dijk orchestrating affairs from the centre, and Konate protecting the right channel, as he is skilled to do. "That could also help rebalance a Liverpool defence which Slot admitted needed "adjustment" after they were opened up through pre-season, with the adventurous new signings Milos Kerkez and Jeremie Frimpong leaving the centre-backs vulnerable. "Any which way, it requires a shift from Guehi or Liverpool - but it could be a conundrum both the player and Premier League champions believe is worth taking on."

Title: Rashford: Man Utd are in no man's land - they need to stick to plan
Content: Marcus Rashford has described "reactionary" Manchester United as being in "no man's land" - and has called on his club to "make a plan and stick to it." Rashford departed United to join Barcelona on loan for the upcoming season but has hit out at the club's strategy in recent years. Speaking on the Rest is Football, Rashford said: ‚ÄúYou see it with any team that‚Äôs been successful over a period of time: they have principles that any coach that comes in, any player that comes in, has to align to these principles or be able to add to these principles. ‚ÄúWhereas at times I feel like United have just been ‚Ä¶ we‚Äôre hungry to win, so we‚Äôll always try to adapt and to sign players that fit this system. But it‚Äôs reactionary. ‚ÄúIf your direction‚Äôs always changing, you can‚Äôt expect to be able to win the league. ‚ÄúYeah, you might win some cup tournaments, but it‚Äôs because you do have a good coach and you do have good players and you have match winners in your team ‚Äì you‚Äôre not there by accident. ‚ÄúThis is what some people forget. So yeah, we‚Äôve been way below where we deem United to be. But then if you take a step back, which I‚Äôve been able to do, especially over the last six months ‚Äì what do you expect? ‚ÄúPeople say we‚Äôve been in a transition for years. To be in a transition, you have to start the transition. So it‚Äôs like the actual transition‚Äôs not started yet. ‚ÄúTo start a transition, you have to make a plan and stick to it. So this is the thing that I feel ‚Äì it‚Äôs not easy. Because if it‚Äôs not going well, the fans demand [change]. ‚ÄúBut this is where I speak about being realistic with what your situation is. ‚ÄúI feel like we‚Äôve had that many different managers and different ideas and different strategies in order to win ‚Ä¶ you end up in the middle of ‚Äì you end up in no man‚Äôs land.‚Äù

Title: Donnarrumma bids farewell to PSG
Content: Gianluigi Donnarumma has bid farewell to Paris Saint-Germain fans on his personal social media. Donnarumma is expected to leave PSG this summer after the Champions League winners signed Lucas Chevalier from Lille to be their first-choice goalkeeper. Donnrumma wrote on Instagram: "From the first day I arrived, I gave everything - on and off the pitch - to earn my place and defend the goal of Paris Saint-Germain. "Unfortunately, someone has decided that I can no longer be part of the group and contribute to the team's success. I am disappointed and disheartened. "I hope to have the opportunity to look the fans at the Parc des Princes in the eyes one more time and say goodbye as it should be done. "If that doesn't happen, I want you to know that your support and affection mean the world to me, and I will never forget it. "I will always carry with me the memory of all the emotions, the magical nights, and of you, who made me feel at home. "To my teammates - my second family - thank you for every battle, every laugh, every moment we shared. You will always be my brothers. "Playing for this club and living in this city has been an immense honour. "Thank you Paris."

Sky Sports News revealed in January that Udinese had failed with a ¬£2.5m bid for Miller but have now landed the Scotland international. The 18-year-old had just 10 months of his deal at Fir Park left and, after missing the start of the season through injury, manager Jens Berthel Askou made a late call to leave him out of the squad for Saturday's goalless draw at St Mirren. At City, it was out of his hands because he wasn't playing, but this move gives him a great chance to get back in and get to the World Cup. Title: Martin: Raskin has been unsettled by transfer interest
Content:
Rangers manager Russell Martin suspects Nico Raskin was unsettled by approaches this summer. However, he praised the Belgium midfielder's "incredible" reaction to being left out of the team. Raskin was dropped for Rangers' 3-0 Champions League qualifying win over Viktoria Plzen last week after failing to have  his usual impact in a 1-1 draw with Motherwell, having started in a wider position than he has previously been
utilised. However, Martin felt Raskin made a "big, big difference" when he came on in Saturday's 1-1 draw with Dundee and believes the 24-year-old is shaking off transfer speculation. Speaking ahead of Tuesday's second leg against the Czech side, Martin said:
"What Nico did last season, rightly or wrongly, I can't have a feeling about. "He came out of the team for reasons that me and him spoke about. And his reaction has been top, like really, really brilliant. And that's all you can ever ask for. "There's been a bit of uncertainty about him this summer, for sure. Not from people ringing us, but I think from people ringing him, definitely. "So I think that's affected his approach. Not in terms of professionalism, but he's a young man, of course it's going to have an impact at some point. "And then we've had a discussion and since he came out of the team, he's been a different guy. Incredible." Martin added: "Hopefully we can get to the end of the window, he's played brilliantly, the window shuts, he's still here. And then we can keep improving and keep kicking on."

Content: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk believes there is room in the Reds squad for a new attacker, amid strong links to Newcastle's Alexander Isak. Liverpool have seen a bid over ¬£100m rejected for the Newcastle striker and the Reds selling Luis Diaz and Darwin Nunez potentially raises more funds for Arne Slot's side to go again for the Swedish striker. "Well we just lost Darwin, he went to Saudi and we lost Lucho, obviously he went to Bayern," Van Dijk told talkSPORT after the Community Shield defeat to Crystal Palace on Sunday. "I think there's always room for an attacker in order to strengthen us so let's see what the window brings in terms of the balance of the team."

Title: Henderson expects CAS to overturn Palace's Europa decision
Content: Crystal Palace goalkeeper Dean Henderson says he is expecting the sporting authorities to overturn the decision to demote the Eagles from the Europa League. Palace were demoted from the Europa League to the Conference League after a UEFA ruling last month over the club's connection with Lyon through former owner John Textor. The Eagles have appealed the decision via the Court of Arbitration for Sport in Lausanne, and a verdict on that appeal is expected on Monday. "Absolutely, 100 per cent," said the goalkeeper to Sky Sports News after the Community Shield win over Liverpool when asked if he expects a good result on Monday. "As players we win it on the pitch, we expect the authorities to deliver what we‚Äôve won and I think every neutral person will agree with us. "You also don‚Äôt want to devalue the FA Cup as well, it‚Äôs a tough competition to win and you should get what you deserve on the back of that."

Title: Leicester crowd give Sheff Wed fan protest standing ovation
Content: Leicester City fans applaud Sheffield Wednesday supporters in solidarity amid the club‚Äôs ongoing financial struggles, as fans hold off entering the stadium in protest.

Title: Parish on Crystal Palace's transfers
Content: Crystal Palace chairman Steve Parish on the club's transfer business after Oliver Glasner repeatedly called for more players: "It‚Äôs difficult. We have an outstanding 15 or 16 players, trying to get that level of quality in is hard. The prices ‚Äì at the end of day we‚Äôre Crystal Palace. "The money at every football club is finite at some point. We will do what we can, try and help where we can. We all want to be better at football as we will try and do what we can."

Title: Slot: No added pressure to Liverpool's season
Content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot insists their high-profile new summer does not bring any added pressure to their season - as there is always pressure at Anfield. The Reds have made five high-profile signings to the tune of ¬£289m - including big moves for Florian Wirtz and Hugo Ekitike. At the same time, Liverpool have also sold five key players including Luis Diaz, Trent Alexander-Arnold and Darwin Nunez to the tune of ¬£185m. Speaking after the Community Shield defeat to Crystal Palace, Slot told TNT Sports: "Because we‚Äôre Liverpool. Pressure is always on. That has nothing to do with bringing players in because we‚Äôve lost players as well. "But even if we bring no players in or ten players in, when you have a Liverpool shirt there is always pressure."

Title: Glasner calls for more Palace signings
Content: Oliver Glasner insists he is happy with his Crystal Palace squad but wants to add "one or two" more players before the end of the window. Palace added the Community Shield to last season's FA Cup by beating Liverpool at Wembley following a 2-2 draw in normal time. Sky Sports Glasner is looking to add to his squad ahead of the new season, with European football set to create a Thursday-Sunday schedule for much of the upcoming campaign. "I'm very happy with the squad because of course they won the trophy," Glasner told TNT Sport." But I don't want to complain about plenty of games, because you see that as a reward. "If we don't win the FA Cup, then we don't talk about European football. But we want to win something, we want to play European football. We will be ready for it. "But of course, if somebody needs a break - such as Daichi Kamada [who was injured] today and maybe we will miss him at Chelsea - and we need just maybe need to add one or two players. "It's not that I have to tell the chairman or somebody, we know it is about finding the right ones. I'm pretty sure we will find the right ones. "We're looking for really clear profiles, great characters, you can see the spirit and the togetherness in the group."

Title: Salah's afternoon to forget at Wembley
Content: Mohamed Salah's pass accuracy rate of 65% was the lowest out of any outfield starter on the pitch at Wembley, as Liverpool lost the Community Shield match with Crystal Palace. Not what you expected from the player with the most assists in the Premier League last season. Don't forget his missed penalty as well - his second failed spot kick in the space of a week.

Title: Idah needs competition to thrive, says Celtic boss Rodgers
Content: Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers claims Adam Idah will be better if he can get some competition up front. The champions eased to a 2-0 win at Aberdeen thanks to goals in either half from midfielders Benjamin Nygren and Reo Hatate, but Idah struggled to make an impact in the centre-forward position. The 24-year-old was expected to kick on after Kyogo Furuhashi left in January, but Daizen Maeda took on the mantle of Celtic‚Äôs main goalscorer after moving inside from a wide position, although the Irishman still finished on 20 goals. Given Celtic have since lost Jota to a long-term injury and sold Nicolas Kuhn, Maeda has been needed out wide, while Idah has been handed a chance to seize the number-nine role. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no doubt that we need to reinforce the top line,‚Äù Rodgers said. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no doubt. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm really pleased with where we are structurally in defensive numbers. We‚Äôve got a squad from our back line to midfield that can cope domestically and cope in the European competition. So I‚Äôm really pleased with that aspect. ‚ÄúBut I think we need competition at the top end of the field. ‚ÄúFor Adam, he‚Äôs a big, honest boy. He was at his best here when was really challenging with Kyogo for the position and that‚Äôs something that is important for us to get. But in the meantime, he will work hard and he‚Äôll always be that reference for us.‚Äù

Title: Chalobah limps out of Chelsea friendly

The Blues have already lost Levi Colwill to an ACL injury and another centre-back in Chalobah appeared to roll his ankle in the friendly at Stamford Bridge. Chalobah was able to walk off the pitch but any lengthy injury could impact Chelsea's transfer plans with just over three weeks of the window left. Earlier this week, Enzo Maresca revealed his desire to sign another centre-back this summer. The Blues have new defender Jorrel Hato, Tosin Adarabioyo and Josh Acheampong as fully fit centre-back options going into the new season, which starts against Crystal Palace on August 17, live on Sky Sports.

Content: Chelsea forward Christopher Nkunku is wanted by his former club RB Leipzig, according to PA, who are keen for the 27-year-old to be included in any deal for Xavi Simons. Chelsea have been in talks for the Netherlands international this summer without an agreement being reached. The Bundesliga side's willingness to take back Nkunku - whose time at Stamford Bridge has been badly disrupted by injury and has seen him score just six Premier League goals - could lay the foundations of a deal. Simons can play either as an attacking midfielder or on the wing and is a potentially more flexible attacking option than Nkunku.

Sassuolo are willing to pay for the loan and include a purchase option in the region of ¬£8.6m (‚Ç¨10m). Muric has three years left on his contract at Ipswich.

Title: Newcastle to bide time over potential move for Jackson
Content: Newcastle will wait for a resolution to Alexander Isak's future before deciding whether to move for Chelsea striker Nicolas Jackson, according to PA. Isak is currently not training with Eddie Howe's squad after a ¬£110m bid from Liverpool was rejected and he is not expected to feature in Saturday's Premier League opener against Aston Villa. The club missed out on signing striker Benjamin Sesko, who joined Manchester United on Saturday from RB Leipzig, but after Chelsea told Jackson on Friday that they are willing to sell it has opened up a possible solution to the impasse. The 24-year-old - who scored 10 Premier League goals last season, but endured a run of one league goal in five months between December and May - trained alone on Friday. Jackson was left out of the squad for the friendly win over Bayer Leverkusen and then again for today's match against AC Milan at Stamford Bridge. He has been pushed down the pecking order at Stamford Bridge following the signings of Liam Delap from Ipswich and Joao Pedro from Brighton, with a feeling that his progress at the club has stalled.

That stance has reputedly caused 'acrimony and tension with Isak refusing to accept the decision with good grace'. The newspaper goes on to insist that it's 'extremely unlikely' Newcastle will change their position even if they sign another striker.

Title: 'Focus has turned to departures at Man Utd'
Content: Sky Sports News reporter Dharmesh Sheth: Following Benjamin Sesko's arrival, the focus at Man Utd is now on departures. Along with AC Milan's interest in Rasmus Hojlund, Borussia Dortmund are still pursuing a deal for Jadon Sancho while a formal offer from Chelsea for Alejandro Garnacho is expected. Real Betis continue to work on a deal to sign Antony. However, United may not be finished when it comes to incomings and want to be in a position to act if a good market opportunity presents itself. Recruiting a central midfielder appears to be high on the agenda and interest in Brighton's Carlos Baleba remains. United have explored the conditions of a deal but it looks like a very difficult transfer to do, not least because Brighton do not want to sell - and are under no pressure to. Baleba has not featured for Brighton since the pre-season victory over Stoke City in Marbella in mid-July due to a minor knee injury.

Title: Amorim: Sesko has great potential

Title: Wilcox hails Sesko's physical talents
Content: Man Utd director of football Jason Wilcox says Benjamin Sesko has a combination of "electrifying pace" and can "physically dominate defenders". Talking about the new signing, he said: ‚ÄúBenjamin possesses a rare combination of electrifying pace and the ability to physically dominate defenders, making him one of the most exceptional young talents in world football. ‚ÄúWe have followed Benjamin‚Äôs career closely; all of our data analysis and research concluded that he has the required qualities and personality to thrive at Manchester United. ‚ÄúWorking under the guidance of Ruben Amorim and our excellent performance team, Benjamin is joining the perfect environment to support him to reach his world class potential. ‚ÄúThe desire that all of our new signings have shown to join the club this summer highlights the appeal and stature of Manchester United as we continue to build and develop a team capable of challenging for the biggest honours.‚Äù

Title: Sesko: 'Man Utd perfect place to reach my maximum level'

Mead, who also helped Arsenal win the UEFA Women's Champions League last season, is considered a really important part of Renee Slegers' squad. Content: West Ham have confirmed that Michail Antonio will not be signing a new deal at the club after his contract expired at the end of last season. His future remained uncertain as he continued his rehabilitation from a car crash in December with the Hammers, but he will no longer be a member of the first team squad. Antonio made his return to competitive action in June, appearing as a substitute for Jamaica in a CONCACAF Gold Cup tie against Guatemala. A club statement added: "Michail will always be a much-loved and respected member of the West Ham United family. As has been the case since December, the club will continue to support and assist him in his ongoing rehabilitation, offering him access to training, facilities and medical care if needed. "Dialogue continues over his future involvement with the club in an alternative capacity - including one that would enable others to benefit from his experience and leadership qualities. "Everyone at West Ham United would like to sincerely thank Michail for his outstanding, dedicated service in a Claret and Blue shirt over the last ten years."

"But when they leave, it's just the club that texts me or calls me, even Tom (media officer), he just mentioned to me that Lesley (Ugochukwu) joined Burnley. "I have this kind of news from him or from the club because I don't pay attention to the ones that need to leave. I just focus on how we prepare the session, how we can win games. "For sure, it's much better to work with 25 players than the biggest number, no doubt. In this moment, we are working with the ones that we want."

Title: Maresca reveals Colwill injury 'problem'
Content: Enzo Maresca has revealed that Chelsea centre-back Levi Colwill picked up an injury in training this week which could force them into the transfer market. Colwill excelled for Chelsea last season, playing 42 times and being a key part of their possession-based style. Chelsea returned for pre-season training on Monday in which Colwill picked up an issue. "We had a problem the last two days with Levi Colwill that we don't know how long he's going to be out," said Maresca on Thursday ahead of their first pre-season friendly against Bayer Leverkusen "Hopefully not too long but for sure it's a problem for us. "It was the first session on Monday. Just in the last minutes of the session, he felt something." Asked what the injury was, Maresca said:  "We need to wait, we don't know yet." Chelsea's latest signing was defender Jorrel Hato from Ajax, while they also have Tosin, Trevoh Chalobah, Wesley Fofana, Josh Acheampong and Benoit Badiashile, who can play at cente-back. But Maresca did not rule out going into the transfer market to cover for Colwill's injury. "It depends," he said. "We need to wait and then we'll see. We know each other from last year and you know in our way how important Levi has been. "I spoke with him yesterday (Wednesday) and I told him if we achieve what we achieved last year, it's also because of him. He was a main player for us."

Title: 'Timing not right for Baleba sale'
Content: Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook: Manchester United have made their first move for Carlos Baleba but will Brighton actually sell the Cameroon international midfielder this window? The chances are very remote. Brighton make no secret of their model - buy talented young players based on Tony Bloom's effective analytics system in a finely tuned recruitment process - and sell them on when their value is realised, when the time is right for the club and the player. Also, and this is crucial, when there is a replacement for him to step into the first team. Money talks in football of course, but the timing doesn't feel right from Brighton's perspective. Baleba was purchased for around ¬£25m in August 2023. His value now will have rocketed, and his ceiling is considered to be higher than that of former midfielder Moises Caicedo. 19-year-old Malick Yalcouye is thought to be a similar type of midfielder to Baleba but he is young and has only had one loan away from the club to develop. One day he could fill Baleba's shoes, but now it is surely too early for him.

Title: Son: 'Hardest decision ever' to leave Spurs
Content: Heung-Min Son goodbye message to Spurs fans on Instagram: "How to find the right words for this? I don't know. I have been thinking for days. It's impossible. But here I go. "It's time for me to say goodbye to Tottenham Hotspur. My home for the past decade. When I arrived in 2015, I didn't speak English, I didn't know London, but you welcomed me with open arms, believed in me, and stood by me through every high and low. "I was just a boy from Korea with big dreams who was supposed to have no chance. And now, 10 years later, North London is in my heart forever. "I've made friends for life here, had the honour of becoming a godfather here, and had the privilege of captaining our special club here. I've poured my heart and soul into this club, which makes this the hardest decision ever. "I thought if I was ever going to leave, it would have to be on my terms, on the best terms, when our mission had been accomplished together. With pride and honour."

Content: South American football expert Tim Vickery on Sky Sports News discussing Rodrygo, who has been a reported target for Arsenal: "Let‚Äôs watch this space over the next few weeks because this could be interesting. "Rodrygo has the Real Madrid dilemma that it‚Äôs hard for players to be top dog there and he‚Äôs so talented ‚Äì almost absurdly talented. "But someone has to do the hard yards and Jude Bellingham said last year that he considered Rodrygo the most talented of all of them and the one who has to sacrifice himself the most for the side. "Where does Xabi Alonso see him? Because he can play anywhere across the front line. He didn‚Äôt use him very much in the Club World Cup and when he did, it was wide right. "We know Rodrygo doesn‚Äôt want to play wide right. He would far prefer a free role. Now what we understand is that he‚Äôs very keen on staying at Real Madrid and proving that he can be a key part of that side. "Over the next two weeks , if that doesn‚Äôt happen, then he might start looking around and what an asset he would be. "It‚Äôs a waste to have him as a bit-part player, filling in spaces or playing wide on the right. You want him roaming free, dropping his little bombs all around the opposing goal."

"There‚Äôs two points to make ‚Äì the first is the excellence of Botafogo‚Äôs scouting system, who pick up these players when they‚Äôre reserves, like Lucas Perri was, or John was on loan in the Spanish second division with Valladolid. "When they brought him back last year, he was an essential part of the team that won the Brazilian title and the Copa Libertadores. He had an excellent tournament recently in the Club World Cup. "Brazil is really becoming a mass producer of goalkeepers and John is right in that mould. He‚Äôs tall, athletic, live and very impressive. John has given wonderful service to Botafogo, he‚Äôs been really dependable. "The only thing you would say at this stage is I don‚Äôt think he has the language‚Ä¶ defending is a collective task and it is vital that the goalkeeper is able to communicate with his defensive unit. "So John would need some time getting up to speed with that, but in terms of his abilities, I don‚Äôt think he has anything to fear in the Premier League and he can give West Ham equally good service as he gave to Botafogo."

Title: Have Newcastle been strung along in Sesko deal?
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: ‚ÄúI think there's a mixture of disappointment and also probably of feeling in the dark a little bit over the Sesko deal. I think the fear from Newcastle at the start of the week was that they might get strung along in this with Manchester United on Monday still having yet to make a formal bid for Benjamin Sesko. ‚ÄúIt feels like they've given everything they can and they've really thrown the kitchen sink at it. "But I have to say, I felt that four or five weeks ago as well, but we‚Äôre getting near the tickly bit soon and we‚Äôve got to get some things done. "We have to make several additions, we know that, even for the numbers. We have people in the squad where we‚Äôd maybe like to put them out on loan or do other things with them. "So we‚Äôre needing generally to add to the squad and we need to get some of the main players in quickly. "But I‚Äôve been saying it from near enough the minute we finished against Newcastle that we have to get it done and I feel like we should be further down. "But in the main, it looks as if we‚Äôre getting closer to things and hopefully a few things will come to fruition this week. "If we didn‚Äôt, I‚Äôd have to be confident I can make something with what we‚Äôve got and find a way around it and get results. "It‚Äôs not that easy in the Premier League and you can see we need a lot. We‚Äôve got a lot of things to do to get better. "We should have Jarrod returning when we go back to training on Wednesday with any luck, we‚Äôll have Tarky [James Tarkowski] returning. Content: James Maddison has been pictured leaving on crutches after he was stretchered off in Tottenham's 1-1 pre-season draw against Newcastle in South Korea. Spurs boss Thomas Frank described the midfielder's "bad" injury as "brutal". The Spurs midfielder came on as a 75th-minute substitute and was only on the pitch for nine minutes before he started hobbling intensely and appearing in real discomfort. Maddison looked distraught - with his head in his hands - as he was stretchered off the pitch. It is the same knee that saw the England international miss the end of last season, including Spurs' Europa League final triumph.

Title: Howe not sure if Isak will return to Newcastle training

The Magpies have finished their pre-season tour of Singapore and South Korea and will return back to the UK next week. Isak was not named on the tour due to an approach by Liverpool - who saw a bid over ¬£100m rejected last week. The Swedish striker was training with former club Real Sociedad but has since returned back to Newcastle. Asked if Howe expects Isak to be back training with the group, the Newcastle boss replied: "Of course I'd like him to be, but whether he will I don‚Äôt know at this moment in time. "Other people have been dealing with that situation back at home."

Title: Man Utd could consider Hojlund offers

Leipzig had proposed taking Hojlund on loan as part of any possible deal for Sesko. A scenario where Sesko joins and Hojlund stays cannot be ruled out.

Title: Maddison stretchered off in Spurs friendly with Newcastle
Content: James Maddison was stretchered off injured during Tottenham's pre-season game with Newcastle in South Korea. Just just over five minutes of normal time remaining, Maddison - who had only been on the pitch for around ten minutes - started hobbling intensely and looked in real discomfort. Maddison was taken off the pitch with his head in his hands in another injury setback for the player. The England international had only just returned from a long-term knee injury sustained at the start of May which kept him out for the end of the season, including the Europa League final win over Manchester United. The injury could have a huge impact on Spurs' transfer window, with Thomas Frank's side already looking for a new attacking midfielder this summer. Spurs failed in an attempt to get Morgan Gibbs-White, who committed to a new contract at Nottingham Forest after the north London club tried to activate his ¬£60m release clause.

Title: Son given guard of honour in final Spurs game
Content: Heung-Min Son was given a guard of honour as he was substituted off the pitch in what is expected to be his final match for Tottenham. The Spurs captain announced on Saturday that he is looking to leave the club to join Major League Soccer club LAFC. Son was taken off in the 64th minute of Spurs' pre-season game with Newcastle in his native South Korea and both sets of players met in the middle to give him a send-off. The South Korean winger is Spurs' fourth-highest goalscorer in the club's history.

Title: Amorim: Things haven't worked out for Garnacho at Man Utd
Content: Ruben Amorim has described Alejandro Garnacho is a "really talented" player but also admits things haven't worked out for the player at Manchester United. Garnacho is one of four United players who could leave the club this summer alongside Antony, Jadon Sancho and Tyrell Malacia. Fellow academy graduate Marcus Rashford has already left to join Barcelona on loan. "You can understand and you can see he's a really talented boy and sometimes things don't work out," said Amorim. "You cannot explain specifically what it is. "But I have the feeling, I think it's clear that Garnacho wants a different thing with a different leadership and I can understand that. So I think it's not a problem. "Sometimes you adapt to one guy, you have the connection. Other times, you want a new challenge so we try to make everything okay to all the parts. To the club, to the coach and to the players. It's a natural thing in football." Amorim also revealed the sales this summer are important because he wants a smaller squad this season - given United are not in European competition so will only fight on three fronts. "I'm really happy with the team," said Amorim. "Without European competitions, I want a small squad so everyone feels really important. "If you have a lot of players, you have one week to prepare and a lot of players are going to be out, and then in training they will be frustrated and then the quality of the training will drop."

Title: Middlesbrough trying to hijack Birmingham's Akpom move

It‚Äôs understood Boro have made a last-ditch bid to the Eredivisie club - despite Ajax having agreed a loan with obligation to buy for ¬£7m with Birmingham. Akpom was scheduled to arrive in England today to undergo a medical with Birmingham. The 29-year-old was Boro‚Äôs top scorer in the Championship two years ago before making a ¬£12.3m move to Ajax.

Title: Lookman hands in Atalanta transfer request
Content: Ademola Lookman has released a statement on X saying he has formally handed in a transfer request at Atalanta. Lookman says he had an agreement with the Serie A club to leave if a "fair offer" was made by another club. And the forward has claimed Atalanta are blocking an opportunity for him to go, despite an approach being made by another club. Earlier this week Sky Italy reported that Atalanta had rejected a ‚Ç¨42 million offer plus ‚Ç¨3 million in bonuses (¬£36.7m / ¬£2.6m) from Inter Milan. Atalanta believe his value is higher. The situation is currently stalled because Inter are unwilling to make further offers, given the player's value. As part of the statement, Lookman said: "I have loved every moment but feel that now, after three wonderful years in Bergamo, it is the right time to move n and experience a new adventure. "There have been numerous clubs approach Atalanta in the past and I have previously always stayed loyal. "However, myself and the ownership of the club have been in agreement that now is the right time and the club were clear with me that if a fair offer came in they would allow me to move. "Despite now receiving an offer in aligment with what I believe had been discussed, sadly the club are blocking the opportunity for reasons I do not understand. "As a result and after many months of broken promises and what I feel has been poor treatment towards me as both a human being and as a professional footballer, sadly I feel I have no choice but to speak out for what I believe is right and I feel that enough is enough. "I can confirm I have now handed in a formal transfer request."

Title: Amorim: Man Utd 'bomb squad' need to find new clubs

United have already let Marcus Rashford leave to join Barcelona but the futures of Antony, Alejandro Garnacho, Tyrell Malacia and Jadon Sancho are still up in the air. United have not taken the quartet on their Premier League Summer Series tour squad and gave them more time away from the club during pre-season to find themselves new clubs. "We just need to follow the markets," said Amorim about those four players. "So the market is open. There are players that clearly show they don't want to be here and that is normal. They are not bad and I'm good. I'm not bad and they are good. "It's a simple situation that they want new challenges. So we will try to use this space to prepare the team that I think is going to be here. "If the market closes and then they are Manchester United players, we as a club have to treat them in the same conditions. But in this moment I'm just working with the players that I think are going to stay and the other guys are trying to find a solution for their careers."

Title: Unpaid wages, transfers embargoes and a closed stand - Sheff Wed in crisis
Content: The new Championship season is just days away but at a time for renewed optimism and anticipation, Sheffield Wednesday are consumed by chaos and uncertainty. Title: Amorim: I want to stay at Man Utd for 20 YEARS!
Content: Ruben Amorim has revealed he wants to be Manchester United manager for the next 20 years. The Portuguese coach is about to take charge of his first full campaign at Old Trafford but his first half-season saw him guide the club to 15th place and defeat in the Europa League final. This summer, Amorim has felt that United are different and the 40-year-old is backing himself to have a Sir Alex Ferguson-style tenure at United. Speaking on United's pre-season tour of the United States, Amorim said of his long-term plans at the club: "Yeah, I want to stay. I want to stay 20 (years). That is my goal and I truly believe in that. Always do. "Something will happen. In some moments I will be lucky. I had a lot of luck during my career as a manager and my idea is to stay for many years. "But again we know that the results will dictate that. I know that last season I used (up) all the credits but I'm ready to start fresh. "I want to be manager of Manchester United for a while. And I took five years to choose this club so I don't want to fail." Asked about his chances of success at United, Amorim replied: "If you look, Sporting was the same thing. They said that in three months I'm out. "They said that I had three per cent (chance) of winning one title with Sporting. It was the same thing."

Title: Moyes: Right-sided player a priority for Everton

Title: Potter pleased with Paqueta news
Content: West Ham boss Graham Potter has rejoiced in the "incredibly positive" news about Lucas Paqueta being cleared of his spot-fixing charges. The FA had been seeking a lifetime ban for the midfielder, whose case was heard by an independent regulatory commission. Paqueta consistently denied the charges. Sky Sports The Brazilian, who had been under investigation since August 2023, was charged with breaching betting rules in May 2024 and the hearing began in March this year. "You never know for sure because anything can happen in the window with anybody,' said Potter. "But the news is incredibly positive. If it had gone the other way, there would have been a whole other line of questions. "Lucas is happy and committed. He is an important person in dressing room and at the club and we love him. We just want to help him enjoy his football. "You can imagine on a personal level for him, having to fight those allegations was an incredible challenge for him. It has been a really tough period in his life and career. "It is a credit to him and his family and everyone who has supported him that he has come through."

Title: Andrews: Wissa transfer situation not ideal

Wissa played no part in Brentford's 1-0 friendly loss to QPR on Saturday amid interest in the striker from Newcastle. "The situation is that he is training at the training ground," Andrews told Sky Sports News. "It‚Äôs probably public knowledge at this stage that he left our training camp in Lisbon. That was probably the right decision for all parties. We had to support him in what is a difficult time for him. "I think we have to remember that it‚Äôs not just about being a footballer, it‚Äôs the person and the human being first. "Again, it's public knowledge that there is some interest in Wiss. We have to respect that and respect him. "I have got a really good relationship with Yoane from last season and that‚Äôs still the case now, but obviously it‚Äôs not ideal." Andrews added: "We have constant communication with Yoane around the situation. I think he‚Äôs OK to a point. I‚Äôve been in this situation myself as a player and it can be stressful for an individual. I think that‚Äôs where it goes back to what are club‚Äôs about and how it‚Äôs run from the top. We always treat people with respect. "When you look at the business we‚Äôve done this season, the outgoings have been done early. This is probably not wanted or desired, certainly from my point of view. It‚Äôs not an ideal scenario but it‚Äôs what the transfer window is."

Title: Analysis: Son a Spurs and Premier League icon
Content: Sky Sports' Sam Blitz: Heung-Min Son will go down as one of Tottenham Hotspur's standout players of the modern era. There is even a fair argument to say he is the standalone Spurs icon of this generation. Harry Kane may be Spurs' all-time record goalscorer, but Son will always be remembered as the one who stayed. Sky Sports Kane gave Spurs fans more goalscoring moments down the years but Son holds just one moment - the trophy lift in Bilbao - which stands above all in terms of Spurs' recent history. And it is worth remembering that many of Kane's goals came from Son's assists. Statistically speaking, Son was one half of the deadliest striker partnership in Premier League history. Son and Kane set each other up 47 times across 229 games together - no Premier League pair has managed more. The 2020/21 campaign was the highlight of their partnership, with their 14 assists for goals between them the most in a single season. Thomas Frank described the South Korean as one of the greatest Premier League wingers of all time and his numbers are definitely up there. Not only is he fourth on Spurs' all-time top goalscorers list but he is 16th on the Premier League's scorers chart - and one of only 34 players to be in the Premier League 100 goals club. Since his Premier League debut, only Mohamed Salah has more goal contributions. Son even has more than Kevin de Bruyne in that time, despite the Belgian joining Manchester City in the same summer that Son arrived at Spurs. All that plus a lovable character that even rivals fans could not argue against, it highlights that Son is not just a Spurs legend, but a Premier League one too.

Title: Howe: Newcastle only looking for the best
Content: Eddie Howe has added that Newcastle are only "looking for the best" in terms of transfer targets amid a challenging window for the club. Not only have the Magpies been hit with Alexander Isak's desire to leave, but they have also missed out on a number of transfer targets to rivals, including Liam Delap, Joao Pedro, Hugo Ekitike and James Trafford. Newcastle have also hit a roadblock in their pursuit of Brentford forward Yoane Wissa. With Callum Wilson departing earlier this summer, it leaves just Will Osula as their only recognised first-team striker on their pre-season tour of Asia. "We're looking for the best players that we can get," said Howe. "Whatever our target position is, we're looking for the best so I see all situations open and available to us. "I feel that's the only way that we're going to get to where we want to go, which is to maximise, and it's quality over quantity. It always has been. That's always been the way that we try to work and the way that we try to recruit, and I think we've done it pretty well to this point. "It's been a challenging summer, because we've missed out on various targets for loads of different reasons, but we're still very competitive, and we're still in there trying to bring very good players to the club - and that won't change til the window shuts."

Title: Howe not sure on next steps after Isak bid rejected
Content: Newcastle manager Eddie Howe has confirmed that the club have turned down a bid from Liverpool for Alexander Isak - but is unsure on what will happen next. Sky Sports News understands Liverpool's opening offer for Isak  was ¬£110m plus add-ons. However, the total offer did not reach ¬£120m. "From my situation I am very much removed from what was happening back home," said Howe in a press conference. "I was made aware of a bid yesterday and that bid was turned down all before I even heard about it. People back in England are dealing with the situation. "I really don't know what happens next. From our perspective, we still support Alex in every way, and my wish is that we see him in a Newcastle shirt again. "It is difficult because you don't know what is going to happen. There can be all sorts of talk and hypothetical situations but then you are dealing with reality. "The reality is we had the first bid from Liverpool yesterday. I believe that was turned down, from this point onwards let's see what happens. "I have no idea to try to predict that. In terms of trying to upset players, from my perspective, we can only talk about us, we try to do things the right way, signing players is always complex, we just try to do what we think is right. "I can't talk about other clubs, that is not for me to say."

Respectfully the club is helping me with this decision. "It was the most difficult decision I have made in my career. Such amazing memories. It was so hard to make the decision. "I need a new environment to push myself. I need a little bit of change - 10 years is a long time. I came to north London as a kid, 23 years old, such a young age. I leave this club as a grown man, a very proud man. "I want to say thank you to all the Spurs fans for giving me so much love. I hope the goodbye is also good timing and this is the right time to make that decision. I hope everyone can accept that and respect that.‚Äù Son confirmed that he had made his decision to leave a while ago but only told a few players. Why did Newcastle reject Liverpool's bid for Isak?
Content: Sky Sports News' Keith Downie: "Liverpool have made a formal approach to Newcastle for Alexander Isak. "It is a bid in excess of ¬£100m, we don't know the exact figure at this stage. "This is not the last we are going to hear of this story. "They are looking to bring in a top-level replacement. They need to have assurances that they will get a player in. "They don't want to leave themselves in a position where they have no strikers. All they would be left with is young Will Osula. "Next week will be so interesting. Newcastle and Isak return on Monday and it will be interesting to see if Liverpool return with a second offer. "Personal terms would not be a problem. It could be done next week. I don't see it dragging on until the end of the transfer window. "It's a huge transfer and would be a Premier League record. Title: Analysis: Why Donnarumma would be an upgrade on Onana
Content: Sky Sports' Peter Smith: "Gianluigi Donnarumma would be a massive signing for Man Utd - both literally and figuratively. "It feels like Donnarumma has gone to even greater heights this season, playing a crucial role in Paris St-Germain's incredible season. "Commanding in Ligue 1, a shootout star against Liverpool in the Champions League and formidable with five clean sheets in eight games at the Club World Cup, Donnarumma would be a huge coup for United if they could get a deal done. "Andre Onana has been in the spotlight since he had that let-off against Wolves in his Premier League debut and uncertainty about the current United keeper has fed the nervousness and lack of conviction about Ruben Amorim's backline. "His total of eight errors leading to goals since the start of 2023/24 is more than any other goalkeeper in the Premier League. Donnarumma would be a substantial upgrade."
