Title: Joao Pedro already paying off price tag
Content: Sky Sports' Adam Bate: Chelsea had already made almost ¬£60m in participation and prize money for reaching the semi-final stage of the tournament and they made another ¬£22m with their 2-0 win over Fluminense in the Club World Cup semi-final on Wednesday. Another ¬£29m is on the line in the final at the weekend. In other words, Joao Pedro has swiftly paid off a chunk of his fee with his outrageous full debut. Chelsea's new signing had not scored from outside the box in 70 games for his previous club Brighton, but it took him just 18 minutes to curl the ball home here. If that effort showed his class, his second-half strike highlighted other assets - his ability as a ball carrier on the counter-attack, his dribbling threat and the power of his shooting. It was an emphatic finish by the Brazilian to all but end Fluminense's hopes. Nicolas Jackson carried the weight of responsibility to lead the line for Chelsea last season but with Liam Delap making an encouraging start to his career with the club, this performance from Joao Pedro offered further proof that the Blues have strengthened. His fluid movement makes him a different proposition and he even contributed at the other end of the pitch with a crucial defensive header late in the first half. He did not celebrate against former club Fluminense. But there will be many celebrations to come.

Title: 'Gyokeres has more to his game than goals'
Content:
Portuguese football journalist David Novo on Sky Sports News: "We all know the Premier League is another level. It's top level.
It's way better than the Portuguese championship. "I don't know if Gyokeres is going to score that amount of goals, but I think he's really up to the challenge. He's going to be a huge signing for Arsenal and I think he's going to score a lot of goals in the Premier League. "He never missed one penalty here in Portugal, so it's one of his weapons, so to speak. We all know he's a really strong and physical striker and with the way Sporting play, they have several penalties. And because Gyokeres suffers a lot of falls in a penalty box, usually that's him taking the responsibility to score those penalties. "People speak about his goals and that's the most important thing for a striker. But he's the type of striker who likes to press the defenders to make the offensive fouls when necessary. "If a manager wants to have a striker who is the first one to defend, Gyokeres can do it. I don't know if it's what Mikel Arteta wants, but he can do it."

Title: Could Gyokeres lose money by making Arsenal move?
Content: Portuguese football journalist David Novo on Sky Sports News: "That's true. We published that yesterday at Record. Title: WATCH: 'It's superb! It's stunning!' | Have Arsenal found their perfect striker?
'Gyokeres deal not in jeopardy despite small difference in bid structure'
Content: Portuguese football journalist David Novo on Sky Sports News: "We published in Record today that Sporting believe there will be an agreement at the end of this week. That will be a relief for everyone involved. "Viktor Gyokeres is supposed to return to training on Friday - and he doesn't want to return. He has already informed Sporting's president he will not return to training. In fact, he was supposed to get back to training yesterday, but Sporting authorised him to return on Friday. "This deal has a lot of issues, some tense situations, so we have to be careful with that, but that's the feeling here in Portugal now. "The problem, since the beginning, is about the money. The info we have here in Portugal is that Sporting want ‚Ç¨80m; ‚Ç¨70m up front, plus ‚Ç¨10m in bonuses. Arsenal are willing to pay ‚Ç¨65m plus ‚Ç¨15m. So it's a small difference of ‚Ç¨5m and I think it's such a tiny difference that it's not going to make the deal collapse. "Arsenal need to give more money up front for the transfer fee to reach the ‚Ç¨70m and to decrease the amount of bonuses. That's what Sporting wants. They are not going to change their minds. "We need to understand if Arsenal is willing to change the offer. We believe so. Speaking of business of this magnitude, ‚Ç¨5m is nothing, so that's why we believe that things are going to happen."

Title: Martin wants any Rangers recruits to be ‚Äòdesperate‚Äô to play for club
Content: Russell Martin feels anyone coming to Rangers must show him they are ‚Äúdesperate‚Äù to play for the club as he looks to build for a successful first campaign in charge. The 39-year-old former Southampton boss has already started to reshape the squad, with midfielder Joe Rothwell joining fellow new defensive recruits Max Aarons and Emmanuel Fernandez, while Lyall Cameron‚Äôs transfer from Dundee had already been set. Martin will get a first opportunity to show Rangers fans his intentions with a pre-season friendly against Club Brugge on Sunday as the focus moves towards the Champions League qualifying tie against Panathinaikos. ‚ÄúPeople need to be desperate to play for this club and not just be an option and one of a few options,‚Äù Martin told Rangers TV. ‚ÄúCan you come here and add to us as a group in terms of your behaviour, the way you train, the way you work and who you are as a human being, your willingness to play in a way that we want to? Which is not for everyone because it‚Äôs not easy. ‚ÄúAlso playing for this football club will not be for everyone ‚Äì character first and then talent after and, if we get both, we will be really happy. ‚ÄúThe ones we think will be coming into the building in the next week or two, we‚Äôll be so pleased with them and we still need some help, but we also can‚Äôt be in a rush to get ones we‚Äôre not too sure about. ‚ÄúWhen we do get them in, it will be down to a lot of very hard work, a lot of due diligence and we‚Äôll make sure they are the right ones.‚Äù

Estevao, the 18-year-old winger who is to join them after the tournament following a ¬£29.1m deal, cancelled out Cole Palmer's opener when he took a pass from the right and smashed a shot in from a tight angle. ‚ÄúYou can see he is a huge talent, you can see is a fantastic player,‚Äù said Maresca. ‚ÄúThe only thing now is when you come from South America or another part of the world to Europe you need to adapt. ‚ÄúWe are going to help him to adapt and first of all to enjoy football. We don‚Äôt have any doubt, as he is so good, that he is going to be an important player for Chelsea.‚Äù The Italian added: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre very happy. It‚Äôs a fantastic day. The semi-finals of the Club World Cup ‚Äì the best clubs in the world ‚Äì and we are there. ‚ÄúProbably for us it has been the perfect night because we won and Estevao scored, so it was very good for all of us.‚Äù

Title: Improved offer for Mbeumo expected
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Dharmesh Sheth: Manchester United are expected to go in with an improved offer for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo. Internal discussions at United continue over their next steps regarding their pursuit of the 25-year-old, who effectively has two years left on his deal. There is a feeling that United's latest proposal - worth an initial ¬£55m, reaching ¬£62.5m with add-ons- is not far away from what Brentford want. However, the structure of the deal will be significant. Brentford want at least ¬£65m ‚Äì with most, if not all, of that amount guaranteed. Mbeumo only wants to join United and Brentford sporting director Phil Giles says the Cameroon international has said the forward is happy to stay if a deal cannot be agreed. While United‚Äôs focus is on Mbeumo and potential sales, they are still exploring a deal for a striker. It‚Äôs understood that Juventus mentioned the sale of Dusan Vlahovic when talks took place over Sancho. Juventus are desperate to sell Vlahovic ‚Äì he is on huge wages and has entered the final year of his contract. Juve are still interested in Napoli striker Victor Osimhen, who was on loan at Galatasaray last season. Vlahovic is one of a number of strikers United have looked at and they continue to keep an eye on Ollie Watkins‚Äô situation at Aston Villa.

Title: Uncertain whether free agent Brownhill will continue at Burnley
Content: Josh Brownhill‚Äôs future at Burnley is uncertain as the club continue to prepare for life back in the Premier League. Burnley said in May that discussions were ongoing with their club captain over a new deal, but he is now out of contract as of Monday and a free agent. The Clarets have yet to tie the player down and the midfielder is in a position to sign for another club. Securing Brownhill‚Äôs future was a key priority for Scott Parker this summer. His importance to the side was recognised by his fellow teammates when he picked up the Players‚Äô Player of the Season award following promotion. It would be a major setback to lose the 29-year-old - who joined in 2020 - who played such a key role in guiding Burnley back to the Premier League at the first time of asking. However, Burnley are comfortable with the offer they have made to Josh Brownhill. With the midfielder's contract having expired, there is a reluctant acceptance that the player is considering all of his options and his future may lie away from Turf Moor.

Title: Hull to appeal against transfer embargo and ‚Äòconfident‚Äô of resolving situation
Content: Hull have announced they will appeal against an English Football League transfer embargo and are ‚Äúconfident of resolving the matter‚Äù. The Sky Bet Championship club said in a brief statement that they have been placed under a ‚Äúthree-window fee restriction with immediate effect‚Äù. The statement said: ‚ÄúHull City can confirm that we have received notification from the EFL that the club is subject to a transfer embargo and a three-window fee restriction with immediate effect. ‚ÄúWe will appeal the three-window fee restriction and are confident of resolving the matter as soon as possible.‚Äù Turkish owner Acun Ilicali, who took control at the MKM Stadium in January 2022, assured fans at a question-and-answer session this week that the club did not have any financial issues. But fans‚Äô group Hull City Supporters Trust said it was ‚Äúdeeply concerned‚Äù and that the embargo raises ‚Äúserious questions about the club‚Äôs financial management‚Äù.

The Sweden international impressed on loan at Ipswich last season despite their relegation back to the Championship. Ipswich had an obligation to buy him if they had stayed up, and they have also maintained interest in signing him again this summer. But he has been shortlisted at a number of clubs across Europe including Besiktas and Sevilla, and may have the chance to play in the Premier League again at another club next term. Cajuste made 33 appearances on loan at Ipswich last season, scoring and assisting once, after joining Ipswich over Brentford, who had also been keen.

Title: Cardiff owner Tan expected to reject takeover bid from consortium led by Bale
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Amar Mehta: Cardiff City owner Vincent Tan is expected to reject a bid to buy the club from a consortium led by Gareth Bale. It is understood that Bale submitted an offer that is lower than the current owners' valuation, and they are expected to turn it down. One source has told Sky Sports News that the offer was ¬£20m, less than a reported ¬£40m. And Sky Sports News also understands that there are other, higher offers on the table to buy Cardiff from Tan. It remains to be seen whether Bale's consortium return with another offer, but one is likely to come given his open interest in buying his hometown club. In June, Bale told Sky Sports News: "We are interested in getting Cardiff. "It's my home club, it's where I grew up and my uncle used to play for them. To be involved with an ownership group would be a dream come true."

Title: Hannover closing in on loan deal for Celtic defender Nawrocki
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Sky in Germany's Florian Plettenberg: Hannover are closing in on a loan deal for Celtic centre-back Maik Nawrocki. It is understood the clubs have agreed a season-long loan deal for the 24-year-old. Sky in Germany are reporting that Nawrocki has completed a medical with the 2. Bundesliga club. The Poland international made five appearances for Celtic last season, scoring one goal.

Title: NEW EPISODE! Listen to the latest Transfer Talk podcast
Content: Pete Graves is joined by Dharmesh Sheth and Sam Tighe to discuss Manchester United's latest bid for Bryan Mbeumo with the Brentford forward still favouring a move to Old Trafford. Also on the agenda is Chelsea's signing of Joao Pedro and the latest on their pursuit of Borussia Dortmund winger Jamie Gittens. Plus, as talks with RB Leipzig striker Benjamin Sesko stall, Arsenal are linked with Noni Madueke, Eberechi Eze and Rodrygo as Mikel Arteta looks to add a winger this window.

Title: Tomiyasu expected to leave Arsenal after contract cut short
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Takehiro Tomiyasu is expected to leave Arsenal by way of the mutual termination of his contract. The Japan defender still has a year left on his current deal, plus an option on a further year. But Tomiyasu is not expected back from a long-term knee injury until later in the year. He played only six minutes of football for Arsenal last season, and the problem required surgery. Tomiyasu signed for the club from Bologna in 2021 and has made 84 appearances for the Gunners.

Title: Parma in talks over signing Watford midfielder Dele-Bashiru
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Anthony Joseph: Parma are in talks to sign Watford central midfielder Tom Dele-Bashiru. It is understood that the 25-year-old has told the club he wants to leave. Watford are open to selling him this summer and are exploring options for him, but only at the right price. Dele-Bashiru has one year left on his contract, but Watford have the option to extend by a further year.

Title: Tottenham Women appoint Ho as new head coach
Content: Tottenham Women have appointed Martin Ho as their new head coach on a three-year deal. The Englishman leaves Norwegian side SK Brann to replace Robert Vilahamn, who left Spurs at the end of last season after two years at the club. Ho was in the Everton academy before moving into coaching. He worked as Andy Spence's assistant for Everton Women between 2015 and 2018 before taking up the head coach role at Liverpool Women U21s. Ho left in 2020 to become an assistant manager at Manchester United Women. In 2023, he was appointed as SK Brann's head coach, replacing Olli Harder.

Title: London City Lionesses sign forward Franssi
Content: Women's Super League 2 side London City Lionesses have signed Finland international forward Sanni Franssi. The 30-year-old, who is part of Finland's Euro 2025 squad, joins from Spanish Liga F side Real Sociedad. Franssi said ‚ÄúI‚Äôm really excited, it is an exciting project and club to be a part of. It‚Äôs a club with a lot of ambition; they want to do great things [at London City]. ‚ÄúThese types of projects are always the most exciting to be a part of for a player. Fans can expect a lot of energy from me on the pitch; I will always give my all for the team. I can‚Äôt wait to meet everyone and give the fans a great season!‚Äù

Title: Nico Williams signs new TEN-YEAR contract at Athletic Club
Content: Nico Williams has signed a new 10-year contract at Athletic Club. A target for Barcelona, Bayern Munich, Arsenal and many more, the 22-year-old has committed to the club until 2035. His previous deal expired in 2027, but the new one sees a release clause increased by more than 50 per cent. Williams helped Spain to win the Euros last summer as he scored their opener in the 2-1 final win over England. The forward said of his new deal: "When it comes to making decisions, for me, the most important thing is to listen to your heart. "I am where I want to be, with my people, this is my home. Aupa Athletic!"

Title: Watford closing in on signing winger Diallo from Metz in ¬£4.3m deal
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Watford are closing in on the signing of Metz winger Pape Diallo. It is understood the 21-year-old is due to undergo a medical today, after the clubs agreed a deal worth up to ¬£4.3m. The Senegal international scored seven goals and provided four assists in Ligue 2 last season.

Title: Dundee Utd offer free agent Vassell two-year deal
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Dundee United have offered striker Kyle Vassell a two-year contract. The 32-year-old has become a free agent this week after his Kilmarnock deal expired. Killie are also in talks with him over extending his stay at Rugby Park. Colorado Springs Switchbacks have also expressed an interest in taking the Northern Irishman to America, with clubs in the EFL and abroad monitoring his situation.

Title: Derby close to an agreement to sign forward Agyemang from Charlotte FC
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Zinny Boswell: Derby County are closing in on an agreement with Charlotte FC for USA forward Patrick Agyemang. The total package under discussion for the 24-year-old is understood to be worth in the region of  ¬£7.3m ($10m). The initial fee is expected to be around ¬£5.85m ($8m) with ¬£1.46m (‚Ç¨2m) in add-ons. Sky Sports News understands there is still work to be done to get the deal over the line. Agyemang effectively has 18 months left on his deal with the MLS side.

Title: Saints agree deal to sign FC Koln striker Downs
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam: Southampton are understood to have agreed a deal with 2. Bundesliga side FC Koln for striker Damion Downs. Saints have agreed a deal worth up to ¬£6.9m (‚Ç¨8m), including ¬£5m fixed. The 20-year-old USA international scored 10 goals in the German second division last season.

Title: 'Tomiyasu to leave Arsenal after mutual termination of contract'
Content: Arsenal defender Takehiro Tomiyasu will leave the club after a mutual termination of his contract, according to BBC Sport. The 26-year-old has been plagued with injuries since joining the club in the summer of 2021. The Japan international played just six minutes last season and is recovering from knee surgery, which he underwent in February. It is claimed he will be out for up to five months, leading to Arsenal and Tomiyasu reaching a contractual settlement to end his contract. The ex-Bologna player's Gunners contract was due to expire next summer. Tomiyasu has made 84 appearances across all competitions for Mikel Arteta's side.

Title: Maresca: Pedro could make debut against Palmeiras at Club World Cup
Content: New Chelsea signing Joao Pedro could make his debut against Palmeiras in the quarter-finals of the Club World Cup. The Blues face the Brazilian outfit on Friday evening (2am Saturday UK) at Philadelphia‚Äôs Lincoln Financial Field. Pedro is available for the game after completing his ¬£60m move from Brighton earlier this week. Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca said: ‚ÄúJoao‚Äôs situation is a bit strange or different because he was on holiday. "Even if he was working it is not the same when you work for yourself, compared with when you work with the team. ‚ÄúBut we are very happy with Joao. In the last two days he worked with us. "We‚Äôll see if we need him and if we have a chance to give him some minutes we‚Äôre going to give him some minutes.‚Äù

Title: David to have Juve medical today ahead of free transfer from Lille
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Jonathan David has arrived in Turin ahead of having a medical today with Juventus. All being well, he will then sign a long-term contract. David is a free agent after his contract at Lille expired earlier this week.

Title: Hull City hit with transfer embargo - reports
Content: Hull City have been placed under a transfer embargo by the Football League until the end of summer 2026 as fears grow over the financial stability of the Championship club, according to The Telegraph.

Title: Chelsea keeper Petrovic headed to Sunderland?
Content: Djordje Petrovic appears likely to remain in the Premier League with the Serbian goalkeeper set to join Sunderland in a transfer which will net Chelsea a cool ¬£21.5m, write The Daily Mirror.

Title: Mosquera tells Valencia he wants Arsenal move
Content: Cristhian Mosquera has told Valencia that he has his heart set on joining Arsenal this summer after the La Liga outfit rebuffed an offer for the defender, according to the Daily Mirror. Valencia are understood to value the centre-back in the region of ¬£25m (‚Ç¨30m). Sky Sports News reported last week that the Gunners had opened talks over the 21-year-old.

Title: Heinze to join Arteta coaching team at Arsenal
Content: Former Man Utd defender Gabriel Heinze is joining Mikel Arteta‚Äôs coaching staff at Arsenal, write The Athletic. Heinze has been working as a head coach, most recently in Argentina with Newell's Old Boys.

Title: Real open to Rodrygo exit amid Arsenal interest
Content: Real Madrid and new boss Xabi Alonso are open to allowing Arsenal transfer target Rodrygo to leave the club this summer, according to The Athletic. Earlier this week we reported Chelsea's Noni Madueke is another name under consideration among several possible winger targets at Arsenal. Chelsea do not need to sell the 23-year-old and he has not asked to leave. Athletic Club's Nico Williams was a top target for Arsenal but he wants to sign for Barcelona. Crystal Palace's Eberechi Eze is also a player Arsenal admire. There is no evidence to suggest yet which deal Arsenal would like to try and close.

Title: Ramsey join Mexican club Pumas UNAM
Content: Aaron Ramsey has joined Mexican club Pumas UNAM. The 34-year-old was put in caretaker charge of Cardiff for the final three games of last season as they were relegated to League One.

Title: Newcastle increase bid for Forest's Elanga to ¬£55m
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Pete Graves: Newcastle United have made an improved offer in the region of ¬£55million for Anthony Elanga. Newcastle had an initial bid rejected of ¬£45m for the Nottingham Forest winger, but have returned with an improved bid as Eddie Howe looks to secure one of his top targets. Elanga is believed to be intrigued by the project at Newcastle, while Eddie Howe sees him as a player who can significantly improve their attacking options. Talks continue.

Title: Hearts' Penrice heading to AEK Athens
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: AEK Athens have agreed a deal to sign Hearts left-back James Penrice. It‚Äôs understood the Scottish Premiership side will receive a significant transfer fee for the 26-year-old. Penrice is due to fly to the Netherlands on Saturday to meet up with AEK squad, who are on their pre-season training camp.

Title: Dundee United seal Pappoe loan deal
Content: Dundee United have completed the signing of Isaac Pappoe from Ferencvaros on a season-long loan. The Ghana youth international is a 21-year-old midfielder made just five appearances for the Hungarian champions last season, however boss Jim Goodwin is confident Pappoe can have an impact in Scotland. "We‚Äôve worked extremely hard to bring Isaac to the club amid strong interest from elsewhere,‚Äù said Goodwin on Dundee United‚Äôs official website. ‚ÄúHis energy and work ethic are infectious, and he has terrific ball-carrying and progressing abilities. Out of possession, he reads the game intelligently. ‚ÄúWe enjoyed great success with the loan market last year. Luca Stephenson, Emmanuel Adegboyega and Sam Dalby, among others, were instrumental in our European qualification. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre confident Isaac can continue along this trend.‚Äù The move is subject to both international and SFA clearance.

Title: Aberdeen sign Iceland rising star Kjartansson
Content: Aberdeen‚Äôs fifth signing of the summer is Icelandic youth international Kjartan M√°r Kjartansson. The 18-year-old central midfielder arrives from Stjarnan on a four-year contract for an undisclosed fee and subject to international clearance and VISA formalities. ‚ÄúKjartan is a player who our scouting department have been aware of and tracking for some time. We are pleased to have signed him given the significant interest from some big clubs,‚Äù Dons boss Jimmy Thelin said.

Title: Dortmund confirm Gittens set to join Chelsea
Content: Borussia Dortmund have confirmed Jamie Gittens is set to move to Chelsea. The German club say "all parties agreed to this deal today" in Fort Lauderdale, Florida. The contractual details are still to be finalised, the statement adds. "The talks with Chelsea were challenging, but ultimately we are pleased that we can most likely realize our financial ambitions and then have planning security," said BVB sporting director Sebastian Kehl. He added: "Jamie is an outstanding player who has given us a great deal of pleasure. He now wants to take the next step in his career at Chelsea, and we wish him all the best and much success." Gittens is set to sign a seven-year contract at Chelsea, in a deal which could see Dortmund net ¬£48m plus ¬£3.5m in add-ons.

Title: Man City Women appoint Denmark boss Jeglertz as new head coach
Content: Andree Jeglertz has agreed a four-year contract to become Manchester City Women's new head coach, with the Denmark national team manager set to take over after this summer's European Championship. Sky Sports

Title: Abraham signs for Besiktas on loan
Content: Ex-Chelsea forward Tammy Abraham has signed for Turkish side Besiktas on a one-year loan deal from Roma. Sky in Italy have reported there is a ‚Ç¨2m loan fee with an obligation to buy for ‚Ç¨13m. There is also ‚Ç¨2m in potential bonuses. Roma are understood to have done the deal as the Italian club are in a race against time to comply with UEFA's Financial Fair Play rules.

Title: Como agree ¬£16.5m Kuhn fee
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News reporter Anthony Joseph: Como have agreed an initial ¬£16.5m fee for Celtic winger Nicolas Kuhn. It‚Äôs understood the clubs are ironing the finer details of potential add-ons, but a deal is expected to be reached soon. Kuhn, 25, has also verbally agreed terms on a long-term contract with the Serie A club.

Title: Shankland pens three-year Hearts deal
Content: Hearts have announced that captain Lawrence Shankland has re-signed with the club on a three-year contract. The 29-year-old Scotland forward ‚Äì who has scored 68 goals since arriving from Belgian side Beerschot three years ago ‚Äì looked to be on his way out of Tynecastle after several rounds of negotiations over the past 18 months failed to result in an agreement However, after becoming a free agent this summer and exploring his options, Shankland has been persuaded by recently-installed manager Derek McInnes to accept an offer to become the club‚Äôs highest-paid player. The striker flew out to Spain on Wednesday evening to meet up with the Hearts squad at their pre-season training base and the Jambos announced on Thursday afternoon that he has agreed a deal until 2028, bringing to an end a long-running contract saga. ‚ÄúLawrence‚Äôs not only been ingrained in the club the last few years, he‚Äôs been a big player for the club, knows his way about the Premiership, knows his way to goal,‚Äù McInnes told the Hearts website. ‚ÄúIt just made so much sense on so many levels for me. I‚Äôve known Lawrence since he was a young boy and I know how important family is to him and how important being happy is. ‚ÄúI always felt that that was a huge advantage for us. Not only does he enjoy his time at Hearts, those family connections are always very strong.‚Äù Shankland marked his first campaign at the club by becoming the first Hearts player in 31 years to score more than 20 goals in a season and then netted 31 goals in 2023-24 to earn himself every Scottish Premiership Player of the Year award available and secure a place in the Scotland squad for Euro 2024. The former Ayr and Dundee United forward‚Äôs most recent campaign was more of a struggle in front of goal and he incurred the wrath of some fans after a costly Conference League penalty miss away to Cercle Brugge in November, although he did notch five times in his final five appearances to leave supporters clinging to the hope that he might decide to remain at Tynecastle. The retention of their most prolific forward of the 21st century represents a significant coup at a time when Hearts are embarking on an exciting new era in partnership with Jamestown Analytics and with Brighton owner Tony Bloom on board as a minority investor. ‚ÄúI do feel that having that recognised number no.9, a goal scorer with a real pedigree, Scotland internationalist, the motivation for Lawrence to do well here at not only a club that he loves, a club that he‚Äôs happy with,‚Äù added McInnes. ‚ÄúYou see the way he‚Äôs embraced his team-mates this morning. He‚Äôs a really popular boy, but he‚Äôs got so much to do here. In my time at Hearts, I want to make sure it‚Äôs successful and I want Lawrence to feel exactly the same and he does. ‚ÄúWe want to be lifting silverware. We want to be going into group stages in Europe and we want to have a consistent thing going here and that is the driver for all of us. I do feel that having Lawrence in the building gives us a better chance of achieving all that.‚Äù

Title: Fernandez ‚Äòcan‚Äôt be more grateful‚Äô after signing for Rangers
Content: New Rangers signing Emmanuel Fernandez has revealed how he had to dig deep to revive his dream of a career in professional football. The 23-year-old centre back joined Gers on a four-year deal on Wednesday after a standout season with Peterborough in League One last term. But Fernandez recalled being placed in limbo in 2020 when he was released by Gillingham as a teenager and signed for non-league Ramsgate before Peterborough eventually offered him a route back into league football in 2021. ‚ÄúMy journey from being let go by a club, playing non-league during the Covid season, not really having a club and then obviously getting an opportunity at Peterborough, where it took me a while to start playing, but eventually I played and after fully playing [last season], to get this move, I can‚Äôt be more grateful,‚Äù he said in an interview with Rangers TV. ‚ÄúI think it was my family behind me, pushing me and making sure they kept me on the right tracks to train harder. If I didn‚Äôt have a club, train and just push myself to the next level because during Covid you couldn‚Äôt really do much. But I‚Äôd go to the park, do runs sometimes, bring my brother along with me, so that‚Äôs what pushed me to get to this point in my career."

Title: Andrews: I love the way Antoni takes the ball and drives
Content: New Brentford head coach Keith Andrews has highlighted Antoni Milambo's experience and dribbling skills after the Feyenoord midfielder completed his move to the Gtech. Milambo was part of the Netherlands U21 side lost 2-1 to eventual winners England in the recent Euro 2025 semi-final. ‚ÄúAntoni has played a lot of football in the last 12 months and really shot to prominence," Andrews told the Bees website. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs had experience in the Eredivisie, Champions League and most recently the U21 Euros with the Netherlands. ‚ÄúI love the way that Antoni takes the ball and drives; he has the ability to go past players and he‚Äôs a goal threat. He will complement the midfielders we have in the building. ‚ÄúNow it‚Äôs just a case of getting him used to the intensity and rhythm of the Premier League and our own intensity levels. I am looking forward to working with him.‚Äù Meanwhile, Brentford technical director Lee Dykes said the club had been tracking the Dutchman for some time. ‚ÄúWe are all very excited by the arrival of Antoni Milambo,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe recruitment department have followed Antoni for a few years now and have closely monitored his development at Feyenoord into the first team. ‚ÄúWe believe that Antoni has all the attributes needed to be a very good Premier League player and feel he has the potential to develop his game to a high level here in England. ‚ÄúAntoni is a skilful, forward-thinking midfield player capable of scoring all types of goals as proven through his youth development phase, in the Eredivisie and in the Champions League. ‚ÄúI would like to place on record our appreciation to the senior management team at Feyenoord for their assistance with our interest in Antoni and their professionalism throughout the transfer process.‚Äù

Title: Milambo joins Brentford as Andrews's first signing
Content: Brentford have begun the Keith Andrews era by completing the signing of Feyenoord midfielder Antoni Milambo, subject to international clearance. Brentford have agreed a deal featuring an initial ¬£15.4m (‚Ç¨18m) payment plus an additional ¬£3.4m (‚Ç¨4m) in add-ons. Milambo, who scored four goals in 40 Eredivisie appearances for Feyenoord, is not a replacement for Arsenal-bound Christian Norgaard and instead fits the profile the club have wanted to add for a while - an attack-minded No 8.

Title: Taylor dismisses speculation that Tierney return influenced move
Content: Greg Taylor has dismissed the notion that the return of fellow left-back Kieran Tierney this summer effectively forced him out of Celtic after his move to Greek side PAOK. ‚ÄúI would certainly not say that‚Äôs fair,‚Äù Taylor said in an interview with Sky Sports News. ‚ÄúI think there‚Äôs been competition for my place at Celtic in the whole six years I was there and it was not something I ever shirked from. ‚ÄúI loved that, it drove me on, it helped me find my best level so, no, I wouldn‚Äôt say it was particularly Kieran coming back. It was just that I felt that it was probably the right time for me to try something different.‚Äù Taylor, who won 11 trophies and made more than 200 appearances for Celtic, said leaving Parkhead was ‚Äúthe biggest decision‚Äù of his career. ‚ÄúWhen I left Kilmarnock back in 2019 it was that bit easier because I was progressing,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI wanted to go and try and play for the biggest team in Scotland and I think at that time there probably weren‚Äôt many who believed I would play as many games as I did but the one person that really did was myself. ‚ÄúI was lucky to go and play 200-plus games for Celtic which was unbelievable. It wasn‚Äôt easy, there was a million things to weigh up but I just felt it was the right time to do it.‚Äù

Title: Richarlison to be assessed before decision on Spurs future
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas: Richarlison is among the players Thomas Frank will assess in pre-season before a decision is made on his Tottenham future. The Brazil striker has been the subject of wide speculation in successive transfer windows, in part down to injuries hampering his ability to play regular football. His preference remains to stay and fight for his place at Spurs, conscious he has not been able to show his best because of those periods on the sidelines. But Galatasaray are thought to be among a number of teams who would be interested in signing him if there is any sign he could leave this summer. The Turkish club may be more interested in the scenario of a loan, as would several other clubs, although that is far away from being a possibility at this stage. Among Richarlison's priorities is to ensure he is the regular Brazil No9 and for that he needs to play regularly at a high level. He still has two years left on his contract at Spurs, who will play Champions League football next season and therefore need the strength in-depth. The club are looking to sign new forward players.

Title: Man Utd 'stepping up interest' in Watkins

With moves for Sporting Lisbon's Viktor Gyokeres and Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo not progressing, the club are said to be turning their attentions to the England international. Title: Guardiola to hold 'crunch talks' with players as summer plans begin
Content: Pep Guardiola will hold crunch talks with Manchester City players as he begins a "tough" squad cull. His team were knocked out of the Club World Cup this week, having taken a squad of 27 players to the USA. In quotes carried by The Sun, Guardiola said: ‚ÄúWe have a big squad and we‚Äôll see what happens. "It‚Äôs tough. I‚Äôve no idea ‚Äì we‚Äôll see with the club which ones. We‚Äôll talk with the players as well. ‚ÄúBut we‚Äôll rest, come back in the next few days and start the Premier League. The season will be so long and many things can happen. Title: Braga closing in on deal for Celtic's Lagerbielke
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Braga are close to agreeing a deal worth ¬£2m for Celtic centre-back Gustaf Lagerbielke. Title: Mitoma wants to stay at Brighton and sign new contract
Content: Kaoru Mitoma has told Brighton he wants to stay at the club and sign a new deal. Brighton are keen to sit down with the Japan forward to discuss improved terms and an extension to his contract. The club want to reward Mitoma for his performances with a new deal that reflects his importance to Fabian Hurzeler's squad. Mitoma's current deal at Brighton runs out in two years. Brighton rejected offers from Saudi Pro League club Al Nassr for Mitoma in the winter window. Bayern Munich also have him on a list of targets for the left-wing position this summer. Brighton boss Fabian Hurzeler told Sky Sports News: "We try to keep our best players. "Mitoma played a great last season but it's only because we as a club worked together. Then you can shine as individuals. It's the most important that all the players try to understand that. Mitoma understood it the last season. "I'm really looking forward to seeing him back [on Thursday for pre-season]. That's the plan. We look forward to continue working with him, to try to improve him because I still think his limit is not reached yet. "That's our job, his job the job of the whole club to get the best potential out of the players and that's what we're looking for in the pre-season. I'm sure he will be an important part of us."

Title: Burnley owner set to takeover Espanyol
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhehol: Burnley owner Alan Pace is set to complete the takeover of LaLiga club Espanyol in a deal worth ¬£173m (‚Ç¨200m). Sky Sports News understands the initial price is ¬£156m, but could rise to ¬£173m if certain incentive-based conditions are met. The deal is understood to have been spearheaded by Pace and his investment team. They have finally completed due diligence after more than three months of sifting through the data room and expect to take a stake of just over 99 per cent of the club. Pace‚Äôs firm Velocity Sports Partners (VSP) are expected to arrive in Barcelona next week to finalise the paperwork and begin conversations designed to strengthen the side ahead of the upcoming season. The discussions have taken place at boardroom and ownership level and have not involved anyone from the club throughout this process. It‚Äôs understood this process has been conducted entirely separate from Burnley and does not impact or take resources away from the club in any way. Pace and VSP are said to remain fully committed to Burnley with the target to remain in the Premier League next season. Sky Sports News has been told that Burnley‚Äôs leadership want to ensure Scott Parker is backed this transfer window heading into an exciting new season as a Premier League club. This has been evidenced by signings such as Loum Tchaouna, Bashir Humphreys and Quilindschy Hartman among others. The Premier League and LaLiga have been kept informed of discussions and intentions.

Title: Listen to the latest Transfer Talk podcast
Content: Pete Graves is joined by Dharmesh Sheth and Sam Tighe to discuss Manchester United's latest bid for Bryan Mbeumo with the Brentford forward still favouring a move to Old Trafford. Title: Sulemana joins Atalanta from Southampton
Content: Atalanta have announced the signing of Kamaldeen Sulemana from Southampton in a deal worth around ¬£18.3m. The 23-year-old travelled to Bergamo and completed his medical checks this week. Title: Rangers sign Bournemouth midfielder Rothwell

Title: Juventus in 'positive' talks with Man Utd over Sancho

Title: Sunderland, Bournemouth interested in Petrovic

Title: Chelsea's new man! Joao Pedro's best Premier League goals
Pedro: Playing for Chelsea means winning trophies
Content: Joao Pedro on his Chelsea move: "I grew up watching the Premier League, and Chelsea were a club that won trophies. So, when you join Chelsea, you can only think one thing: to win trophies. "Every competition, you have to think, 'I play for Chelsea and that is my ambition'."

Title: Why Pogba chose Monaco move

Title: Hurzeler: Pedro move is an excellent deal for Brighton
Content: Brighton head coach Fabian Hurzeler says selling Joao Pedro to Chelsea is an "excellent deal" for the club. Chelsea will pay up to ¬£60m for the striker who scored 30 goals in 70 appearances for Brighton since joining in 2023. Hurzeler said: "This is a good move for all parties. It‚Äôs an excellent deal for the club, and a good return on a significant investment in an area of the pitch where we have a lot of competition and are already well served in terms of our attacking talent. "It‚Äôs also an exciting move for Joao: it gives him the opportunity to play Champions League football this coming season, and he will of course be keen to cement his position in the Brazil team ahead of the World Cup next summer. "Joao has given us some wonderful moments ‚Äì during my time and before I came to the club ‚Äì so on behalf of everyone I would like to thank him for his service over the past two seasons and wish him the best for the future."

Title: Chelsea sign Pedro from Brighton with forward to join CWC squad

The former Netherlands international and captain has managed Feyenoord, Guangzhou R&F, Rangers and most recently Besiktas. Title: Chelsea Women sign Lyon defender Carpenter

On completing her move to Chelsea, Carpenter said: "I'm really excited about this new challenge; it‚Äôs a new adventure. Chelsea have enjoyed so much success in England, and I'm delighted to‚ÄØnow be‚ÄØa‚ÄØpart‚ÄØof‚ÄØit." Sky Sports

Title: Branthwaite: I'm over the moon to sign new Everton deal
Content: Jarrad Branthwaite says he is "over the moon" to have signed a new five-year deal at Everton. The 23-year-old evertontv: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm over the moon. It's been something we've been talking about since the end of the season, and to get it signed now is something I'm really excited about. ‚ÄúThe trust the club's put in me and how many games I've played over the past two seasons has made it quite an easy decision for me to stay and to keep progressing as a player. ‚ÄúI know the club. I feel loved by the players ‚Äì we‚Äôve got a good group here ‚Äì and the fans. Over the past few years, I‚Äôve seen the impact the fans have on us as a team and how much it means to them. And, obviously, with the new stadium we‚Äôve got here, the new ownership and the new manager, it's an exciting project and it's something I want to be part of. ‚ÄúMoving to the new stadium together and having that first game at home is something we‚Äôre all looking forward to. We want to go again and push for a good season.‚Äù He added: ‚ÄúThe ambition was a huge thing. I think you saw towards the end of last season as a team what we can do. ‚ÄúThe manager has been really good, not only for me but for the group. Title: Branthwaite signs new Everton contract

Title: Arsenal sign Kelly on permanent deal after Man City exit
Content:
Arsenal Women have signed Chloe Kelly on a free transfer following the expiration of her Manchester City Women contract, after a loan spell at the Gunners last season. The England forward has turned her loan into a permanent move after she joined Arsenal in January, scoring twice and providing five assists in 13 appearances across all competitions. The 27-year-old helped Renee Slegers' side win the Champions League last season, starting in their 1-0 final win over Barcelona in May. Kelly said of her move: "Putting pen to paper on a permanent contract at Arsenal is a standout moment for me. "Learning from an incredible manager and continuing to build relationships with an excellent team is a journey I'm looking forward to continuing. "I'm excited for more silverware at this special club and to bring more trophies back to North London to celebrate with our supporters.
"I've always said that Arsenal supporters are the best, and to have them on my side, singing my name, means so much to me." Sky Sports

Title: Juventus close to agreeing David deal
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Juventus are close to agreeing a deal to sign striker Jonathan David. Sky Sports News has been told a "lot of the details have been agreed in principle". David is a free agent after his contract at Lille expired. A number of clubs in the Premier League, La Liga and Serie A have all held talks with his representatives since January. Meanwhile, Sky in Italy are reporting that David‚Äôs arrival would not impact Juve‚Äôs interest in Napoli striker Victor Osimhen. The idea remains to sign both strikers, with the exit of Dusan Vlahovic.

Title: VOTE: Should Liverpool sell Diaz this summer?
Content: Liverpool have rejected an approach from Bayern Munich for Luis Diaz. There has also been interest in the 28-year-old from Barcelona and Al Nassr this summer. Liverpool will not entertain any approaches for the Colombia international - but are they right too? Vote in our poll below!

Title: Semedo to undergo Watford medical today ahead of move from Udinese
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Udinese striker Vivaldo Semedo is due to undergo a medical today ahead of his move to Watford. Once completed, the 20-year-old is expected to finalise the paperwork on his five-year contract with the Championship club.

Title: Future England No 1? U21 Euros winner Beadle's rise analysed
Content: Sky Sports

Title: Liverpool reject Bayern approach for Diaz
Content: Exclusive by Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas: Liverpool have rejected an approach from Bayern Munich for Luis Diaz. Bayern's sporting director Max Eberl has been told the 28-year-old is not for sale. Discussions have gone no further since. It is the second time this summer that the Reds have taken this stance, having issued the same message to Barcelona earlier in the window. Liverpool will not entertain any approaches for the Colombian, with their message clear that he is not for sale. Club executives are prioritising team performance in their stance on Diaz, viewing him and his contribution as pivotal to the coming seasons.

Title: Transfer latest: Mbeumo, Watkins and Kudus
Content: Brentford's Bryan Mbeumo edges closer to a move, Ollie Watkins appears on Man Utd's radar and Spurs eye Mohammed Kudus. All the latest:

Title: Papers: Bayern Munich considering move for Rashford
Content: Bayern Munich are considering a shock move for Marcus Rashford - The Sun The top stories and transfer rumours from Wednesday's newspapers... Sky Sports

Title: Leon set to complete Man Utd move
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Diego Leon is flying to the UK to complete a move to Manchester United. The left-back signed a pre-contract agreement in January and a formal announcement is expected once the contract is signed and the visa process is complete. The Paraguayan agreed the deal in January, but spent the second half of last season at his club Cerro Porteno. Leon, 18, joins on a deal that could be worth up to ¬£7m.

Title: Wolves chairman opens up on O'Neil sacking
Content: Speaking on the Business of Sport podcast Wolves chairman Jeff Shi opens up on sacking Gary O'Neil, admits they shouldn't have let Diogo Jota go to Liverpool, gives his honest thoughts on VAR and reviews last season.

Title: Oxford Utd sign midfielder De Keersmaecker
Content: Oxford United midfielder Brian De Keersmaecker from Eredivisie side Heracles Almelo for an undisclosed fee. The 25-year-old scored seven goals in 64 league appearances for the Dutch side over the last two seasons.

Title: Derby re-sign free agent Weimann
Content: Derby County have re-signed forward Andi Weimann, who was a free agent after leaving Blackburn Rovers at the end of last season. The 33-year-old previously had a spell at Pride Park between 2015 and 2018, featuring 88 times and scoring nine goals. He has signed a one-year deal with the club.

Title: Tete picks Fulham over Everton
Content: Kenny Tete has chosen to sign a new three-year deal to stay at Fulham instead of joining Everton. Tete's deal at Fulham ran out on Monday which meant he could have left for Everton on a free transfer. But he has now chosen to extend his stay at the club until 2028, in deal which includes a club-held option to extend by a further 12 months. Kenny Tete (left) in action for Fulham against Everton

Title: Tottenham Women set to appoint Ho
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Michael Bridge: Tottenham Women set to appoint SK Brann boss Martin Ho as their new manager. Robert Vilahamn left Spurs at the end of last season after two years at the club. Englishman Ho was in the Everton academy before moving to coaching. He worked as Andy Spence's assistant for Everton's women's team between 2015 and 2018, before taking up the head coach role at Liverpool Women's U21. Ho left in 2020 to become assistant manager at Manchester United's women's team. In 2023, he was appointed as SK Brann's head coach, replacing Olli Harder.

Title: Fati joins Monaco from Barcelona
Content: Ansu Fati has joined Monaco on loan from Barcelona. The 22-year-old forward spent the 2023-24 season on loan at Brighton, scoring four times. He returned to Barcelona and made 11 appearances last season. Fati is Monaco's third summer signing after following Eric Dier and Paul Pogba, who joined on free transfers.

Title: Semenyo signs new Bournemouth contract
Content: Antoine Semenyo has signed a new five-year contract at Bournemouth after attracting interest from Manchester United, Liverpool and Tottenham this summer. The 25-year-old scored 13 goals and produced seven assists in all competitions last season as Bournemouth achieved a club-record points tally in the Premier League and a joint-highest finish of ninth. Tottenham stepped up their interest in Semenyo earlier this month while Man Utd were also admirers despite also attempting to sign Bryan Mbeumo. Semenyo was also on Liverpool's transfer shortlist and was believed to favour playing for a Champions League club, but he has committed his future to Bournemouth. Sky Sports

Title: Sesko talks with Arsenal 'at a standstill'
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Amar Mehta: One source has told Sky Sports News that talks with clubs interested in RB Leipzig striker Benjamin Sesko, including Arsenal, have not progressed and are at a standstill. Sesko's camp believed his future would be sorted by now, with several clubs interested in signing the forward. It is understood that while a move away from the German club is not off, talks have not progressed so far during the window. The player remains relaxed about his future and won't force a move out of RB Leipzig.

Title: Legia make enquiry for Celtic winger Yang
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph: Legia Warsaw have made an enquiry for Celtic winger Hyunjun Yang. It‚Äôs understood a number of clubs in England and across Europe are monitoring the South Korea international‚Äôs situation. Yang has three years left on his contract at Celtic. The 23-year-old scored six goals and provided six assists in all competitions last season.

Title: Brentford set to sign Feyenoord midfielder
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas: Brentford are set to begin the Keith Andrews era by signing an exciting young midfielder on a five-year contract. The club are currently finalising the arrival of Antoni Milambo from Feyenoord. Brentford have agreed a deal featuring an initial ¬£15.4m (‚Ç¨18m) payment plus an additional ¬£3.4m (‚Ç¨4m) in add-ons. Milambo is a 20-year-old central midfielder who has scored four goals in 40 Eredivisie appearances. He is not a replacement for Arsenal-bound Christian Norgaard and instead fits the profile the club have wanted to add for a while: an attack-minded No. 8. Milambo has already completed a medical.

Title: Leeds sign Wolfsburg defender Bornauw
Content: Leeds have signed Wolfsburg defender Sebastiaan Bornauw on a four-year deal for a fee of ¬£5.1m. The centre-back made 15 Bundesliga appearances last season, scoring twice. Bornauw, 26, is the third signing made by the newly-promoted Premier League club following the arrivals of Lukas Nmecha and Jaka Bijol. Bornauw moved from Anderlecht to Cologne in Germany in 2019 before joining Wolfsburg where he played Champions League football. He has also played four times for Belgium.

Title: The Football Museum | Graham Potter
Content: On the Football Museum podcast, West Ham manager Graham Potter talks of Claret and Blue memories‚Ä¶with a twist. He explains why he cut ties with his boyhood club and why we should be grateful for VAR.

Title: Sunderland sign Diarra in club-record deal
Content: Sunderland have signed midfielder Habib Diarra from RC Strasbourg for a club-record fee of ¬£30m. The 21-year-old has signed a five-year contract with Sunderland paying ¬£27m up-front plus ¬£3m in add-ons. Diarra is a direct replacement for Jobe Bellingham, who left this summer to join Dortmund, with all of his transfer fee committed to pay for the Senegal international. Sunderland beat off top competition, including Leeds for Diarra‚Äôs signature. Diarra becomes the latest addition to Regis Le Bris‚Äô squad this summer, following the arrival of Enzo Le Fee from AS Roma in a ¬£20m deal. Diarra captained Strasbourg throughout an immensely successful 2024-25 campaign, which culminated in the club securing European football for only the second time in 20 years.

Title: Williams signs new Forest deal
Content: Neco Williams has signed a new deal with Nottingham Forest until 2029. The defender has played 107 times for the club since joining from Liverpool in 2022. Williams, 24, said: "This club has come so far in recent years, and I am proud to be on the journey. ‚ÄúEveryone knows how ambitious our owner is, and I‚Äôm grateful to him for showing belief in me and showing belief in the club. The future is exciting." Forest owner Evangelos Marinakis said: "Nottingham Forest is a club for ambitious players; people who want to grow with us on our exciting journey and create special memories. "Neco shares our vision for the direction we are going as a club and he is a key part of our team."

Title: Hoilett agrees new Hibs deal
Content: Junior Hoilett has agreed a new deal with Hibernian The Canadian winger has penned a new one-year deal that‚Äôll see him remain at Hibs until the summer of 2026. Hoilett impressed for the Easter Road side during the 2024/25 campaign, contributing to nine goals (four goals and five assists) in 30 appearances.

Title: Madueke among Arsenal winger targets
Content: Latest from Sky Germany's Florian Plettenberg and Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Noni Madueke is another name under consideration among several possible winger targets at Arsenal. Chelsea do not need to sell the 23-year-old and he has not asked to leave. Nico Williams was a top target for Arsenal but he wants to sign for Barcelona. Rodrygo is another prime candidate at Arsenal but a deal with Real Madrid is not easy to achieve. Eberechi Eze is also a player Arsenal admire. There is no evidence to suggest yet which deal Arsenal would like to try and close.

Title: Charlton sign goalkeeper Kaminski
Content: Charlton Athletic have signed goalkeeper Thomas Kaminski from Luton Town for an undisclosed fee on a three-year deal. The Belgium international played in every game of the Hatters' 2023/24 Premier League campaign after joining them that summer. He also won the Premier League Save of the Season, and has a wealth of experience in England's top two leagues.

Title: West Ham announce Cummings transfer
Content: West Ham have announced the signing of 19-year-old Daniel Cummings on a free transfer. The forward has signed a long-term deal following the expiry of his contract at Celtic. Cummings confirmed his departure from the Glasgow club earlier today.

Title: Lawrence leaves Chelsea as Blues agree Carpenter deal
Content: Ashley Lawrence has left Chelsea to join Lyon. The Canadian joined the Blues in 2023 and won four trophies in two seasons at the club, making 60 appearances across all competitions. In the opposite direction, Chelsea have agreed a deal to sign fellow right-back Ellie Carpenter from Lyon in a separate move, Sky Sports News understands. Carpenter won the Champions League with Chelsea boss Sonia Bompastor at Lyon and the move is a big one for the WSL champions.

Title: Kepa impressed by Arsenal's desire to win
Content: New Arsenal signing Kepa Arrizabalaga said: ‚ÄúI'm really, really happy to be here, really excited and looking forward to what is coming. ‚ÄúThe ambition that is shown in this club, when I talk with Mikel [Arteta] and Inaki [Cana], how much they show me their desire to win‚Ä¶ "I think we are so close to winning and, hopefully, altogether, we can achieve it.‚Äù

Title: Arsenal complete ¬£5m deal to sign Kepa from Chelsea
Content: Arsenal have completed a deal to sign Chelsea goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga, after triggering the ¬£5m release clause in his contract. Kepa will compete with first-choice goalkeeper David Raya, after Neto returned to Bournemouth from his loan spell at the Emirates. Arsenal are understood to be impressed with Kepa's desire to join the club and fight for his place in the team. The Spain international was signed by Chelsea in the summer of 2018 from Athletic Club for ¬£71.8m, a world-record transfer fee for a goalkeeper at the time. Sky Sports

Title: Kesler Hayden makes Coventry move
Content: Aston Villa have confirmed that Kaine Kesler Hayden has joined Coventry City in a ¬£3.5m deal. The defender has signed a four-year deal with the Championship club.

Title: 'A new chapter begins' - Kepa says goodbye to Chelsea
Content: Kepa has said goodbye to Chelsea ahead of signing for Arsenal. The goalkeeper is expected to join the Gunners in a ¬£5m deal. In a post on social media, he said: ‚ÄúThank you Chelsea. After seven unforgettable years, the time has come to close a very special chapter in my life. Chelsea was my home, my family, and the place where I grew both as a footballer and as a person. ‚ÄúI arrived full of dreams and I leave with unforgettable memories: titles like the Champions League, Europa League, UEFA Super Cup, Club World Cup‚Ä¶ but above all, moments shared with incredible people on and off the pitch. ‚ÄúThank you to the coaches, the staff, my teammates, and most of all, to you, the fans. Wearing this badge has been an honour and a source of pride. ‚ÄúNow a new chapter begins, and I face it with the same passion and commitment as always. I leave with a heart full of gratitude. ‚ÄúWith love and respect, Kepa Arrizabalaga‚Äù

Title: Valencia open to selling Arsenal target Mosquera

Title: Villa announce signing of Dutch teenager Redmond
Content: Aston Villa have announced the signing of teenage striker Zepiqueno Redmond on a free transfer. The 19-year-old joins following the expiry of his contract at Feyenoord. The striker a Netherlands U19 international who played four times for Feyenoord's first team in the Eredivisie last season. He is a product of Feyenoord's academy and a consistent goalscorer at youth level.

Title: Ward returns to Wrexham
Content: Wrexham have announced the signing of Wales goalkeeper Danny Ward on a free transfer. Ward joins on a three-year deal after leaving Leicester upon the expiry of his contract. The 32-year-old came through at Wrexham's academy before leaving to sign for Liverpool in 2012.

Title: Ubochioma leaves Dundee United
Content: Dundee United have confirmed Meshack Ubochioma has departed Tannadice. The 23-year-old Nigerian winger joined United from Hungarian side ZTE last summer. However, he made only three first-team appearances before embarking on a loan spell with Livingston.

Title: Duran set to sign for Fenerbahce
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Gary Cotterill: Jhon Duran is flying to Turkey to sign for Fenerbahce. The Turkish club ‚Äì managed by Jose Mourinho ‚Äì has agreed a deal with Al Nassr, reportedly worth more than ¬£65m. Former Aston Villa striker Duran is expected to sign a contract to 2030.

Title: Rangers agree deal to sign Bournemouth's Rothwell
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam: Rangers have agreed a deal with Bournemouth to sign midfielder Joe Rothwell. He‚Äôll be joining permanently from Bournemouth for an undisclosed fee. Rothwell is entering the final year of his current contract. Rothwell turned down the opportunity to go to La Liga to once again work under Russell Martin who he played for when on loan at Southampton in 2024. He has spoken highly of his coaching style in the past. The 30 year-old spent last season on loan at Leeds where he gained promotion to the Premier League making 39 appearances in all competitions.

Title: Abraham set for Besiktas move
Content: Former Chelsea forward Tammy Abraham is set for a permanent move to Besiktas from Roma. The 27-year-old, capped 11 times by England, spent last season on loan at AC Milan, scoring 10 goals. Abraham is on his way to Turkey to complete the formalities of a reported ¬£17m switch to the Super Lig, with Besiktas posting a video on social media of the striker on board a plane bound for Istanbul. ‚ÄúHello Black Eagles, I‚Äôm coming for you. See you at the airport today,‚Äù Abraham said. Besiktas confirmed the proposed transfer in a statement on the club‚Äôs website. ‚ÄúNegotiations have begun with the player and his club AS Roma SPA regarding the transfer of professional football player Kevin Oghenetega Tamaraebi Bakumo-Abraham,‚Äù the statement read. Abraham had a loan spell at Aston Villa before a ¬£34m move to Roma in the summer of 2021, winning the Europa Conference League under former manager Jose Mourinho.

Title: Sulemana completes Atalanta move
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Zinny Boswell: Kamaldeen Sulemana has completed his move to Atalanta from Southampton. The 23-year-old has passed all his medical checks and the contracts have been signed ahead of an announcement. Atalanta agreed an ¬£18.3m (‚Ç¨21.5m) deal with Southampton for the winger. The agreement is made up of a ¬£15m (‚Ç¨17.5m) initial payment and further ¬£3.3m (‚Ç¨4m) in add-ons. Saints have also secured a 15 per cent sell on clause. Former Southampton boss Ivan Juric wanted Sulemana at Atalanta. The Ghana international is understood to be excited about the project, with the Italian club playing in the Champions League in the coming season.

Title: Juve serious about signing Osimhen
Content: Latest from Sky in Italy: Juventus are getting serious about signing Victor Osimhen. The Napoli striker is a primary objective for the Bianconeri and contacts intensified over the weekend. Juventus want to be sure the player wants to join them before then approaching Napoli for talks over a deal. Osimhen is one of the prime striker names on the market this summer.

Title: Everton duo agree contract extensions
Content: Everton Women have confirmed midfield duo Aurora Galli and Lucy Hope have both agreed one-year contract extensions. Galli became the first Italian to play in the WSL after signing from Juventus in July 2021. The 28-year-old is fit again after sustaining an anterior cruciate knee ligament (ACL) injury on the opening day of last season. Meanwhile, Hope announced on Monday that she is pregnant, and will therefore be supported by Everton‚Äôs medical staff as she continues light training before taking time off for the birth of her child.

Title: Firpo leaves Leeds
Content: Leeds have announced that left-back Junior Firpo is leaving the club as a free agent. The 28-year-old, who joined from Barcelona in 2021, "moves on to a new challenge" following the expiry of his contract. Real Betis' sporting director Manu Fajardo said last week Firpo wants to return to the Spanish club, but that a deal is not yet finalised. Firpo started his professional career with Betis before playing for Barcelona and Leeds. The Dominican Republic international spent two seasons with Leeds in the Premier League before helping the club win promotion from the Championship as division winners last season. Firpo made 35 appearances in all competitions for Leeds in his final season, providing 10 assists and scoring four goals.

Title: Taylor completes PAOK move
Content: Celtic left-back Greg Taylor has completed a move to Greek side PAOK. The 27-year-old has signed a three-year contract, marking the end of a six-year spell at Celtic.

Title: Is Man Utd's deal for Mbeumo any closer?
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Lyall Thomas: Man United remain hopeful of concluding a deal for Bryan Mbeumo despite comments from Brentford sporting director Phil Giles on Monday suggesting the player is happy to stay if nothing is agreed. United are working on a potential new proposal, with their most recent offer of ¬£62.5m (made up of an initial ¬£55m plus ¬£7.5m in add-ons) deemed not enough for the London club. Brentford want in excess of ¬£65m, with most if not all of that guaranteed. United will stay disciplined and not overpay, having their own estimations of the 25-year-old. United are thought to be impressed with Mbeumo‚Äôs desire to join and personal terms are understood to be agreed in principle. Elsewhere, the club have a long-standing interest in Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins. United are exploring bringing in a striker this summer - regardless of Rasmus Hjolund‚Äôs future. Also high on the agenda is trimming the squad to help fund further incomings.

Title: Savage appointed Forest Green boss
Content: Robbie Savage has been appointed as manager of Forest Green Rovers. As head coach of Macclesfield last season, Savage secured promotion to the National League North at the club‚Äôs first attempt. On his appointment, Savage said: "I feel I have an opportunity to develop a squad to create an attacking brand of football - an aggressive form of football to try and get Forest Green back into the EFL. "I want a fast, exciting style but the most important thing is to win games."

Title: Strand Larsen turns Wolves loan into permanent deal
Content: Wolves have announced the permanent signing of Jorgen Strand Larsen following his initial season-long loan from Celta Vigo last season. The striker has extended his stay at Molineux until 2029 after certain clauses in his contract were met, which automatically turned his loan deal permanent.

Title: WATCH: Best of Andrews' first Brentford press conference
Are Arsenal any closer to new striker?
Content: Benjamin Sesko and Viktor Gyokeres remain the focus of Arsenal‚Äôs attention - but a potential deal for either appears no closer. Other names under discussion include Aston Villa‚Äôs Ollie Watkins The club are also exploring the addition of a more versatile attacking player - with Eberechi Eze heavily linked.

Title: Salford reject approaches for Mnoga
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Amar Mehta: Salford have rejected two bids for Haji Mnoga and consider the right-back not for sale. Sky Sports News understands that two League One clubs are interested in signing the 23-year-old but Salford have rejected offers from both. The Tanzania international joined Salford in September 2024 from Portsmouth and has one year left on his current deal.

Title: Man Utd latest: Sancho, Antony and Rashford
Content: Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth: Juventus continue to work on a deal to sign Man United forward Jadon Sancho. Club-to-club contacts are ongoing, with United understood to want around ¬£25m. It is not an easy deal to do as Sancho is very likely to have to take a pay cut. Juventus officials are in dialogue with Sancho‚Äôs camp over personal terms. Sky in Italy have reported that Napoli have cooled their interest in the player and are focussing on other targets. Real Betis, meanwhile, are doing everything they can to push through a deal for Antony. The Betis sporting director admits it is a complex deal to do. Como have also shown an interest in Antony, but it is understood Antony‚Äôs preference is a return to Betis. He spent a successful second half of last season on loan there last season ‚Äì scoring nine goals in 24 starts. There are also lots of discussions via intermediaries from interested clubs over Marcus Rashford and Alejandro Garnacho. As yet, no formal offers have been made, but they are expected.

Title: Taylor close to PAOK move
Content: Celtic left-back Greg Taylor has completed a medical with PAOK ahead of his move to Greece. It‚Äôs understood the 27-year-old is finalising the paperwork on a three-year contract today. An announcement is expected in the next 24 hours - marking the end of Taylor‚Äôs six-year spell at Celtic.

Title: Decisions to make at No 9 for Man Utd
Content: Aston Villa's Ollie Watkins is said to be on Man United‚Äôs radar this summer, according to The Athletic's reporting. He will be considered in the event that Rasmus Hojlund leaves. Hojlund initially joined United on a five-year deal worth ¬£72m in 2023, but is yet to prove he can score regularly in the Premier League. United‚Äôs full focus at the moment is said to be on agreeing a deal with Brentford for Bryan Mbeumo - but there has been contact between Old Trafford executives and their Aston Villa counterparts over Watkins. United are weighing up several striker options.

Title: Bornauw completes Leeds medical
Content: Sebastiaan Bornauw has completed his Leeds medical. Leeds are understood to be paying an initial ¬£5.13m (‚Ç¨6m) for the Belgium international, who has a year left on his deal with Wolfsburg. It is expected that he will sign a four-year deal at Elland Road.

Title: Are Liverpool getting closer to Guehi deal?
Content: 'Advanced talks' are taking place betwen Liverpool and Marc Guehi over a summer move, according to Sky Germany's Florian Plettenberg. The Palace defender is described as being 'top of the list' at Liverpool.

Title: Liverpool deliberating over Quansah replacement
Content: Given Jarell Quansah's imminent exit to Bayer Leverkusen, Liverpool's next move in the transfer market will be to pursue a new centre-back, The Athletic reports. They are looking at a number of candidates. Crystal Palace‚Äôs Marc Guehi is under consideration, but only if the price is right given the player is out of contract next summer. Nottingham Forest‚Äôs Murillo is also admired but likely to be too pricey.

Title: Could Arsenal sign a left winger AND Eze?
Content: Could Arsenal sign Eberechi Eze and a striker AND a left winger this summer? That's an intriguing suggestion from The Athletic's David Ornstein this morning. According to his report, Arsenal are giving 'serious consideration' to signing Eze but may regard him as an attacking forward rather than a left winger. 'It is unclear whether a sale would need to happen first to facilitate a move, but this would be separate to their pursuit of a striker and left winger,' he writes. Sky Sports

Title: Where will Rashford end up?
Content: Marcus Rashford is prioritising a move abroad if he leaves Manchester United this summer, according to a report from The Athletic's David Ornstein. The 27-year-old spent the second half of last season on loan at Aston Villa but they decided against activating a ¬£40m option to buy. The forward still has three years left on his Old Trafford deal but does not appear to be part of Ruben Amorim's plans. Rashford currently favours a switch overseas and ideally one that would enable him to compete for titles.

Title: When is the earliest Pedro could play for Chelsea?
Content: Joao Pedro will fly from Brazil to the USA to have a medical and join Chelsea's Club World Cup squad today. The forward can be signed mid-tournament with the registration period open from June 27 to July 3. It means he could make his Blues debut in the tournament quarter-finals against Palmeiras on Friday in Philadelphia. Chelsea view Pedro as a versatile forward who can play as a No 9 and across the front line.

Title: Diaz continuing to attract interest
Content: Bayern Munich have added Liverpool forward Luis Diaz to their list of left-winger targets, according to Sky in Germany. They want to sign a player in that position and have explored a deal. There has been no contact with Liverpool at this stage with Diaz one of a number of options Bayern are looking at. Barcelona had an approach knocked back for the 28-year-old earlier this month, who is also of interest to Saudi Pro League club Al Nassr.

Title: Why Eze is in demand

Title: Arsenal latest
Content: The Gunners remain in talks to sign defender Cristhian Mosquera. The Valencia academy product, who made the final shortlist for the 2024 Golden Boy award, has caught the eye at this summer's U21 Euros Championships. Meanwhile, Eberechi Eze is one of a number of forwards on Arsenal‚Äôs wish list ‚Äì which also includes Real Madrid's Rodrgyo. The Brazilian, who suffered with multiple injuries last season, will be allowed to leave after new Spurs boss Thomas Frank gave the green light for his exit. Title: Your evening headlines...
